style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a href="https://oceanofpdf.com/">OceanofPDF.com</a></p><h1 style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a name="bookmark1">&zwnj;</a>Preface<a name="bookmark2">&zwnj;</a></h1><p style="padding-top: 21pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Tuesday. Ordinarily, it&#39;s just another cog in the relentless machine of the week, a day neither remarkable for its joys nor its sorrows. Most Tuesdays dissipate like mist in the morning sun, leaving no lasting impression. But April 3rd was different, violently so. It&#39;s a date seared into my very being, a permanent scar on the timeline of my life.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">That Tuesday marked a catastrophic turning point, a day when the familiar trajectory of my existence, my family&#39;s future, and indeed, the fate of the entire world, was irrevocably and shockingly altered. The change, when it</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">came, was abrupt and without the slightest hint of foreshadowing, a sudden cleaving of reality itself. I would soon learn I was alone in this experience.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The morning of the 3rd had unfolded with a deceptive and almost painful normalcy. The well-worn routine began at 5:30 AM, with the gentle, but persistent, rousing of my eldest son, a 16-year-old for whom the early hours were a form of mild torture. Each day, I delivered the same quiet lecture, a reminder of the growing responsibilities that came with approaching adulthood. By 6:00 AM, he was gone, a silhouette disappearing down the street toward the bus stop, leaving me to steal a few more precious, fleeting moments of sleep before the next wave of activity.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">At precisely 7:00 AM, my wife and I would rise, embarking on the carefully orchestrated ballet of preparing our two younger children for their school day. It was a practiced dance, a testament to years of shared mornings. Our 15-year-old son, already exhibiting a fierce independence that bordered on</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">self-sufficiency, navigated his morning preparations with minimal intervention. Our 13-year-old daughter, however, still required transport, a task, and a privilege, that I gladly accepted.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">After the flurry of farewells and the carefully timed departures, I&#39;d drop her at school and navigate the quiet streets back to the tranquil haven of my</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">home office. The privilege of working remotely, a now-commonplace perk in the world of Information Technology, eliminated the soul-crushing daily</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">commute. Companies, in a rare display of enlightened self-interest and financial pragmatism, had embraced the remote work model, significantly reducing their overhead in the process.</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">I had just finished my second call of the day, a mundane discussion about backups. A brief, almost unnerving calm had descended. And then, without warning, the world changed.</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><h2 style="padding-left: 9pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 107%;text-align: center;">Robert of Earth, attend. Let this day be marked in your personal history, for it signifies the dawn of a profound transformation. Your universe has been selected for integration. I am the Great System, and my arrival heralds the restructuring of your reality.</h2><h2 style="padding-top: 10pt;padding-left: 16pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 107%;text-align: center;">Robert, understand that you have been singled out. From the multitude of individuals inhabiting your planet, you alone</h2><h2 style="padding-left: 9pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 107%;text-align: center;">have been chosen, through a process of impartial designation, to be the prime subject of this initial phase. Your life, as you know it, is irrevocably altered. You are now the designated</h2><h2 style="text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 19pt;text-align: center;">representative for Earth in this grand undertaking.</h2><h2 style="padding-top: 11pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">A preparatory period of six of your Earth months is allotted.</h2><h2 style="padding-top: 1pt;padding-left: 12pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 107%;text-align: center;">Following this, you, Robert, will be relocated to a random universe, already functioning under the System&#39;s governance, for comprehensive training and evaluation. This displacement will last until your native universe is prepared for full integration, a process projected to require approximately 412 Earth years. Should you survive this extensive period, you shall return to your people, a herald of the profound alterations that accompany System integration.</h2><p style="padding-top: 14pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">I sat, frozen, captivated by the impossible spectacle of the floating window. My mind raced, desperately trying to recall every detail of last night&#39;s</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">dinner. Surely, something I&#39;d eaten could explain this vivid hallucination.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:2.2pt solid #2B2B2B;display:block;min-height:199.5pt;width:455.2pt;"><p class="s4" style="padding-top: 17pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 107%;text-align: center;">Do not be alarmed, Robert. I have thoroughly scanned your being, and aside from a few minor health concernschiefly a need for increased physical activityyour mental acuity is remarkably high for a Tier G Human. In a few moments, I will initiate the process of creating your personalized System Core and integrating it with your soul. Upon completion of this</p><p class="s4" style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 107%;text-align: center;">procedure, you will have access to further, more detailed information regarding your new role.</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 13pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;What? Waitwhat?&quot; Robert stammered, his voice thick with shock and his mind reeling, utterly unable to process what he&#39;d just heard.</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:2.2pt solid #2B2B2B;display:block;min-height:138.0pt;width:455.2pt;"><p class="s4" style="padding-top: 17pt;padding-left: 10pt;text-indent: -3pt;line-height: 107%;text-align: justify;">Which specific aspect is unclear? My comprehensive analysis indicates you possess a fully functional understanding of the English language, Robert. In fact, I project you will readily</p><p class="s4" style="padding-left: 112pt;text-indent: -88pt;line-height: 107%;text-align: justify;">acquire fluency at Tier 1, with the English language skill unlocked at Level 4 proficiency.</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 13pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Stop! You don&#39;t understand; there must be some mistake!&quot; Robert cried out, his voice rising in panic, his hands shaking uncontrollably. &quot;I can&#39;t</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">leaveI have a wife and three children!&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><h2 style="padding-top: 17pt;padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 107%;text-align: center;">I am the System. Error is an impossibility for my existence. For 9,476 duodecillion years, since the precise moment of my creation, I have performed flawlessly, without deviation. I</h2><h2 style="padding-left: 1pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 107%;text-align: center;">represent the absolute epitome of perfection. Others, however, are demonstrably not so fortunate in their design.</h2><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 13pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">&quot;Wait, please, listen! There has to be another way, some other solution! How can you claim to be perfect and still choose someone with a family,</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">with young children who desperately need him? To tear him away forever, a lifetime of separation, just to coldly observe their reactions? It doesn&#39;t make any sense!&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:2.2pt solid #2B2B2B;display:block;min-height:219.0pt;width:455.2pt;"><p class="s4" style="padding-top: 17pt;padding-left: 1pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 107%;text-align: center;">Your emotional distress is noted, but I did not personally select you. That task is delegated to a subordinate subroutine. While not possessing the inherent perfection of my core code, it functions within acceptable parameters. You seem fixated on</p><p class="s4" style="text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 19pt;text-align: center;">the concept of fairness, a human construct, but you must</p><p class="s4" style="padding-top: 1pt;padding-left: 1pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 107%;text-align: center;">understand: the selection process is purely random. Blame fate or luck if it provides you with some small comfort, though I</p><p class="s4" style="padding-left: 38pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 107%;text-align: center;">assure you, such concepts are rather... imprecise and ultimately meaningless.</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 13pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;What am I supposed to do? Just... <i>what</i>? Explain that to me!&quot; Robert&#39;s voice, once pleading, now cracked with a rising tide of anger and desperation. &quot;You&#39;re telling me I have six months, a mere six months, to</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">prepare to abandon my family forever, and you expect me to just... calmly accept that? Is that your &#39;perfect&#39; plan?&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:2.2pt solid #2B2B2B;display:block;min-height:138.8pt;width:455.2pt;"><p class="s4" style="padding-top: 17pt;padding-left: 18pt;text-indent: 8pt;line-height: 107%;text-align: left;">Your acceptance is neither solicited nor required for the process to proceed. The selection is final and, according to</p><p class="s4" style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 107%;text-align: center;">established protocols, entirely unalterable. This is a governing principle, an immutable directive to which all entities, myself included, are irrevocably bound.</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;And those so-called governing principleswere <i>they </i>established by whom, exactly?&quot; Robert demanded, his voice low and controlled, but laced with barely contained anger.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:2.2pt solid #2B2B2B;display:block;min-height:98.2pt;width:455.2pt;"><p class="s4" style="padding-top: 17pt;padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 107%;text-align: justify;">Why, I did, naturally. That should be self-evident. As the sole, truly perfect being in all of existence, who else could possibly be entrusted with such a momentous and vital responsibility?</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 13pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;I see. So, if you&#39;re the ultimate authority, the one who <i>makes </i>the rules,&quot; Robert pressed, his voice edged with a defiant skepticism, probing for any hint of weakness, &quot;why can&#39;t you simply change them?&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:2.2pt solid #2B2B2B;display:block;min-height:117.8pt;width:455.2pt;"><p class="s4" style="padding-top: 17pt;padding-left: 13pt;text-indent: -3pt;line-height: 107%;text-align: justify;">I acknowledge your reluctance, but any further discussion is unproductive; modification of the governing rules is simply not possible. Now, prepare yourself for core creation and</p><p class="s4" style="padding-left: 9pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 19pt;text-align: justify;">subsequent System linking. Over the coming</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">centuries, the System will monitor your adaptation and your physiological responses to the unfamiliar physical laws of this new reality.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Centuries? style="padding-top: 16pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert stared at the display, his mind struggling to grasp the implications. &quot;So, I&#39;m essentially a level-one newbie in some colossal, cosmic RPG?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Based on your understanding of &#39;RPGs,&#39; the analogy is... adequate. However, this is not a simulated game; it is your actual reality. The displayed information reflects the initial scans performed upon System activation. It will dynamically evolve alongside your progression. Much of the framework will align with your existing knowledge of game mechanics. Classes, such as Wizard or Ranger, exist, but are structured within a tiered system.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 10pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">There are common classes, like Fighter; rarer ones, such as Defender of the Keep; and even mythic classes, like Archmage of the Blinding Snow. Level advancement grants stat and skill points determined by your class and profession tiers. A common Fighter might receive one point in Strength,</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">one in Constitution, and one unassigned point per level. A mythic class could grant five points in Intelligence, three in Wisdom, and four unassigned points. Professions adhere to a similar tiered structure. A user with high-tiered classes and professions will, inevitably, possess significantly greater</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">power than one with lower tiers.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;So, how do I go about acquiring a class?&quot; Robert asked, a note of skepticism in his voice.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Reach level 10 to unlock your first class selection. The options presented will be contingent upon your stats, feats, abilities, traits, titles, and perks. Concentrating on improving those attributes is highly advisable. Bear in mind, you are being translocated to a universe where the System has been operational for millennia, possibly even millions of years. You do not wish to be the most vulnerable entity.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;And what about a profession? I have a job; why isn&#39;t it listed?&quot; Robert asked, confusion evident in his tone.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">You possess a job, not a formalized profession within the System. While acquiring a computer-related profession is possible, its utility in your destination universe may be limited. This might seem counterintuitive, but in a universe governed by magical forces, technology does not follow the same developmental trajectory. This apparent paradox exists, despite the fact that the entire System is managed by a Master AI residing within a computer network spanning 27 artificial universes.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;And who, might I ask, created this entire, elaborate System?&quot; Robert inquired, a hint of challenge in his voice.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">That information is not within my accessible data banks. Were you to pose the query to the Master AI, it would likely assert self-creation.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;This Master AI sounds... like an ass,&quot; Robert muttered, mostly to himself.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">That is an understatement. Now, let us proceed. Vocalize, or mentally project: &#39;Close Status&#39;.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;I suspect you&#39;ve inherited more from the Master AI than I&#39;d find agreeable,&quot; Robert grumbled, a trace of resentment in his tone.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Perfection is a rare trait, and even more rarely acknowledged, now, let us examine your traits. What&#39;s the ultimate</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">purpose? Why does this elaborate structure even exist?&quot; Robert asked, a deep furrow in his brow.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">At its core, the System is designed to facilitate growth, development, and, ultimately, transcendence across countless realities. It is intended to empower individuals throughout the multiverse.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Okay, but why? Why is this constant growth, this accumulation of power, so fundamentally important? Is there some cosmic goal?&quot; Robert pressed, searching for a deeper meaning.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Perhaps &#39;necessity&#39; is not the appropriate framework.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Consider it, instead, an inherent drive. Most sentient beings, regardless of their awareness of the System, possess an intrinsic desire to evolve, to surpass their current limitations, to become more.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;So, you&#39;re confirming the existence of non-humans? Does that mean my</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&#39;transcendence&#39; might involve battling undead dragons or interdimensional horrors?&quot; Robert asked, a hint of dark humor tinged with genuine concern.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The multiverse is characterized by an astonishing biodiversity. Sentient life takes countless forms. Humans are but one race among a vast spectrum, and, objectively speaking, not among the most inherently powerful. As a baseline human, you will initially gain one stat point and one skill point per level, until class selection. This is a statistically average starting point.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Average. Fantastic,&quot; Robert muttered, a touch of sarcasm creeping into his voice. &quot;So, putting aside the existential dread for a moment, what&#39;s the</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">immediate plan? I understand I have six months before departure, but what am I supposed to be doing in the interim?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The objective is comprehensive preparation. The System has provisioned a specialized training dungeon exclusively for your use. It consists of 50 progressively challenging levels.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 10pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Your initial schedule will involve two incursions per week, increasing to four during the final week. You may select the specific days, provided a minimum of two rest days are maintained between each incursion. This allows for</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">physiological adaptation to the System&#39;s effects.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 11pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Outside the dungeon environment, your focus should be on skill mastery. The recommended benchmark is to achieve Tier 3 proficiency in your primary skills and Tier 2 in all secondary skills prior to translocation. This will establish a solid foundation for success in your destination universe.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Providing I survive.&quot; Robert stated.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Survival is statistically probable given the parameters.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Alright,&quot; Robert sighed, &quot;So, practically speaking, what immediate steps do I need to take to prepare for that first dungeon run?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Skill acquisition and practice, coupled with the procurement of basic equipment, are the priorities. Now, let us proceed with the overview. You possess a personal inventory, accessible via mental command. Project the thought: &#39;Open Inventory&#39;.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Okay, let&#39;s continue with the tour, I suppose. Currently, it&#39;s at Level 1, categorized as a subskill within the broader System Skill framework. Consider it a component skill. Within the System, skills are structured across 10 tiers, each tier comprising 10 levels. Upon reaching level 10 within a given tier, you ascend to the subsequent tier.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 10pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The tier progression, in ascending order, is: Novice, Apprentice, Journeyman, Expert, Adept, Master,</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Grandmaster, Sage, Transcendent, and Divine. Subskills, in contrast, are structured soly by levels, ranging from 1 to 10. Skill advancement is achieved through consistent utilization. Your Level 1 Inventory, for instance, provides 10 storage slots.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 10pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Increasing capacity requires active management. Store items, retrieve them, and familiarize yourself with its</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">operational mechanics. Upon attaining Level 2, your Inventory capacity will expand to a 25-slot grid.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Furthermore, at Tier 3, item stacking functionality will be unlocked, allowing up to 10 identical items to occupy a single slot. This principle of experiential learning applies universally to all skills, including subskills. You will also observe a balance of Shop Tokens. These function as a</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">universal currency, accepted at any System Shop to which you have access, enabling the purchase of common, non- specialized items.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Straightforward enough, I suppose,&quot; Robert replied, a hint of resignation in his voice.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Excellent. Now, there are several additional menus that are not immediately relevant to your current situation, but familiarity with their existence is beneficial. Briefly access,</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">then close, each of the following: Party Menu, Spell Menu, Bond Menu, Quest Menu, Equipped Items, Professions,</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Skill Abilities, Guild Overview, Members, Property, and Inventory. Subsequently, review the Friend List and the Log Menu. The objective is simply to familiarize yourself with</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">their location within the System interface.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert complied, his eyes flitting across each menu as it appeared and disappeared in rapid succession. &quot;Okay, that&#39;s done.&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Affirmative. You&#39;ve already acquired First Aid, a valuable asset for mitigating minor injuries. Now, let us address the matter of perks.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 10pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">You&#39;ve garnered a legendary perk that will substantially accelerate your skill advancement. I would advocate for the selection of &#39;Legendary Skills,&#39; which will initiate all nascent skills at Tier 3. As for your uncommon perks, I propose &#39;High Skills,&#39; granting each skill a five-level advancement. The confluence of these two perks will result in your skills commencing at Tier 3, Level 5. Please, peruse the extensive lists at your leisure. The system boasts millions of skills, offering a vast spectrum of choices.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert, after reviewing the options, declared, &quot;Alright, I think I have a plan. You may utilize it immediately.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Thanks! If I pick &#39;Rare Skills,&#39; will that bump my starting skills up to Tier 4, Level 5?&quot; Robert asked, checking.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Affirmative. It&#39;s crucial to understand that these particular skill-enhancing perks are unique. You are the sole individual with the potential to acquire them, at least beyond the uncommon tier. Another advantage of your pioneering status. Furthermore, I must advise against anticipating</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">further complimentary points. By way of illustration, only a minuscule percentage, approximately 0.5%, of Tier G Humans are capable of unlocking even a single magic skill, and an even more restricted subset, around 0.01%, can attain proficiency in multiple magical disciplines.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 10pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Furthermore, the process of unlocking magical abilities is remarkably resource-intensive, and the system is not known for its profligate distribution of said resources. Therefore, let us commence with the magical arts. What specific schools of magic pique your interest? Do you envision yourself manipulating the elements of fire, earth, water, or air? Bear in mind, there exist a total of 27 distinct magical spheres, so I encourage you to deliberate carefully.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">After a moment of consideration, Robert stated, &quot;I guess I&#39;ll start with the basics: earth, fire, water, and air.&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">An excellent foundational selection, we shall proceed to unlock those immediately. It is worth noting that, as the</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">inaugural user, you are not bound by the same constraints that will be imposed upon subsequent users. Are there any additional schools of magic that you wish to explore at this juncture? Perhaps Time, Creation, Healing, Light, or Enchantment magic intrigue you?</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Yeah, those sound good. Let&#39;s add those too. So that&#39;s nine different magic skills, right? Is it okay to have that many?&quot; Robert asked, a little unsure.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Absolutely, your current allotment of skill points is more than sufficient to accommodate such a selection. We shall configure those immediately. Now, considering your existing</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">weapon proficiencies, that aspect is adequately addressed. Perhaps we should now direct our attention towards crafting skills, such as Leatherworking, Sewing, and Hunting. These skills will prove invaluable in maintaining your equipment and generating supplementary income within your new environment.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;That sounds perfect. Let&#39;s do those. I&#39;ll save the rest of my points for later, in case I need them.&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">A prudent and well-considered decision, all modifications have been implemented. This thing is <i>massive</i>,&quot; he said, his</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">voice full of amazement. &quot;It must have thousands and thousands of spells!&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">An accurate assessment, and those represent merely the Tier 1 spells, the tier boasting the most extensive collection.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Mastering all of them would necessitate years of dedicated study. However, fear not, for once you achieve mastery over a particular spell, it is permanently inscribed within your system&#39;s spellbook, obviating the need for further study.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;That&#39;s a <i>huge </i>relief,&quot; Robert said, running his fingers over the old pages. He frowned slightly. &quot;But what about the other skills I picked? Hunting, Enchanting, and the crafting stuff?&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:67.5pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">AI Override Requested: Skill Books...</p><p class="s12" style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">First User Protocol Engaged...</p><p class="s12" style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Override Sanctioned: Skill Books Awarded.</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 1pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:119.2pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 92pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Tier 1 Skill Books Fabricated:</p><p class="s13" style="padding-left: 110pt;text-indent: 13pt;text-align: left;">Introduction to Hunting Introduction to Enchanting</p><p class="s13" style="padding-left: 128pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 17pt;text-align: left;">Introduction to Sewing</p><p class="s13" style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Introduction to Leatherworking</p><p class="s12" style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Skill Books Deposited into Inventory.</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Skill books?&quot; Robert asked, raising an eyebrow.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The distinction between the spellbook and these skill books lies in their method of knowledge transfer. The spellbook necessitates dedicated, traditional study, whereas skill books impart their contained knowledge directly into your cognitive framework. The sheer volume of information contained within the spellbook precluded its functionality as a skill book, particularly given your current level of development.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Huh, interesting,&quot; Robert muttered, sinking into a nearby chair. &quot;So, I just &#39;use&#39; these skill books, and I&#39;ll instantly know how to hunt, enchant, sew, and work leather?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Precisely, however, I must caution you that a transient cephalalgia  a temporary headache  may be a</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">consequential side effect. It is therefore advisable to remain seated for the duration of the knowledge transfer.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a href="https://oceanofpdf.com/">OceanofPDF.com</a></p><h1 style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a name="bookmark11">&zwnj;</a>Chapter 5<a name="bookmark12">&zwnj;</a></h1><p style="padding-top: 21pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">&quot;Okay, I think that&#39;s enough information for now. I need to talk to Sara. But honestly, I have no idea how to even begin explaining this, let alone <i>proving </i>it. How do you tell your wife you&#39;re being whisked away to another</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">dimension? Reality? Whatever this is?&quot; He ran a hand through his already disheveled hair.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">You can share these screens with anyone. All you have to do is think about it.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Finding a small measure of solace in the AI&#39;s ability to provide some form of proof  at least something tangible he could show Sara  Robert left his home office. He paused hesitantly at the kitchen doorway, the scent of something baking  cinnamon, maybe?  doing little to calm the storm raging inside him. He cleared his throat, then called out, &quot;Honey? We need to talk,&quot; his voice tight with the weight of the impending conversation, a</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">tremor he couldn&#39;t quite suppress.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Sara emerged from around the corner, wiping her hands on a dish towel, her usual playful demeanor already tinged with concern. She asked if it was</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">another work emergency, her eyes, usually sparkling with laughter, already betraying a deeper worry, a premonition. &quot;Not even close,&quot; Robert replied, his voice a low murmur, &quot;I&#39;ve apparently received some kind of &#39;great</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">honor,&#39; but the messenger well, let&#39;s just say he was a total jerk.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Sara&#39;s skeptical eyebrow rose, a silent question demanding more information, prompting Robert to mentally show her the system logs. As</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">she read, her smile vanished completely, replaced by a furrowed brow and a look of utter disbelief, her eyes darting back and forth across the projected text. &quot;What the hell is this, Robert? This is this is insane!&quot; she exclaimed, her voice rising in pitch.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert sighed, the weight of it all pressing down on him. He explained, as best he could, that he hadn&#39;t chosen this, that he was now unwillingly part</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">of some exclusive, and apparently very strange, club. Sara&#39;s immediate, visceral response was for him to simply reject it, to refuse. Robert explained, his voice laced with frustration, his attempts; he&#39;d tried to say no, multiple times, but he&#39;d been told, quite firmly, to accept it.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">When Sara declared, with a fierce protectiveness, that he couldn&#39;t possibly leave in six months and never return, Robert offered the faint, almost pathetically weak, hope of a possible return when the system went live  a prospect that did absolutely nothing to reassure her, given the mind- boggling 400-year timeframe. She voiced her fear, the sheer impossibility of the situation, her words tumbling over each other.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">His voice was firm, a vow, a desperate promise, though his eyes, he knew, showed his own fear, he would take care of her and the kids, no matter what. With a desperate, clinging hope, she asked if they could go with him, a question Robert promised to look into immediately.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">No, non-users are not able to transfer with you. I&#39;m sorry, but that&#39;s just how it is.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;I&#39;m told no,&quot; Robert said, his voice heavy with disappointment, the words tasting like ash in his mouth. &quot;Youre told?&quot; Sara scoffed, her anger and frustration rising, bubbling over like a pot left on high heat. Are you some kind of robot now, Robert? Controlled by this this insane system? Is that what&#39;s happening?&quot; Robert sighed, rubbing his temples, trying to stave off the throbbing headache that was rapidly building.</p><p style="padding-top: 10pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Its not that simple, Sara. Its incredibly complex. Honestly, it&#39;s like nothing I&#39;ve ever encountered before, and I dont fully understand it yet, to be honest. Well, you better <i>start </i>understanding, Robert, and fast. This isn&#39;t a game.&quot; Its not the system, exactly. I have a a helper, of sorts. A personal AI, assigned to me to help me navigate all of this madness. &quot;Can I, can <i>we </i>talk to it?&quot; Sara asked, a desperate edge to her voice, a plea for some kind of control in this uncontrollable situation.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">That is not possible. I&#39;m talking to you through your personal core. I&#39;m basically just transmitting the information into your</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">brain. I do not have a way to interact with anyone outside your mind.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;I&#39;m told that&#39;s not possible,&quot; Robert relayed, feeling a growing sense of helplessness. &quot;This AI it&#39;s essentially inside my mind. It can&#39;t directly talk with anyone else. It&#39;s contained.&quot; Sara&#39;s eyes narrowed, her gaze piercing. &quot;A digital guide, huh? So, you&#39;re having conversations with a computer in</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">your head? Is that what I&#39;m hearing?&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Essentially, yes,&quot; Robert admitted, feeling a blush creep up his neck. &quot;It provides a a direct, secure connection to the system. That&#39;s how they communicate.&quot; &quot;Well, figure something out, Robert,&quot; Sara said, her voice steel-edged, though her eyes betrayed her fear, &quot;because this isnt just about you anymore. Its about us. Our family. Our future. Tell that that System I want a word. A very long word. And some damn good answers.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Guilt washed over Robert, a tidal wave threatening to drown him. Hed been so focused on his own predicament, the sheer, mind-boggling absurdity of it all, that hed neglected, until this very moment, the full, devastating impact on Sara and the kids. I know, he said softly, his voice thick with emotion, and Im trying. I swear, Im trying. I did ask about you and the kids. They won&#39;t allow it.</p><p style="padding-top: 10pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">A tense, heavy silence filled the room, thick with unspoken fears, anxieties, and a growing sense of dread. Sara finally broke it, her voice surprisingly calm, but with an underlying tremor of steel, a resolute determination. Fine. If youre doing this if you have to do this then do it right, Robert. Make absolutely sure were protected. Financially. Emotionally.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Everything. What exactly do you even need to do to get ready for this this utter craziness?&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;From what I&#39;m told,&quot; Robert began, trying to recall the AI&#39;s explanation, &quot;the system will basically force me to prepare. It has a mandatory training program of sorts. A very intense one.&quot; &quot;Of sorts?&quot; Sara</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">pounced on the vague wording, her concern etched on her face. &quot;What does that mean, Robert? Be specific.&quot; &quot;From what I understand,&quot; he continued, choosing his words carefully, &quot;it has designed a specific training program</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">just for me. A a kind of dungeon, where I&#39;ll, I guess, level up and learn new skills to prepare for whatever comes next.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Sara&#39;s eyebrows shot up, disappearing into her hairline. &quot;A dungeon? You mean like in those video games you&#39;re always playing? That&#39;s that&#39;s what you&#39;re telling me?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">A dungeon is a self-contained zone, normally underground, but that is not always required where mana gathers and powers a keeper, normally an AI contained within a dungeon core. That keeper uses that power to create challenges for users but offers rewards for completing those challenges.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">You will find monsters to fight, puzzles to solve, and quests to complete.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;It&#39;s not a game, Sara. It&#39;s real. I&#39;ll face real dangers, fight actual monsters, and solve mind-bending puzzles, it seems.&quot; Sara&#39;s eyes widened in disbelief and fear. &quot;Monsters? Like, trolls and dragons?&quot; &quot;Exactly. The AI says I have to complete a 50-level dungeon in six months. It gets progressively harder, but I&#39;m forced to take breaks, so at least there&#39;s that.&quot; &quot;That doesn&#39;t sound safe,&quot; Sara worried, her voice trembling. &quot;Probably not, but I guess it gets</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">harder as I progress, so Ill learn?&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">He tried to sound optimistic, but failed miserably. And what about the kids? Family? Your parents? Even the government? Theyll notice you disappearing. Robert chuckled nervously, a hollow sound. Im not</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">worried about the government. Theyve got bigger problems. Well, I am. People will ask. This isnt a joke, Robert. This is our life. I know, I know. Well sit the kids down after school and explain. We&#39;ll just have to hope they can keep it secret for as long as possible. Sara&#39;s voice trembled. &quot;I&#39;m scared, Robert. This wasn&#39;t the plan. A few more years and the kids were off to college, and we could focus on us, on our life.&quot; Robert&#39;s eyes welled up, mirroring her fear. &quot;I know, honey. Our best years were about to start. We</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">were close.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Sara&#39;s voice broke, a sob escaping. &quot;I&#39;m going to be alone.&quot; Robert reached out and took her hand, squeezing. &quot;You won&#39;t be alone. You&#39;ll have the kids, and someday, lots of grandkids. But I know this isn&#39;t what we wanted.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">What we planned.&quot; &quot;What about your parents, your siblings? What do we tell them?&quot; &quot;I&#39;m not sure yet,&quot; Robert admitted, his voice heavy. &quot;We have a little time. I&#39;m going to go back to my office and talk to the AI more. John will have questions. He&#39;s smart, too smart sometimes.&quot; Sara nodded, her eyes filled with worry and fragile hope. &quot;I know. And you better have the answers, or at least some.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;It&#39;s not a game, Sara. Not this time. It&#39;s real. I&#39;ll face real dangers, fight actual monsters, and solve, I don&#39;t know, super complicated, mind-bending puzzles, it seems. It&#39;s a real place.&quot; He could see the disbelief, the fear, growing in her eyes. Robert returned to his office, feeling a strange mix of dread and a flicker of excitement. He sat heavily and focused on the AI. &quot;I need to know everything about this training,&quot; he said, his voice barely a</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">whisper, firm with resolve.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The dungeon will be a rigorous test of your physical and mental abilities; you will encounter a variety of challenges, from combat encounters to intricate puzzle-solving. The</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">rewards for completing each level will be significant, both in terms of experience points and valuable equipment.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Equipment?&quot; Robert asked, a flicker of curiosity breaking through his anxiety, a small distraction from the overwhelming reality of his situation. &quot;What kind of equipment?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Yes, you will be able to acquire powerful weapons and</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">armor within the dungeon. These items will be essential for your survival and continued progress through the increasingly difficult levels.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;And the dangers? Anything specific I should be particularly worried</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">about? Any tips? Warnings?&quot; he asked, a knot forming in his stomach, his heart pounding against his ribs.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">The dungeon is home to a wide range of creatures, some of which are quite dangerous, even deadly. You will need to be cautious, strategic, and resourceful in your approach.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Additionally, the dungeon itself can be treacherous, with</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">hidden traps, environmental hazards, and other unforeseen challenges designed to test your limits.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert shuddered involuntarily, a cold wave washing over him. &quot;This sounds like an absolute nightmare. A living, breathing nightmare.&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">It will be a difficult and arduous journey, but it will also be a profoundly rewarding one. You will emerge from the dungeon a stronger, more capable, and more resilient individual, prepared for the challenges that lie ahead.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert sighed, a long, slow exhale, a mixture of resignation and a strange, almost reluctant determination settling over him. &quot;I guess I guess I&#39;m as ready as I&#39;ll ever be. To face whatever this is whatever comes.&quot; He knew, deep down, in the pit of his stomach, that he didn&#39;t have a choice. He had to do this. For Sara. For the kids. For himself</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a href="https://oceanofpdf.com/">OceanofPDF.com</a></p><h1 style="padding-top: 2pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a name="bookmark13">&zwnj;</a>Chapter 6<a name="bookmark14">&zwnj;</a></h1><p style="padding-top: 21pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Alright, let&#39;s get down to brass tacks. What am I supposed to call you? &#39;Mr. AI&#39; is a bit of a mouthful.&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">You can call me Hal, if you&#39;d like. I don&#39;t have a strong preference.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Hal it is, then. Okay, Hal, I&#39;m drowning in questions here. Starting with the basics: what does &#39;leveling up&#39; actually <i>mean</i>?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Leveling up essentially means you&#39;ve become more powerful. skills. What exactly does &#39;unlocking&#39; a skill entail, and what&#39;s the significance of tiers and levels within that system?&quot; Robert inquired.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Just because a skill is locked doesn&#39;t preclude its use. For instance, you could attempt leatherworking before unlocking the skill, but your results would be rudimentary at best.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Unlocking a skill grants foundational knowledge and understanding  the proper tools, techniques, and core concepts.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 10pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">In the case of Leatherworking, you&#39;d learn basic stitching, but not how to craft specific items. Skill books bridge that gap, providing instructions for Tier 1 creations, like simple leather pants. Magic operates similarly; spells are tiered, and you can only learn those within your current tier.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Understood,&quot; Robert nodded, absorbing the information. &quot;So, that leads to my next questions. Why do some subskills lack levels, while others have them?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Certain subskills, such as System Log, are inherently at their maximum potential; there&#39;s no progression path.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">System skills, are also different.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert questioned. &quot;Ah, so system skills, are they upgraded through use.&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">System skills are unique. While usage is a factor, they adhere to a specific formula. For instance, your Inventory skill requires a set number of &#39;uses&#39; (storing and retrieving items) to level up. These requirements escalate significantly: perhaps 10 uses for level 2, 100 for level 3,</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">10,000 for level 4. Most individuals settle for level 4, finding it a good compromise between capacity and effort. Level 5 demands a staggering 1 million uses, but grants a 10x10x10 meter storage space. Level 6 further expands it to 20x20x20 meters.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;That&#39;s an immense amount of space,&quot; Robert observed. &quot;So, what <i>other </i>fundamental knowledge am I missing that the average five-year-old already possesses?&quot; Robert asked, a hint of self-deprecating humor in his voice.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">An exhaustive answer to that would take months.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Very amusing, Hal. A <i>serious </i>answer, please,&quot; Robert requested, with a slight emphasis.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">I wasn&#39;t attempting humor. In a system-integrated universe, a vast amount of information is considered common knowledge, ingrained from a young age. This includes the experience thresholds for leveling, the timing of class and profession unlocks, and comprehensive details about various races and monsters  akin to what your parents would teach you. Imagine simultaneously learning about currency, basic economics, and complex social hierarchies.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;That&#39;s... overwhelming,&quot; Robert conceded. &quot;So, let&#39;s start somewhere. You mentioned economics, let&#39;s start with that,&quot; Robert said.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Certainly. Currency within the System resembles many RPG structures. The base unit is the Copper Coin, which is approximately equivalent to one dollar. Silver Coins are valued at 100 Copper, and Gold Coins follow the same pattern at 100 Silvers. Finally, Platinum Coins adhere to the established progression.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Okay so I&#39;ve seen things like that before in games so it makes sense&quot; Robert said with a thoughtful look.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Prices fluctuate based on location and availability. However, on average, a simple meal at an inn might cost 3 Copper, a basic room 6 Copper, a rudimentary leather armor set 65</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Copper, a decent horse 2 Gold, and a small, un-enchanted house around 20 Gold. Staple goods, like flour, are subject to greater price variation. A pound of flour might be 10</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Copper in a city, but 30 Copper in a remote village.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;So, prices are dynamic, influenced by local conditions and supply and demand,&quot; Robert summarized.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Precisely. Now, regarding social norms...</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Do we <i>have </i>to?&quot; Robert interjected, a hint of dread in his voice.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Without knowing your precise destination, specific customs are difficult to outline. However, some universal principles apply. Power, or the perception of it, is often paramount.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Initially, you&#39;ll be relatively weak. Even if you out-level many, there will be individuals vastly more powerful. In numerous cultures, this disparity can lead to exploitation.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 10pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Maintaining a low profile and avoiding interactions with those of higher social standing is advisable. Also, those with higher quality gear tend to be in a higher standing, it&#39;s best to avoid them as well. Your magic will in time, make you more powerful but with that power, will come unwanted attention.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert chuckled dryly. &quot;That&#39;s universally sound advice, regardless of the universe. Keep your head down, mind your own business.&quot; He then posed a serious question. &quot;But how does this system work for children? Surely, five- year-olds aren&#39;t granted full system access?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Children under five have extremely limited access, viewing only basic identifiers like name, race, and gender. From five to ten, they can perceive traits and feats but cannot interact with them. Between ten and twelve, they gain read-only access to their skill list. At twelve, full read access to the</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">system is granted, but modification remains restricted. Finally, at fifteen, full system access unlocks. This staggered approach safeguards both the child and those around them.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Good. It would be rather disturbing to have seven-year-olds casually wielding fireballs,&quot; Robert quipped, a hint of dark humor in his tone.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Not unless someone provided them with a wand of fireballs.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Wait, is that a <i>realistic </i>possibility?&quot; Robert asked, his tone shifting to one of genuine concern.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">It depends on the specific wand&#39;s properties and activation requirements.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;That&#39;s... deeply unsettling,&quot; Robert admitted.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Agreed. Now, let&#39;s shift focus to your initial dungeon run. It is suggested that you first inform you family, and then spend some time learning, a few offensive, defensive, and healing spells. We can equip you with a starter weapon, like a basic knife. The first level is designed to be introductory, with relatively weak opponents, likely either &#39;friendly&#39; creatures or low-level rats.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 10pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The dungeon itself is small, approximately 7-9 rooms, and lacks a boss encounter. It&#39;s intended to familiarize you with the core mechanics. You should gain one, possibly two levels, and potentially acquire some basic system-issued</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">gear. There should also be a system shop in the first room, allowing you to spend your tokens on armor or other necessities.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;So, shall we aim for three days from now?&quot; Robert proposed.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">That time frame is acceptable and provides adequate preparation.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a href="https://oceanofpdf.com/">OceanofPDF.com</a></p><h1 style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a name="bookmark15">&zwnj;</a>Chapter 7<a name="bookmark16">&zwnj;</a></h1><p style="padding-top: 21pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert cast a quick glance at the clock on the wall. Five hours remained until his eldest was due home. <i>More than enough time to lose myself in</i></p><p class="s5" style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">some arcane studies, <span class="p">he thought with a smile. He reached for the hefty,</span></p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">leather-bound grimoire resting on the table, its pages filled with the secrets of ages. With a satisfying <i>thump</i>, he opened it, the scent of aged parchment and dried herbs filling the air. He began to leaf through the brittle pages, his fingers tracing the faded ink of diagrams and incantations. &quot;Now, where to begin?&quot; he murmured to himself, then, addressing Hal, added, &quot;Any insightful suggestions, perhaps?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Prioritize healing, Robert. You possess ample skill with a blade for offensive maneuvers, but remember, a strong defense is equally crucial. Grievous wounds will undoubtedly impede your progress, hindering your ability to learn and grow.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">&quot;Makes perfect sense,&quot; Robert conceded, turning to the section dedicated to the Sphere of Healing. His eyes scanned the titles. &quot;&#39;Valicar&#39;s Light Touch of Healing&#39;? Honestly, who came up with <i>that </i>name?&quot; he chuckled.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Valicar Tra&#39;Narmaila. A groundbreaking pioneer in the field of restorative magic. His contributions were so significant that many foundational healing spells bear his name, a testament to his legacy.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;So, hypothetically speaking, if <i>I </i>were to devise a completely new spell,&quot; Robert mused, a hint of ambition in his voice, &quot;it would be recorded as, say, &#39;Robert&#39;s Magnificent Spell of Utterly Astonishing Whatever&#39;?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Only if that is your chosen designation, as the originator of the spell, you have the sole authority to determine its official name, which will then be recorded within the System.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">However, bear in mind that the System itself is incredibly</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">ancient, stretching back through billions of millennia. The likelihood is high that someone, somewhere, has already explored similar magical concepts, perhaps even millions of years ago.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert returned his attention to the grimoire, meticulously studying the</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">intricate details of Valicar&#39;s spell. He read and re-read the passage, but upon finishing, he found the specifics frustratingly elusive, slipping from his memory like grains of sand. &quot;What in the world?&quot; he muttered, rubbing his temples. &quot;My memory is usually far sharper than this.&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Undoubtedly, however, you are not merely memorizing words; you are internalizing a fundamental System concept, a Spell. This is your first encounter with such an intricate process. It will naturally require time and dedicated effort to fully grasp. As you continue to learn and assimilate more spells, the process will become progressively easier.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Furthermore, your current Tier within the Sphere of Healing influences the learning curve. As a Tier 4 in the Sphere of Healing, mastering a Tier 1 spell will not be overly protracted, but it will still necessitate a degree of focused practice.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert, undeterred, continued to pore over the spell, repeating the incantations and visualizing the energy flows described. After approximately twenty minutes of concentrated effort, a surge of understanding washed over him.</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:33.0pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 43pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Valicar&#39;s Light Touch of Healing learned!</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Right,&quot; Robert said, a hint of relief in his voice. &quot;So, I can call it quits now, correct?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Indeed. The spell is now fully integrated into your repertoire. You can access it at any time through your System Spell Sheet.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert, with a flick of his wrist and a mental command, conjured the shimmering, translucent sheet, eager to see his newly acquired skill listed among his capabilities.</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Before you immediately gravitate towards pyrotechnics, I implore you to consider a broader range of offensive options. There&#39;s a whole world of elemental magic to explore.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert paused, momentarily taken aback. &quot;I appreciate the... <i>gentle </i>redirection,&quot; he said with a slight chuckle. &quot;Any specific suggestions, then? I&#39;m open to broadening my horizons.&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Indeed, let&#39;s begin with establishing a solid foundation. I recommend mastering &#39;Lesser Bullet of Water,&#39; &#39;Lesser Bullet of Earth,&#39; and, because I sense your unwavering fascination with flames, we can include &#39;Lesser Bullet of Fire&#39; as well. These spells, while seemingly simple, are versatile and will provide valuable experience in</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">manipulating different elemental energies. However, keep in mind that &#39;Fireball&#39;, that iconic spell of fiery destruction, is classified as a Tier 3 spell. As you currently do not have access to any Tier 3 spells, it is currently beyond your reach, but something to look to the future for.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert, accepting the wisdom of this approach, grinned sheepishly. &quot;Fair enough.
