left;">&quot;Not much, but enough to start,&quot; Robert commented. &quot;Those skill tokens are a nice touch.&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Correct. I think the System is being generous. Use those tokens now. Common-tier tokens probably won&#39;t be as valuable later on.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert agreed and spent his three tokens on the starter packages.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;left:0.4pt;min-height:170.2pt;top:0.4pt;width:208.5pt;"><p class="s6" style="padding-left: 39pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Purchase Complete:</p><p class="s8" style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 29pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">1 common dagger</p><p class="s8" style="padding-left: 29pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">1 common shortsword 1 common leather chest piece</p><p class="s8" style="padding-left: 29pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">1 common leather pants</p><p class="s8" style="padding-left: 29pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">1 common leather helmet</p><p class="s8" style="padding-left: 29pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">2 basic skill tokens</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert equipped the armor and strapped the shortsword to his belt. &quot;Time to continue,&quot; he said.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He approached the door and swung it open. A long hallway stretched out</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">before him, leading to a dimly lit room. Robert stepped into the corridor, his eyes scanning the darkness. As he reached the end of the hallway, he cast a light spell into the room. A cacophony of screeches erupted as three large rats charged towards him. Robert drew his sword and prepared to meet the onslaught. With a swift strike, he felled the first rat.</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:84.8pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Sword Strike: Tier 1 Sword Skill, Level 2 Short Sword Skill, +7 to attack chance, success, target hit. Damage applied base 5, bonus from skill 3,</p><p class="s12" style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 17pt;text-align: center;">size difference 4, total damage 12, target killed</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 1pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:33.0pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Quest Complete!</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The notification flashed before his eyes, detailing the attack. Before he could fully react, the second rat lunged, biting his leg.</p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:84.8pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 9pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">User attacked by Lart Common Rat, small size bonus +2, speed bonus +2 user distracted +2,</p><p class="s12" style="padding-left: 9pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">chance to hit +6, user hit. Base damage 2, tier 1, total damage 3, user hit for 3 health.</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Hal, turn off those notifications!&quot; Robert exclaimed, hopping back.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Confirmed.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Regaining his composure, Robert intercepted the third rat&#39;s attack and dispatched it with a swift blow. He then turned to finish off the second rat.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:136.5pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 155pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Combat complete:</p><p class="s12" style="padding-left: 160pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Targets Killed:</p><p class="s12" style="padding-left: 20pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">3 Level 1 Common Large Rats killed (10 exp*3),</p><p class="s12" style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">total 30 experience.</p><p class="s12" style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Skills used:</p><p class="s12" style="padding-left: 125pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Bladed Weapons: +3 exp Short Swords: +2 exp</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Okay, Hal, that could have gone better. Let&#39;s keep the combat notifications to the bare minimum, please.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:33.0pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Notification settings adjusted</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;So, what&#39;s next? Do I loot these things, search the room, or keep going?&quot; Robert asked.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Always loot your kills, you never know what you might find. Simply touch the body and think &#39;loot.&#39; While rats aren&#39;t worth much, you can learn skills to break down creatures more efficiently, obtaining valuable materials like skins, pelts, and other parts. The loot function is just a basic starting point.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert approached the first rat and looted it, receiving a single copper coin. He repeated the process with the other two rats. After a quick search of the room, he found nothing of interest except a new hallway leading deeper into the dungeon. With a determined look, Robert stepped into the unknown.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a href="https://oceanofpdf.com/">OceanofPDF.com</a></p><h1 style="padding-top: 2pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a name="bookmark29">&zwnj;</a>Chapter 14<a name="bookmark30">&zwnj;</a></h1><p style="padding-top: 21pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert pressed onward, his footsteps echoing softly in the dimly lit hallway that stretched out before him like a maw leading into the unknown. He reached the threshold of the next chamber and, with a murmured incantation and a flick of his wrist, cast a &#39;Minor Illumination&#39; spell, flooding the room with a soft, white light.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The sudden brilliance revealed a horrifying sight: a pack of oversized rats, their eyes gleaming with feral hunger, their high-pitched squeals piercing</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">the silence as they surged towards him in a wave of fur and teeth. Reacting instantly, Robert channeled his earth magic, shaping the raw energy into a dense, &#39;Lesser Bullet of Earth&#39; that hurtled towards the lead rat with brutal force.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The projectile struck true, impacting with a sickening thud and sending the creature sprawling lifelessly to the stone floor. Before the others could close the distance, he followed up with a &#39;Lesser Bullet of Fire&#39;, but his aim was slightly off, the fiery missile narrowly missing its intended target and impacting harmlessly against the far wall.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Undeterred, Robert swiftly recast the fire spell, his focus unwavering, and this time, the burning projectile found its mark, incinerating one of the remaining rodents in a flash of searing heat. As he was casting, one rat had gotten through his defenses. Drawing his hunting knife with practiced ease, He parried a set of teeth. another set sank into his leg. Robert parried the first set, his blade deflecting a vicious bite aimed at his hand. Out of the</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">corner of his eye he spotted the second rat, but felt teeth sink into his leg. Gritting his teeth, He finished off the rat in front of him.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He then turned to the one gnawing on him. A swift, decisive thrust of his blade silenced the last remaining rat, ending the immediate threat. The</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">chamber fell silent, save for Robert&#39;s own ragged breathing and the faint crackling of embers where the fire spell had impacted. He surveyed the scene, the bodies of the five oversized rodents littering the floor. With a sigh, he methodically looted the corpses, adding a paltry sum of eight</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">copper coins to his meager purse  a small reward for a surprisingly brutal encounter.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Shaking his head at the underwhelming spoils, he moved on, stepping cautiously into the next corridor, the darkness beckoning him deeper into the dungeon&#39;s depths. He allowed a moment of peace to wash over, before speaking, &quot;So, Hal, overall assessment? How am I performing so far?&quot; He tried to keep his voice light, masking the lingering throb in his leg and the underlying unease that gnawed at him.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Not a disastrous performance, all things considered,</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">however, I must inquire as to your defensive strategy, or rather, the apparent lack thereof. You sustained</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">unnecessary damage during that encounter, a wound that could have been easily avoided with the proactive application of a relatively simple protective spell. Why did you choose to engage in direct combat without first establishing any form of magical defense?</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 10pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Prudence dictates prioritizing personal safety, especially in an environment as unpredictable as a dungeon. A preemptive shield, even a minor one, could have significantly mitigated the risk.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert paused mid-stride, a wave of self-recrimination washing over him as Hal&#39;s words sank in. He slapped his forehead with the heel of his hand. &quot;Damn it,&quot; he muttered, chiding himself, &quot;I completely blanked on the</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">defensive spells. What an utterly idiotic oversight.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He mentally berated himself for his carelessness, a rookie mistake that could have had serious consequences. With a renewed sense of focus, he quickly summoned his System Spell Sheet, his eyes scanning the list of available spells, making a silent vow to prioritize defensive measures in future encounters.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He wouldn&#39;t make the same mistake twice. As he reached the threshold of the third room, he took a moment to prepare, his earlier recklessness replaced with a cautious approach. He first murmured the incantation for</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&#39;Minor Shield of Air,&#39; feeling the familiar sensation of swirling air currents forming a protective barrier around him.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Then to top off his health he added the words of &#39;Valicar&#39;s Light Touch of Healing&#39; on himself. He inhaled deeply, centering himself, and then, with another whispered incantation, cast &#39;Minor Illumination&#39; into the chamber, bathing the space in a revealing light, ready to face whatever awaited him.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Two distinct groups of three rats each scurried out from opposite corners of the room, their beady eyes glinting menacingly in the sudden brightness.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert reacted with practiced efficiency, launching a volley of three &#39;Lesser Bullets of Earth&#39; at the group on his right, while simultaneously drawing his hunting knife and closing the distance with the rats on his left, prepared to engage them in close-quarters combat.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">The ensuing battle was a whirlwind of motion and magic, but thanks to his preemptive defensive measures, it was remarkably brief and one-sided. He emerged victorious, completely unscathed, the six rats lying lifeless on the stone floor.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">A slight frown creased his forehead as he surveyed the scene. &quot;Hal,&quot; he inquired, a hint of suspicion in his voice, &quot;isn&#39;t this well, isn&#39;t this a bit</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">*too* easy? I mean, these are supposed to be training runs, but I&#39;m barely breaking a sweat.&quot; He felt a growing sense of unease, a feeling that something wasn&#39;t quite right.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">You are, quite literally, engaging in combat with rodents, Robert, large rodents, admittedly, but rodents nonetheless. While their size may be somewhat enhanced compared to their mundane counterparts, they still possess the inherent limitations of, well, *rats*. Their tactical prowess is hardly noteworthy.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 10pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">This particular dungeon floor is a standard introductory scenario, meticulously designed to acclimate you to the fundamentals of combat and spellcasting within a controlled, relatively low-risk environment. It&#39;s a proving ground for basic skills, not a crucible of ultimate challenge.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">However, do not allow this initial ease to lull you into a false sense of security. Complacency is a dangerous enemy. The difficulty will escalate progressively. Consider this a gentle introduction; the true challenges lie ahead.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;I suppose you&#39;re right,&quot; Robert acknowledged. &quot;So, this was the third room. I&#39;m guessing there are only a few more. This won&#39;t be a long dungeon floor.&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Correct, Remember, this is just the beginning. The real tests lie ahead.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Duly noted,&quot; Robert murmured, acknowledging Hal&#39;s advice and making a conscious effort to dispel any burgeoning complacency. He methodically looted the fallen rodents, collecting their meager offerings before proceeding down the seemingly endless hallway, the silence broken only by the rhythmic tap of his boots against the stone floor.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He reached the entrance to the next chamber, and, remembering his earlier oversight, he paused to recast &#39;Minor Shield of Air,&#39; renewing the protective barrier of swirling wind currents around him  a precaution that had already proven its worth.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">With another muttered incantation, he cast &#39;Floating Mage Light,&#39; flooding the room with light and revealing the next challenge: two groups of four rats each, a noticeable increase in both number and, presumably, potential threat compared to the previous encounters.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He stuck to his now-established strategy, a combination of ranged magic and close-quarters combat. He unleashed a barrage of &#39;Lesser Bullets of Earth&#39; at the group positioned on his right, while simultaneously charging</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">towards the group on his left, his hunting knife held ready. As he closed the distance, a swift, darting strike from one of the rats glanced off his newly- cast shield, the impact jarring but ultimately harmless  a potent reminder that even these seemingly insignificant creatures could pose a danger if underestimated. The battle was short but furious, a flurry of spells and steel. Finally, with the last rat dispatched and silence returning to the chamber, Robert looted the bodies, adding their meager coins to his growing pouch.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He then paused, leaning against the wall for a moment, taking several deep breaths to regulate his breathing and calm his racing heart. &quot;Hal,&quot; he inquired, a hint of weariness in his voice, &quot;quick question: if I were to rest here for a short period, say, a minute or two, to regain my stamina, would these *delightful* rats respawn, forcing me to repeat this charming exercise?&quot; The question was pragmatic, a consideration of resource management and efficient progression.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Respawns depend on the dungeon, for this training dungeon, they won&#39;t. Take your time and rest</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Valuable intel, indeed,&quot; Robert acknowledged, mentally filing away the information about the lack of immediate respawning for future reference; a small comfort, but a welcome one nonetheless. After allowing himself a</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">brief respite, a few precious moments to catch his breath and gather his strength, he straightened up, pushing himself away from the wall and steeling his resolve for the next challenge. He proceeded into the connecting hallway, his senses heightened, anticipating another encounter with the dungeon&#39;s ubiquitous rodent population.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Reaching the entrance to the next chamber, he paused, performing his now- routine pre-combat ritual: a murmured incantation to re-cast &#39;Minor Shield of Air,&#39; ensuring his protective barrier was at full strength. Then, taking a deep, steadying breath, he cast &#39;Floating Mage Light,&#39; the spell banishing</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">the darkness and revealing the scene within: not two, but *three* distinct groups of rats, a significant escalation in the threat level, their beady eyes gleaming with predatory hunger.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert reacted instantly, his training kicking in. He unleashed a rapid-fire barrage of &#39;Lesser Bullets of Earth,&#39; his aim honed by previous encounters, decimating almost half of the assembled rodents before they could even</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">close the distance. He then transitioned seamlessly to melee combat, drawing his hunting knife and moving with a surprising agility, weaving through the remaining rats, his blade a blur of silver.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Despite his proactive defense and swift attacks, he couldn&#39;t avoid all damage; several rats managed to land glancing blows, but his air shield held firm, absorbing the brunt of the impacts. Finally, after a frantic, heart-</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">pounding skirmish, the last rat fell, silence descending once more upon the chamber.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert, leaning heavily against the wall, his chest heaving, his breath coming in ragged gasps, muttered, &quot;Hal, that... that was significantly more</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">intense than the previous encounters.&quot; The understatement was palpable; he was clearly feeling the strain of the escalating challenges.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Indeed, the difficulty increased substantially, but you performed admirably, Robert. You maintained your composure under pressure and secured a decisive victory.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 10pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">While you sustained some minor damage, that&#39;s a natural consequence of engaging in combat, particularly given your current level of experience and skill mastery. With consistent practice and dedicated training, your efficiency and defensive capabilities will undoubtedly improve.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;That&#39;s true, I suppose,&quot; Robert replied, his voice still slightly breathy. &quot;It&#39;s strange... logically, I knew I wasn&#39;t in any <i>actual </i>peril, but the adrenaline,</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">the instinct... it still felt incredibly intense.&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Combat is inherently stressful. Increased power and skill will make future battles of this scale easier to manage. For now, prioritize learning from each encounter and honing your techniques through practice. That is the path to mastery.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;That&#39;s a perspective I hadn&#39;t fully considered, but I suppose you&#39;re right,&quot; Robert conceded, acknowledging the wisdom in Hal&#39;s words. He leaned against the wall, taking a few more deep, steadying breaths. &quot;Just give me a minute to collect myself, and then I&#39;ll press on. No use delaying the inevitable.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">After allowing himself a short period of recuperation, a brief pause to regain his composure and let his heart rate return to normal, Robert pushed himself upright, a renewed sense of determination hardening his gaze. He ventured into the next hallway, the narrow passage leading him deeper into the dungeon&#39;s unknown depths.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">As he reached the threshold of the next chamber, his hand instinctively went through motions, ready to renew, his now-routine pre-combat preparation: a whispered incantation to refresh the swirling winds of his &#39;Minor Shield of Air,&#39; ensuring his defenses were at their peak. But before his hand moved, and he could utter the first syllable of the spell, Hal&#39;s voice resonated clearly in his mind, an unexpected interruption that brought him to a halt.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">This will be the final room. Expect your hardest fight.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert, momentarily paused by Hal&#39;s interruption, took the opportunity to review his available spells, seeking a way to enhance his combat</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">effectiveness. He decided to add a new layer to his pre-battle preparations, selecting &#39;Minor Increased Movement&#39; from his repertoire, a spell designed to imbue him with a temporary burst of speed. He murmured the incantation, feeling a subtle surge of energy coursing through his limbs, a lightness in his step. Satisfied that he was as prepared as he could be, he stepped across the threshold and into the next chamber, simultaneously casting &#39;Floating Mage Light&#39; to banish the darkness.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The sudden illumination revealed a truly daunting sight: four distinct groups of four rats each, a veritable horde of rodents, their eyes gleaming with predatory hunger as they surged towards him in a unified wave of attack. This was, by far, the most significant challenge he had faced yet.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Reacting instantly, Robert unleashed a rapid-fire volley of &#39;Lesser Bullets of Earth,&#39; his enhanced speed allowing him to cast and aim with remarkable swiftness. The projectiles slammed into the advancing rats, cutting a swathe of destruction through their ranks, eliminating roughly half of the monstrous rodents before they could even close the distance. Without missing a beat, he transitioned to melee combat, drawing his hunting knife and engaging the remaining rats, relying on his &#39;Minor Shield of Air&#39; to deflect the inevitable attacks from the swarming creatures.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The battle was a blur of motion and violence, a desperate dance of survival.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Despite his best efforts, his shield, weakened from blocking. began to</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">waver, and two rats managed to slip past his defenses, sinking their teeth into his leg, sending jolts of pain through him. A third rat, emboldened by his momentary vulnerability, launched a desperate, leaping attack, catching</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert off guard and sending him stumbling backward, momentarily disrupting his balance.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The remaining rats seized the opportunity, swarming him with renewed ferocity. In a desperate, adrenaline-fueled frenzy, Robert fought back with primal intensity, parrying bites, deflecting claws, and landing a lucky,</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">desperate blow that knocked one rat away. However, another rodent managed to latch onto his arm, its sharp teeth piercing his flesh, causing a searing wave of pain. Gritting his teeth against the agony, Robert, with a surge of raw strength born of desperation, punched the rat clinging to his</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">arm, dislodging it with a sickening crunch. Seizing the momentary reprieve, he instantly channeled his magic, forming and unleashing a &#39;Lesser Bullet</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">of Earth&#39; at point-blank range, obliterating the creature. He followed it up immediately with a second, aimed at the last remaining rat, finally ending the brutal encounter.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:33.0pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Level Up!</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert, his chest heaving, his breath coming in ragged gasps, slowly sank to the floor, the adrenaline-fueled frenzy giving way to exhaustion and the throbbing pain in his arm and leg. He leaned heavily against the cold stone wall, his body trembling with exertion. &quot;That... that was far too close,&quot; he muttered, his voice strained, the words barely audible above the pounding</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">of his heart. &quot;I need to get *significantly* better. That level of performance is simply unacceptable.&quot; The self-criticism was harsh, but honest; he knew he had made mistakes, relied too much on brute force and not enough on strategy and preparation.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">After several long moments, allowing his breathing to return to something approaching normal and the shaking in his limbs to subside, he focused his will, murmuring the incantation for &#39;Valicar&#39;s Light Touch of Healing,&#39; directing the restorative magic towards the gnawing pain in his arm.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He felt the familiar warmth spread through his injured limb, the tissues knitting themselves back together. Once the healing was complete, he pushed himself to his feet, his legs still slightly unsteady. He surveyed the chamber, now eerily silent save for the dripping of water somewhere in the</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">distance. The room was clear of immediate threats, the only remaining feature of note being a simple, wooden chest resting in the far corner.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">He methodically looted the sixteen rat corpses, collecting their meager spoils, before turning his attention to the chest, a flicker of anticipation stirring within him  a potential reward for his harrowing ordeal.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Well done, Robert, that was a tough fight, but you persevered. Once you open the chest, the portal home will appear.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Opening the chest Robert was greeted by the dungeon&#39;s AI</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;left:0.4pt;min-height:234.8pt;top:0.4pt;width:287.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Dungeon run complete: Uncommon chest awarded.</p><p class="s6" style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Chest contains:</p><p class="s9" style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">One skill book (Aikido) Five silver coins</p><p class="s9" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Two basic skill tokens</p><p class="s9" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">One Uncommon Shop Token</p><p class="s6" style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Items added to user inventory.</p><p class="s6" style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Thank you for visiting The Training Dungeon!</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">With that the chest vanished, replaced by a shimmering portal. As Robert stepped through the portal he received one final notice:</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:33.0pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Quest Complete!</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a href="https://oceanofpdf.com/">OceanofPDF.com</a></p><h1 style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a name="bookmark31">&zwnj;</a>Chapter 15<a name="bookmark32">&zwnj;</a></h1><p style="padding-top: 21pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">A surge of energy, exhilarating and potent, coursed through Robert as he stepped through the shimmering portal, back into the familiar confines of his home. The crisp, clean air filled his lungs, a stark contrast to the stale, damp atmosphere of the dungeon. The now-familiar &quot;Level Up!&quot; notification flashed before his eyes, a testament to his victory, but the sense of triumph was quickly overshadowed by a much more heartwarming sensation.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Two tiny arms, strong with the fierce love of a child, wrapped themselves around his legs in a vice-like grip. &quot;Daddy, you&#39;re back!&quot; Stacey&#39;s cheerful voice, filled with unadulterated joy, rang out, instantly melting away the lingering tension from the dungeon. &quot;My little princess,&quot; Robert chuckled, his voice thick with emotion as he reached down and ruffled her hair. He looked around, realizing the rest of his family wasn&#39;t immediately there.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;I&#39;m back, and I&#39;m alright. Where&#39;s everyone else? Did they forget about their old man?&quot; &quot;Mommy&#39;s in the shower,&quot; Stacey explained, her voice</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">dropping to a conspiratorial whisper, &quot;and the boys are...&quot; Her explanation was cut short as John and Richard, alerted by the commotion, burst into the room, their faces lighting up at the sight of their father. &quot;Dad! You&#39;re really back!&quot; John exclaimed, his usual reserved demeanor cracking to reveal pure, unadulterated relief.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Yes, I&#39;m back,&quot; Robert confirmed, his voice steady despite the whirlwind of emotions swirling within him. The relief of returning home, the joy of seeing his children, the lingering adrenaline from the dungeon - it was almost overwhelming. &quot;I&#39;ve finished the first floor. Let&#39;s wait for your</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">mother, and then we can talk about it, okay? I have a lot to tell you.&quot; He headed towards the bathroom suite, his heart swelling with a profound</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">sense of gratitude.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Honey, I&#39;m back,&quot; he called out to Sara, his voice echoing slightly in the tiled space. &quot;Give me a minute,&quot; Sara replied, her voice muffled by the</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">sound of running water. Turning around to head back to the kids, Robert only took a few steps before he was enveloped in a tight, almost desperate hug. Sara, wrapped in a towel, her hair damp, clung to him as if he might disappear.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;You made it back,&quot; she whispered, her voice trembling slightly, her body pressed against his. The fear and worry she had been holding back for days poured out in that single, heartfelt embrace. A warm smile spread across Robert&#39;s face, and he held her close, savoring the feeling of her in his arms. &quot;Yes, I did,&quot; he murmured, burying his face in her hair. &quot;But we should probably get out of the bathroom. The kids are waiting, and they&#39;re probably bursting with questions.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The kids will wait a minute, Sara murmured, pulling Robert into a passionate kiss, her earlier worry replaced by a surge of affection. She</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">lingered for a moment, her eyes, filled with a mix of relief and lingering worry, softening as she gazed at him. I was so worried, she whispered, her voice thick with emotion. After a much-needed moment with Sara, clinging to the normalcy and love it represented, Robert returned to the living room.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The kids were excitedly chattering, their earlier apprehension replaced by a flurry of questions and observations. He sat down on the couch, instantly becoming the center of their attention. &quot;So,&quot; he asked, a playful twinkle in his eye, &quot;what do you want to talk about, kids? What burning questions do you have for your old, dungeon-delving dad?&quot; John, ever the eager one, his mind always racing, immediately piped up. So, what did you see? What did you do? What did you fight? Tell us everything!&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert leaned back, a thoughtful expression on his face, and began to recount his adventure. He painted a vivid picture of the dungeon floor he had just explored, describing the echoing, torch-lit corridors, the chilling dampness, and the monstrous creatures he had encountered. He spoke of the challenges he had faced, the strategic battles he had fought, and the close calls that had left his heart pounding. As he spoke, he could see the wonder and fear reflected in their eyes, their imaginations running wild with his descriptions, their concern for him evident.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">When he finished, a flurry of questions erupted. You fought rats?&quot; John asked, a hint of disappointment in his voice, clearly unimpressed. &quot;Even I could fight rats! Did you find any loot? Yes, rats, Robert replied, a</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">chuckle escaping his lips, &quot;but rats the size of small dogs. And lots of them, all at once. Imagine a whole horde of them, rushing at you in the dark.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Gross,&quot; Stacey exclaimed, wrinkling her nose in disgust. &quot;No more talk about rats, Dad. Please.&quot; &quot;As for loot,&quot; Robert continued, pulling out a handful of copper coins from his pocket, their dull gleam reflecting the lamplight, &quot;just coins. Not much value here, unfortunately. But I did find a chest at the end, hidden away in a corner. Inside was a skill book.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">A skill book?&quot; Richard asked, his eyes widening with interest. &quot;What does it do? What kind of skill?&quot; It teaches me Aikido, Robert answered, holding up the worn leather-bound book. Aikido? Stacey asked, tilting</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">her head. Whats that? Its a type of martial art, Robert explained. A way of fighting, but also a way of moving, of using your body.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Ill probably learn it and then teach you all. It&#39;s all about using your opponent&#39;s energy against them. I also got a few more Skill Points, so I might be able to level up my teaching skill to Tier 3, which will let me teach you guys even better.&quot; With that, Robert decided to put the excitement of his return behind him and spent the rest of the day just relaxing with his family, savoring their company, and recharging after his ordeal.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The following morning, Robert woke up early, his mind buzzing with the possibilities that the new skill book presented. He retreated to his home office, a quiet sanctuary where he could focus without distraction. As he</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">opened the book, a prompt appeared before his eyes, asking if he wanted to spend a skill point to learn the skill within. He selected &quot;yes,&quot; and a surge of knowledge flooded his mind, a torrent of information washing over him.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Images flashed before his eyes: graceful movements, precise strikes, and effective defenses, all flowing together in a seamless dance of motion. He saw bodies twisting, turning, redirecting force. Aikido, he realized, was more than just a martial art. It was a philosophy, a way of life. It emphasized harmony, balance, and the use of an opponent&#39;s force against them, a principle that resonated deeply with him.</p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:50.2pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 160pt;text-indent: -144pt;text-align: left;">General Skill - Martial Arts Unlocked, Subskill Aikido Learned.</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The notification confirmed his understanding. Eager to put this new</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">knowledge into practice, he headed out to the backyard, the cool morning air crisp against his skin. As he moved through the forms, practicing the graceful, flowing movements of Aikido, he felt a sense of peace settle over him, a sense of power tempered by control.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">His family watched from the window, a mix of amusement and admiration on their faces. &quot;Honey, that was... impressive,&quot; Sara said, a teasing twinkle in her eye, as he finished his practice. John and Stacey, however, were less impressed. &quot;Mom, really?&quot; John groaned, rolling his eyes. &quot;Sorry, kids,&quot;</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Sara chuckled, ruffling John&#39;s hair. &quot;Just a little too much excitement for this early in the morning.&quot; Robert laughed as he headed back inside, wiping the sweat from his brow. &quot;Thanks, honey,&quot; he said, grinning. &quot;Later, I&#39;ll</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">show you some more moves, maybe teach you a few.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Gross!&quot; the kids chorused, their faces scrunched up in mock disgust, a playful end to the morning&#39;s training. While continuing to laugh, Robert told them he was headed back into his office to look into using his stat points from his level up. He needed a clear head for that.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He decided to allocate one stat point to Intelligence, bringing it up to match his Wisdom, creating a balance that felt right. Another point went to Dexterity, to enhance his newly acquired martial arts prowess, to make his movements sharper, more fluid. Finishing that up, he looked at his Skill Points. He had three basic and four Unlocked points, which would be enough to get his teaching up to the next tier.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Making his decision, he focused his will, channeling the points into upgrading his Teaching skill. He invested three points, elevating it to Tier 3, Level 4, a satisfied hum resonating within him as he felt the skill solidify, growing stronger. Robert took a deep breath, his fingers drumming on the desk, a nervous energy thrumming through him. He&#39;d leveled up his Teaching skill, and now came the true test, the one that made him the most</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">apprehensive. &quot;Hal,&quot; he asked his AI companion, his voice low, &quot;how do I use this on John? How do I transfer this knowledge?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Think about the knowledge you want to transfer. Call him in, and I&#39;ll guide you through it.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">A knot formed in Robert&#39;s stomach. This wasn&#39;t just teaching anymore. This was rewriting his son&#39;s mind, imprinting knowledge directly onto his consciousness. &quot;John,&quot; he called out, his voice slightly strained, &quot;can you</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">come here for a second?&quot; John entered, his usual carefree demeanor replaced by a flicker of curiosity, sensing the seriousness in his father&#39;s tone. &quot;Yeah, Dad? What&#39;s up?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Go ahead and place one of your hands on John&#39;s head. Once you are ready focus on teaching him the skill. Let John know it will feel strange and will probably give him a headache.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Repeating what Hal had said, Robert placed a hand on John&#39;s head, the touch feeling strangely unnatural, almost invasive. &quot;Just relax and focus,&quot; he instructed, his voice low and steady. &quot;It might feel a little...strange. Hal says you might get a headache.&quot; John closed his eyes, a trusting smile on his face, completely unaware of the monumental process about to begin.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert took a deep breath and channeled the knowledge, picturing equations and formulas, the building blocks of Algebra, flowing from his mind into his son&#39;s.</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:119.2pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">You are attempting to grant the Subskill Algebra to a Non-System User.</p><p class="s12" style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 17pt;text-align: center;">This is not recommended.</p><p class="s12" style="padding-left: 9pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Repeated use of this ability can cause harm to the recipient.</p><p class="s12" style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 17pt;text-align: center;">Do you wish to continue (Yes/No)?</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He gritted his teeth, his resolve hardening, and mentally pressed &quot;Yes.&quot; Nothing seemed to happen for a moment, the silence stretching, then John suddenly tensed up, his body going rigid. A moment later, he started to</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">shake, a soft groan escaping his lips, a single tear forming in the corner of his closed eye.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:102.0pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Transfer complete.</p><p class="s12" style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Non-System User John Williams has been given the following Skill</p><p class="s12" style="padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Mathematics at Tier 1 Level 3 Subskill Algebra at Level 3.</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert took his hand off John&#39;s head, his own hand trembling slightly. John slumped to the ground as if his strings had been cut, his face pale, his breathing shallow. &quot;John? Are you alright?&quot; Robert asked, his voice laced with worry, fear gripping his heart. Had he pushed too far? John opened his eyes, a grimace forming on his face, his hand going to his head. &quot;Yeah, I think so,&quot; he said, his voice weak. &quot;But...wow. That felt like someone crammed an entire textbook into my head, all at once. My head is pounding.&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">That should be the worst time for him The issue was you imparted a skill and a subskill; he was hit twice as hard. I&#39;d give him at least 3 weeks before you try another one.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;It seems I made a mistake,&quot; Robert admitted, his voice filled with regret. &quot;I should&#39;ve just transferred the Math skill first. By going straight for Algebra, the system had to grant the general Math skill first. That was a bit much, all at once. Too much information.&quot; He turned to John, his voice full of concern. &quot;Hal says we need to wait at least three weeks before attempting</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">another skill transfer. We&#39;ll let your mind recover. For your brother and</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">sister, we&#39;ll start with basic Math today, and we&#39;ll revisit Algebra in a couple of weeks. We&#39;ll take it slower.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Later that day, Robert repeated the process with Richard, Stacey, and Sara, transferring the general Math skill to each of them. While they experienced some discomfort, a mild headache and a feeling of mental fullness, it was nowhere near as intense as John&#39;s reaction. They were able to handle the</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">single skill transfer much better.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Exhausted from the intense mental exertion, the sheer emotional toll of transferring skills to his family, the worry and the relief swirling within him, the family decided to call it a night and retire early. They needed rest, time to process the day&#39;s extraordinary events, and to prepare for the challenges that still lay ahead. The weight of his responsibilities, the power</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">he now wielded, and the uncertain future pressed down on Robert, but as he looked at his sleeping family, he knew he would do whatever it took to protect them, to guide them through this new, strange reality.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a href="https://oceanofpdf.com/">OceanofPDF.com</a></p><h1 style="padding-top: 2pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a name="bookmark33">&zwnj;</a>Chapter 16<a name="bookmark34">&zwnj;</a></h1><p style="padding-top: 21pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The days immediately following Robert&#39;s first harrowing dungeon</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">experience were a period of intense adjustment and rapid transformation, not just for him, but for the entire family. John, in particular, underwent a</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">remarkable metamorphosis. While initially disoriented by the sudden influx of advanced mathematical knowledge, he quickly embraced his newfound abilities with an almost obsessive fervor. He spent countless hours poring</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">over textbooks, scribbling complex equations on any available surface, his usual lighthearted demeanor replaced by a laser-like focus that bordered on unsettling.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He devoured information like a starving man, his mind effortlessly grasping concepts that had previously been beyond his reach. Robert watched his eldest son with a mixture of pride and concern, constantly monitoring him</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">for any adverse side effects, any sign that the forced knowledge transfer had caused unforeseen damage. While Richard and Stacey didn&#39;t exhibit the</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">same dramatic shift as John, they too displayed a significant, albeit more subtle, improvement in their mathematical comprehension, a testament to the effectiveness of Robert&#39;s Teaching skill, even at its current level.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The day after his return from the dungeon, Robert faced the daunting task</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">of explaining his sudden departure from his job. He informed his boss, with a carefully crafted explanation about an urgent and unforeseen personal</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">matter, that he needed to tender his immediate resignation. His boss, understandably, was far from thrilled, expressing his displeasure with a</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">mixture of frustration and bewilderment. However, he ultimately conceded, recognizing the sincerity in Robert&#39;s voice and the urgency in his eyes.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Fortunately, Robert had accumulated a substantial amount of vacation time  thirty days&#39; worth  which provided a temporary financial cushion, a small reprieve in the midst of the overwhelming uncertainty. Later, while examining the silver coins he&#39;d acquired from the dungeon, Robert noticed</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">their unremarkable appearance, devoid of any intricate designs, save for a series of strange, unfamiliar symbols etched onto their surfaces.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Hal explained that these markings were in the System&#39;s original language, a unique script that could only be applied to officially sanctioned System currency. Each coin, Hal further elaborated, weighed precisely one ounce and could be sold for approximately thirty dollars in the outside world.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">While this wasn&#39;t a king&#39;s ransom, a few hundred of these coins would be sufficient to cover their basic living expenses for a reasonable period.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The real financial breakthrough, however, would come if he could manage to acquire a few gold coins  a prospect that would significantly alleviate</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">their immediate monetary concerns and allow them to explore the potentially lucrative, but still largely unknown, possibilities of enchanting items. Driven by this need, and by the looming six-month deadline, Robert threw himself into a rigorous training regimen.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He meticulously studied the spellbook, committing incantations and diagrams to memory, practicing the intricate hand gestures and vocalizations required for each spell. He sparred with John, honing his swordsmanship skills, and diligently practiced Aikido, striving for fluidity and precision in his movements. After three long days of dedicated practice, talking with the family, it was agreed it was time to take on the second</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">floor.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Finally, clad in his full armor, a significant upgrade from his previous attire, and with his weapons readily accessible, Robert stepped back through the shimmering portal, venturing once more into the depths of the Training Dungeon, ready to face whatever challenges awaited him on the second</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">floor. He was armed not only with steel and magic, but also with a growing understanding of the System and a fierce determination to protect his family.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;<b>Welcome to Dungeon 7883667HG8776DE985762763FF7-1 currently called The Training Dungeon</b>,&quot; the dungeon AI announced.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert, recognizing the familiar room, quickly snapped a few photos for his family. He then turned his attention to the System Store.</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><table style="border-collapse:collapse;margin-left:6.625pt"
