style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Hal, is the System trolling me? Robert asked, puzzled by the offerings.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">No, while the System wont simply hand you everything, it also recognizes your unique circumstances. Its ensuring youre prepared without making it too easy</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">So, these spellbooks could contain incredibly powerful spells, or they could be useless? Robert questioned.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">I cant say for certain. Any spell can be valuable, especially for training your skills. However, the specific spells are</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">random</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">That ruins my plan to sell coins to support my family, Robert lamented.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Selling System coins might not be a sustainable strategy.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Its unlikely that people regularly find large quantities of gold and silver coins</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;You&#39;re absolutely right,&quot; Robert concurred, his mind already racing with possibilities. &quot;My primary focus for income generation needs to shift towards enchanting. If I can master the creation of even moderately enchanted items, I should be able to sell a few discreetly before arousing</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">undue suspicion or attracting unwanted attention from well, anyone who might take an interest in unexplained magical artifacts.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He paused, considering another potential avenue. &quot;And healing magic that could be an even more lucrative, and perhaps less conspicuous, option.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">If I can acquire and master more potent healing spells, spells beyond the basic &#39;Light Touch of Healing,&#39; I might be able to offer discreet, paid healing services. People are always seeking miracle cures, and I could potentially provide them, for a price, of course. It&#39;s a delicate balance, though  too much visibility, and I risk exposure; too little, and we won&#39;t have enough to live on.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Driven by this strategic shift in focus, Robert interacted with the glowing orb once more, making several purchases from the System Store. With that business concluded, he closed the shop interface, the holographic display vanishing with a shimmer. Before venturing out of the safe confines of the landing room, he took a moment to equip the newly acquired armor pieces, the firm leather a reassuring weight against his skin. He adjusted the straps, ensuring a snug but comfortable fit, a tangible improvement in his defenses. Ready, he moved to the next room.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">As he stepped through the doorway and into the first chamber of this new floor, he was immediately struck by an unusual, almost unsettling,</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">ambiance. Unlike the previous rooms, which had been shrouded in darkness save for his own magical illumination, this one was bathed in a soft, ethereal glow, emanating from an unseen source. The light was strangely unsettling, casting long, distorted shadows that seemed to dance and shift of their own accord.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Peering cautiously into the chamber, Robert&#39;s eyes widened in surprise. He spotted several amorphous, gelatinous shapes, shifting and pulsing rhythmically, their forms indistinct and constantly changing. They were</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">unlike anything he had encountered before.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Hal,&quot; he inquired, his voice a hushed whisper, &quot;is there a System function, some kind of spell or ability, that allows me to *identify* unknown entities or objects? I need more information about what I&#39;m dealing with here.&quot; He felt a prickle of unease; these strange creatures were clearly something beyond his current understanding.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">You can use the Identify skill to learn about creatures and items. Higher tiers provide more detailed information.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;That sounds like a necessary skill for survival in this place,&quot; Robert muttered, acknowledging the inherent dangers of facing unknown entities.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He promptly allocated a Skill Point to learn &#39;Identify,&#39; understanding its importance for both offense and defense.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:50.2pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 79pt;text-indent: -54pt;text-align: left;">General Skill Identify Learned, due to feats, skill unlocked at Tier 4 Level 5.</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">With his new skill, Robert focused on one of the creatures.</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;min-height:174.8pt;width:287.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="s8">: Common Slime</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Class<span class="s8">: N/A</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Race<span class="s8">: Slime (Red) </span>Profession<span class="s8">: N/A </span>Gender<span class="s8">: N/A</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Stats<span class="s8">: Str 1, Dex 1, Con 1, Int 1, Wis 1, Cha 1</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Level<span class="s8">: 3</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Resistances<span class="s8">: Physical (100%), Fire (100%)</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Health<span class="s8">: 25</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Mana<span class="s8">: N/A</span></p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Wonderful,&quot; Robert muttered sarcastically, reading the information provided by &#39;Identify.&#39; &quot;So, we have five Red Slimes, boasting a delightful</p><p class="s5" style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">one hundred percent <span class="p">resistance to both physical </span>and <span class="p">fire damage. Just perfect. My sword is about as useful as a wet noodle against these things.&quot; He paused a beat.</span></p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">That would be a good guess.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Five Red slimes, no fire,&quot; he repeated. He considered. &quot;Given the elemental nature of magic, and the fact that these are <i>Red </i>Slimes, associated with fire, it&#39;s a logical deduction that water-based attacks would be their weakness. I&#39;ll proceed on that assumption; it&#39;s the best option I have at the moment.&quot; With his strategy tentatively decided, Robert prepared for the</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">encounter. He murmured the incantation for &#39;Minor Shield of Air,&#39; feeling the familiar sensation of swirling air currents forming a protective barrier around him. Then, with a cautious step, he entered the chamber, his senses on high alert.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The slimes, predictably slow and sluggish in their movements, began to</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">advance towards him, their gelatinous bodies quivering with what he could only assume was predatory intent. Selecting the nearest slime as his initial target, Robert focused his will and unleashed a &#39;Lesser Bullet of Water,&#39; the projectile arcing through the air towards the amorphous creature. The watery missile struck the slime with a resounding <i>splat</i>, and Robert</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">immediately followed up by casting &#39;Identify&#39; again, checking the creature&#39;s status to gauge the effectiveness of his water-based attack and confirm his hypothesis.</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;min-height:174.8pt;width:287.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="s8">: Common Slime</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Class<span class="s8">: N/A</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Race<span class="s8">: Slime (Red) </span>Profession<span class="s8">: N/A </span>Gender<span class="s8">: N/A</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Stats<span class="s8">: Str 1, Dex 1, Con 1, Int 1, Wis 1, Cha 1</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Level<span class="s8">: 3</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Resistances<span class="s8">: Physical (100%), Fire (100%)</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Health<span class="s8">: 10</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Mana<span class="s8">: N/A</span></p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Water it is, then,&quot; Robert confirmed, a grim satisfaction in his voice as the &#39;Identify&#39; spell confirmed the significant damage inflicted by the &#39;Lesser Bullet of Water&#39;. With a newfound confidence in his chosen tactic, he moved with swift, practiced precision, dispatching the remaining slimes with a series of well-aimed water bullets. Each creature required two direct hits, a testament to their resilience, but against his focused water attacks, they proved no match. He maintained a steady rhythm, casting, aiming, and firing, his movements fluid and economical, conserving his mana as much as possible.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Once the final slime dissolved into a harmless puddle, leaving behind only a faint, shimmering residue, Robert allowed himself a moment to catch his breath. He methodically looted the fallen creatures, collecting his due. Each slime yielded a paltry sum of 5 copper coins, a small but expected reward.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">However, upon looting the final slime, he discovered a pleasant surprise: a small, shimmering opal, nestled amongst the dissolving remains. &quot;Well,</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">now,&quot; he murmured, picking up the gem and holding it up to the light, admiring its iridescent glow. &quot;A gem! I have no immediate idea of its</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">precise market value, but it&#39;s undoubtedly more valuable than a handful of copper.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">A welcome bonus, indeed.&quot; With the chamber finally cleared of all threats and rewards collected, Robert turned his attention to the next unexplored passage, eager to discover what further challenges  and potential treasures  awaited him within the depths of the dungeon. As he stepped through the doorway, he was immediately met with a new sight. Inside the next room, he encountered another group of slimes, but these were distinctly different in appearance from the previous group, their coloration a stark contrast to</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">the fiery red of the ones he had just defeated. A new variable had been introduced, and Robert knew he needed to adapt quickly.</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="p">: Common Slime</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Class<span class="p">: N/A</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Race<span class="p">: Slime (Blue)</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Profession<span class="p">: N/A</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Gender<span class="p">: N/A</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Stats<span class="p">: Str 1, Dex 1, Con 1, Int 1, Wis 1, Cha 1</span></h3><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 17pt;text-align: left;">Level<span class="p">: 3</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Resistances<span class="p">: Physical (100%), Water (100%)</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Health<span class="p">: 25</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Mana<span class="p">: N/A</span></h3><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 13pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Five more slimes,&quot; Robert observed, taking stock of the situation in the new chamber. &quot;But these are *blue* slimes. A complete reversal of the previous encounter. Logically, if Red Slimes are weak to water, then Blue</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Slimes, their elemental opposite, should be vulnerable to fire. &#39;Lesser Bullet of Water&#39; is definitely out; it&#39;s time to switch tactics.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He prepared himself for the encounter, a grim determination setting in. With the practiced efficiency born of repetition and a growing understanding of</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">the dungeon&#39;s mechanics, Robert engaged and swiftly dispatched the five Blue Slimes, his &#39;Lesser Bullets of Fire&#39; proving as effective as he had hypothesized. He moved with a confident fluidity, eager to progress and discover what further challenges, and potential rewards, lay beyond this chamber.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The next two rooms presented familiar scenarios, a sense of *dj vu* washing over him. The first contained Brown Slimes, which he quickly recognized as vulnerable to earth-based attacks, and the second was populated by Whitish-Blue Slimes, susceptible to his &#39;Minor Shield of Air,&#39; and his air based attacks. He dealt with these elemental foes methodically, conserving his mana and minimizing any unnecessary damage. While the loot obtained from these encounters was, as expected, unremarkable  a scattering of copper coins and the occasional minor crafting material  the fourth room he entered held a surprise, a deviation from the established pattern, hinting at the dungeon&#39;s potential for unexpected rewards.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The training was not just combat; it was about recognizing what element worked with what slime.</p><table style="border-collapse:collapse;margin-left:6.625pt" cellspacing="0"><tr style="height:88pt"><td style="width:77pt;border-top-style:solid;border-top-width:1pt;border-top-color:#EDEDED;border-left-style:solid;border-left-width:1pt;border-left-color:#EDEDED;border-bottom-style:solid;border-bottom-width:1pt;border-bottom-color:#EDEDED;border-right-style:solid;border-right-width:1pt;border-right-color:#EDEDED"><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s8" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Ring of Lesser</p><p class="s8" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Stoneskin</p></td><td style="width:27pt;border-top-style:solid;border-top-width:1pt;border-top-color:#EDEDED;border-left-style:solid;border-left-width:1pt;border-left-color:#EDEDED;border-bottom-style:solid;border-bottom-width:1pt;border-bottom-color:#EDEDED;border-right-style:solid;border-right-width:1pt;border-right-color:#EDEDED"><p style="padding-top: 8pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s8" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Tier 1</p></td><td style="width:353pt;border-top-style:solid;border-top-width:1pt;border-top-color:#EDEDED;border-left-style:solid;border-left-width:1pt;border-left-color:#EDEDED;border-bottom-style:solid;border-bottom-width:1pt;border-bottom-color:#EDEDED;border-right-style:solid;border-right-width:1pt;border-right-color:#EDEDED"><p class="s8" style="padding-left: 1pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">A plain copper ring that, when activated, envelops the</p><p class="s8" style="padding-left: 1pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">wearer in a thin, protective layer of stone. This &#39;Stoneskin&#39; absorbs 15 points of damage before dissipating. The ring holds 10 charges, consuming one per activation. It can be recharged at a cost of 100 mana per charge.</p></td></tr></table><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;A genuine magic item! My very first one, in fact. Not a bad start at all,&quot; Robert murmured, a surge of excitement coursing through him. He carefully slipped the Ring of Lesser Stoneskin onto his finger, the cool metal a</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">tangible reminder of his progress. The simple copper band felt surprisingly substantial, imbued with a subtle energy he could almost sense. He admired it for a moment before turning his attention back to the dungeon, his focus sharpening. He moved on to the next room, pushing open the heavy door and stepping through, his senses on high alert. As he entered he spoke.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Well, now <i>this </i>presents a more complex tactical scenario,&quot; he observed, taking in the scene before him. &quot;Two distinct groups, each comprised of eight slimes and a mix of <i>all four </i>elemental types in each group.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Two red, two blue, two brown, and two whitish-blue. Definitely a step up in difficulty, but nothing insurmountable, provided I approach this methodically.&quot; He paused, formulating a plan of attack, drawing upon his previous experiences. Robert decided to adhere to the elemental weaknesses he had already established, prioritizing targets based on the order he had encountered them previously. This meant focusing first on the Red Slimes, neutralizing them with &#39;Lesser Bullets of Water,&#39; then shifting his attention to the Blue Slimes, exploiting their vulnerability to fire with appropriately</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">targeted spells.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The Brown (Earth) and Whitish-Blue (Air) slimes would follow, each engaged with their respective elemental weaknesses. It was a calculated approach, designed to maximize his efficiency and minimize the risk.</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:33.0pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Level Up!</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">After looting the fallen slimes, Robert proceeded to the final room. Inside, he found two massive, imposing slimes. Using Identify, he learned more about these formidable foes.</p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;min-height:174.8pt;width:287.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="s8">: Uncommon Large Slime</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Class<span class="s8">: N/A</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Race<span class="s8">: Slime (Red) </span>Profession<span class="s8">: N/A </span>Gender<span class="s8">: N/A</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Stats<span class="s8">: Str 3, Dex 3, Con 6, Int 3, Wis 3, Cha 3</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Level<span class="s8">: 3</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Resistances<span class="s8">: Physical (100%), Fire (100%)</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Class<span class="s8">: N/A</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Race<span class="s8">: Slime (Blue)</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Profession<span class="s8">: N/A</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Gender<span class="s8">: N/A</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Stats<span class="s8">: Str 3, Dex 3, Con 6, Int 3, Wis 3, Cha 3</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Level<span class="s8">: 3</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Resistances<span class="s8">: Physical (100%), Water (100%)</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Health<span class="s8">: 100</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Mana<span class="s8">: N/A</span></p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Alright,&quot; Robert muttered, steeling his resolve as he surveyed the daunting challenge before him. &quot;These slimes are clearly a significant step up from</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">the previous encounters. They&#39;ll be tougher to take down, requiring more mana and more precise tactics. But,&quot; he added, a determined glint in his eyes, &quot;we <i>can </i>do this. Careful planning and precise execution are key.&quot; He took a deep breath, mentally preparing himself for a protracted and demanding fight.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">As soon as Robert crossed the threshold into the chamber, a fiery projectile launched with surprising speed and accuracy by the Red Slime slammed into him, bypassing his now-dormant air shield.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The searing heat caught him completely off guard, inflicting a painful 10 points of fire damage. The sudden attack served as a harsh lesson: these</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">slimes were not only more resilient but also possessed offensive capabilities.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He immediately prioritized maintaining a safe distance, dodging a jet of water launched by the Blue Slime. In return, he retaliated with a carefully</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">aimed &#39;Lesser Bullet of Water&#39; of his own, striking the red slime. However, to his dismay, the attack only inflicted a mere 7 points of damage  a significantly lower amount than he had anticipated. &quot;This is going to be a <i>long </i>and arduous battle,&quot; he grimaced, realizing the increased resilience of these enhanced slimes. With unwavering determination, Robert settled into a grueling rhythm, unleashing a relentless barrage of &#39;Lesser Bullets of</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Water&#39; at the Red Slime, prioritizing it based on his established strategy.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The combat was a protracted, intense affair, demanding constant focus and precise spellcasting. Finally, after what felt like an eternity, the targeted Red Slime dissolved. He immediately shifted his focus to the Blue Slime, switching to &#39;Lesser Bullets of Fire&#39; to exploit its elemental weakness. The</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">fire spells proved more effective, bringing the blue slime down more quickly. The battle, though ultimately successful, left Robert utterly drained, his mana reserves significantly depleted. He checked his character stats, noticing for the first time that his Stamina had reached 10 points  a milestone, but also a clear indication of his physical exhaustion.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He made a mental note to investigate ways to improve his Stamina regeneration. As he finished looting the fallen slimes, collecting his hard- earned rewards, he was surprised to discover that each slime had yielded a <i>silver </i>coin  a substantial improvement over the copper he&#39;d been finding. Then, as soon as he claimed the final coin, the remnants of the defeated slimes vanished completely, and in their place, a treasure chest materialized with a soft shimmer, a tangible reward for his perseverance.</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Dungeon run complete: Uncommon chest awarded.</h3><h3 style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Chest contains:</h3><p class="s5" style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">One Book of Blueprints (Enchanting Tier 1) Twenty-Five silver coins</p><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p class="s5" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 17pt;text-align: left;">One Uncommon Shop Token</p><h3 style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Items added to user inventory.</h3><h3 style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Thank you for visiting The Training Dungeon!</h3><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 13pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">As soon as the items were claimed, the chest vanished, and a portal materialized in its place.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Casting a healing spell to recover his strength, Robert took a final look around the room before stepping through the portal.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a href="https://oceanofpdf.com/">OceanofPDF.com</a></p><h1 style="padding-top: 2pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a name="bookmark35">&zwnj;</a>Chapter 17<a name="bookmark36">&zwnj;</a></h1><p style="padding-top: 21pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Well, hello there, handsome,&quot; Sara drawled, her eyes twinkling with amusement and a hint of appreciation as Robert stepped back through the shimmering portal, clad in his newly acquired leather armor. &quot;Looking incredibly dashing, or should I say, <i>dangerous</i>, in all that leather.&quot; Robert grinned, a flash of weariness momentarily forgotten in the warmth of her playful banter. He reached out, pulling her into a quick, reassuring hug, savoring the brief contact.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Thanks for the compliment,&quot; he replied, his voice a low murmur against</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">her hair. &quot;But if I&#39;m being honest, I&#39;m far more interested in <i>removing </i>all of this than posing in it.&quot; Sara chuckled, stepping back and playfully swatting his arm. &quot;Always making grand promises, aren&#39;t you?&quot; she retorted, her eyes sparkling. &quot;Actions speak louder than words, my dear.&quot; Leaving that playful exchange hanging in the air, they made their way to the master bedroom, where Robert gratefully shed the constricting, sweat-soaked</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">armor, the leather still bearing the faint scent of the dungeon.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He took a long, hot shower, letting the water wash away the grime and lingering tension of the battle. Refreshed and clad in comfortable clothes, he rejoined his family in the living room, ready to share the details of his second dungeon run, including the strategic acquisition of the enchanted item recipe book. John, ever the analyst, immediately began flipping through the pages of the newly acquired book, his brow furrowed in</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">concentration. &quot;This seems like a reasonable starting point,&quot; he commented, his fingers tracing the diagrams and descriptions.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;These Tier 1 enchantments are certainly not earth-shattering in terms of power, but that &#39;Minor Healing Ring&#39; that could prove quite useful in a variety of situations. Though, I confess, I&#39;m not entirely sure how to quantify the practical effect of &#39;10 health points&#39; in real-world terms.&quot; &quot;That&#39;s an excellent question, and one I hadn&#39;t fully considered,&quot; Robert admitted. &quot;Let&#39;s find out.&quot; He activated his newly acquired &#39;Identify&#39; skill, focusing his intent on each member of his family in turn. The System</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">responded, displaying a concise summary of their base statistics, including their current health points, providing a tangible benchmark for comparison.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid Williams</span></h3><h3 style="padding-left: 1pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Class<span class="p">: N/A</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="p">: John Williams</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Class<span class="p">: N/A</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Race<span class="p">: Human(Non-System)</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Profession<span class="p">: N/A</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Gender<span class="p">: Male</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Stats<span class="p">: Str 4, Dex 4, Con 4, Int 6, Wis 5, Cha 7</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Level<span class="p">: N/A </span>Resistances<span class="p">: N/A </span>Health<span class="p">: 35 </span>Mana<span class="p">: N/A</span></h3><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 17pt;text-align: left;">Race<span class="p">: Human(Non-System)</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Profession<span class="p">: N/A</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Gender<span class="p">: Male</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Stats<span class="p">: Str 3, Dex 4, Con 4, Int 6, Wis 6, Cha 7</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Level<span class="p">: N/A </span>Resistances<span class="p">: N/A </span>Health<span class="p">: 35 </span>Mana<span class="p">: N/A</span></h3><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 13pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Okay, so, based on these &#39;Identify&#39; results,&quot; Robert began, explaining the implications of the newly revealed health statistics to his family, &quot;10 health points represents a surprisingly *significant* portion of your overall health, especially for you, Stacey, and Mom. For someone with a lower health pool, that &#39;Minor Healing Ring&#39; could quite literally be the difference between life and death, or at the very least, prevent a serious injury from becoming critical. And considering the remarkably low material cost  a</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">simple copper ring  it&#39;s an incredibly efficient investment.&quot; He paused, pulling out his phone and quickly searching online for current market prices. &quot;It appears that a plain copper ring can be acquired for around twenty dollars, and a set of basic engraving tools will run us another twenty to thirty. That&#39;s a negligible expense for such a potentially life-saving item. I&#39;ll place an order for five rings and the tools on Amazon right now. With any luck, they should arrive tomorrow, allowing us to begin production almost immediately.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Richard, who had been quietly examining the photographs in the enchanted item recipe book, suddenly spoke up. &quot;These illustrations are actually quite detailed and informative,&quot; he observed. &quot;We should consider compiling</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">some sort of informational packet, a guide for well, for whoever might need this kind of knowledge in the future. These pictures would be perfect visual aids.&quot; Robert considered the suggestion, nodding slowly. &quot;That&#39;s a surprisingly insightful idea, Richard. Even though the full System integration is still months, potentially years away, having readily available information could be incredibly valuable. A proactive approach, preparing for the inevitable. We can use this,&quot; he said, placing the comprehensive System guidebook on the table, &quot;as our primary source material. A foundation to build upon.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The family gathered around the table, drawn in by the prospect of contributing to this crucial project. John, his eyes gleaming with intellectual curiosity, eagerly flipped through the guidebook&#39;s pages. &quot;This is astonishing,&quot; he murmured, his voice filled with awe. &quot;This book contains a wealth of information, meticulously detailed explanations of nearly every aspect of the System. It covers the history, the various races, the bestiary of monsters We should definitely prioritize creating copies of this, or at the very least, extracting and organizing the most essential information.&quot; The</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">remainder of the day was dedicated to a lively, collaborative discussion, brainstorming the optimal content and structure for their planned informational packet. Ideas flowed freely, fueled by a shared sense of</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">purpose and a growing understanding of the System&#39;s complexities.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Later, during dinner, John, ever the strategist, steered the conversation back to their immediate crafting priorities. &quot;While the informational packet is important, I still believe focusing on readily producible healing items is the most pragmatic approach,&quot; he stated, his gaze fixed on Robert. &quot;Consider a &#39;Basic Rod of Healing,&#39; for instance. According to the recipe book, it provides eight points of healing per charge and holds fifteen charges. That&#39;s enough to stabilize a severely injured person, potentially preventing them from succumbing to their wounds. The only significant drawback is that it doesn&#39;t appear to be rechargeable.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert nodded, thoughtfully studying the relevant entry in the recipe book. &quot;You&#39;re correct, it&#39;s a one-time-use item. But the crafting process itself seems remarkably straightforward. All we need is an oak rod  easily</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">obtainable  and the same basic engraving tools we ordered for the rings. The primary limitation is the mana cost: two hundred mana per rod.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Considering the time required for both the rune-carving process and my current mana recovery rate, I estimate we could realistically produce two rods per day, at least until I can further increase my mana capacity and enchanting proficiency.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The family spent a little while longer discussing the optimal crafting strategy, weighing the pros and cons of various enchanted items, before finally calling it a night, their minds filled with plans and possibilities. The following day, Robert, after bidding his family a temporary farewell, kept a</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">watchful eye out for the expected Amazon delivery. As soon as the package arrived, he retreated to his office, his anticipation growing. He carefully unpacked the contents: the five simple copper rings and the set of engraving tools. He then retrieved the blueprint book, opened it to the &#39;Minor Healing Ring&#39; recipe, and laid out all the necessary materials on his desk.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Following the instructions with meticulous precision, he picked up the first copper ring and touched the engraving tool to its surface. He felt a subtle</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">tingle as his &#39;Enchanting&#39; skill activated, guiding his hand with an almost supernatural precision. The tool moved seemingly on its own, carving</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">intricate runes into the soft metal. Within twenty minutes, the process was complete. He checked his status, confirming the expenditure of 100 mana, and initially believed he had successfully created a ring capable of healing someone five times. However, a closer inspection of the finished product revealed a crucial, unexpected detail.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;min-height:140.2pt;width:263.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="s8">: Ring of Healing</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Tier<span class="s8">: 1</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Rank<span class="s8">: Uncommon</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="s8">: This ring was made by an expert enchanter and when used will expend 1 charge to heal up to 17 health points.</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Charges<span class="s8">: 10</span></p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Hal, what&#39;s going on?&quot; Robert asked his AI.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Simple, as a Tier 4 Level 5 Enchanter, you&#39;re crafting a Tier 1 item. Even though you&#39;re not very experienced, your skill tier compensates. It makes sense that an expert would produce a better result than a novice.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;So, my Tier 1 items will be better than the book suggests?&quot; Robert asked.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Mostly, Factors like material quality, tool quality, and other variables play a role. But these rings are perfect, capable of nearly fully healing anyone in your family.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert glanced at his status screen, noting his current mana levels and the time elapsed during the creation of the first ring. He calculated that, with careful pacing and allowing for natural mana regeneration, he could comfortably craft a ring approximately every 45 minutes without completely depleting his reserves. This would allow him to maintain a steady production rate without compromising his ability to perform other essential tasks, such as spell practice and, you know, <i>eating</i>.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">With this schedule in mind, he dedicated the remainder of the day to crafting the remaining four copper rings, meticulously repeating the enchanting process for each one. He worked with a focused intensity, the rhythmic carving of runes and the subtle hum of magical energy filling his office. He finished the final ring just as the familiar sounds of his children returning home signaled the end of the school day, a perfect synchronization of his crafting schedule and family life.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">As soon as his children, Richard and Stacey, walked through the door, along with John, Robert gathered them together, a sense of quiet pride swelling within him. He presented each of them, and Sara, with one of the newly enchanted &#39;Minor Healing Rings.&#39; The children were immediately captivated, marveling at the intricate runes carved into the simple copper bands. They were even more amazed when, upon slipping the rings onto</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">their fingers, the bands magically adjusted themselves, resizing to fit perfectly and comfortably. Robert carefully explained the rings&#39; function, emphasizing their limited healing capacity and the importance of using them judiciously. He stressed that these were not toys, but potentially life- saving tools to be used only in emergencies.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He then turned his attention to the next phase of his crafting plan: the creation of the &#39;Basic Healing Rods.&#39; He placed another Amazon order, this time for a set of twenty-one-inch by one-and-a-quarter-inch oak dowels </p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">the core material for the rods  along with a can of wood stain to give them a more polished appearance, and, importantly, an electric engraving pen to streamline the rune-carving process. He informed his family that he would begin working on the rods as soon as the materials arrived the following day, further expanding their arsenal of magical protections. While reviewing the seemingly endless entries in the blueprint book, searching for</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">other potentially useful enchantments, Robert identified several protective items that he believed would significantly benefit his family&#39;s safety.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He decided to prioritize two specific creations: an &#39;Amulet of Protection (Kinetic)&#39;, designed to mitigate damage from physical impacts, and a &#39;Ring of Protection (Falling)&#39;, which, as the name suggested, would safeguard against fall-related injuries.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">These two items, he reasoned, would provide a substantial layer of defense against some of the most common and potentially debilitating threats they might encounter in their daily lives. He also bookmarked two additional types of healing rods, expanding beyond the basic version: a &#39;Rod of Cure Poison&#39; and a &#39;Rod of Cure Blindness&#39;. These specialized rods, while requiring more complex enchantments and a higher mana investment, would address specific, potentially life-threatening conditions. Robert envisioned that these three types of healing rods  basic, poison-curing, and blindness-curing  would eventually form the cornerstone of their income- generating strategy, providing a valuable service and ensuring their family&#39;s long-term financial security.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The next day, the eagerly awaited package containing the oak dowels and the electric engraving pen arrived. As soon as the children had left for</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">school and John had departed, Robert, with a sense of purpose, retreated to his makeshift workshop  his home office, now repurposed for his</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">burgeoning magical crafting endeavors. He carefully laid out the blueprint book, opening it to the &#39;Basic Healing Rod&#39; page, and arranged the newly arrived materials on his workbench. With a practiced hand, he measured and cut the oak dowels to the precise length specified in the instructions.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Then, taking a deep breath to steady himself, he began the intricate process of carving the required runes into the smooth surface of the wood.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">This time, aided by the electric engraving pen, the task was significantly less arduous than hand-carving the rings. Still, it demanded intense concentration. Each rune had to be etched perfectly, following the blueprint&#39;s intricate patterns. As he completed each rune, a faint, ethereal</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">glow emanated from the wood, accompanied by a subtle drain on his mana reserves  a tangible manifestation of the magical energy being infused into the rod.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">After approximately an hour of meticulous work, the rune-carving was complete. He then carefully applied the wood stain, transforming the pale oak into a rich, dark hue, giving the rods a more refined and professional appearance. Finally, with the stain dry, he performed the final step: the imbuing of the rod with the healing enchantment itself.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He channeled his mana, focusing his will, and felt the familiar surge of</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">energy flowing from him into the wooden rod. He repeated this process for each of the rods, working steadily until the last one was complete. As he finished the final rod, a wave of profound satisfaction washed over him. He had not just crafted a tool; he had created something truly <i>special</i>, something that could potentially save lives. He carefully inspected each of the completed rods, admiring the intricate runes and the smooth, polished finish. A feeling of quiet pride swelled within him; he was making tangible progress, taking concrete steps to protect and provide for his family in this new, uncertain reality.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;min-height:140.2pt;width:263.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="s8">: Oak Rod of Healing</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Tier<span class="s8">: 1</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Rank<span class="s8">: Uncommon</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="s8">: This rod was made by an expert enchanter and when used will expend 1 charge to heal up to 12 health points.</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Charges<span class="s8">: 20</span></p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Once again, the tangible results of his labor underscored the significant advantage conferred by his high &#39;Enchanting&#39; skill tier; what might have</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">taken an apprentice enchanter days, or even weeks, he had accomplished in a matter of hours. He carefully calculated the time and mana expenditure involved in creating each rod, factoring in his natural mana regeneration rate.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He concluded that completing the remaining nineteen &#39;Basic Healing Rods&#39; would require approximately four days of dedicated effort, a substantial</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">time commitment, but one he deemed absolutely worthwhile given the potential rewards  both financial and in terms of the invaluable healing</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">capabilities the rods would provide. After allowing himself a full hour for his mana reserves to replenish, a necessary precaution to avoid overexertion, he commenced work on the next rod, determined to complete at least three more before the day&#39;s end, maintaining a steady and</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">sustainable production rate.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">This rigorous crafting schedule became his new normal for the following</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">four days. He meticulously balanced his enchanting work with his familial responsibilities and personal needs, a careful juggling act that demanded</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">discipline and focus. His free time was no longer spent in passive leisure; instead, every spare moment was dedicated to honing his skills, expanding his magical repertoire, and producing the enchanted items that would safeguard his family and secure their future.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He even managed to find time during this to, once again, level up his inventory skill. Finally, with the last of the healing rods completed and his preparations meticulously checked, Robert knew the time had come for his third foray into the depths of the Training Dungeon, a prospect that filled him with a mixture of apprehension and anticipation. He was ready to face whatever challenges awaited him, armed with his growing magical prowess and the knowledge that he was fighting for something far more important than personal glory.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a href="https://oceanofpdf.com/">OceanofPDF.com</a></p><h1 style="padding-top: 2pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a name="bookmark37">&zwnj;</a>Chapter 18<a name="bookmark38">&zwnj;</a></h1><p style="padding-top: 21pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;<b>Welcome to Dungeon 7883667HG8776DE985762763FF7-1 currently called The Training Dungeon</b>,&quot; the dungeon AI announced.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert looked around and saw that the room was the same as before. Deciding to just get started he went to the System Store and opened the inventory.</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><table
