style="width:203pt;border-top-style:solid;border-top-width:1pt;border-top-color:#EDEDED;border-left-style:solid;border-left-width:1pt;border-left-color:#EDEDED;border-bottom-style:solid;border-bottom-width:1pt;border-bottom-color:#EDEDED;border-right-style:solid;border-right-width:1pt;border-right-color:#EDEDED"><p class="s8" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Includes a Steel longsword, an Oak quarterstaff, and a Recurved Shortbow w/50 common arrows in a leather quiver.</p></td></tr></table><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Examining the newly acquired items from the store, Robert considered his options and decided to use his Special Purchase Token on the &#39;Weapons</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Package,&#39; anticipating a significant upgrade to his offensive capabilities. He was not disappointed. He immediately swapped out his relatively simple hunting knife for the newly acquired longsword, a far more substantial and imposing weapon.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The difference was immediately palpable; the weight and balance of the longsword felt right in his hand, a noticeable increase in both reach and potential damage output. He made a few experimental swings, testing its heft and feeling a surge of confidence. The package also included a well- crafted bow, but Robert decided to hold off on utilizing it for the moment. He wasn&#39;t entirely sure if he wanted to invest a valuable Skill Point in learning the &#39;Archery&#39; skill, especially given his existing proficiency with melee weapons and his current focus on expanding his magical repertoire. The bow would remain a potential option for the future, a contingency plan should his circumstances change.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">With his weapon choice solidified, and making sure his armor was firmly in place, Robert steeled his resolve and stepped through the portal, entering</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">the first chamber of the next dungeon floor, expecting the usual sterile, empty room. Instead, he was met with a completely unexpected and somewhat unsettling sight. The room wasn&#39;t the typical enclosed space he had encountered previously; it was a vast, cavernous chamber, its dimensions far exceeding any of the previous rooms. The air was thick with the smell of smoke and damp earth, and the space was dimly lit by a flickering fire that illuminated a crudely constructed campsite huddled near the center.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Around the fire sat six humanoid figures, significantly smaller than adult humans, their features vaguely familiar, yet distorted and unsettling. A quick cast of &#39;Identify&#39; confirmed his suspicions: these were Goblins, the common, low-level monstrous humanoids of countless fantasy tales, now standing  or rather, sitting  before him in the flesh, a far cry from the mindless, predictable rodents he had faced previously. This was a different kind of challenge altogether.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;min-height:192.0pt;width:239.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="s8">: Common Goblin</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Class<span class="s8">: N/A</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Race<span class="s8">: Goblin, Tier G</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Profession<span class="s8">: N/A</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Gender<span class="s8">: Male</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Stats<span class="s8">: Str 7, Dex 11, Con 8, Int 6, Wis</span></p><p class="s8" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">5, Cha 3</p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Level<span class="s8">: 5 </span>Resistances<span class="s8">: None </span>Health<span class="s8">: 50</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Mana<span class="s8">: N/A</span></p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert had, in fact, anticipated this encounter, or at least, an encounter <i>like</i></p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">this. The System Guidebook, his constant companion and source of</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">invaluable information, had explicitly warned about the prevalence of goblins within the lower levels of many dungeons. They were, in essence, the quintessential &#39;starter&#39; monster, a step up from giant rats, but still relatively low on the threat scale  <i>relatively </i>being the key word.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Knowing that a passive approach would be unwise, Robert strategically retreated a few steps, buying himself precious seconds to prepare. He swiftly murmured the incantation for &#39;Minor Shield of Air,&#39; feeling the</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">familiar rush of wind forming a protective barrier around him. Then, without hesitation, he unleashed a volley of &#39;Lesser Bullets of Air,&#39; his aim honed by previous encounters.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The goblins, startled by the sudden magical assault and the disruption of their presumed rest, let out a cacophony of high-pitched, guttural screams and unintelligible shrieks as they scrambled to their feet and charged</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">towards him, their small, beady eyes filled with a mixture of rage and fear. Robert deftly dispatched the closest goblin with another precisely aimed air bullet, dropping it before it could even reach him. He then seamlessly transitioned to melee combat, drawing his newly acquired longsword, the</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">superior steel gleaming in the dim light.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The goblins, armed with pathetically crude wooden clubs, proved to be no match for Robert&#39;s skill, his enhanced strength, and, most importantly, his vastly superior weapon. He moved with a practiced grace, parrying their clumsy attacks and delivering swift, decisive strikes, quickly eliminating</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">the remaining goblins. Each fallen foe yielded a meager reward: 10 copper coins and 35 experience points  a small but steady contribution to his progress.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">After confirming the area was clear, Robert briefly searched the goblins&#39;</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">crude campsite, but found nothing of value, only a collection of tattered furs and gnawed bones. Disappointed but not surprised, he pressed onward,</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">deeper into the dungeon. The second room he encountered was an almost exact replica of the first, another cavernous space with a similar goblin encampment.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He cleared this room with the same methodical efficiency, employing the same combination of magic and melee combat. The third room, however, presented a new tactical challenge, a variation on the established theme. There were still six goblins, but this time, two of them were positioned at the rear of the chamber, armed with crude, short bows  goblin archers, a ranged threat that demanded a shift in his approach.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">/</p><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="p">: Common Goblin Archer</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Class<span class="p">: N/A</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Race<span class="p">: Goblin, Tier G</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Profession<span class="p">: N/A</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Gender<span class="p">: Male</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Stats<span class="p">: Str 6, Dex 13, Con 8, Int 6, Wis 5, Cha 3</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Level<span class="p">: 5</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Resistances<span class="p">: None</span></h3><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 17pt;text-align: left;">Health<span class="p">: 50</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Mana<span class="p">: N/A</span></h3><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 13pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He prioritized the archers, but they managed to fire a few arrows, all of which missed. The room was soon cleared, and a notification appeared:</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:33.0pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Level Up!</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The fourth room presented a familiar, yet incrementally more challenging, scenario. It mirrored the layout of the third, a cavernous space with a goblin encampment, but the number of enemies had increased. This time, Robert faced eight goblins: six melee fighters armed with their crude clubs, and two archers positioned at the rear, ready to provide ranged support.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Recognizing the immediate threat posed by the archers, Robert prioritized them, swiftly dispatching them with precisely aimed &#39;Lesser Bullets of Air&#39; before turning his attention to the onrushing melee fighters. Despite taking a few glancing blows from the clubs, his armor and the protective &#39;Minor Shield of Air&#39; spell absorbed the majority of the impact, minimizing any significant damage. He moved with a practiced efficiency, a blend of magic and swordsmanship, systematically eliminating the remaining goblins.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The fifth room, however, represented a significant escalation in difficulty. It was noticeably larger than the previous chambers, and instead of a single goblin encampment, it contained <i>two </i>separate camps, each populated by six goblins, including two archers. Robert immediately understood that</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">charging headlong into this room, as he had done in previous encounters, would be a disastrously reckless tactic. He would be exposed to a potentially devastating crossfire from the archers, leaving him vulnerable and overwhelmed.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He needed a new approach. Retreating back into the hallway, he briefly consulted his spellbook, searching for a suitable solution. He quickly identified and memorized the incantation for &#39;Minor Windscreen,&#39; a spell designed to create a temporary barrier of swirling air, capable of deflecting projectiles. His plan solidified: he would erect the &#39;Minor Windscreen&#39; to</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">shield himself from one camp while focusing his initial attacks on the other, effectively dividing and conquering the enemy forces.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">After refreshing his &#39;Minor Shield of Air&#39; to ensure maximum protection, Robert took a deep breath and charged into the room. He immediately cast &#39;Minor Windscreen,&#39; the spell manifesting as a shimmering, translucent</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">barrier of swirling air between him and the leftmost goblin camp. Then, with a burst of speed, he unleashed a flurry of spells and sword strikes at the goblins on the right, prioritizing the archers as before. He was nearly</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">finished with the first group when the four melee fighters from the shielded camp, having circumvented the &#39;Windscreen,&#39; finally closed the distance and engaged him.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Simultaneously, the archers from that group, having repositioned themselves, attempted to find clear lines of fire, seeking gaps in his defenses. Robert deftly dodged several arrows, but two managed to strike his &#39;Minor Shield of Air,&#39; the magical barrier absorbing the impact and preventing any injury. With the first camp neutralized, Robert swiftly turned his attention to the remaining archers, unleashing a rapid barrage of &#39;Lesser Bullets of Air&#39; while simultaneously dodging and parrying the attacks of the four remaining melee fighters.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Once the archers were eliminated, he focused his full attention on the remaining goblins, employing a combination of sword strikes and spells to bring the chaotic battle to a swift and decisive conclusion. He entered the sixth room, which was similar to the 5th. There were seven goblins per camp, with three of those being archers. Falling back on the same tactic he cleared the room.</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:33.0pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Level Up!</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Having cleared six consecutive rooms, each presenting an escalating level</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">of challenge, Robert decided to take a much-needed respite, recognizing the importance of rest and recuperation in maintaining peak combat</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">effectiveness. He retreated to a previously cleared chamber, a relatively safe haven amidst the dangers of the dungeon.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He sat down, leaning against the cool stone wall, and consumed one of his carefully rationed food packs and a portion of water from his inventory, replenishing his depleted energy reserves and quenching his thirst. The</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">simple act of eating and drinking, a mundane routine in the outside world, felt like a luxury in the harsh environment of the dungeon.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Once he felt sufficiently restored, Robert stood, stretching his stiff muscles and preparing himself for the next challenge, a growing feeling that there were not many rooms left on this floor. He headed towards the entrance to the next chamber. He peered cautiously into the room, assessing the situation. This room, unlike the previous ones with their multiple</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">encampments, contained only a single campfire, around which eight goblins were gathered.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">However, one of the goblins immediately stood out, its appearance distinctly different from the others, suggesting a higher rank or specialized role. Before engaging, Robert instinctively cast &#39;Identify&#39; on this unusual goblin, seeking to gather crucial intelligence about its capabilities and potential weaknesses. He was not about to rush blindly into another potentially dangerous encounter.</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;min-height:192.0pt;width:239.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="s8">: Common Goblin Shaman</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Class<span class="s8">: N/A</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Race<span class="s8">: Goblin, Tier G</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Profession<span class="s8">: N/A</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Gender<span class="s8">: Male</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Stats<span class="s8">: Str 5, Dex 12, Con 7, Int 9, Wis</span></p><p class="s8" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">6, Cha 3</p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Level<span class="s8">: 5 </span>Resistances<span class="s8">: None </span>Health<span class="s8">: 60</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Mana<span class="s8">: N/A</span></p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert stared intently at the results displayed by the &#39;Identify&#39; spell, his mind racing to process the implications. This goblin was significantly different from the others he had encountered. Its ability to wield magic,</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">specifically the casting of spells, marked it as a Goblin Shaman  a far more</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">dangerous and unpredictable adversary than the common melee fighters or even the archers. He knew, from both the System Guidebook and his own growing experience, that spellcasting enemies were high-priority targets,</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">capable of inflicting significant damage and disrupting his combat strategies.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He had to eliminate the shaman quickly, while simultaneously managing the threat posed by the three goblin archers, whose ranged attacks could prove lethal if left unchecked. The tactical challenge was significantly more complex than anything he had faced thus far. With a renewed sense of</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">urgency, Robert refreshed his protective spells, ensuring his &#39;Minor Shield of Air&#39; was at full strength. He then initiated the battle, stepping into the</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">chamber and immediately launching a volley of &#39;Lesser Bullets of Air&#39; at the shaman.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">However, to his dismay, the projectiles were deflected harmlessly by a shimmering, translucent barrier surrounding the goblin  a protective spell, confirming his suspicions. Before Robert could adjust his tactics, the shaman retaliated, launching a sickly green orb of energy towards him.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert instinctively dodged, the orb narrowly missing him and impacting against the far wall. He watched in horrified fascination as the orb, instead of dissipating, slithered across the stone surface, leaving a trail of bubbling, corroded rock in its wake  a clear and alarming indication of its highly</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">acidic nature.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">This was not a simple firebolt or ice shard; this was a weapon designed to inflict lingering, debilitating damage. Recognizing the immediate threat, Robert made a split-second decision to temporarily shift his focus. He switched his targeting to the goblin archers, unleashing a rapid barrage of</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&#39;Lesser Bullets of Air,&#39; while simultaneously dodging and weaving to avoid the shaman&#39;s continued magical assaults. The skirmish was tense and frantic, a desperate race against time.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">After what felt like an eternity, but was likely closer to a minute, the last of the archers fell, their crude bows clattering uselessly to the ground. Robert immediately turned his attention back to the four remaining melee fighters, who were diligently attempting to guard their shaman leader. A few swift,</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">precise sword strikes and spell combinations later, and the last of the fighters was dispatched.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He charged directly at the shaman, his longsword raised, but his initial attacks were deflected by the same shimmering barrier that had protected it from his earlier spells. He pressed his attack, his blows relentless, until finally, with a powerful, overhead strike, he managed to pierce the shaman&#39;s protective barrier, the force of the blow staggering the creature.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He followed up with three more swift, decisive strikes, finally ending the shaman&#39;s threat. He stepped back, breathing heavily, his body aching, and meticulously scanned the chamber, ensuring that no hidden goblins or lingering magical effects remained. Satisfied that the room was truly clear, he began the methodical process of looting the fallen creatures. As expected, each goblin yielded a small amount of copper coins.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">However, the shaman, as befitting its higher status, dropped a far more</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">valuable prize: a spellbook. Upon closer inspection, Robert discovered that it contained a collection of Tier 1 spells from the School of Destruction  a school of magic focused on raw, offensive power. While he hadn&#39;t initially planned on acquiring another magical specialization, the opportunity to expand his spell repertoire, especially with potentially devastating offensive spells, was too tempting to resist.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He made a mental note to formally acquire the &#39;Destruction Magic&#39; skill upon his return home. As soon as the final goblin body was looted, the corpses vanished, and in the center of the room, a treasure chest materialized with a soft, shimmering glow, a reward for his hard-fought victory.</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 187%;text-align: left;">Dungeon run complete: Rare chest awarded. Chest contains:</h3><p class="s5" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">One Tier 2 Spell Book of Elemental Light (Contains 25 random spells from the Sphere of Elemental Light)</p><p class="s5" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">One gold coin</p><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p class="s5" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 17pt;text-align: left;">One Uncommon Shop Token</p><h3 style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Items added to user inventory.</h3><h3 style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Thank you for visiting The Training Dungeon!</h3><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 13pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The items were added to his inventory, and the chest vanished. The portal home appeared. With one last glance at the dungeon, Robert stepped through the portal.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a href="https://oceanofpdf.com/">OceanofPDF.com</a></p><h1 style="padding-top: 2pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a name="bookmark39">&zwnj;</a>Chapter 19<a name="bookmark40">&zwnj;</a></h1><p style="padding-top: 21pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">With a final surge of effort, Robert heaved open the heavy, ornate lid of the treasure chest, revealing its contents. After storing the contents, He took a moment to steady himself. With his task finally completed he focused on</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">the return. A soft blue glow emanated from the corner of the room. Taking one last look around, and confirming that he had collected all the items, He stepped through. The familiar sensation of stepping through the portal washed over him, and he found himself back in the den, the mundane comforts of home a stark contrast to the harsh realities of the dungeon.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">A satisfied grin spread across his face as he took in the familiar surroundings, the tension of the past few hours beginning to ease. He spotted Sara waiting for him, her presence a beacon of warmth and normalcy. A gentle, welcoming smile graced her lips, her eyes filled with a mixture of relief and pride. He strode towards her, and they met in a warm embrace, a silent acknowledgment of the dangers he had faced and the</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">relief of his safe return.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">A quick, tender kiss sealed the moment, a reaffirmation of their bond. &quot;So,&quot; Sara began, her voice soft but filled with genuine curiosity, her eyes sparkling with interest, &quot;tell me everything. How did it go? Was it as challenging as you expected? What did you find?&quot; She held his gaze, eager to hear his recounting of events.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;It was intense,&quot; Robert replied, a slight understatement, as he began to recount the details of his latest dungeon expedition, describing the escalating challenges, the goblin encounters, the strategic use of spells, and the harrowing battle against the goblin shaman. &quot;And the best part,&quot; he added, a hint of triumph in his voice, &quot;I acquired not one, but *two* new spellbooks. One containing spells from the School of Light  which I already knew I could learn  and another, surprisingly, filled with spells from the School of Destruction.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He paused, a flicker of uncertainty crossing his face. &quot;Honestly, I&#39;m a bit hesitant about branching out into another school of magic so soon. It feels</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">like spreading myself too thin.&quot; Sara, ever practical, raised a questioning</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">eyebrow. &quot;How could you *not* take it?&quot; she challenged, a playful glint in her eyes. &quot;From what you&#39;ve described, most of those Destruction spells seem highly *effective* in combat situations. And frankly, my dear, you could always use more powerful offensive options. You can not always win with brains.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Hal,&quot; Robert interjected, turning his attention to the ever-present AI and idly thumbing through the pages of the newly acquired Destruction spellbook, &quot;I&#39;ve noticed that many of these spells seem to require proficiency in a *second* magical sphere, in addition to Destruction, in</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">order to cast them. Is that a common occurrence with higher-level spells, or is it specific to this school of magic?&quot; He needed clarification before making a decision about his future magical studies.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">It&#39;s not that uncommon for some spells to require multiple spheres to learn, these spells are typically more powerful for their tier. Take Ice Shard, for example. It&#39;s a Tier 1 spell that combines Destruction and Water magic, dealing 50% more damage than your Water Bullet spell for only a slight increase in mana cost.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert&#39;s eyes widened as Hal&#39;s explanation sank in, a sudden realization dawning on him. &quot;So, it&#39;s not just about having access to *more* spells,&quot; he clarified, &quot;it&#39;s about having access to potentially *synergistic* spells, combinations that could amplify my overall effectiveness. It&#39;s about expanding my tactical options and creating entirely new magical strategies. Given that context,&quot; he added, a determined glint replacing the earlier hesitation in his eyes, &quot;investing a Skill Point to unlock the Sphere of Destruction seems not just worthwhile, but practically *essential*.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;I definitely need to expand my offensive capabilities beyond basic elemental bullets.&quot; He paused, flipping through the pages of the Destruction spellbook again, his fingers tracing the unfamiliar diagrams and incantations. After a moment of focused consideration, he made his decision. With a firm nod, he mentally confirmed his choice, allocating the Skill Point and unlocking the Sphere of Destruction, feeling a subtle shift in</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">his magical awareness as the new school of magic integrated itself into his repertoire.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Turning his attention to another pressing question, he addressed Sara, seeking her practical perspective. &quot;What about archery?&quot; he inquired. &quot;Do you think it would be a worthwhile investment to acquire that skill? It feels like a significant deviation from my current focus on magic and melee combat.&quot; Sara considered his question thoughtfully, her brow furrowing slightly. &quot;Well,&quot; she began, &quot;I don&#39;t see how it could *hurt*. From your descriptions of the dungeon encounters, there have been several instances where a ranged weapon, like a bow, could have provided a significant tactical advantage.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;allowing you to engage enemies from a safer distance or target specific threats more effectively. It might be a valuable addition to your arsenal.&quot; Robert nodded slowly, contemplating the potential benefits of adding archery to his skillset, weighing it against the cost of the Skill Point and the time required to develop proficiency. He then picked up the school of light spellbook. Turning his attention back to the newly acquired spellbooks, Robert first opened the one containing spells from the School of Light.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He was immediately drawn to the powerful protective and restorative spells within. &#39;Regeneration,&#39; promising continuous healing over time, and &#39;Shield of Light,&#39; offering a significantly stronger defensive barrier than his current &#39;Minor Shield of Air,&#39; caught his immediate attention. These spells represented a substantial upgrade to his defensive capabilities. He also noted &#39;Radiant Bolt,&#39; a clearly offensive spell, described as a concentrated beam of pure light energy.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">It promised significantly more damage output than his current &#39;Lesser Bullet&#39; spells, and surprisingly, with only a slightly higher mana cost.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">However, one particular spell description gave him pause. &quot;Hal,&quot; he asked, pointing to the entry for &#39;Blessing of Light,&#39; &quot;this spell says it grants a</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&#39;blessing,&#39; increasing the target&#39;s power and speed. But it doesn&#39;t specify</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">*who* or *what* is bestowing this blessing. Is it a divine entity? A force of nature? The System itself?&quot; The ambiguity of the description intrigued and slightly unsettled him.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Within the confines of this current universe, the &#39;Blessing of Light&#39; is directly empowered by the System itself, due to there being no divine beings. However, in active, populated universes, such blessings typically originate from, and are granted by, the deities or equivalent divine entities that hold sway within that specific reality.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Local divinities?&quot; Robert repeated, his eyebrows arching in surprise and a hint of disbelief. The concept of multiple universes, each with its own set of gods, was a lot to process, a vast expansion of his previously held</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">worldview.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Precisely. In time, as you progress along your chosen path, accumulating power and achieving true mastery over a</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">particular skill or domain, you may even aspire to attain a divine rank yourself. It is an extraordinarily challenging and perilous undertaking, fraught with obstacles and powerful rivals, but it is, theoretically, possible. Each universe, each self-contained reality, typically possesses a limited number of such divinities, beings of immense power who wield considerable influence over their respective domains. And, in due course, this currently isolated universe, under the influence of the System, will also develop its own pantheon of true gods.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">A profound question, one that had plagued humanity for millennia, suddenly surfaced in Robert&#39;s mind. &quot;So, what about <i>the </i>God?&quot; he asked, his voice tinged with a mixture of genuine curiosity and a hint of trepidation. &quot;The singular, all-powerful creator God that many religions on Earth worship? Is He real?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">That is a question that transcends even the vast knowledge and computational power of the System itself. The ultimate origin of the multiverse, the existence or non-existence of a singular, prime creator, remains an unresolved mystery, a question beyond the System&#39;s capacity to answer.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert, slightly overwhelmed by the implications of that statement, decided to table the theological debate for the time being. There were far more</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">immediate and practical concerns demanding his attention, namely, the mastery of his newly acquired spells and the continued preparation for his impending departure.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert dedicated the next two days to an intense regimen of study and practice, immersing himself in the intricacies of the Light and Destruction magic schools, meticulously learning the incantations, hand gestures, and mana control techniques required for each new spell. He also, remembering the conversation with Sara, decided to allocate a Skill Point to unlock the</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">&#39;Archery&#39; skill, dedicating a portion of his training time to practicing with the bow he had acquired, developing a basic level of proficiency with the ranged weapon.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">In addition, he dedicated some time to producing a few more of the &#39;Basic Healing Rods,&#39; recognizing their immediate utility and potential for future income generation. While meticulously crafting these healing rods, a sudden thought, a spark of inspiration, ignited in Robert&#39;s mind. &quot;Hal,&quot; he inquired, pausing his work, &quot;the System Guidebook mentions that one of the avenues for gaining experience is through the creation of items. I&#39;ve</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">been actively enchanting quite a few items lately, both rings and rods, but I haven&#39;t noticed any corresponding increase in my experience points.&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">That is because you are currently a Tier 4 Expert in Enchanting, and you are exclusively crafting common, Tier 1 items. There is no significant challenge presented to your current skill level in performing these routine tasks, and therefore, no experience is awarded. The System rewards growth and the overcoming of obstacles, not mere repetition.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Robert absorbed this explanation, a thoughtful frown creasing his forehead. &quot;I understand the logic,&quot; he acknowledged. &quot;But at the moment, I&#39;m limited by the available blueprints. I <i>can&#39;t </i>create anything more complex.&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">That is an incorrect assumption. While pre-existing blueprints provide a convenient roadmap, they are not a</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">prerequisite for creation. Where do you believe these spells and blueprints originated? They were not simply bestowed upon the world by the System; they were discovered, developed, and refined through the efforts of countless individuals over millennia, through painstaking experimentation and a deep understanding of fundamental principles. Someone, had to design them.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">A flicker of excitement ignited in Robert&#39;s eyes. &quot;So, you&#39;re suggesting that I could, theoretically, attempt to devise my <i>own </i>enchantments, to create</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">new blueprints through a process of trial and error?&quot; he asked, the prospect both daunting and exhilarating.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Precisely, with your Tier 4 expertise in Enchanting, combined with the foundational knowledge contained within the System Guidebook and the spellbooks you possess, you have the necessary building blocks to begin experimenting. You may not be able to immediately create high-tier enchantments, but you possess sufficient understanding to potentially develop simpler, yet novel, applications of magical principles.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">A new idea, a specific goal, took root in Robert&#39;s mind. &quot;I&#39;ve just mastered the &#39;Regeneration&#39; spell from the School of Light,&quot; he mused. &quot;It&#39;s a powerful healing spell, but it requires continuous casting. I wonder I</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">wonder if I could figure out how to imbue a rod, similar to the &#39;Basic Healing Rod,&#39; with the &#39;Regeneration&#39; effect, creating a &#39;Rod of</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Regeneration&#39; that would provide sustained healing over time.&quot; Fueled by this ambitious new goal, Robert dedicated the remainder of his time, before his next schedule dungeon run. To the challenging, but potentially immensely rewarding, task of experimental enchantment.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">It took all the time, and a bit of luck, but after 2 days he was able to create a simple Rod of Regeneration.</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="p">: Oak Rod of Regeneration</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Tier<span class="p">: 2</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Rank<span class="p">: Uncommon</span></h3><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="p">: This rod was made by an expert enchanter and when used will expend 1 charge to regenerate 75 points of health over 10 minutes.</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Charges<span class="p">: 10</span></h3><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 13pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">With painstaking care, Robert meticulously documented every step of the &#39;Rod of Regeneration&#39; creation process, from the precise measurements of the oak dowel to the intricate carving of the runes and the specific method</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">of mana infusion. He was determined to not only replicate his initial success but to refine and optimize the procedure. Over the following few days, he dedicated himself to crafting several more of these potent healing devices, each new rod a testament to his rapidly developing skills and his growing understanding of enchantment principles.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">While the repetitive crafting of these relatively low-tier items still did not yield any experience points, he did notice a tangible improvement in his rune-carving technique, his hand becoming steadier, his lines more precise, his overall efficiency increasing with each completed rod. Time, however, was a relentless current, and soon the day arrived for his scheduled return to the Training Dungeon. Since it was a Sunday, he took advantage of the opportunity to share a proper farewell with his family, a ritual that had</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">become increasingly important in their uncertain new reality, before stepping once more through the shimmering portal and into the unknown.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;<b>Welcome to Dungeon 7883667HG8776DE985762763FF7-1 currently called The Training Dungeon Fourth Floor</b>,&quot; the dungeon AI announced.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">After carefully reviewing the System Store&#39;s current offerings, Robert found nothing that particularly sparked his interest or addressed his immediate needs, no new enchantments or tools that warranted an expenditure. He decided, therefore, to allocate his recently acquired gold piece towards a</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">more strategic investment: the purchase of an additional Skill Point, recognizing that expanding his fundamental capabilities was ultimately more valuable than acquiring any single item.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">With that decision made and the transaction completed, he pressed onward, advancing deeper into the dungeon. This floor, at first glance, seemed to</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">closely mirror the layout and enemy composition of the third floor, a</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">familiar pattern of goblin encampments. However, a closer assessment, aided by his &#39;Identify&#39; skill and a growing sense of tactical awareness, revealed two significant deviations, two notable escalations in the threat level. The fifth room, instead of the usual single Goblin Shaman, was guarded by two of these spellcasting adversaries, a doubling of magical firepower that demanded a cautious approach.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">And the final chamber, the presumed location of the floor&#39;s boss encounter, held not another Shaman, but a Goblin Chief  a larger, stronger, and undoubtedly more dangerous variant of the goblin species, promising a final, formidable challenge before he could claim victory over this level of the Training Dungeon.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;min-height:192.0pt;width:287.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="s8">: Common Goblin Chief</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Class<span class="s8">: N/A</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Race<span class="s8">: Goblin, Tier G</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Profession<span class="s8">: N/A</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Gender<span class="s8">: Male</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Stats<span class="s8">: Str 12, Dex 11, Con 13, Int 8, Wis 7,</span></p><p class="s8" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Cha 3</p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Level<span class="s8">: 9 </span>Resistances<span class="s8">: None </span>Health<span class="s8">: 100 </span>Mana<span class="s8">: N/A</span></p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">With a carefully honed strategy, born of experience and a growing understanding of goblin tactics, Robert methodically worked his way through the floor, prioritizing the elimination of archers and melee fighters in each encounter, conserving his mana and minimizing risk. He saved the fifth room, with its two Goblin Shamans, for after he had cleared the minor rooms, taking them out with his now-refined approach to neutralizing spellcasting enemies. This methodical clearing led him to the final challenge: the Goblin Chief.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He engaged the Chieftain, a formidable opponent boasting significantly enhanced strength and resilience compared to its lesser kin. Despite</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert&#39;s best efforts, the Chief managed to breach his defenses on several occasions, inflicting a series of minor, but painful, wounds  a testament to its superior combat prowess. The battle was fierce and protracted, a test of skill and endurance, but ultimately, Robert&#39;s combination of magic, swordsmanship, and strategic thinking proved superior.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He emerged victorious, the Goblin Chief falling before him. After ensuring the chamber was secure, Robert systematically plundered the spoils from</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">the fallen goblins, collecting the usual assortment of copper coins and</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">minor crafting materials. He then turned his attention to the treasure chest that had materialized upon the Chief&#39;s defeat, opening it to reveal its contents: a significant upgrade to his current armor, a Tier 2 Rare-quality Hardened Leather Jerkin and Pants set, along with a respectable sum of 50 silver coins.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">As he was assessing his rewards, a System notification chimed, informing him that he had achieved a significant milestone: Level 10, a testament to his accumulated experience and a marker of his growing power. He took a moment to absorb this information, a sense of accomplishment washing</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">over him. Then, gathering his thoughts and his newly acquired loot, he stepped towards the shimmering portal that had appeared, ready to return home, his body weary but his spirit invigorated by his latest triumph.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a href="https://oceanofpdf.com/">OceanofPDF.com</a></p><h1 style="padding-top: 2pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a name="bookmark41">&zwnj;</a>Chapter 20<a name="bookmark42">&zwnj;</a></h1><p style="padding-top: 21pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Emerging from the portal, back into the familiar comfort of his home, Robert was immediately greeted by the welcoming presence of his family. He exchanged warm embraces and greetings, then, with a weary sigh, sank gratefully onto the plush couch, the soft cushions a welcome contrast to the hard stone floors of the dungeon.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;That floor,&quot; he began, a mixture of exhaustion and satisfaction in his voice, &quot;was significantly more challenging than the previous ones. I faced a Goblin Chief, a creature that was actually at my level, a true test of my abilities. The good news is, not only did I emerge victorious, but the</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">experience pushed me to a significant milestone: I reached Level 10. And that,&quot; he added with a grin, &quot;means I&#39;m finally eligible to select a Class, a major step forward in my System progression.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">John, ever the inquisitive one, immediately seized upon this new development. &quot;So, how does this Class selection process actually work?&quot; he asked, his eyes gleaming with intellectual curiosity. &quot;What factors</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">determine the specific Classes that are offered to you? Is it purely random, or is there a logical system behind it?&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert paused, thoughtfully stroking his chin as he gathered his thoughts. &quot;According to the information in the System Guidebook,&quot; he replied, &quot;the Class selection process is *not* random. It&#39;s a complex algorithm that takes into account a multitude of factors, including your currently acquired skills, the tiers you&#39;ve reached in those skills, any feats you&#39;ve accomplished, your base statistics, your racial traits, and even any titles you&#39;ve earned. It&#39;s a</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">holistic assessment of your overall capabilities and potential.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">He paused again, then added, &quot;Hal, is there anything else I should be aware of, any nuances or hidden factors that the guidebook might have omitted,</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">before I proceed with the Class selection?&quot; He wanted to make the most informed decision possible, as this choice would significantly shape his future development within the System.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Your understanding of the core mechanics is sound, but before you proceed, there are crucial preparations to</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">consider. First, strategically allocate your unspent stat points. While there&#39;s no single &#39;correct&#39; distribution, striving for a minimum of 20 in your primary attributes is generally advantageous for maximizing your Class choices. Second, and equally important, do not neglect your available Perk Points. You have one Rare Perk and two Common Perks yet to be assigned. These Perks can have a profound impact on your character&#39;s development and, consequently, on the Classes offered to you.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert, taking Hal&#39;s advice to heart, immediately opened his character status screen, a holographic display of his accumulated attributes and skills. He realized with a start that Hal was absolutely correct; he had been so focused on acquiring new skills and mastering spells that he had completely overlooked the fundamental aspect of allocating his earned stat points. He had four unspent points, a significant resource that could substantially impact his overall capabilities.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">After a moment of careful consideration, weighing the relative importance of each attribute, he decided to allocate one point each to Intelligence and Wisdom, bringing both of those crucial mental stats up to 19. Before he could articulate his next thought, Hal interjected:</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Given your current objective and the mechanics of Class selection, I would strongly recommend utilizing your two remaining Common Perk Points to acquire additional stat points. This would allow you to achieve the recommended threshold of 20 in both Intelligence and Wisdom.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert, recognizing the soundness of this advice, immediately followed Hal&#39;s suggestion. He navigated to the Perks section of his status screen and selected the &#39;Additional Stat Point&#39; option twice, consuming his two Common Perk Points. He then allocated the two newly acquired stat points, one each to Intelligence and Wisdom, bringing both attributes up to the desired baseline of 20. He felt a subtle but noticeable shift in his mental clarity, a slight sharpening of his cognitive abilities.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Next, he turned his attention to his remaining Rare Perk Point, the most valuable and potentially impactful of the three. He carefully reviewed the</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">available options, scrolling through the list of Rare Perks, each one offering a unique and significant advantage. One particular Perk immediately caught his attention, its description promising a profound impact on his upcoming Class selection:</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><table style="border-collapse:collapse;margin-left:6.625pt" cellspacing="0"><tr style="height:36pt"><td style="width:47pt;border-top-style:solid;border-top-width:1pt;border-top-color:#EDEDED;border-left-style:solid;border-left-width:1pt;border-left-color:#EDEDED;border-bottom-style:solid;border-bottom-width:1pt;border-bottom-color:#EDEDED;border-right-style:solid;border-right-width:1pt;border-right-color:#EDEDED"><p class="s6" style="padding-right: 8pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Perk Name</p></td><td style="width:45pt;border-top-style:solid;border-top-width:1pt;border-top-color:#EDEDED;border-left-style:solid;border-left-width:1pt;border-left-color:#EDEDED;border-bottom-style:solid;border-bottom-width:1pt;border-bottom-color:#EDEDED;border-right-style:solid;border-right-width:1pt;border-right-color:#EDEDED"><p style="width:365pt;border-top-style:solid;border-top-width:1pt;border-top-color:#EDEDED;border-left-style:solid;border-left-width:1pt;border-left-color:#EDEDED;border-bottom-style:solid;border-bottom-width:1pt;border-bottom-color:#EDEDED;border-right-style:solid;border-right-width:1pt;border-right-color:#EDEDED"><p class="s8" style="padding-left: 1pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Your starting Base Class will always be at least Uncommon quality. Furthermore, any Class offered to you during the selection process will be automatically upgraded by one tier of rarity.</p></td></tr></table><p style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Hal,&quot; Robert inquired, seeking confirmation of his understanding, &quot;if I interpret this correctly, selecting this &#39;Rare Class&#39; Perk means I will <i>never </i>be offered a Common-tier Class, and any Class I <i>am </i>offered will be automatically elevated to the next higher tier of rarity, correct? So, a normally Uncommon Class would become Rare, a Rare Class would</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">become Legendary, and so on?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">That is a precise and accurate interpretation of the Perk&#39;s functionality, essentially, it guarantees a higher baseline quality for your Class and significantly improves the</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">potential rarity of the Classes presented to you.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert paused, considering the implications. &quot;So, why isn&#39;t this Perk universally selected? Why doesn&#39;t everyone strive for Uncommon or higher Classes if such Perks are available?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Perk Points, particularly those of Rare or higher quality, are exceptionally scarce resources. Unlike you, most individuals do not begin their System journey with any pre-existing Perk Points. Many people live out their entire lives, progressing through numerous levels, without ever acquiring a single Perk Point, let alone one of Rare quality. Across the vast expanse of the multiverse, it is not uncommon to encounter</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">individuals who have reached Level 100 or even higher without ever obtaining a single Perk. By that stage of advancement, Perks that primarily influence initial Class selection become largely irrelevant.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Robert was momentarily stunned by this revelation. &quot;So, I actually received a relatively <i>advantageous </i>starting position in this whole chaotic situation?&quot; he asked, a hint of incredulity in his voice.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">While your entry into the System was jarring, the initial benefits like the Perk Points were substantial. However,</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">remember the System seeks balance. Your current strong focus on magic  ten different disciplines is impressive  means the System will likely try to counterbalance this when assigning your Class. Interestingly, an odd number of primary skills sometimes offers more flexibility in Class options than an even number. While your current magic skills should be sufficient for a solid Class, perhaps consider diversifying into other areas eventually. There&#39;s no immediate rush, though.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert thought for a few moments. Considering that he had Creation, Destruction, Light, Air, Earth, Water, Healing and now the 3 new ones, he pondered. &quot;Probably good enough.&quot; With his final preparations complete, his attributes optimized, and his Perks strategically selected, Robert took a deep breath and initiated the Class selection process, ready to embrace the next, defining stage of his System journey.</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 65pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><span style=" color: #008000; They possess an intimate understanding of the fundamental forces that govern existence, allowing them to manipulate the fabric of reality itself. They can summon life from nothingness, sculpt mountains with a gesture, and bend the flow of time to their will. But this immense power carries a profound responsibility.
