They are masters of cryomancy, capable of summoning blizzards at will,</p><p class="s8" style="padding-left: 10pt;padding-right: 9pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">conjuring sentient constructs of pure ice, and encasing their enemies in tombs of impenetrable frost. They often appear cloaked in shimmering robes that seem woven from frozen starlight, their presence radiating an aura of intense cold. Their</p><p class="s8" style="padding-left: 1pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 17pt;text-align: center;">power extends beyond mere combat; they are also adept at crafting intricate enchantments, weaving spells of protection and offense into objects and even the very air around them. Their knowledge of ancient, often forbidden, lore is vast and constantly expanding, fueled by a relentless pursuit of arcane secrets. (Grants 3 points to Int/Wis per level, 2 points to Dex per level, and 2 free points)</p></td></tr><tr style="height:249pt"><td style="width:80pt;border-top-style:solid;border-top-width:1pt;border-top-color:#EDEDED;border-left-style:solid;border-left-width:1pt;border-left-color:#EDEDED;border-right-style:solid;border-right-width:1pt;border-right-color:#EDEDED"><p class="s8" style="padding-left: 2pt;padding-right: 1pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Wandering Ranger of the Silent Way</p></td><td style="width:56pt;border-top-style:solid;border-top-width:1pt;border-top-color:#EDEDED;border-left-style:solid;border-left-width:1pt;border-left-color:#EDEDED;border-right-style:solid;border-right-width:1pt;border-right-color:#EDEDED"><p class="s9" style="padding-left: 25pt;padding-right: 2pt;text-indent: -22pt;text-align: left;">Mythica l</p></td><td style="width:321pt;border-top-style:solid;border-top-width:1pt;border-top-color:#EDEDED;border-left-style:solid;border-left-width:1pt;border-left-color:#EDEDED;border-right-style:solid;border-right-width:1pt;border-right-color:#EDEDED"><p class="s8" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Enigmatic and elusive, the Wandering Ranger of the Silent Path is a master of stealth and a living embodiment of the natural world&#39;s untamed spirit.</p><p class="s8" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">They move through the wilderness with an uncanny silence, their presence often undetected until they</p><p class="s8" style="padding-left: 8pt;padding-right: 7pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">choose to reveal themselves. More than mere warriors, they are deeply connected to the rhythms of nature, drawing strength and wisdom from the</p><p class="s8" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">forests, mountains, and rivers. They are protectors of the wild, silent guardians of the innocent, and</p><p class="s8" style="padding-left: 9pt;text-indent: -6pt;text-align: left;">implacable foes to those who threaten the balance of the natural world. They are the unseen watchers in the shadows, the whisper of the wind through the</p><p class="s8" style="padding-left: 22pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">trees, the embodiment of nature&#39;s quiet power.</p></td></tr></table><table style="border-collapse:collapse;margin-left:6.625pt" cellspacing="0"><tr style="height:36pt"><td style="width:80pt;border-left-style:solid;border-left-width:1pt;border-left-color:#EDEDED;border-bottom-style:solid;border-bottom-width:1pt;border-bottom-color:#EDEDED;border-right-style:solid;border-right-width:1pt;border-right-color:#EDEDED"><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p></td><td style="width:56pt;border-left-style:solid;border-left-width:1pt;border-left-color:#EDEDED;border-bottom-style:solid;border-bottom-width:1pt;border-bottom-color:#EDEDED;border-right-style:solid;border-right-width:1pt;border-right-color:#EDEDED"><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p></td><td style="width:321pt;border-left-style:solid;border-left-width:1pt;border-left-color:#EDEDED;border-bottom-style:solid;border-bottom-width:1pt;border-bottom-color:#EDEDED;border-right-style:solid;border-right-width:1pt;border-right-color:#EDEDED"><p class="s8" style="padding-left: 33pt;text-indent: -25pt;text-align: left;">(Grants 3 points to Str/Dex per level and 1 point to Wis/Cha as well as 2 free points per level)</p></td></tr></table><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Wow... these are... incredible,&quot; Robert exclaimed, his voice filled with a mixture of astonishment and disbelief as he scrolled through the list of presented Class options. &quot;I I don&#39;t even understand how I qualified for <i>any </i>of these, let alone all of them. They seem far beyond anything I could have reasonably expected.&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Your initial assessment was inaccurate. You did, in fact, qualify for four Legendary class options. This is primarily attributable to the fact that your skills, and your proficiency within those skills, significantly exceed the typical parameters for a Level 10 character. Furthermore, you possess an unusually diverse and extensive array of</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">magical disciplines, coupled with a Divine ability  a combination exceedingly rare at your current level.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">When these factors are considered in conjunction with your accumulated Perks and your unique Title, the result is a</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">character profile that the System has deemed exceptionally potent, thus meriting access to Legendary-tier Class options. However, your &#39;Rare Class&#39; Perk automatically elevated these Legendary options to the Mythical tier.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Remember, the System adheres to strict rules of balance and fairness, but it also rewards exceptional achievement.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert shared the list of his potential Class options with his assembled family, seeking their input and perspectives. John, ever the pragmatist, was the first to offer his analysis. &quot;Based on your stated preferences and observed tendencies,&quot; he began, his brow furrowed in concentration, &quot;I</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">believe the &#39;Grand Archmagi of Creation&#39; is the most logical choice. I know you enjoy magic, making the &#39;Wandering Ranger of the Silent Path&#39; a less</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">suitable fit, despite its potential synergies with your existing skills. The &#39;High Enchanter of the Frozen Wastes,&#39; while undeniably powerful, seems geared towards large-scale, almost industrial-level enchanting, a role that doesn&#39;t seem to align with your more solitary and personal approach to magic.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">That leaves the two Archmagi options. Of those two, the &#39;Grand High Magi of Elemental Fury&#39; appears to be inherently more restrictive, limiting you to the four classical elements, whereas the &#39;Grand Archmagi of Creation&#39; seems to offer far greater flexibility and broader applications of magical</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">power.&quot; &quot;Hal,&quot; Robert inquired, turning his attention to the ever-present AI, &quot;what is your assessment? Do you concur with John&#39;s analysis?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">For the most part, John&#39;s assessment is accurate, with a</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">few significant clarifications. The &#39;Wandering Ranger of the Silent Path&#39; does indeed align well with skills such as hunting and your newly acquired archery, positioning you as a protector of nature, a role that might hold some appeal.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Conversely, the &#39;High Enchanter of the Frozen Wastes,&#39; as John noted, is better suited for a support role, focusing on enchanting items for entire armies and nations  a role you could potentially fulfill, given your exceptional &#39;Enchanting&#39; skill. A &#39;Mythical Enchanter&#39; would undoubtedly command an exorbitant price for their services from any ruler in the multiverse.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Now, regarding the final two choices, the &#39;Grand High Magi of Elemental Fury&#39; is arguably the more immediately</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">powerful option, in terms of raw destructive potential.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">However, it does confine you to the four elemental spheres of magic  fire, water, earth, and air  thereby limiting your overall versatility. The &#39;Grand Archmagi of Creation,&#39; on the other hand, while perhaps not possessing the same immediate, overwhelming destructive force, offers a significantly broader range of magical applications and</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">fewer inherent restrictions, allowing for greater adaptability and long-term growth.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;One more question, Hal,&quot; Robert interjected. &quot;Why is the &#39;Grand Archmagi of Creation&#39; specifically designated as &#39;Unique&#39;? What does that signify?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">At the highest echelons of power, particularly with Classes that are intrinsically tied to a specific, fundamental skill or ability, it is common for there to be only one individual in</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">existence who holds that particular Class title. The System enforces a kind of cosmic exclusivity.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;So,&quot; Robert clarified, absorbing this information, &quot;if I were to select this Class, I would be the <i>only </i>&#39;Grand Archmagi of Creation&#39; in the entire multiverse?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">That is correct, while &#39;Unique&#39; Classes are, by their nature, exceedingly rare, their rarity does not always correlate directly with superior power. However, in the case of the &#39;Grand Archmagi of Creation,&#39; I believe this designation is a strong indicator of its exceptional potential.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Well, then,&quot; Robert concluded, a decisive tone entering his voice, &quot;that makes the decision rather straightforward, doesn&#39;t it?&quot; He took one last, lingering look at his family, their faces a mixture of pride, apprehension, and unwavering support. With a deep breath and a silent prayer for guidance, he mentally selected the &#39;Grand Archmagi of Creation&#39; Class, embracing the unknown path that lay ahead.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:67.5pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Class Selection Complete:</p><p class="s12" style="padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Grand Archmagi of Creation(U) Selected</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 1pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:33.0pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Quest Complete!</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 1pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:33.0pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Title Earned: First Mythic</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 1pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:33.0pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Level Up!</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a href="https://oceanofpdf.com/">OceanofPDF.com</a></p><h1 style="padding-top: 2pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a name="bookmark43">&zwnj;</a>Chapter 21<a name="bookmark44">&zwnj;</a></h1><p style="padding-top: 21pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">A wave of raw, untamed power surged through Robert&#39;s very being, a feeling unlike anything he had ever experienced, as the System notification confirming his new Class  <i>Grand Archmagi of Creation </i> echoed in his mind. It was as if the universe itself had shifted, subtly but profoundly.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Colors seemed to explode with a newfound vibrancy, sounds resonated with an almost painful clarity, and a tingling energy permeated every cell of his body.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He felt a nascent, intuitive connection to the fundamental forces of existence, a sense of the underlying structure of reality that had previously been hidden from him. &quot;That that was <i>intense</i>,&quot; Robert stammered, his voice barely a whisper, still reeling from the sheer overwhelming power that had just washed over him. He felt fundamentally <i>different</i>, altered on a level he couldn&#39;t quite articulate.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Congratulations, Robert. You have achieved something truly extraordinary, something vanishingly rare. To attain a</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Mythical-tier Class at your relatively low level is practically unheard of. Typically, individuals who reach such heights of power do so only after progressing through multiple Class advancements, or through the complex and often unpredictable process of Class merging. The fact that you have received a Mythical Class as your first Class designation places you in a truly exceptional category  statistically, a one-in-a-billion occurrence within the System&#39;s user base.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;So, Hal,&quot; Robert began, trying to wrap his mind around the implications of Hal&#39;s words, &quot;the System Guidebook, while comprehensive, doesn&#39;t really go into detail about the hierarchy of Class rankings. Where exactly does</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&#39;Mythical&#39; fall on the overall spectrum of power?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The Class ranking system, from lowest to highest, is as follows: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Epic, Legendary,</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Mythical, Divine. There is also the &#39;Unique&#39; designation, but this is an anomaly, as it can apply to any rank and simply indicates that the Class is one-of-a-kind. As the holder of a Unique Mythical Class, you are, quite literally, a one-in-a- trillion phenomenon across the entire multiverse.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">A knot of apprehension tightened in Robert&#39;s stomach. &quot;So,&quot; he asked, a</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">tinge of worry creeping into his voice, &quot;does that mean I should expect to</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">have a giant target painted on my back when I eventually relocate? Will I be hunted down by powerful beings seeking to acquire my power, or something?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The probability of becoming a target is directly correlated with your demonstrable power level and the specific environments you choose to inhabit, it is highly advisable to maintain a low profile and avoid attracting unnecessary attention, particularly in the early stages of your development. I strongly recommend acquiring the &#39;Hide</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Status&#39; skill; it will significantly reduce the likelihood of others accurately assessing your true capabilities and Class designation.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;So, what now, Dad?&quot; John asked, his voice brimming with barely contained excitement, his eyes wide with a mixture of awe and anticipation. Robert took a deep breath, feeling the weight of his new reality settling upon him, a mixture of responsibility and exhilarating possibility. &quot;Now,&quot; Robert replied, his voice firm, a determined glint shining in his eyes, &quot;we begin to unravel the secrets of this extraordinary power. We delve deep into the mysteries of Creation itself, and I start down the path of becoming the architect of my own destiny, the shaper of my own fate.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">This Class it&#39;s not just a title; it&#39;s a calling.&quot; The family, drawn together by this momentous occasion, spent the remainder of the day immersed in a whirlwind of discussion, speculation, and planning. They analyzed Robert&#39;s new Class description, debated the potential applications of his newfound abilities, and grappled with the profound implications  both positive and</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">negative  of wielding such immense power.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">They pondered the challenges that lay ahead, the responsibilities he would now bear, and the vast, unexplored possibilities that stretched out before him. As the sun began to dip below the horizon, casting long, dramatic shadows across the room and painting the sky with hues of orange and purple, Robert turned to Hal, seeking guidance.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Hal,&quot; he inquired, his voice a mixture of curiosity and a touch of apprehension, &quot;what&#39;s the <i>immediate </i>next step? How do I practically begin <i>training </i>this new Class? Are there specific exercises, techniques, or areas of focus I should prioritize?&quot; He felt a sense of urgency, a desire to begin mastering this incredible gift as quickly and efficiently as possible.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Your immediate path remains largely unchanged. Continue your current training regimen  honing your existing skills, expanding your magical repertoire, and engaging in dungeon runs. One of the key benefits of possessing a defined Class is that dungeon rewards, including experience gains and item drops, will now be tailored to specifically support your Class development. The System actively invests in the growth of its users, and it will provide you with the necessary resources and opportunities to reach your full potential.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The morning light had arrived. Robert had stayed up most of the night planning. &quot;So Hal, besides the fact I can make things, what other powers come from this class?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">As a Grand Archmagi of Creation, you possess the innate ability to manipulate and control the universe. Which includes the creation of life and control over time and space. While you won&#39;t be great at those right now, it comes with the class. However, as you level, you should notice passive benefits, like your spells costing less or taking less time to cast. Also, you may want to look at your status, I believe you have already gained an ability.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Pulling up his status, he was surprised to note that he had gained a new ability, but in the excitement, he had missed the notice.</p><h3 style="padding-top: 16pt;padding-left: 7pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Class Ability<span class="p">: </span><i>Fabric of Reality</i></h3><h3 style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 7pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="p">: The user can sense and manipulate the underlying structure of reality, allowing them to:</span></h3><ol id="l2"><li data-list-text="1)"><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 7pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Analyze Objects: Gain detailed information about an object, including its composition, history, and potential uses.</p></li><li data-list-text="2)"><p style="padding-left: 23pt;text-indent: -16pt;text-align: left;">Repair Objects: Mend damaged objects at a molecular level.</p></li><li data-list-text="3)"><p style="padding-left: 7pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Create Simple Constructs: Form basic objects from raw energy or existing matter.</p></li></ol><h3 style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 7pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Limitations<span class="p">:</span></h3><ol id="l3"><li data-list-text="1)"><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 7pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The complexity of the creations is limited by the user&#39;s skill and energy reserves.</p></li><li data-list-text="2)"><p style="padding-left: 23pt;text-indent: -15pt;text-align: left;">The user must be in direct contact with the object to manipulate it.</p></li><li data-list-text="3)"><p style="padding-left: 23pt;text-indent: -16pt;text-align: left;">Overuse can lead to mental fatigue and a drain on the user&#39;s energy.</p></li></ol><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 7pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">This ability grants profound insight into the fundamental structure of objects and materials, allowing for detailed analysis and precise manipulation. It serves as a versatile tool for both problem-solving and exploration, enabling interactions with the world on a deeply fundamental level. Mana cost varies depending on the complexity and scale of the intended interaction.</p><p style="padding-top: 16pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Hal,&quot; Robert exclaimed, his voice a mixture of awe and disbelief, his eyes widening as he stared at the newly revealed ability description on his status screen. &quot;This &#39;Fabric of Reality&#39; it looks <i>incredibly </i>powerful. The potential applications are staggering.&quot; He could barely grasp the implications of such an ability.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Indeed, the potential is substantial. However, it is crucial to</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">remember that the true power of any ability, regardless of its inherent potential, ultimately resides in the skill, knowledge, and imagination of the wielder. In the hands of a skilled and creative individual, such an ability can be used to achieve</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">extraordinary feats, to reshape reality in profound ways. But in the hands of someone lacking in understanding or discipline, it might be little more than a fascinating, yet ultimately unproductive, toy.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert chuckled, a hint of self-deprecating humor in his voice. &quot;So, the</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">million-dollar question is which am I? The skilled wielder or the clueless toy-user?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Only time, dedicated practice, and the unfolding of events will reveal the answer to that question, Robert.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Driven by a burning curiosity and a desire to understand the full scope of his new ability, Robert spent the next several days immersed in exploration and experimentation. He focused his &#39;Fabric of Reality&#39; ability on a wide variety of objects, ranging from simple, mundane items like rocks and plants to more complex, technologically advanced devices like his</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">smartphone and television.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He was astonished by the sheer depth and breadth of information the ability revealed, providing him with detailed insights into the object&#39;s composition, history, creation process, and even potential, unrealized applications. It was like having an incredibly detailed, interactive blueprint and user manual for everything he examined. He also began to tentatively experiment with the <i>manipulation </i>aspect of the ability.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He started with small, simple tasks, repairing broken household items  a cracked ceramic mug, a torn book binding, a malfunctioning toy  with a mere touch and a focused exertion of his will. He was amazed by the speed and ease with which he could mend these objects, the broken pieces seamlessly rejoining, the tears vanishing as if they had never existed. He did, however, quickly discover the limitations of his current abilities. While he could easily manipulate and repair objects roughly the size of a television remote control, anything significantly larger or more complex,</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">like a full-sized appliance or a piece of furniture, proved to be beyond his current capacity, resisting his attempts at alteration.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">After a particularly intense practice session, Robert paused, leaning back in his chair and considering his overall character progression. &quot;Hal,&quot; he began, &quot;I need some guidance on allocating my stat points. Given that my &#39;Grand Archmagi of Creation&#39; Class already provides significant bonuses to</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Intelligence and Wisdom, which attributes should I prioritize to maximize my overall effectiveness and long-term potential?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">That is a strategically sound question, Robert. While Intelligence and Wisdom are undoubtedly crucial for your magical abilities, neglecting other attributes would create imbalances in your overall development. In your particular case, I strongly recommend prioritizing Constitution.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Constitution directly influences your physical resilience, stamina, and, most importantly, your lifespan. A higher Constitution translates to a longer natural life expectancy.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">For a Tier G Human, a baseline Constitution score of 20 typically grants a lifespan of approximately 100 years. Each additional point above 20 adds roughly five years to that baseline, with significant, non-linear increases occurring at certain milestone values.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">For example, reaching a Constitution score of 50 could potentially extend your lifespan to around 400 years. Given your stated desire to return to Earth after the System&#39;s integration, achieving a Constitution score of at least 60 is crucial to ensuring your survival until that time. A Constitution of 150, while ambitious, would grant you a</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">potential lifespan exceeding 1,000 years.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert was astonished. &quot;So, those high-level warriors, the ones with incredibly high Constitution scores they could potentially live for <i>thousands </i>of years?&quot; he asked, trying to wrap his mind around the concept.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">While there are beings within the multiverse who have achieved lifespans measured in *millions* of years, these are exceedingly rare exceptions, often possessing unique racial traits, extraordinary Classes, or access to powerful life-extending artifacts or magic. For the vast majority of</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">individuals, even those with advanced Classes and high levels, lifespans are considerably shorter.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 10pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Most beings, particularly those with Common or Uncommon Classes, are fortunate to reach 200 years of age. A smaller percentage might reach 500 years, and an even more select few might achieve 2,000 years. Beyond that, it becomes exponentially rarer.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 11pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Beings who are tens of thousands of years old, or even</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">older, are incredibly uncommon, perhaps one in a hundred billion, across the vastness of the multiverse.</p><p style="padding-top: 8pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;How do they even <i>achieve </i>such incredible lifespans?&quot; Robert asked, still struggling to comprehend the sheer scale of time involved. &quot;I can barely</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">imagine living to be 200, let alone thousands of years.&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">It is a result of the fundamental rules governing this multiverse and the inherent nature of the System, as individuals progress, gaining levels, acquiring powerful skills, and mastering their chosen Classes, they can achieve feats of longevity that would be considered impossible in</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">your previous reality. You will, in time, encounter beings who have lived for centuries, even millennia. It is a testament to the boundless potential for growth and adaptation that the</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">System provides.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert took a deep breath, processing the implications of Hal&#39;s explanation. &quot;Right,&quot; he said, his voice firm with resolve. &quot;No point in dwelling on the unimaginable. My immediate priority is clear: focus on increasing my Constitution. A long life is the first step to everything else.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 8pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a href="https://oceanofpdf.com/">OceanofPDF.com</a></p><h1 style="padding-top: 2pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a name="bookmark45">&zwnj;</a>Chapter 22<a name="bookmark46">&zwnj;</a></h1><p style="padding-top: 21pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The following days were a blur of intense preparation, a dedicated effort to hone his skills, expand his magical repertoire, and solidify his physical conditioning. He pushed himself relentlessly, driven by the knowledge that his family&#39;s future, and his own survival, depended on his success. He practiced his spellcasting, refining his technique and expanding his</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">repertoire of both offensive and defensive magic. He sparred with John, honing his swordsmanship and improving his reflexes.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">He delved deeper into the intricacies of enchanting, experimenting with new techniques and pushing the boundaries of his abilities. He even</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">dedicated time to archery practice, recognizing the value of ranged combat in a variety of situations. He was determined to leave no stone unturned, to maximize his chances of success in the face of the unknown.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert, floor 5, like all level-ending floors, is a checkpoint. These are tests of your overall skills. The next run will be harder.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: -28pt;text-align: left;">&quot;So every five floors will be like that, testing me?&quot; Robert inquired.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Yes and no. While all floors that end in 5 are checkpoints, floors 25 and 50 are major checkpoints, designed to push you to your absolute limits. Consider them significant milestones in your progression.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert, absorbing this information, simply replied, &quot;Great,&quot; a mixture of apprehension and anticipation coloring his voice. He knew that failure was not an option. In the precious days leading up to his scheduled dungeon run, Robert meticulously prepared, attending to every detail with a focused intensity. He carefully inspected each piece of his armor, ensuring there</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">were no cracks or weaknesses, polishing the leather to a gleaming sheen. He sharpened his longsword to a razor&#39;s edge, testing its balance and heft with practiced swings.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He checked the fletching on his arrows, ensuring they were perfectly aligned for optimal accuracy. But most importantly, he cherished every moment spent with his family, knowing that these fleeting interactions were the fuel that drove him, the reason he was willing to face the dangers that awaited him. He held his children close, savored meals with Sara, and engaged in heartfelt conversations with John, drawing strength and solace from their presence.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Finally, the day of the run arrived, a day marked by a mixture of nervous anticipation and grim determination. After a round of heartfelt farewells, filled with lingering hugs and whispered promises, Robert stepped resolutely towards the shimmering portal, the gateway to his next trial, leaving behind the warmth and comfort of home and stepping once more into the perilous unknown.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">A deep, synthesized voice echoed through the cavern. &quot;<b>Welcome, adventurer. class="s8" style="padding-right: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">A simple Silver Ring that contains the ability to cast the <i>Turn Undead Spell. </i>Each use requires 1 charge and the ring contains 10 charges, and cannot be recharged</p></td></tr></table><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Hal, could this... could this be a sign?&quot; Robert asked, his voice tight with urgency.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">The answer is clear, Robert. Purchase the ring. And a word of advice: do not deplete that final charge. Your class ability is exceptionally powerful. With dedicated study, you can</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">master not only the crafting of similar items but also the spell it contains.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert&#39;s eyes widened. &quot;Any magic item?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Indeed. As a Master of Creation, you possess the unique ability to decipher the workings of others&#39; creations.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert didn&#39;t hesitate. He bought the ring and slid it onto his finger. He stepped out of the room and into a dimly lit hallway. Casting a quick light spell, he moved down the corridor, his heart hammering in his chest. As he emerged, his breath hitched. Before him stretched an open field, an expanse of countless headstones under a breathtaking, star-dusted sky. Cautiously, Robert activated his air and light shields. After a final, lingering look at the graveyard, he cast his Blessing of Light spell. Prepared, he stepped into the eerie silence. He&#39;d taken no more than five steps when the earth around several headstones erupted, and four skeletons clawed their way free.</p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;min-height:209.2pt;width:239.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="s8">: Skeleton</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Class<span class="s8">: N/A</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Race<span class="s8">: Undead</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Profession<span class="s8">: N/A</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Gender<span class="s8">: N/A</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Stats<span class="s8">: Str 8, Dex 14, Con 10, Int 6, Wis</span></p><p class="s8" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">8, Cha 5</p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Level<span class="s8">: 10</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Resistances<span class="s8">: Slashing(50%), Darkness(90%), Death(auto) </span>Health<span class="s8">: 110</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Mana<span class="s8">: N/A</span></p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert&#39;s sword glanced off the nearest skeleton, barely leaving a scratch. He reacted instantly, unleashing a Radiant Bolt that staggered the creature, followed by two more rapid casts that obliterated it. Before he could savor</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">the momentary victory, another skeleton lunged, its rusty sword raised. Robert parried, retreated, and dodged the onslaught of the remaining two, then dispatched the second skeleton with a flurry of Radiant Bolts.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">This aggressive display, however, proved costly: four <i>more </i>skeletons erupted from the earth, surrounding him. Thinking quickly, Robert activated the Ring of Turn Undead, banishing two in a blinding flash. He fell back, raining down bolts of energy until the remaining foes crumbled to dust. The graveyard fell silent once more, but Robert, panting heavily, surveyed the</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">scene with dismay; he&#39;d barely crossed any distance, and the graveyard clearly teemed with undead. After looting the fallen, he found only a few</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">silver coins and a mysterious substance: bone dust. &quot;Hal,&quot; he asked, &quot;what&#39;s this bone dust for?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">It is merely an ingredient for alchemy. It holds no value to you unless you pursue that discipline, but it can be sold for profit once you arrive on a System World.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">&quot;A problem for later,&quot; Robert muttered, tucking the bone dust away. He crept through the graveyard, a grim reaper in his own right, felling three more clusters of shambling skeletons. But his streak of relatively easy</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">victories was about to shatter. Lulled into a false sense of security, expecting <i>another </i>predictable wave of bone and rusty steel, he was completely blindsided by the <i>thing </i>that erupted from the earth.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;min-height:209.2pt;width:239.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="s8">: Skeleton Warrior</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Class<span class="s8">: Fighter</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Race<span class="s8">: Undead</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Profession<span class="s8">: N/A</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Gender<span class="s8">: N/A</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Stats<span class="s8">: Str 13, Dex 13, Con 12, Int 6,</span></p><p class="s8" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Wis 8, Cha 5</p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Level<span class="s8">: 12</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Resistances<span class="s8">: Slashing(50%), Darkness(90%), Death(auto) </span>Health<span class="s8">: 150</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Mana<span class="s8">: N/A</span></p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">These skeletons were differentequipped with superior swords and shields. Wary of this heightened threat, Robert launched a Radiant Bolt. But this skeleton, possessing an agility its lesser brethren lacked, raised its shield, deflecting the magical missile. The creatures advanced, their swords gleaming menacingly in the dim light. Realizing the limitations of a purely magical approach, Robert drew his own blade. Steel met steel, the clash echoing through the silent graveyard.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The skeleton&#39;s strikes were powerful, forcing Robert to rely on his superior swordsmanship to parry each blow. As the battle wore on, fatigue began to set in. Another bolt of energy was met with a well-timed block. Seizing a fleeting moment of opportunity, Robert activated the Ring of Turn Undead. A blinding flash consumed the creature, banishing it in an instant.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He turned to the second skeleton, determined to conserve the ring&#39;s power. He focused his attacks, battering the skeleton&#39;s shield until it splintered and broke. With its defense shattered, he unleashed a final, decisive barrage of Radiant Bolts, overwhelming the creature.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The immediate threat neutralized, Robert slumped, catching his breath. The encounter had been a grueling test, pushing his skills to their limit, but he</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">had prevailed. The two skeletons yielded more bone dust, and a welcome ten silver coins. Recognizing the need to recover, Robert rested.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He rose, weary but resolute, and continued his perilous journey deeper into the graveyard. Another pair of skeletal warriors rose to meet him, their swords glinting ominouslya grim reminder of the constant danger. This new pair, with their enhanced strength, proved formidable. Robert fought with every ounce of skill and cunning, parrying blows and unleashing his own magical attacks, but the relentless onslaught took its toll. He emerged victorious, but only after another exhausting battle, forcing him to rest again.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Examining his gear, he noted several chips in his sword&#39;s blade; a replacement would be needed soon. Rising once more, he pressed on, bracing himself for the next inevitable encounter, which came swiftly as he uncovered another pair of foes.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;min-height:209.2pt;width:239.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="s8">: Skeleton Mage</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Class<span class="s8">: Mage</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Race<span class="s8">: Undead</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Profession<span class="s8">: N/A</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Gender<span class="s8">: N/A</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Stats<span class="s8">: Str 8, Dex 14, Con 10, Int 11,</span></p><p class="s8" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Wis 10, Cha 5</p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Level<span class="s8">: 13</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Resistances<span class="s8">: Slashing(50%), Darkness(90%), Death(auto) </span>Health<span class="s8">: 130</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Mana<span class="s8">: N/A</span></p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Before Robert could even process the results of his <i>Identify </i>spell, a bolt of dark energy slammed into his shield, the impact jarring him and weakening the magical barrier. He surged forward, intent on closing the distance with the attacking skeletal mages, but a fiery projectile from the second forced him into a desperate dive. He retaliated with a Radiant Bolt, only to see it harmlessly absorbed by a shimmering, arcane shield surrounding the creature.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The air crackled with hostile magic. The battle became a brutal, back-and- forth exchange of spells and evasive maneuvers. Robert struggled to pierce the second skeleton&#39;s defenses, while the first, now stripped of its protective shield, relentlessly harassed him with dark magic.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Then, a flicker of opportunity: the first skeleton&#39;s arcane shield wavered. Robert seized the moment, unleashing a concentrated barrage of Radiant Bolts. The creature staggered, its form flickering, then collapsed into a lifeless heap of bone. Now, with his focus solely on the remaining mage, the duel intensified. Spells crisscrossed the battlefield, each a potential</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">harbinger of death.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The tension was a palpable thing, a suffocating weight in the air. Yet, through a combination of skill, resilience, and sheer will, Robert persevered. A final, perfectly-aimed Radiant Bolt struck true, and the skeletal mage crumbled, its malevolent energy extinguished. He looted the fallen, collecting twenty silver coins and more bone dust, then slumped against a headstone, struggling to catch his breath. His status page revealed a critically low mana pool; a significant rest was unavoidable. He consumed a ration, reviewing the battles, searching for any tactical improvements he could make.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">After over an hour, feeling his mana partially replenished, Robert stood, ready to continue. He realized he&#39;d scoured most of the graveyard; only the small mausoleum remained. Recognizing this likely held the final, and most difficult, challenge, and understanding the need to be at his absolute best, Robert decided on a longer rest, waiting for his mana to fully regenerate.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Once his reserves were restored, he meticulously recast his protective spells. Then, with a deep breath to steel his nerves, he pushed open the mausoleum doors and entered. The air inside was thick with a palpable sense of dread. Dim light revealed six skeletal figures standing sentinel, their empty eye sockets burning with an unholy, malevolent glow.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">As he advanced, three sarcophagi <i>burst </i>open, spewing forth two</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">powerfully-built skeletal warriors and a robed skeletal mage. Surrounded by nine formidable opponents, Robert knew this was the ultimate test. The skeletal warriors, wielding swords and shields, pressed a coordinated attack,</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">while the mages unleashed a torrent of devastating spells. Robert, a whirlwind of motion, dodged, weaved, and countered with his own arsenal of spells and the practiced skill of his swordsmanship.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The battle raged, a chaotic maelstrom of life and death. Roberts magic began to tear through the skeletal ranks, yet their numbers remained daunting. With each passing moment, the situation grew increasingly dire. Yet, Robert refused to falter. Drawing upon the last vestiges of his strength and refined skill, he fought with a ferocity that surprised even himself. He danced away from incoming attacks, parried lethal blows, and launched calculated counterstrikes. One by one, the skeletal warriors fell, their lifeless forms adding to the macabre decor of the mausoleum floor. Finally, a well-aimed bolt pierced the mage&#39;s defenses, ending its threat. With the heavy hitters eliminated, the remaining six skeletons were swiftly dispatched.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:33.0pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Level Up!</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Looting the skeletons, he received his normal rewards. As soon as the final body was looted they all vanished and a Golden Chest appeared.</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Dungeon run complete: Epic chest awarded. Chest contains:</h3><p class="s5" style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">One Rare Silver Inlayed Steel Longsword(Enchanted)</p><p class="s5" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Ten gold coins</p><p class="s5" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">One Rare Shop Token</p><p class="s5" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">One Unlocked Skill Point</p><p class="s5" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">One pair of Uncommon Heavy Leather Pauldrons One pair of Uncommon Heavy Leather Bracers</p><p class="s5" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">One pair of Uncommon Heavy Leather Greaves</p><p class="s5" style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">One Uncommon Heavy Leather Helm</p><p class="s5" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">One pair of Uncommon Heavy Leather Boots.</p><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 17pt;text-align: left;">Items added to user inventory.</h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Thank you for visiting The Training Dungeon!</h3><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 13pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">With that final thought the chest vanished and Robert walked through the portal that replaced it.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a href="https://oceanofpdf.com/">OceanofPDF.com</a></p><h1 style="padding-top: 2pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a name="bookmark47">&zwnj;</a>Chapter 23<a name="bookmark48">&zwnj;</a></h1><p style="padding-top: 21pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The dungeon&#39;s stale, damp air, a clinging reminder of the ordeal he&#39;d just endured, clung to Robert like a shroud. Yet, even the oppressive atmosphere couldn&#39;t extinguish the flickering flame of triumph within him. He had conquered the grueling test, pushed himself to the absolute limit, and</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">emerged victorious. As the familiar warmth of his home enveloped him, a wave of exhaustion washed over him, a stark contrast to the adrenaline that had fueled him moments before.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Sara, his wife, her face a canvas of mingled relief and deep-seated worry, rushed to meet him. &quot;Robert!&quot; Her voice was a breathy exclamation, her</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">brow furrowed with concern. &quot;You&#39;re back! Are you hurt?&quot; She searched his face, her hands hovering, wanting to touch, to reassure herself he was truly whole. He pulled her into a tight embrace, burying his face in her hair, the</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">familiar scent grounding him.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;I&#39;m fine, love,&quot; he reassured her, the words a hoarse whisper against her</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">ear. His body throbbed with a symphony of aches, a testament to the brutal battles he&#39;d faced, but he pushed the pain aside. &quot;Just... incredibly worn out.&quot; The children, John, Richard, and little Stacey, drawn by the commotion, clustered around him, their eyes wide with a mixture of awe and apprehension.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Dad, you look like you fought a dragon!&quot; John observed, his voice tinged with both admiration and concern. Stacey, her lower lip trembling slightly, reached out a tentative hand to touch his arm. &quot;Daddy, are you really okay?&quot; she asked, her voice a fragile thread of worry. He knelt, ruffling her hair with a gentle hand. &quot;I&#39;m fine, princess,&quot; he promised, forcing a smile. &quot;Just a little tired. It was a tough one.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He regaled them with a carefully edited tale of his adventure, pulling out a photograph of the eerily beautiful, yet terrifying, graveyard, and a chilling image, captured by his Identify spell, of one of the skeletal warriors. Stacey gasped, her small hand flying to cover her mouth in a mixture of fear and fascination. John, however, looked at his father with a growing unease.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Dad, are you sure you should be doing these dungeon runs?&quot; he asked, his voice laced with a concern that belied his young age.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert sighed, the weight of his responsibilities pressing down on him. &quot;I don&#39;t have a choice, son,&quot; he explained, the weariness returning to his voice. &quot;If I don&#39;t complete two runs a week, the System will force me into back-to- back runs on the last day. And that...&quot; he trailed off, unwilling to voice the potential dangers of such a grueling schedule. &quot;That&#39;s not fair!&quot; Richard burst out, his young face flushed with righteous anger.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;I know, son,&quot; Robert agreed, his voice heavy with resignation. &quot;The System is inflexible. A cold, calculating machine. It has its goals, and it will stop at nothing to achieve them, regardless of the human cost.&quot; &quot;But,&quot; Robert added, forcing a brighter tone, &quot;I did get some pretty good rewards this time.&quot; He pulled out the items acquired from the rare chest, the gleaming new sword catching the light.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">John picked it up, his fingers tracing the intricate carvings on the hilt. &quot;This is beautiful, Dad,&quot; he breathed, his earlier concern momentarily forgotten. &quot;Yes, and perfect timing,&quot; Robert agreed, a genuine smile finally reaching his eyes. &quot;My old sword was starting to show its age, and neither my mending spell nor my Repair ability could fully restore it.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He paused, then continued, &quot;But the best part is the gold. It&#39;s finally enough to buy one of the Tier 2 spell books, and I desperately need the power boost to keep up.&quot; &quot;Which one are you going to get?&quot; John asked, his eyes shining with interest. Robert hesitated. &quot;I&#39;m leaning towards water,&quot; he admitted. &quot;I wish one of the books offered advanced healing; that would significantly help me craft more powerful items. But, with any luck, one of the water spells will have some healing properties, even if it&#39;s not the primary focus.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">After a precious hour spent reconnecting with his family, a balm to his weary soul, Robert retreated to his spare room, the designated space for his System-related activities. He began the methodical process of organizing his inventory, a task that always brought a strange mix of satisfaction and frustration. As he sorted through the accumulated items, he was struck, not for the first time, by the ephemeral nature of so many of them.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Equipment that had once seemed invaluable was now obsolete, rendered useless by the System&#39;s relentless progression. Returning to his office, seeking inspiration for his next enchanting project, a sudden, intriguing thought sparked in his mind. &quot;Hey Hal,&quot; he asked, his voice tinged with curiosity, &quot;is it possible to enchant cloth?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Indeed. Enchanting cloth is achievable, but it presents a</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">greater challenge than enchanting objects with fixed forms.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The process requires a superior level of skill and</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">exceptional precision, particularly in the stitching. Your current capabilities suggest you can manage it, Robert.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">However, a crucial caveat: inferior thread can compromise the enchantment&#39;s stability, leading to a potentially dangerous and uncontrolled discharge of magical energy.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Can I use something stronger than cloth thread?&quot; Robert asked.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Certainly. Your proficiency in sewing makes silver thread a natural choice for enchanting cloth. Silver possesses excellent conductive properties for magical energy. When purchasing, however, be certain to select thread of the utmost purity; impurities can significantly compromise the enchantment&#39;s stability.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert&#39;s search for silver thread led him down an online rabbit hole, culminating in a surprisingly affordable find. &quot;Forty dollars for a hundred feet of 99.99% pure silver? A steal,&quot; he muttered to himself, clicking the</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&#39;buy&#39; button with a satisfied smirk. The transaction complete, his thoughts immediately jumped to the practical application. <i>Cloaks</i>. The image formed in his mind: a flowing garment, subtly shimmering with magic. <i>A cloak woven with an air shield, a constant barrier against attack. Or perhaps, </i>he considered, a spark of excitement igniting within him, <i>a cloak of swiftness, drawing upon the power of a minor time spell to grant bursts of incredible speed. </i>The potential applications seemed endless.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Both cloak concepts possess considerable merit.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Remember to acquire a set of needles specifically designed</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">for working with fine metallic threads; standard needles may prove inadequate.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Thanks for the reminder, Hal,&quot; Robert replied, a grateful smile spreading across his face. He turned his attention back to the screen, browsing through various online vendors for suitable cloaks. He quickly located several promising options and, with a few clicks, ordered a dozen heavy cloth cloaks in a variety of dark, neutral colors, thinking they would provide the best canvas. Just as he confirmed the purchase, Sara entered the room, her</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">gaze drawn to the array of cloaks displayed on his monitor.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Cloaks?&quot; she questioned, a playful lilt in her voice, one eyebrow arched in amusement. &quot;Really, Robert? Aren&#39;t those a bit... theatrical, even for you?&quot; &quot;They&#39;re a simple, classic garment,&quot; Robert defended, a hint of a smile playing on his lips. &quot;Perfect for testing my enchantments. I need a blank canvas, and this will help me practice. Once I&#39;ve mastered the basics, I&#39;ll</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">move on to more complex items, like shirts and jackets, or even dresses.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;I suppose that makes a certain kind of sense,&quot; Sara conceded, though a small, thoughtful frown creased her brow, hinting at a lingering skepticism. &quot;But couldn&#39;t you achieve the same result with just a simple piece of cloth? Seems a bit extravagant.&quot; &quot;Not quite,&quot; Robert explained patiently. &quot;I need to test the enchantments on something I can actually wear, something that simulates real-world conditions. A loose piece of fabric won&#39;t give me</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">accurate results.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The following day, a large package arrived, containing Robert&#39;s carefully chosen supplies and the dozen cloaks. He cleared his workbench, a sense of anticipation building within him. With practiced precision, honed over countless hours of crafting, he began the intricate task of enchanting the first cloak. Selecting a spool of shimmering silver thread, he meticulously inscribed the runes of the <i>Air Shield </i>spell onto the dark fabric, his brow furrowed in concentration. After an hour of focused, painstaking work, the enchantment was complete. He stepped back, took a breath and cast the</p><p class="s5" style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Identify <span class="p">spell to reveal its properties.</span></p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="p">: Cloak of Shielding</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Tier<span class="p">: 1</span></h3><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 17pt;text-align: left;">Rank<span class="p">: Uncommon</span></h3><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><b>Description</b>: This cloak, crafted by the hand of an expert enchanter, will expend 1 charge to cast a <i>Minor Shield of Air </i>spell upon the wearer.</p><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Charges<span class="p">: 15</span></h3><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 13pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Pleased with his first creation, Robert turned his attention to the second cloak. He imbued it with the runes of the minor movement spell, carefully weaving them into the fabric. Once the enchantment was complete, he cast the Identify spell.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;min-height:156.8pt;width:239.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="s8">: Cloak of Minor Movement</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Tier<span class="s8">: 1</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Rank<span class="s8">: Uncommon</span></p><p class="s8" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><b>Description</b>: This cloak, crafted by the hand of an expert enchanter, will expend 1 charge to cast a <i>Minor Increased Movement </i>spell upon the</p><p class="s8" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">wearer.</p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Charges<span class="s8">: 15</span></p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The Air Shield cloak, humming faintly with contained magic, was carefully folded and stored alongside its un-enchanted brethren. A profound sense of satisfaction, the quiet pride of a craftsman in a job well done, settled over Robert. He sealed the box, leaving the remaining cloaks for later, and sought out the comforting chaos of his family. He found them gathered in</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">the living room, a tableau of domestic tranquility: Sara reading, the children engrossed in a board game.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He joined them, relishing the simple joy of their company, the worries and pressures of the System fading into the background. The next morning,</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">while organizing his ever-growing inventory  a task that seemed to become more complex with each passing day  Robert noticed a</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">surprisingly large balance of silver coins. Nearly four hundred, accumulated from countless dungeon runs, and largely forgotten amidst the more immediately pressing concerns of crafting materials and magical upgrades.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He rarely paid attention to the mundane currency, focused as he was on acquiring rarer resources. Intrigued by their current potential value, and</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">aware that his enchanting supplies weren&#39;t cheap, a plan began to form. He decided to investigate their worth in the &quot;real world.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert&#39;s research pointed him towards a local pawn shop, &quot;Golden Hand Pawn,&quot; a well-established, if somewhat dusty, institution known for its fair dealings, at least according to online reviews. He arrived to find a short queue, a mix of people hoping to offload unwanted possessions or secure a quick loan. As he waited, he approached a young employee, a man with tired eyes and a neatly trimmed beard, who was restocking shelves behind the counter.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Excuse me,&quot; Robert began, &quot;I have a collection of silver coins I&#39;m looking to sell. Would you be interested?&quot; The employee, sensing a potential commission, immediately straightened up, a flicker of interest in his eyes. &quot;Possibly,&quot; he replied, his voice noncommittal. &quot;Let&#39;s see what you&#39;ve got.&quot;</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert produced a single coin from the pouch, placing it carefully on the counter.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The employee picked it up, turning it over in his fingers, his brow furrowing as he examined the unfamiliar script and intricate design. &quot;Where did you get these?&quot; he asked, his tone a mixture of curiosity and suspicion. &quot;They were part of my father&#39;s estate,&quot; Robert explained, keeping his tone neutral. &quot;He was a bit of a collector, but I don&#39;t know much about their origins.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The employee nodded slowly, then disappeared into a back room, returning moments later with a small testing kit. He meticulously tested the coin, confirming its high silver purity. &quot;Alright,&quot; he said, finally looking up. &quot;We can offer you spot price minus five dollars, depending on how many you have.&quot; Robert pressed for clarification. &quot;$30.47 is the spot, take away $5 will make your total $25.47&quot;.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Robert considered for a moment, then countered, &quot;How about $26.00 even?</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">It&#39;s a fair price, and it saves us both the hassle of dealing with cents.&quot; The employee hesitated, then, with a shrug, agreed. &quot;Deal.&quot; Robert returned to his car, the weight of the remaining 199 coins a tangible reminder of his</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">unexpected windfall. He brought the heavy pouch back inside, the employee now visibly more enthusiastic.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">After a thorough, and somewhat painstaking, count and examination of each coin, the transaction was finalized. Robert walked out of the Golden Hand Pawn with $5,174 in crisp bills, a significant sum that eased the financial pressure he&#39;d been feeling. Back home, he found Sara in the kitchen, preparing dinner. He recounted the story of the pawn shop visit, handing her the thick stack of cash.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Here,&quot; he said, &quot;Put this somewhere safe. It&#39;s a nice little bonus.&quot; While he was pleased with the unexpected income, Robert knew it wasn&#39;t a</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">sustainable solution. The System demanded constant progress, a relentless pursuit of power. With a renewed sense of purpose, and a slightly lighter heart, he returned to his office, the image of the unfinished cloaks foremost in his mind.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">His enchanting endeavors, the true path to security and advancement, beckoned. Several days, filled with focused work and precious family time, passed in a blur. Finally, the last of the cloaks was imbued with its</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">protective enchantment. Robert stood back, admiring his handiwork. He was ready.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He prepared himself mentally and physically, gathering his supplies and donning his enchanted gear. It was time to descend into the dungeon once more, this time to face the unknown challenges of the sixth floor.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a href="https://oceanofpdf.com/">OceanofPDF.com</a></p><h1 style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a name="bookmark49">&zwnj;</a>Chapter 24<a name="bookmark50">&zwnj;</a></h1><p style="padding-top: 21pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Stepping through the portal, Robert was greeted by the usual AI greeting:</p><h3 style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Welcome, adventurer. You have entered Dungeon <i>7883667HG8776DE985762763FF7-1</i>, currently known as The Training Dungeon. You are now on the Sixth Floor.</h3><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert not wasting any time went straight to the shop interface to buy the water justify;">&quot;Hal, I&#39;m starting to think the System&#39;s messing with me,&quot; Robert said, a puzzled frown on his face. &quot;I need that healing book, but what&#39;s the deal with these spell scrolls?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Spell scrolls are one-time-use spells, you can cast directly</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">from them, or study the scroll to learn the spell permanently. Studying it destroys the scroll, though.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;So, five random spells I can potentially add to my spellbook? Anything goes, huh?&quot; Robert mused. &quot;I guess even a mediocre Tier 3 spell is better than nothing at this point.&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">True, but remember the randomness. You could get spells from schools you can&#39;t use yet, or even five duplicates.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Still worth a shot, if it gets me closer to that healing book. Fifty gold...&quot; Robert trailed off.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Speaking of gold, have you considered selling some of your items?</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Completely slipped my mind!&quot; Robert exclaimed. &quot;Does the System shop pay decently?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Not compared to a real merchant. But for an enchanter, even a third of an item&#39;s value can be a boost.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;A third? The System&#39;s a real tightwad,&quot; Robert chuckled.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">It&#39;s designed to encourage player interaction, the System wants users to rely on each other, not it. Of course, in your situation, options are limited.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">After buying the water book and the scroll pack, Robert in his voice, &quot;Am I losing it, or are some of these prices seriously inflated?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Enchanted items invariably command a premium. The art of enchanting is a rare and coveted skill. As for the healing item, any artifact capable of mending wounds is highly sought after. While that particular rod might offer only modest healing to a seasoned adventurer, it could be the difference between life and death for someone awaiting a skilled healer. The question then becomes: what value do you place on a human life?</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert paused, stroking his chin thoughtfully. &quot;Point taken. So, in theory, if I returned with eighty of those rods, I could afford the remaining books...&quot; He trailed off, lost in calculation. Before embarking on his task, Robert retrieved the spell scrolls and examined them with a critical eye.</p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;min-height:174.8pt;width:239.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="s8">: Scroll of Earth Bind</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Tier<span class="s8">: 3</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Rank<span class="s8">: Uncommon</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="s8">: Earth Spell that anchors an opponent to the earth, making them unable to move or cast spells.
