I can unlock an extra sphere, but I won&#39;t have any pre-learned spells in it.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;However, the System often provides them, either through quests or the shop.&quot; Elara pondered for a moment, then her face brightened. &quot;Mommy once told me stories about a mage who could create amazing illusions. I&#39;d like to learn something like that.&quot; &quot;Illusion, huh? That&#39;s an excellent choice,&quot; Robert said, genuinely impressed. &quot;It could be useful for both of us. We can learn it together.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Yes, please!&quot; Elara exclaimed, her eyes shining with excitement. With that settled, Robert used his last skill point to unlock the Illusion sphere and shared it with Elara. &quot;I got a feat!&quot; Elara exclaimed, surprised. &quot;It&#39;s called</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Polymathic Prodigy. It gives me a 10% bonus to learning spells from my four spheres and a 5% bonus to skill experience in those spheres.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert chuckled. &quot;That&#39;s a fantastic bonus. What level did you unlock the spheres at?&quot; &quot;Tier 1, level 9,&quot; Elara replied. &quot;Good. With that bonus, we should be able to get three of those spheres to Tier 2 before we leave in five months. That will be a significant advantage.&quot; Finally, fulfilling the initial steps of his commitment as her teacher, Robert pulled out his Tier 1 spellbook and handed it to Elara.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">This book contains every Tier 1 spell for Air, Healing, and Light. Look through it and pick two spells from each school. Ill review your choices</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">tomorrow. If I approve, you can start studying them. Im not sure how that will work without full System access, though.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">She can study them fine, she just doesn&#39;t have access to her System Spellbook yet, but she can add spells to it, she</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">just cannot view it or use them yet.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;The good news,&quot; Robert said to Elara, &quot;is that you can begin studying and learning spells. The only limitation is that your System Spellbook isn&#39;t</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">accessible yet. You&#39;ll gain full access when you turn fifteen.&quot; Elara checked her status screen. &quot;According to my status, I have fourteen Earth days remaining until my fifteenth birthday,&quot; she confirmed.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Perfect,&quot; Robert replied, a smile spreading across his face. &quot;That gives us ample time to master a few dozen spells. And then the real fun begins.&quot; The following morning, Elara sat with Robert, indicating the spells she had selected. He was surprised to see she had chosen three healing spells and</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">three defensive ones, all centered around protection and support.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Why these six?&quot; Robert asked, genuinely curious about her reasoning.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Father always said that the best defense is a strong defense,&quot; Elara replied, a hint of melancholy coloring her voice. &quot;I want to follow his teachings.&quot; Robert nodded, understanding her grief and the depth of her respect. &quot;Those are the words of a wise man,&quot; he said softly.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Youve honored him well with your choices. These six are an excellent foundation. Dedicate today and tomorrow to studying them. And remember, Elara, it&#39;s alright to grieve. If you ever need to talk, Sara and I are here, without judgment.&quot; Over the next few days, Elara diligently learned her first six spells, then selected another six, this time all focused on healing.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert didn&#39;t push her towards offensive magic, understanding her current priorities. He knew that in time, she would likely choose some offensive spells, but for now, there was no rush. He suspected she would soon surpass his own healing abilities, which he welcomed. He had a strong feeling the System would eventually require Elara to accompany him on dungeon runs, and he wanted her to be able to protect herself, and if needed, take over the healing role, so he can focus on their group defence and attack.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">While Elara studied, Robert dedicated his free time to crafting items to sell to the System Shop, determined to accumulate enough funds to purchase</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">the spellbooks he needed. Five days after returning with Elara, it was time</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">for another dungeon run. As he stood before the shimmering portal, he bid his family farewell, instructing Elara to continue her studies.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Robert, I&#39;m scared,&quot; Elara confessed, her voice trembling. &quot;What if it&#39;s like last time? What if it&#39;s too dangerous?&quot; Robert placed a reassuring hand on</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">her shoulder. &quot;One thing I&#39;ve learned about the System,&quot; he said, his voice calm and steady, &quot;is that it&#39;s firm but fair. I&#39;ll be challenged, certainly, but never by something I can&#39;t overcome with enough effort.&quot; With those reassuring words, he stepped through the portal.</p><h3 style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Welcome, adventurer. You have entered Dungeon <i>7883667HG8776DE985762763FF7-1</i>, currently known as The Training Dungeon. You are now on the Seventh Floor.</h3><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Wasting no time Robert went to the store and sold off all of the items he had crafted, 85 Rods of healing, 35 cloaks, and 10 staves, which earned him 138 gold coins. 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Hal, why is the Gravity book so much more expensive than the other Tier 1 books?&quot; Robert asked.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Because Gravity is a rare Sphere of magic, one not many people learn. Because it&#39;s a rare book it commands a higher price.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert shook his head, purchased all the books, and exited the room. As soon as he stepped out, he found himself in a dense forest.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a href="https://oceanofpdf.com/">OceanofPDF.com</a></p><h1 style="padding-top: 2pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a name="bookmark57">&zwnj;</a>Chapter 28<a name="bookmark58">&zwnj;</a></h1><p style="padding-top: 21pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The oppressive heat of the afternoon sun beat down on Robert&#39;s brow, each ray a tangible weight. He found himself, not in the expected confines of a structured dungeon, but amidst the vibrant chaos of a primeval forest, teeming with life both beautiful and deadly. The air hummed with the incessant buzz of insects, the chirping of unseen birds, and the rustling of leaves under the weight of hidden creatures.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Towering trees, their gnarled branches reaching skyward like the arms of ancient giants, cast long, dancing shadows that played tricks on the eye. The very air seemed to vibrate with a primal energy, a constant reminder that he was a stranger in a land ruled by tooth and claw. Every rustle of leaves, every snap of a twig underfoot, sent a jolt of adrenaline through him, a primal instinct honed by the constant threat of unseen dangers.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The wind, a fickle and capricious force, whispered through the leaves, carrying with it the scent of pine, damp earth, and something else... something wild and untamed. The branches of the ancient trees groaned and creaked under the wind&#39;s unseen hand, a chorus of mournful sounds that echoed through the silent forest.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">His first encounter, a jarring reminder of this world&#39;s brutal reality, came swiftly. Three boars, far larger and more ferocious than any he had encountered in his hunting trips with his father back on Earth, charged out of the undergrowth, their tusks gleaming menacingly in the dappled sunlight. Their eyes, small and beady, were filled with a savage hunger.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Instinct, honed by his recent trials, took over.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Reacting instantly, Robert channeled his mana, weaving a shimmering wall of water before the charging beasts. The Water Wall spell, born of his newly acquired knowledge, erupted from the ground, a solid barrier of churning, swirling water. The boars, caught completely by surprise, slammed into the unexpected obstacle, their momentum broken, their formation scattered.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The sudden impact sent spray flying, momentarily obscuring the scene.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Seizing the opportunity, Robert quickly focused his will, shaping another spell. An Earth Bullet, a concentrated sphere of solidified earth, materialized in his hand. He hurled it with all his might, aiming for the head of a lone boar, momentarily separated from its companions. The projectile</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">flew true, guided by his intent, striking the boar directly in the eye.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">It was a lucky shot, a testament to his growing skill and a desperate prayer answered. The force of the impact was devastating, penetrating the skull and killing the beast instantly. It collapsed in a heap, its lifeless eyes staring blankly at the sky. But there was no time for celebration, no time for reflection.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The remaining two boars, enraged by the death of their companion, regained their footing and charged again, their snorts of fury echoing through the trees. Robert, drawing his sword, met their attack head-on. He moved with a fluid grace, a deadly dance of parry and thrust, his blade flashing in the sunlight. He ducked under a wild swing, the boar&#39;s tusk narrowly missing his head, and riposted with a swift, precise thrust, his sword piercing the beast&#39;s thick hide.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The boar squealed in pain, but continued its attack, its rage undiminished. The battle was a whirlwind of motion, a desperate struggle for survival.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Finally, with a combination of skillful swordsmanship and well-timed spells, Robert managed to bring down the remaining boars, their bodies joining their fallen comrade on the forest floor.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He stood there, panting, his chest heaving, his muscles aching. Sweat dripped from his brow, mingling with the blood and dirt that stained his clothes. He looked around, his senses on high alert, ensuring that no other predators were lurking nearby, drawn by the sounds of the fight. Satisfied that he was, for the moment, alone, he knelt beside the fallen boars and began the grim task of looting their carcasses.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">He recovered a single silver coin, surprisingly well-preserved, a pelt of</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">coarse boar skin, and roughly five pounds of boar meat from each animal. The meat, though raw, represented a valuable source of sustenance in this unforgiving environment. He stored the spoils in his inventory, a space</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">outside of normal reality, accessible only to him.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Continuing his trek deeper into the forest, Robert encountered his next adversary: a large, feline predator, resembling an oversized bobcat, its eyes glowing with a predatory intelligence. It moved with a sinuous grace, its muscles rippling beneath its sleek fur. Reacting quickly, Robert cast an Air Bullet, a concentrated blast of compressed air, striking the cat and inflicting minor damage, more of an annoyance than a serious wound.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The creature hissed, its fur bristling, and launched itself into the branches of a nearby tree, disappearing from sight. What followed was a tense, drawn- out game of cat and mouse, a deadly dance played out amidst the towering trees and dense undergrowth. Robert would strike at the cat with spells and sword, only to have it vanish into the canopy, its movements swift and silent.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Then, a moment later, it would reappear, attacking from a different angle, its claws extended, its teeth bared. This frustrating pattern continued for several minutes, testing Robert&#39;s patience and his reflexes. He realized that he needed to change his tactics. He couldn&#39;t afford to waste his mana on</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">ineffective attacks. Deciding on a new approach, Robert channeled his energy into a Minor Movement spell, enhancing his speed and agility.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He felt a surge of power, his muscles responding with newfound quickness. With his enhanced speed, he anticipated the cat&#39;s next attack, dodging its claws with ease. As the cat landed, momentarily vulnerable, Robert seized the opportunity. He cast Earth Bind, a spell that caused the very earth beneath the cat&#39;s paws to solidify, trapping it in place.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The creature struggled, its powerful muscles straining against the magical restraints, but it was held fast. With the cat immobilized, Robert unleashed a barrage of Earth Bullet spells, each projectile striking with unerring accuracy. The cat roared in pain and defiance, its struggles weakening with each impact.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Finally, with a final, shuddering breath, it succumbed, its body slumping to the ground. Robert approached cautiously, his sword still at the ready, and confirmed that the creature was dead. He looted the carcass, retrieving two silver coins and a surprisingly soft and well-preserved pelt.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The next encounter brought a renewed sense of danger. A group of five boars, even larger than the first, emerged from the thick undergrowth, their snorting and grunting a clear sign of their aggressive intent. Robert knew that a direct confrontation with such a large group would be suicidal. He needed to use his wits, to leverage the environment to his advantage.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He quickly scanned his surroundings, his eyes searching for any tactical advantage. He spotted a narrow passage between two ancient, towering trees, their trunks thick and gnarled, their roots intertwined like the limbs of embracing giants. It was a natural chokepoint, a perfect place to funnel the boars&#39; charge.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He lured the boars towards the passage, taunting them with shouts and small, harmless spells. The enraged beasts, driven by instinct and fury,</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">charged towards him, their hooves pounding the earth. As they approached the narrow passage, Robert cast Wall of Earth, a solid barrier of rock and soil erupting from the ground, blocking their path.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The boars, unable to stop their momentum, slammed into the wall with a resounding thud, their charge halted abruptly. Confused and disoriented, they milled about, trapped in the confined space. Robert, taking advantage of their predicament, moved with swift precision. He used his sword, now a familiar extension of his arm, to dispatch the boars one by one, his movements efficient and deadly.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">The narrow passage prevented them from flanking him, forcing them to face him head-on, a fatal disadvantage. After the brutal, close-quarters</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">battle, Robert stood amidst the carnage, his breath coming in ragged gasps. He looted the boars, collecting five silver coins, five pelts of boar skin, and a substantial twenty-five pounds of boar meat.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The weight in his inventory was growing, a testament to his hard-won victories, but also a reminder of the constant struggle for survival. He pressed on, his senses heightened, his body weary but his spirit unbroken. He soon encountered another formidable opponent: a large panther, its fur a deep, velvety black, absorbing the light, making it appear almost spectral in the dappled shade of the forest.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The panther moved with an unnerving silence, a predator perfectly adapted to its environment. It attacked with incredible speed and agility, its claws raking, its teeth snapping, a whirlwind of deadly grace. Robert, however, was no longer the naive newcomer he had been just hours before. He had learned, adapted, and grown stronger with each encounter.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He dodged the panther&#39;s initial attacks, his movements fluid and practiced, and countered with spells and sword strokes of his own. The battle was a</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">fierce exchange, a dance of death played out under the watchful eyes of the ancient trees. Finally, with a well-aimed Earth Bullet, striking the panther in a vulnerable spot, Robert managed to bring the beast down.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He looted the carcass, recovering three silver coins and a valuable panther pelt, its fur smooth and luxurious to the touch. As the day wore on, the wilderness seemed to test Robert with increasing fervor, throwing a gauntlet of fierce creatures his way, as if determined to break his spirit.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He found himself locked in combat with a snarling pack of wolves, their eyes gleaming with predatory hunger, their coordinated attacks forcing him to rely on his agility and quick thinking. Later, the piercing shriek and razor talons of a giant eagle, its shadow huge and imposing against the sky, forced him to duck and weave. And finally, the very earth trembled beneath the charge of a monstrous bear, a behemoth of muscle and fury, its roar a deafening challenge.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Each encounter was a brutal trial, pushing his skills, his endurance, and his magical reserves to their absolute limits. But with every foe vanquished, Robert&#39;s resolve hardened, his determination solidifying into an unbreakable will to survive. He was a solitary figure, pitted against the untamed wilds, refusing to yield, refusing to be broken.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">After the final, exhausting fight with the bear, Robert found himself in a small, sun-drenched clearing, a rare patch of open space in the dense forest. He was utterly exhausted, his body bruised and battered, his muscles screaming in protest, his mana reserves nearly depleted. But he was victorious. He had faced the challenges of the wilderness, and he had prevailed.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He sank to the ground, leaning against a smooth, sun-warmed rock, and allowed himself a moment of respite. He closed his eyes, listening to the sounds of the forest, no longer feeling quite so threatened. He looked at the passing clouds, the endless blue above, the world seemed to have changed. He knew that his journey was far from over, that countless dangers still lay ahead, but he felt a sense of quiet confidence.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">A certainty that he was ready for whatever challenges awaited him. After resting for a short while, allowing his body to recover and his mana to slowly replenish, Robert was jolted back to alertness by the sound of a distant, guttural growl. It was a low, menacing rumble that resonated through the trees, a clear indication that his respite was over.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The forest was not yet done with him. He knew that there were still many dangers lurking in the shadows, waiting for an opportunity to strike. He</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">rose to his feet, his muscles stiff and sore, but his resolve firm. He strapped on his sword, the familiar weight comforting, and set off once more, his senses on high alert, ready to face whatever came his way.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">His next encounter, a grim reminder of the constant threat, was with a group of three boars, similar to the ones he had faced earlier. He dispatched them with a practiced efficiency, a combination of swordplay and well-aimed spells. He looted the carcasses, collecting the usual spoils: three silver coins, three pelts of boar skin, and fifteen pounds of boar meat.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Next, he encountered a large lynx, its fur a mottled pattern of browns and grays, blending seamlessly with the dappled shadows of the forest floor.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The lynx was a formidable opponent, quick and agile, its claws sharp and deadly. But Robert, honed by his previous battles, was able to anticipate its movements, to parry its attacks, and to counter with a series of well-placed Earth Bullets.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The lynx fell, its sleek body collapsing in a heap. He looted the carcass, gaining two silver coins and a valuable lynx pelt, its fur soft and luxurious. As the day wore on, and the sun began its slow descent towards the horizon, painting the sky with hues of orange and purple, the forest became a relentless arena, a proving ground that tested Robert at every turn.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He battled his way through a gauntlet of wild beasts, each encounter a desperate, life-or-death struggle. Wolves with eyes like burning coals, their howls echoing through the trees; bears of monstrous size, their roars shaking the very ground he stood on; and sleek panthers that moved like shadows through the undergrowth  all fell before his unwavering resolve, his growing skill, and his increasingly potent magic.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Every victory, hard-won and etched in sweat and blood, fueled his determination to survive, to push forward, to overcome the seemingly endless challenges of this untamed wilderness. He was no longer just surviving; he was adapting, evolving, becoming a force to be reckoned with. The sun beat down on Robert&#39;s brow as he pushed deeper into the heart of the forest.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The air grew heavy, almost suffocating, and the sounds of life had changed. It was a different type of sound and Robert was on edge. He continued to push on and the only sound was the rhythmic thud of his footsteps, now almost silent on the soft earth and the distant rustle of unseen creatures. A chill, unrelated to the temperature, ran down his spine as he crested a small, grassy hill, his eyes scanning the landscape before him.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">He laid eyes on the clearing before him, and his breath caught in his throat. Lying in the middle of the clearing, bathed in the golden light of the setting sun, was the largest feline creature he had ever seen, dwarfing even the</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">panther he had faced earlier. It resembled a panther, but it was immense, easily ten feet long from the tip of its nose to the base of its powerful tail.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Its fur was a deep, lustrous black, absorbing the light, giving it an almost ethereal quality. It lay sprawled on the grass, seemingly unconcerned, its massive head resting on its paws. This was a creature utterly secure in its</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">power, a creature that knew it was the apex predator, the undisputed lord of its domain.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert, his heart pounding in his chest, carefully surveyed his surroundings. He searched for any sign of other creatures, any potential ambush, any hidden danger. He knew that confronting this beast head-on would be incredibly risky, bordering on suicidal. He needed to be cautious, to be strategic. He needed to use every advantage he could muster.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">After a tense moment of observation, he concluded that the giant panther was, for the moment, alone. He began his attack with a carefully orchestrated combination of spells. First, he cast Greater Earth Bind, channeling a significant amount of his remaining mana into the spell, hoping to immobilize the beast, even if only for a few precious seconds.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">As the earth beneath the panther&#39;s paws began to solidify, he followed up immediately with Nature&#39;s Wrath, a spell that summoned thorny vines and roots from the surrounding vegetation, further entangling the creature. The panther, startled by the sudden attack, struggled against the binding earth and the encroaching vines. Its muscles strained, its claws digging into the ground, its powerful body rippling with effort.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert knew he didn&#39;t have much time. The creature was incredibly strong, and it would soon break free. Wasting no time, he began to spam Flame Bolt spells, channeling his remaining mana into each fiery projectile. He hurled four bolts in rapid succession, each one striking the panther&#39;s flank, searing its fur and flesh.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The beast roared in pain and fury, its struggles intensifying. The sound was deafening, a primal scream of rage that echoed through the forest. With a mighty heave, the panther shattered the Earth Bind spell, the solidified earth crumbling around its paws. The Nature&#39;s Wrath vines, though still hindering its movements, were also beginning to give way.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The creature lunged at Robert, its claws outstretched, its eyes burning with a terrifying intensity. Robert, anticipating the attack, dodged with a speed honed by countless battles. He narrowly avoided the razor-sharp claws, feeling the wind of their passage against his skin. He countered with a powerful Earth Bullet, aiming for the beast&#39;s head. The projectile struck, but the panther&#39;s skull was thick, its hide tough.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The spell slowed it down, staggering it momentarily, but it didn&#39;t deliver a killing blow. The panther roared again, a sound filled with pain and unbridled rage, and charged once more. Robert knew he couldn&#39;t afford to let the creature get close. He needed to keep it at bay, to wear it down with spells.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He dodged another swipe of its claws, narrowly avoiding a potentially fatal blow, and cast Minor Movement, enhancing his speed and agility. He then unleashed a flurry of sword strikes, each one aimed at a vulnerable point  the joints, the eyes, the soft underbelly. The panther roared in pain with each successful hit, but it refused to give up, its resilience astonishing. It turned to face Robert, its eyes filled with hatred, its body a tapestry of wounds, both magical and physical.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Realizing that a prolonged battle would be his undoing, Robert decided on a desperate gambit. He quickly erected a Water Wall between himself and the panther, creating a temporary barrier, a momentary respite. The panther, momentarily confused, slammed into the wall, its momentum broken. This gave Robert the precious seconds he needed.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He recast Greater Earth Bind, channeling every last ounce of his remaining mana into the spell. The earth beneath the panther&#39;s paws solidified once more, trapping it in place, its struggles even more desperate than before.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">With the beast immobilized, Robert, his body trembling with exhaustion, his mana reserves utterly depleted, unleashed four more Flame Bolt spells.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The fiery projectiles slammed into the panther, one after another, searing its flesh, burning its fur. The creature roared one last time, a sound filled with pain and defiance, before finally succumbing to its wounds. Its body slumped to the ground, its life extinguished. Robert stood there, swaying on his feet, his breath coming in ragged gasps, his body covered in sweat and blood, both his own and the creature&#39;s. He had done it. He had defeated the monstrous panther.</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:33.0pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Level Up!</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The familiar notification echoed in his mind, a small comfort amidst the exhaustion and the lingering adrenaline. He slowly approached the fallen beast, his sword still held loosely in his hand, and cautiously looted its carcass. He was surprised, and more than a little relieved, to receive 50</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">silver coins, a substantial amount compared to his previous spoils.</p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;left:0.4pt;min-height:187.5pt;top:0.4pt;width:287.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Dungeon run complete: Uncommon chest awarded.</p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Chest contains:</p><p class="s9" style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">One Uncommon Oak Longbow Two gold coins</p><p class="s9" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">One skill token</p><p class="s6" style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Items added to user inventory. Thank you for visiting The Training Dungeon!</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Looking around at the forest one last time he took a look at his status before he entered the portal and returned home.</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: style="padding-top: 21pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Dusty, weary, and bearing the invisible scars of countless battles, Robert stumbled through the shimmering portal, leaving behind the untamed wilderness of the dungeon and stepping back into the familiar embrace of his home. The transition was jarring; the cacophony of the forest  the rustling leaves, the growls of unseen beasts, the constant hum of magical energy  was replaced by a blessed, profound quiet, broken only by the</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">gentle ticking of the grandfather clock in the hallway.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">His home, a modest but comfortable haven, stood in stark contrast to the brutal realities he had just faced. A wave of relief washed over him, a sense of peace he hadn&#39;t realized he&#39;d been craving. Before he could even fully process the shift, his family  his wife, Sara, and their children, John, Richard, and Stacey  rushed to greet him, their faces a mixture of palpable relief and uncontainable joy.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Their hugs were tight, almost desperate, a tangible expression of their worry and their love. &quot;You&#39;re back,&quot; Sara breathed, her voice a soft whisper against his ear, her eyes, wide and searching, scanning his form for any signs of injury, any hint of the dangers he had faced. Her touch was gentle, reassuring, a grounding force in the whirlwind of his life. &quot;We were so worried. We always worry.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert smiled, a genuine, heartfelt smile that reached his tired eyes, and squeezed her hand, his calloused fingers intertwining with her delicate ones. &quot;I&#39;m fine, love,&quot; he reassured her, his voice hoarse but steady. &quot;Just a bit tired. A little worse for wear, perhaps, but nothing I can&#39;t handle.&quot; He pulled back slightly, allowing her to fully see him, to reassure herself that he was truly unharmed.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Later, gathered around the warm glow of the fireplace, the crackling flames casting dancing shadows on the walls, Robert recounted his adventures, his words painting vivid pictures of the strange and wondrous creatures he had encountered in the dungeon&#39;s sprawling forest. He regaled them with tales of colossal boars, their tusks gleaming like polished ivory; of sleek,</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">shadow-like panthers that moved with an unnerving grace; and of monstrous bears whose roars shook the very ground he stood on.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He carefully omitted the more gruesome details, the moments of sheer</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">terror, the crushing weight of loss, focusing instead on the wonder and the challenge. He even produced a few photographs, taken with his cell phone, of the towering, ancient trees, their branches reaching towards the sky like supplicating arms, and of some of the less threatening creatures, their forms both familiar and strangely alien.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Stacey, his youngest, listened with wide, captivated eyes, her small hand clutching his arm, her imagination ignited by the tales of a world so</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">different from their own, a world of magic and danger, a world her father had bravely ventured into. The older children, John and Richard, listened with a more discerning ear, asking questions about strategy, about the mechanics of magic, their minds already grappling with the complexities of the System.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The following days settled into a comfortable, productive rhythm, a whirlwind of focused activity punctuated by moments of quiet family connection. Robert dedicated himself to crafting, his hands, surprisingly adept despite his relative inexperience with the System, moving with a newfound proficiency. He fashioned rods of healing, their smooth surfaces imbued with the power to mend wounds and soothe pain, and spell staffs, each one a conduit for specific magical energies, their intricate designs reflecting the complex forces they channeled.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He also began to formally train Elara, his student, in the basics of magic.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Her enthusiasm was infectious, a bright spark that rekindled his own</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">burgeoning passion for the arcane arts. He found himself enjoying the role of mentor, guiding her through the fundamental principles, patiently correcting her mistakes, and celebrating her small but significant victories. Watching her grasp the concepts, seeing the wonder in her eyes as she manifested her first, flickering spell, filled him with a profound sense of satisfaction.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He remembered his first successes with magic and how it had filled him with that same wonder. But beneath the surface of this domestic tranquility,</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">a shadow of sadness lingered. Robert couldn&#39;t shake the knowledge that his time with his family was finite, that in a few short months, he would be forced to leave them, to venture out into the vastness of the multiverse, a journey from which there might be no return.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The System&#39;s demands were absolute, its rules unyielding. The only solace he could find was in the knowledge that he was working tirelessly to ensure their future, to provide them with the resources and the skills they would need to thrive in his absence. He was building a legacy, a foundation of security, brick by painstaking brick. He would do everything in his power to provide a good life for his family.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">During this period of intense preparation, he also focused on rapidly expanding his family&#39;s knowledge base. He utilized his System-granted skill &#39;Teaching&#39;, a form of accelerated knowledge transfer, to impart the fundamentals of Geometry to his wife and children. This wasn&#39;t traditional teaching; it was a direct infusion of understanding, bypassing the usual lengthy process of lectures and exercises.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Within a remarkably short time, they possessed a working knowledge of geometric principles, a foundation upon which he planned to build. He intended to use the same skill to impart knowledge of Calculus in two weeks, providing them with a strong mathematical foundation crucial for navigating many aspects of the System-influenced world. He focused the</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">knowledge transfer in the way he had designed to best suit their chosen life paths.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Four days later, driven by the relentless pressure of the System&#39;s timetable, Robert returned to the Dungeon, steeling himself for the challenges that awaited. He completed floor eight, a stark contrast to the previous verdant landscape. This floor was a more traditional cave system, a labyrinth of twisting tunnels and echoing chambers, the air thick with the smell of damp earth and something else something acrid and unpleasant.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The inhabitants were equally uninviting: goblins, their eyes gleaming with malice; orcs, their brutish strength a constant threat; and bats, their screeching cries echoing through the darkness. He navigated the treacherous passages, his senses on high alert, his spells and sword his only</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">companions. Hal, the AI companion residing within his mind, provided constant tactical analysis and warnings, a silent, ever-present partner in his struggles.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He was still getting use to Hal&#39;s comments and it startled him at times. The System shop, a constant beacon of opportunity, offered new items after he cleared the floor. Among them were Tier 2 spellbooks in Illusion and Gravity, powerful additions to his growing magical arsenal. After carefully assessing his finances, and selling the crafted items he had painstakingly created during his time at home, he was able to afford both books.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">This significant investment cost him a hefty 120 gold coins. The acquisition of these new spells represented a major step forward in his magical development, expanding his tactical options and enhancing his overall</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">power. The use of the new spells was demonstrated by Hal who showed him how to best use them. Completing the eighth floor run also earned him</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">another level, pushing him closer to the significant milestone of level 17.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The chest at the end of the floor, a gleaming, ornate container that materialized out of thin air, proved to be a rare find. It contained several items, including a robe of exceptional quality. He immediately recognized its potential value to Elara. The robe was not only aesthetically pleasing, with its intricate embroidery and flowing design, but it also provided significant protection and, more importantly, increased the wearer&#39;s mana recovery rate by a remarkable 2%.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">This would be a crucial advantage for a budding mage, allowing her to cast spells more frequently and recover her magical energy more quickly. He hoped that she would find great use of the robes. As he continued his rigorous training regimen, both within the dungeon and during his brief periods at home, Robert, despite his relatively short time within the System  a mere few weeks  noticed a marked improvement in his abilities.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">His control over the five elemental spheres of magic  fire, air, water, earth, and enchantment  had reached a surprising level of proficiency. He could</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">now weave spells with greater speed and precision, shaping the raw magical energy with an almost intuitive understanding, a testament to his natural</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">talent and Hal&#39;s constant guidance, accelerating his learning curve far beyond what a normal human could achieve.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">His swordsmanship, while still rudimentary compared to seasoned warriors, had also advanced significantly, thanks in part to the System&#39;s skill enhancements and Hal&#39;s strategic advice during combat. He had achieved a basic mastery over the long sword, his movements becoming more fluid and economical, his strikes gaining power and accuracy. He felt a growing, albeit cautious, confidence in his ability to face whatever challenges the System threw at him, a confidence born of hard-won experience and the unwavering support of his AI companion.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">This cycle of dungeon runs and home-based training continued for the next week, a relentless but rewarding grind. Robert conquered three more floors of the dungeon, each one presenting unique challenges and dangers. He acquired a Tier 2 spellbook in the Sphere of Destruction, broadening his</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">offensive capabilities, and a coveted Tier 3 book in Healing, significantly enhancing his ability to mend wounds and restore vitality.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The System shop continued to be his primary source of income; selling crafted items and looted treasures earned him a total of 190 gold, of which he spent 170 gold on the new spellbooks, a testament to their value and his commitment to maximizing his magical potential. He also found a new set of Rare Tier Leather Armor for himself, replacing the old, worn-out armor he had been using.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">It was a much-needed upgrade. His new armor, crafted from the hide of a rare creature known as a Wyvern, was a significant upgrade. The armor, designated as &quot;Rare Wyvernhide,&quot; was not only nearly twice as strong as</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">his previous set, providing superior protection against physical attacks, but it also possessed a self-repair enchantment.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">This magical property, explained in detail by Hal, meant that minor damage to the armor would automatically mend itself over time, a crucial advantage in the heat of battle, significantly increasing its longevity and reducing the need for costly repairs. A significant milestone was reached as Robert finally attained level 20, a pivotal moment in his System journey.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Reaching this level unlocked the opportunity to choose his first profession, a specialization that would define his future path and grant him access to a whole new set of skills and abilities. After careful consideration and</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">extensive consultation with Hal, his ever-present AI companion, who provided detailed analyses of each option, he narrowed down his choices to two Legendary options: Grand Arcane Engineer and Mythic Enchanter of</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">the Healing Light.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Each profession offered a unique and powerful path, representing the</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">pinnacle of magical achievement in their respective fields. The decision weighed heavily on him, the implications far-reaching, the choice shaping the very core of his identity within the System. The future depended on the choice he made now. This was a lot to take in for someone so new to the system.</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><table style="border-collapse:collapse;margin-left:6.625pt" class="s8" style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 1pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">(Grants 1 points to Int/Wis per level, 1 point to both Dex/Str per level, and 1 free point)</p></td></tr><tr style="width:303pt;border-top-style:solid;border-top-width:1pt;border-top-color:#EDEDED;border-left-style:solid;border-left-width:1pt;border-left-color:#EDEDED;border-right-style:solid;border-right-width:1pt;border-right-color:#EDEDED"><p specializes in creating powerful healing artifacts.</p><p class="s8" style="padding-left: 1pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">They possess a deep understanding of both magic</p></td></tr></table><table style="border-collapse:collapse;margin-left:6.625pt" cellspacing="0"><tr style="height:231pt"><td style="width:84pt;border-left-style:solid;border-left-width:1pt;border-left-color:#EDEDED;border-bottom-style:solid;border-bottom-width:1pt;border-bottom-color:#EDEDED;border-right-style:solid;border-right-width:1pt;border-right-color:#EDEDED"><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p></td><td style="width:70pt;border-left-style:solid;border-left-width:1pt;border-left-color:#EDEDED;border-bottom-style:solid;border-bottom-width:1pt;border-bottom-color:#EDEDED;border-right-style:solid;border-right-width:1pt;border-right-color:#EDEDED"><p
