style="width:303pt;border-left-style:solid;border-left-width:1pt;border-left-color:#EDEDED;border-bottom-style:solid;border-bottom-width:1pt;border-bottom-color:#EDEDED;border-right-style:solid;border-right-width:1pt;border-right-color:#EDEDED"><p class="s8" style="padding-left: 2pt;padding-right: 1pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">and medicine, allowing them to infuse objects with life-giving energy. The role of a Master Enchanter of the Healing Light is crucial in</p><p class="s8" style="padding-left: 2pt;padding-right: 1pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">maintaining balance and healing the world. They are often sought after by kings, queens, and heroes alike, and their creations are prized possessions.</p><p class="s8" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 1pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Core Skills: Healing, Enchanting, Light</p><p class="s8" style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 1pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">(Grants 2 points to Int/Wis per level, 2 points to Dex per level, and 3 free points)</p></td></tr></table><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;So, Hal, what&#39;s your take on this?&quot; Robert asked, a thoughtful frown creasing his forehead. &quot;It&#39;s a tough call.&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Indeed, it presents a significant dilemma, your background as an engineer is deeply ingrained, a core part of your identity for many years. However, you&#39;ve also explicitly stated your commitment to prioritizing protection  your own, and now Elara&#39;s. Given that unwavering priority, the Mythic Enchanter of the Healing Light is the logically</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">superior choice.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Hmm, there <i>are </i>other options, though, right? Even if they&#39;re not as powerful...&quot; Robert trailed off, a hint of uncertainty in his voice. &quot;And why &#39;Unique&#39;? What does that even signify in this context?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">That is correct, alternative paths exist, but selecting one would demonstrably weaken your overall capabilities, hindering your stated objective. As for &#39;Unique,&#39; in the context of Legendary and higher-tier classes and professions, especially those intrinsically linked to a specific individual, like your Creation-based class and the Healing Light profession, it denotes exclusivity. There can only be one &#39;Grand Archmagi of Creation&#39; at any given time, just as</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">there can only be one &#39;Mythic Enchanter of the Healing Light&#39;.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Okay, so I&#39;m basically irreplaceable in this specific role until I... well, until I&#39;m gone. That&#39;s a bit daunting, but good to know, I guess,&quot; Robert said, a nervous chuckle escaping his lips. He took a deep breath. &quot;You&#39;re right, Hal.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Protection is paramount.&quot; He straightened his shoulders, a newfound</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">resolve hardening his gaze. &quot;Enchanter it is.&quot; With a decisive nod, he made his selection. As his updated status sheet flashed before his eyes, his eyebrows shot up in surprise. &quot;Whoa! Is it just me, or are my stats about to go through the roof?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">As we previously discussed, Robert, your Mythic classification signifies a substantial power differential, the gap between you and the majority of System users will be considerable. Be grateful for this advantage; it significantly increases your chances of survival and your capacity to safeguard those under your protection.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Right, protection. That&#39;s the key,&quot; Robert replied, his voice firm, the initial shock giving way to a renewed sense of purpose.</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:33.0pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Profession Unlocked!</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 1pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:33.0pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Ability Unlocked!</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 1pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Profession Ability<span class="p">: Enchanting Touch of the Master Healer</span></h3><h3 style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="p">: A unique and powerful ability that allows the Enchanter to imbue healing properties into objects. This enchantment can be applied to weapons, armor, or even</span></h3><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">consumable items. When activated, the enchanted item will not only provide its base function but also emit a gentle healing aura,</p><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">restoring health to the user or nearby allies over time. Additionally, the Enchanter can enhance the healing properties of existing</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">potions and salves, making them more potent and effective.</p><h3 style="padding-top: 14pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Limitations<span class="p">: The Enchanter cannot imbue a property that is greater than what is known to him</span></h3><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 13pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Hal,&quot; Robert began, his voice tinged with apprehension, &quot;I&#39;ve been giving this a lot of thought. Do you think I&#39;ve finally reached a point where I could start revealing my abilities to others... without, you know, attracting unwanted attention or putting myself in unnecessary danger?&quot; He trailed</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">off, the unspoken fear hanging in the air.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The probability of a safe reveal has significantly increased, however, to further mitigate potential risks, I would strongly advise raising your Constitution to a minimum of 30. Your unallocated stat points allow for this adjustment.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert nodded slowly, considering Hal&#39;s suggestion. He trusted the AI&#39;s judgment implicitly. Accessing his status screen, he redistributed his points. Four points flowed into Constitution, bringing it to a robust 31, providing a substantial boost to his resilience and overall health. He allocated two points to Strength, raising it to a respectable 15, improving his physical capabilities. The remaining four points he held in reserve, a contingency for future needs, a buffer against the unknown.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Satisfied with the adjustments, a sense of cautious optimism began to replace his apprehension. He decided it was time. Later that afternoon,</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">gathered around the familiar comfort of the dinner table, the aroma of Sara&#39;s cooking filling the air, Robert began to explain his new profession and the</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">burgeoning scope of his abilities. As he had anticipated, John, with his sharp, analytical mind, was the quickest to grasp the full implications.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Dad,&quot; John exclaimed, his eyes wide with excitement, &quot;this is incredible! You can enchant <i>anything </i>to have healing properties, even objects you didn&#39;t personally craft! The possibilities are... limitless!&quot; The rest of the family, though perhaps not fully understanding the technical nuances, echoed John&#39;s enthusiasm, their faces reflecting a mixture of pride and awe.</p><p style="padding-top: 10pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">They unanimously agreed that Robert had made the right choice, embracing the path that best suited his skills and his protective instincts. The conversation then shifted, becoming more strategic, more focused. They began to discuss the practicalities of his newfound abilities, brainstorming how to proceed, how to gradually, carefully, reveal this extraordinary information to others, navigating the potential risks and maximizing the potential benefits.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a href="https://oceanofpdf.com/">OceanofPDF.com</a></p><h1 style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a name="bookmark61">&zwnj;</a>Chapter 30<a name="bookmark62">&zwnj;</a></h1><p style="padding-top: 21pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">So, how do we break this news? Robert asked, gathering his family around the dinner table. John chuckled, Maybe we could just shoot some fireballs at a news crew. Thatd certainly make headlines. Robert smiled. While that would be quite a spectacle, I think a more subtle approach is needed. If the whole world knew about the future, it could lead to mass</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">panic or a religious frenzy. Sara nodded. Exactly. We need to be cautious. Gradual disclosure is the key.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Elara, confused, piped up, Why tell anyone at all? &quot;Well, for one, I want to ensure our family&#39;s safety and future. And to do that, we&#39;ll need substantial resources. Plus, there are things the world can do to prepare. We have centuries, but societal change takes time.&quot; Richard pondered. &quot;Perhaps we should start small. Invite the grandparents and everyone else. We can</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">make it a family gathering and break the news together.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">A family meeting, huh? John mused. Kind of like a family intervention, but instead of addiction, its the end of the world. Robert chuckled. Something like that, I suppose. Well need to be delicate. We dont want to scare them or overwhelm them. And what about the rest of the world?</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Sara asked. When do we tell them? And how? Thats the million-dollar question, Robert admitted. We could start with close friends and trusted associates. Build a small, reliable circle. Then, as we gain more control and understanding, we can slowly expand our circle of influence.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;I&#39;ll call my parents, and you can call yours,&quot; Sara suggested. &quot;Since your family lives close together, it might be easier to visit them in person rather than trying to gather them here.&quot; Robert considered this. &quot;That&#39;s a good idea. You get your mom and brother on board, and we&#39;ll fly up to South Carolina.&quot; &quot;Sounds like a plan, I&#39;ll call them shortly,&quot; Sara said.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Over the next few days, the family prepared for their trip. Sara&#39;s mother and brother were excited about the family gathering, and Robert&#39;s family was looking forward to the visit. The only hiccup was Robert&#39;s appearance.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">After boosting his Constitution, he looked much younger than his actual age. Realizing the potential issues with airport security, they decided to drive instead.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">In the meantime, Robert visited a pawn shop in Tampa to sell some of his gold coins. Despite some initial curiosity about the strange inscriptions on the coins, the shop owner was impressed with the gold&#39;s quality. Robert managed to sell twenty coins for a substantial sum, providing the family with a comfortable financial cushion with Robert no longer working.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Before the trip, Robert decided to run another dungeon, a challenging cave system teeming with giant ants. While his physical weapons were</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">ineffective against these creatures, he relied on his growing Tier 2 magical arsenal, including Earth Spear and Fire Lance, to overcome the challenge.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Thinking about his spell books, his Tier 3 healing included a lot more powerful spells including the more powerful version of the Tier 1 Valicar&#39;s spells that he had. As soon as he had time he was going to start using those for his healing items.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Four days later, they loaded up the family SUV and hit the road. The ten- hour drive to Robert&#39;s parents&#39; house was uneventful, and they arrived on time. Sara went to pick up her family from the airport, while Robert entertained his own family, who were curious about his youthful appearance. Once everyone had arrived, they gathered around a large</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">outdoor table. As the kids played, the adults engaged in lively conversation. Robert decided to seize the moment.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Before we begin, I know I&#39;ve kept you all in suspense, but I&#39;ll answer one question first. The young woman with us is Elara. She&#39;s under my care after her family was tragically killed. I&#39;ll explain more later, but first, I have a question for you all.&quot; Robert&#39;s expression turned serious.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Dad, do you still enjoy smoked boar?&quot; he asked. &quot;Oh yeah, I can smoke a boar like nobody&#39;s business,&quot; Thomas replied, a nostalgic smile on his face. Elizabeth chuckled. &quot;The last time your father smoked a boar, the whole neighborhood could smell it. We had an impromptu block party.&quot; Michael laughed. &quot;Good times. Those were the days.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert looked around at his family: his parents, Thomas and Elizabeth; his older brother, Michael; his younger brother, David; and his younger sister, Emily. He shook his head and pulled four five-pound slabs of boar meat from seemingly thin air. &quot;Think you could handle this? I&#39;ve got about fifty pounds more.&quot; A stunned silence filled the room. Then, David stood up.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Where did that come from? You couldn&#39;t have hidden that under the table!&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert grinned. &quot;Same place I got this,&quot; he said, pulling out a Wyvernhide armor set. The table erupted in excited questions and demands for explanations. Robert simply smiled and returned the items to their invisible source, knowing a full explanation would take some time.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He raised his hand to silence the room. &quot;About a month ago, I received</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">some information that has changed my life and, eventually, the lives of all of you. In time, this information will change the world.&quot; With that, he</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">pulled up the first few system messages from his log and displayed them for his family to read. &quot;Robert, what is that?&quot; Emily asked, her eyes wide with curiosity. &quot;That, little sister, is what changed everything.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">A heavy silence fell over the table as everyone absorbed the information. Thomas was the first to break the silence. &quot;So, what does this all mean, son?&quot; Robert took a deep breath. &quot;For now, not much changes for you all. The significant changes won&#39;t occur for centuries. However, our future family members will be well-prepared. I plan to leave our family with the resources and knowledge needed to lead when the time comes.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;I know a lot about magic, though I&#39;ve only mastered the weaker spells so far. Before I leave, I&#39;ll learn much more. I plan to leave you all books</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">containing these spells and guides on the System, including a breakdown of my journey. This will help our descendants earn feats and quests early, giving our future family a significant advantage.&quot; David grinned. &quot;Magic,</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">huh? I&#39;d call you crazy, but it&#39;s hard to ignore what I&#39;ve just seen. Are you serious? You really know magic?&quot; Robert smiled at his younger brother. &quot;I do, little bro. But we should probably keep this a secret from the kids for now.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">With that, Robert spent the next hour going over everything that had happened, telling them about his abilities, his skills, and spells. He talked</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">about the dungeon runs, and how he met Elara. He went over crafting and what he could make and showed them some of the other items he had and even the coins he had collected. His father interrupted him while he was talking about his enchanting abilities with a question, &quot;Son you do know how these items could change the world right?&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Yes, Dad, I do,&quot; Robert replied. &quot;While I can&#39;t regrow limbs or replace missing parts yet, I can heal nearly all diseases and cure most poisons. I can even infuse these abilities into objects.&quot; He pulled out a Rod of Healing. &quot;This rod can heal almost any injury sustained today, from broken bones to gunshot wounds. I believe I could even create a rod to cure cancer. The only limitation is the number of uses.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Emily, a nurse, interjected. &quot;Robert, as a Nurse Practitioner, I know how many people die because we can&#39;t stabilize them fast enough. These rods would be invaluable.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert nodded. &quot;I understand, Emily. The problem is, that this rod can only be used fifteen times before it&#39;s depleted. I could leave you hundreds, but it wouldn&#39;t be enough. The issue lies in Mana. It&#39;s an exotic particle that doesn&#39;t currently exist in our universe. The System generates Mana and provides it to me. Once the System fully integrates our universe, it will</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">introduce Mana, which will then spread rapidly. Until then, no one here can recharge or create these items.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Jennifer, David&#39;s wife, asked, &quot;So if we had access to Mana, could we use magic too?&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Not quite,&quot; Robert explained. &quot;Humans don&#39;t naturally have the ability to use Mana. The System provides a shortcut, allowing us to use it without fully understanding it. Over time, humans could potentially learn to use</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Mana without the System&#39;s help, but it would take centuries of practice for minimal results.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;So, what&#39;s the next step?&quot; Robert asked. &quot;I&#39;ll continue preparing, but what do we do, and who do we tell?&quot; Thomas was the first to respond. &quot;Son, for every person you tell, a dozen more will find out. How long before the government starts asking questions?&quot; Robert considered this. &quot;I know, but</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">should we withhold information from the government? While I want to</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">ensure our family leads the way, I also want our nation to lead. I served my country for a reason, and it wasn&#39;t just for the paycheck.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;The problem with involving the government is that they&#39;ll never be satisfied,&quot; Michael warned. &quot;They&#39;ll want more and more, and I can see them locking you in a room and draining you of all your knowledge.&quot; Robert smiled. &quot;I don&#39;t think they can do that. My Constitution is 31, which not only boosts my health significantly but also extends my lifespan to around 200 years. I&#39;m stronger, faster, and have abilities that could easily</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">neutralize anyone who tries to harm me.&quot; &quot;So that&#39;s why you look younger,&quot;</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Emily realized. &quot;Your lifespan is increasing, and your body is getting stronger.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Exactly,&quot; Robert confirmed. &quot;With the System, I could eventually live for 500 years or more. From what Hal tells me, there are beings out there who are thousands, even tens of thousands of years old.&quot; &quot;That&#39;s hard to imagine,&quot; his mother said. &quot;Most people in System worlds are ordinary, with average power levels,&quot; Robert explained.</p><p style="padding-top: 10pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Gaining power requires taking risks and facing danger. While you can level up through daily life, combat is the fastest way to grow. Stats are crucial, and most people end up with common or uncommon classes and professions, limiting their potential. Even with optimal stat allocation, they might reach level 50 or 60 in their lifetime.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;So, with a Mythical class and profession, you&#39;ll far surpass others?&quot; David asked. &quot;Absolutely,&quot; Robert replied. &quot;Let&#39;s compare. At level 10, a common class gains 30 stat points. A Mythical class, like mine, gains significantly more. Even ignoring profession bonuses, I&#39;ll have double the stats. As we level up, this gap widens. At level 30, a common class might have around 160 stat points, while I&#39;ll have over 300. Most of my stats will be in</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Intelligence and Wisdom, but I&#39;ll also have a massive Mana pool compared to others. By level 50, my Constitution will grant me a lifespan of 400 years, and it scales from there.</p><p style="padding-top: 11pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">With my current growth rate, I&#39;ll likely reach 60 or 65 in Constitution before I leave, giving me a lifespan of 500 to 550 years. It&#39;s mind-boggling.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;I&#39;ve noticed you haven&#39;t been investing in Charisma,&quot; Emily observed. &quot;What does it actually do?&quot; Robert pulled up his stat sheet and consulted Hal for more details.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Charisma influences social abilities and personal magnetism. It affects things like persuasion, deception, leadership, intimidation, diplomacy, and performance. Emily is right, you should probably add some points. It&#39;ll help you interact with others more effectively.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He paused, considering his options. &quot;Actually, I have four spare points. I think I&#39;ll add them to Charisma now.&quot; No one objected, so Robert added the points to his Charisma stat. The kids returned at that moment so everyone agreed to stop here and think about any questions to ask later that night when the kids all went to bed.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a href="https://oceanofpdf.com/">OceanofPDF.com</a></p><h1 style="padding-top: 2pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a name="bookmark63">&zwnj;</a>Chapter 31<a name="bookmark64">&zwnj;</a></h1><p style="padding-top: 21pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Later that evening, after tucking the kids in, the adults gathered in the family room to continue their discussion. &quot;Robert,&quot; Emily inquired, &quot;are these items the best you can do?&quot; &quot;Not even close,&quot; Robert replied. &quot;The issue lies in the materials. Oak has its limitations. I&#39;d need more exotic</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">materials and gemstones to amplify the power. Unfortunately, I don&#39;t have access to the right resources.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;What about the gemstones?&quot; Emily asked. &quot;Do they have to be real? Would glass work?&quot; &quot;No, they must be genuine,&quot; Robert explained.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Different stones are better suited for different types of magic. For instance, Blue Topaz or Aquamarine would be ideal for enchanting using magic from the Sphere of Healing, while Yellow Topaz or Chrysoberyl would be better for spells from the Sphere of Light.&quot; &quot;That sounds quite expensive,&quot; Emily mused. &quot;Is it worth the cost?&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert pulled out his phone and began researching. &quot;I&#39;m not certain,&quot; he said. &quot;A 1-carat Blue Topaz, for example, would cost around $400.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">However, I have no idea how many charges it would provide, and Aquamarines are even more problematic. Chrysoberyls seem like a more promising option. I can get a 1.3-carat stone for about $260, which might be a good starting point for testing.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;What about Sapphires?&quot; His mother asked, &quot;I have that old ring I don&#39;t</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">wear anymore, it&#39;s got that gaudy stone on it, can we use it to test?&quot; Robert thought about it for a second, &quot;I remember that, It was grandma&#39;s ring, the stone is large enough if I remember.&quot; His mother continued, &quot;Ya it&#39;s a little over a carat. How long would it take you to enchant something?&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert thought about it, &quot;I&#39;d have to take the stone off the ring, I don&#39;t have the right tools nor the skill to engrave the runes on the ring, but I could mount it on a rod, better yet, silver.&quot; Robert got quiet for a few minutes, lost in thought. &quot;I would have to mount the stone to a rod, and then if I carved</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">the runes in silver and attached them to the stone, I would get a much better</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">result. I can melt a few of my silver coins and use those and I have a few good pieces of Oak rods.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert continued, &quot;Okay so I&#39;ll try it tomorrow, I might need to run to a hardware store and get a few things so I can melt the silver, but this is doable.&quot; Elizabeth left the room for a moment and returned with the ring, &quot;Here you go, this is exciting, I hope it works.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The next day, Robert headed to a hardware store, purchasing a stone crucible and a blowtorch for melting the silver. Back home, he first</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">removed the stone from its setting and selected an unused rod. Carefully, he carved the runes for his Tier 3 healing spell into the wood, followed by a cavity to house the gemstone. Placing ten coins in the crucible, he ignited</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">the torch and melted the silver.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Once molten, he slowly poured the silver into the carved runes, connecting them to the cavity. Finally, he encased the stone in silver, securing it with a silver strap. With the physical preparations complete, Robert began the enchanting process. Immediately, he noticed the increased Mana cost.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">While his previous rods required around 250 Mana, this one demanded a staggering 2000. As he finished the enchantment, he examined the completed rod, a surge of anticipation coursing through him:</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;min-height:174.8pt;width:239.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="s8">: Silver Enhanced Oak Rod of Healing</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Tier<span class="s8">: 4</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Rank<span class="s8">: Epic</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="s8">: This rod was made by an expert enchanter who used silver inlays and a Sapphire stone in its creation. and when used will expend 1 charge to heal up to 75 health points.</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Charges<span class="s8">: 100</span></p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 1pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:33.0pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Feat Unlocked!</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert pulled up his new feat:</p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;min-height:192.0pt;width:287.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="s8">: Architect of the Arcane </span>Description<span class="s8">: First person to create an enchanted item, of Epic Quality and at least</span></p><p class="s8" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Tier 4. Tier 5 is required for enchanting or Tier 4 for both the Enchanting Skill and the Sphere of Enchanting.</p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Effect<span class="s8">: +4 levels to your enchanting skill, or if you have both +2 to each of your enchanting Skill and Sphere. You have a +5% chance of any item you enchant being 1 tier higher in rarity.</span></p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Hal, what do you think the System would pay for this rod?&quot; Robert pondered.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Based on the previous one, I&#39;d estimate around 9 gold.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert&#39;s eyes lit up. &quot;Even considering the cost of the stones, I could potentially craft eight of these from the money I would get from that. That&#39;s a gold mine!&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">For now, yes. But remember, Tier 5 Enchanters have been honing their craft for 15 to 20 years. They&#39;re nearly masters. To them, 9 gold isn&#39;t much. You&#39;ve created a Tier 4 Epic healing item, something many Enchanters can&#39;t do. A Tier 5 version might fetch 25 to 30 gold. Good Enchanters live comfortably; Great Enchanters swim in wealth.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;So, once I reach that level, I won&#39;t have to worry about money?&quot; Robert asked, hopeful.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">The average worker on most System worlds earns 2 to 3 gold a year and lives decently. A high-level worker might make 5 to 6 gold annually and live quite well. A skilled</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">professional with their own shop could earn 20 to 30 gold a year. At your current pace, you could leave Earth with a few hundred gold. Ask Elara about the cost of items on her world to get a better idea.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Well, that&#39;s reassuring. I&#39;ll never starve,&quot; Robert said, gathering the rod. &quot;I&#39;ll go show the others.&quot; Finding his family gathered outside at the table, he put the new rod on the table. &quot;Robert it&#39;s beautiful,&quot; Emily said. &quot;The question is, is it better?&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">With a smile, Robert pulled out a sheet of paper where he had written both the old rod&#39;s description as well as the new rod&#39;s.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;min-height:140.2pt;width:239.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="s8">: Oak Rod of Healing</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Tier<span class="s8">: 1</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Rank<span class="s8">: Uncommon</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="s8">: This rod was made by an expert enchanter and when used will expend 1 charge to heal up to 12 health points.</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Charges<span class="s8">: 20</span></p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;min-height:174.0pt;width:239.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="s8">: Silver Enhanced Oak Rod of Healing</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Tier<span class="s8">: 4</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Rank<span class="s8">: Epic</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="s8">: This rod was made by an expert enchanter who used silver inlays and a Sapphire stone in its creation. and when used will expend 1 charge to heal up to 75 health points.</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Charges<span class="s8">: 100</span></p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Well, these new rods are definitely an upgrade,&quot; Emily laughed. &quot;But those stones are a bit pricey, close to $2000 each.&quot; Robert smiled. &quot;Don&#39;t worry,</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">they&#39;re a solid investment. The System Shop will pay 8 or 9 gold coins per rod, which is roughly $16,000 each. Even if I buy five stones at a time, that&#39;s a $6,000 profit per rod. Enchanters can make a killing.&quot; The room fell silent. &quot;Son, if we ordered 10 stones, could you finish the rods before your next dungeon run?&quot; Thomas asked. &quot;Not a chance,&quot; Robert replied. &quot;It&#39;ll</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">take weeks to get the stones. But once they arrive, I can make two rods a day, so six to eight per run.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">David stepped in. &quot;I&#39;ve got the money to order 20 stones. Just pay me back.&quot; Robert chuckled. &quot;I&#39;ll give you 40 gold coins from the sale. Double your money back seems fair.&quot; Emily pondered. &quot;Even with that, you&#39;d still make over $200,000. You&#39;re right, it&#39;s a moneymaker.&quot; &quot;Yes, but time is the issue,&quot; Robert explained. &quot;It&#39;ll take 12-13 days to make 20 rods, including dungeon runs. After that, we&#39;ll make another 10 for the family. Hopefully, I&#39;ll learn something new and create something more powerful, like limb replacements.&quot; Emily&#39;s eyes widened. &quot;Robert, if you could create limb replacements, we could help countless people. Forget money, we&#39;d make millions!&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">David set his phone down. &quot;Good news! I found a gemstone shop in Atlanta. They have plenty of the stones we need. Ill drive over tomorrow and pick them up. You should be able to start tomorrow afternoon.&quot; Robert grinned. Thats fantastic! Ill grab some extra oak rods and get everything ready. I should be able to make five rods before my next run, so I can pay you back. But itll be the run after that before you see a profit. David shrugged. No rush.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The family spent the rest of the day discussing their future. A few hours later, Thomas asked, &quot;Son, you said Constitution makes you tougher, right?&quot; Robert pondered. &quot;Yes, it increases physical resistance. Im currently at 7. What does that mean? Are you bulletproof? Thomas inquired.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Not quite. A 7 means you can withstand physical attacks like punches, but bullets are a different story. To stop most handguns, youd need a score of 10. For rifles, youre looking at 15. To get to 10, youd need a Constitution of 50. For 15, its 90.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">So, not quite bulletproof yet, Robert continued. I could probably win a boxing match, but for handguns, Id need about 21 more levels, or 10 with some strategic point allocation. For rifles, its 30 levels away. Thomas nodded, understanding. So, we keep this to ourselves until you reach that</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">10. Even if you cant stop a rifle round, your high health would probably let you survive, right? Robert laughed. Youre probably right. And you could always heal me up.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The next day David left early to head to Atlanta and Robert went to the</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">hardware store to get more Oak Rods. Later that afternoon, he was able to start working again on the new rods. This continued for the next three days. By the time Robert&#39;s next run had arrived he had created 5 new rods to sell.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">On the day of Roberts next run, the kids were at Michaels house, and the adults gathered at Roberts parents. Dressed in his armor and clutching his sword, Robert walked into the room. Damn, Robert, looking mighty</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">medieval, Emily teased. Thomas shook his head. So, whats the plan,</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">son? Robert glanced at his father. Its time to tell Hal, Robert informed Hal he was ready, and a portal materialized in the corner of the room.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Everyones eyes were fixed on the swirling portal. So, thats how it</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">works? David asked, surprised. You just walk into that thing?Robert chuckled. Yep. Not sure how long this will take, but expect several hours, maybe even a full day. With that, he stepped into the portal.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a href="https://oceanofpdf.com/">OceanofPDF.com</a></p><h1 style="padding-top: 2pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a name="bookmark65">&zwnj;</a>Chapter 32<a name="bookmark66">&zwnj;</a></h1><h3 style="padding-top: 21pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Welcome, adventurer. left;">&quot;Hal is that what I think it is?&quot; Robert yelled to Hal.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">If you are talking about the Tier 2 book then yes it is. Though you are nowhere close to getting it. You&#39;ve found a few rare tokens, but I&#39;m guessing you will not see Epic for another 10 levels or so. That being said you can exchange 4 rare tokens for an Epic which happens to be how many you have. With that, you could buy the scroll pack which would at least give you a few Tier 4 spells to cast.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Probably a good idea, unless I get spells for things like trash disposal, which wouldn&#39;t help me at all here.&#39; Robert said in reflection. &quot;How do I exchange them?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">When you go to purchase the pack, it will give you the option to use your 4 rare tokens.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Following his instruction Robert purchased the scroll pack and received the following:</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="p">: Scroll of Fiery Tempest</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Tier<span class="p">: 4</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Rank<span class="p">: Epic</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="p">: A combination of Fire and Air. This spell summons a powerful whirlwind of flame that can</span></h3><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 17pt;text-align: left;">devastate large areas.</p><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Charges<span class="p">: 1</span></h3><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;min-height:156.8pt;width:239.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="s8">: Scroll of Temporal Shift</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Tier<span class="s8">: 4</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Rank<span class="s8">: Epic</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="s8">: A combination of Time and Space. This spell allows the caster to manipulate time and space, enabling them to travel through time forward or backward for up to thirty minutes.</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Charges<span class="s8">: 1</span></p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;min-height:157.5pt;width:239.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="s8">: Scroll of Mind Control</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Tier<span class="s8">: 4</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Rank<span class="s8">: Epic</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="s8">: A combination of Mind and Illusion. This spell grants the</span></p><p class="s8" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">caster the ability to dominate the minds of others, forcing them to obey the caster&#39;s commands.</p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Charges<span class="s8">: 1</span></p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;min-height:174.0pt;width:239.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="s8">: Scroll of Necromantic Resurrection</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Tier<span class="s8">: 4</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Rank<span class="s8">: Epic</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="s8">: A combination of Necromancy and Soul. This spell allows the caster to reanimate the dead, bringing them back to life as powerful undead servants.</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Charges<span class="s8">: 1</span></p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="p">: Scroll of Conjuration of the Divine</span></h3><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 17pt;text-align: left;">Tier<span class="p">: 4</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Rank<span class="p">: Epic</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="p">: A combination of Conjuration and Light. This spell summons powerful celestial being to aid the caster in battle or other tasks. </span>Charges<span class="p">: 1</span></h3><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 13pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Hal, what the heck is this?&quot; Robert exclaimed, eyes wide as he scanned the list of spells. &quot;I can&#39;t even use three of these! And time travel? Are you serious?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">It&#39;s random. But yeah, those are pretty powerful spells. Be careful with that mind-control one though. It&#39;s illegal in a lot of places.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert returned to the shop to check the price of the scrolls. &quot;Holy cow, Hal! The System will buy that scroll for 250 gold!&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Well, it is a Tier 4 Epic spell combining two spheres. I&#39;d expect it to be expensive.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;I don&#39;t think I need the Necromancy spell, so I&#39;ll sell it. And as for the mind control... I&#39;m not sure it&#39;s worth the risk. I&#39;ll sell that one too. At least I&#39;ll have enough to buy all the other books.&quot; Before he could change his mind, Robert sold the two scrolls and purchased the remaining books. &quot;Hal, tell me about Conjuration. I&#39;m guessing it&#39;s what I think it is?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Probably, Conjuration is a Sphere of magic focused on the creation and manipulation of matter and energy. Conjurers excel at summoning creatures from other planes of existence, creating objects out of thin air, and transporting themselves and others across vast distances.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert grinned. &quot;So, it&#39;s definitely worth unlocking.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Unlocking the skill he held off on learning the spells, after the last time he did that, he wasn&#39;t risking a side quest again. Heading into the next area he</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">discovered his dungeon run this time was a desert. As soon as he stepped through the door it vanished behind him landing him in a vast open desert. Looking around he was able to spot what looked like a building several miles ahead and with nothing else to do, he headed off in that direction.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert had taken no more than a few steps before his first foe burst out of the sand&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;min-height:192.0pt;width:239.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="s8">: Giant Scorpion</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Class<span class="s8">: N/A</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Race<span class="s8">: Scorpion </span>Profession<span class="s8">: N/A </span>Gender<span class="s8">: Male</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Stats<span class="s8">: Str 18, Dex 19, Con 22, Int 5,</span></p><p class="s8" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Wis 4, Cha 5</p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Level<span class="s8">: 18</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Resistances<span class="s8">: Physical (20%)</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Health<span class="s8">: 590</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Mana<span class="s8">: N/A</span></p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert, his body a blur of motion, dodged the scorpion&#39;s massive pincers. The creature&#39;s chitinous exoskeleton glinted in the desert sun as it lunged forward. With a swift gesture, Robert cast Fire Lance. A fiery spear materialized its tip ablaze before it was hurled with deadly accuracy, piercing the scorpion&#39;s exoskeleton. The creature roared in pain, its movements slowed. Seizing the opportunity, Robert activated Earth Spike striking the creature again. Robert&#39;s Air barrier deflected the scorpion&#39;s retaliatory strike before it shattered leaving him unprotected. He moved in</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">for the final blow, his sword raised high. With a powerful swing, he severed the scorpion&#39;s tail, ending the creature&#39;s threat.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert looted the scorpion, earning 10 silver and 10 pounds of valuable chitinous shell. He continued his trek, battling twelve more scorpions</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">before a familiar message appeared:</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:33.0pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Level Up!</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Level 21, just 14 more to go until he felt like he was no longer in danger from anyone on Earth. After about 20 more minutes he encountered a</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">different creature:</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;min-height:192.0pt;width:239.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="s8">: Horned Lizard</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Class<span class="s8">: N/A</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Race<span class="s8">: Desert Lizard</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Profession<span class="s8">: N/A</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Gender<span class="s8">: Male</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Stats<span class="s8">: Str 16, Dex 21, Con 19, Int 5,</span></p><p class="s8" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Wis 4, Cha 5</p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Level<span class="s8">: 19 </span>Resistances<span class="s8">: N/A </span>Health<span class="s8">: 520 </span>Mana<span class="s8">: N/A</span></p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert watched the Horned Lizard, its spiny body glistening in the desert sun. The creature puffed itself up, a defensive display that only made it look more ridiculous. The lizard lunged, its sharp claws aimed at Robert&#39;s chest. With a swift motion, Robert cast Fire Lance. A fiery spear materialized in his hand and shot towards the lizard. The creature was struck, its scales sizzling and smoking. It let out a high-pitched screech and retreated. Robert followed up with Earth Spear. A solid, earthen spike shot from the ground, impaling the lizard. The creature thrashed wildly, but the spear held firm.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">With a final, decisive strike, Robert finished off the creature. The battle was over. Robert stood victorious, the silence of the desert broken only by the soft hiss of the dying fire.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Looting the creature Robert found 8 silver coins and a Horned Lizard skin. Continuing on, Robert was attacked by 10 more of the lizards before he reached the building he had been walking toward. If nothing else the creatures on this run were paying out in experience points.</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:33.0pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Level Up!</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The wind whipped across the barren landscape, carrying grains of sand that stung the eyes and chapped lips. The sun beat down mercilessly, a blazing</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">orb in a sky of endless blue. Robert, weary from his journey through the desert, approached a crumbling fortress. Its once-proud walls, now eroded and scarred, stood as a silent sentinel against the encroaching sands. The fortress, a relic of a bygone era, was a stark contrast to the desolate landscape. Its broken windows and shattered doors hinted at a violent past, perhaps a battle lost to the relentless sands of time. As Robert ventured</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">closer, he could see the skeletal remains of creatures scattered across the courtyard, a grim reminder of the dangers that lurked within these ancient walls.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Entering the broken ruins Robert looked around for danger, knowing this would be the location of the final battle from this dungeon run. Entering the courtyard in the middle of the fortress his unspoken question was answered by the largest lizard he had ever seen:</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;min-height:192.0pt;width:239.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="s8">: Giant Fire Lizard</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Class<span class="s8">: N/A</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Race<span class="s8">: Volcanic Lizard</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Profession<span class="s8">: N/A</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Gender<span class="s8">: Male</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Stats<span class="s8">: Str 25, Dex 21, Con 23, Int 5,</span></p><p class="s8" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Wis 4, Cha 5</p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Level<span class="s8">: 22</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Resistances<span class="s8">: Fire(85%), Water (-25%)</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Health<span class="s8">: 1220</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Mana<span class="s8">: N/A</span></p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Looking at the information provided by his skill he knew which spells to use.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert, heart pounding, readied himself for the battle. The Fire Lizard, a monstrous creature of flame, roared, its breath a torrent of fire. Robert knew he had to act fast. He raised his hand, focusing his energy. A bolt of water,</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">crystalline and powerful, shot forth. It struck the lizard&#39;s scaly hide, extinguishing a small portion of the flames. The creature roared in pain, but its rage only intensified. The lizard charged, its claws outstretched. Robert</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">swiftly cast Water Wall, a shimmering barrier of water materializing in front of him.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The lizard&#39;s claws struck the wall, causing ripples and distortions, but the barrier held. Robert seized the opportunity. He unleashed another Water</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Bolt, this time aiming for the lizard&#39;s eyes. The bolt struck true, blinding the creature momentarily. It stumbled, its attacks becoming less precise. Robert continued his assault, each Water Bolt chipping away at the lizard&#39;s health. The creature, though wounded, fought with a savage ferocity. Its fiery breath scorched the earth, and its claws raked at the water wall. Finally,</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">after a grueling battle, the lizard&#39;s health dwindled to zero. It let out a final, mournful roar before collapsing to the ground, its fiery form extinguished. Robert stood victorious, his body weary but his spirit unbroken.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert looted the fallen Fire Lizard, claiming a gold coin and a fiery Firestone. As soon as he finished, the creature&#39;s remains vanished, replaced by a shimmering chest.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;left:0.4pt;min-height:234.8pt;top:0.4pt;width:287.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Dungeon run complete: Rare chest awarded.</p><p class="s6" style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Chest contains:</p><p class="s9" style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">One skill book (Cartography) Five gold coins</p><p class="s9" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">One unlocked skill tokens One Rare Shop Token</p><p class="s6" style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Items added to user inventory.</p><p class="s6" style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Thank you for visiting The Training Dungeon!</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">With that the chest vanished and Robert exited through the portal.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a href="https://oceanofpdf.com/">OceanofPDF.com</a></p><h1 style="padding-top: 2pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a name="bookmark67">&zwnj;</a>Chapter 33<a name="bookmark68">&zwnj;</a></h1><p style="padding-top: 21pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Stepping through the portal, Robert was immediately surrounded by his family, all buzzing with anticipation. His dad, Thomas, was the first to break the silence. &quot;Welcome back, son! You were gone for a good six hours. How&#39;d everything go?&quot; Robert gave his father a quick nod, then turned to Sara, pulling her into a warm hug. &quot;It was a success,&quot; he said, a smile spreading across his face. &quot;A really good run, actually. I jumped up two levels, and got a bunch of other stuff.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">He then launched into a detailed retelling of his adventure, painting a picture of the vast desert and the massive, intimidating fort. He even</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">showed them pictures of the bizarre, dangerous creatures he&#39;d faced. When he finally revealed the sheer number of scrolls he&#39;d managed to collect, the room went silent with stunned amazement. With a flourish, he counted out sixty gold coins and handed them to his surprised brother, settling his debt for the twenty stones.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The family then gathered around, eagerly examining the new spellbooks, impressed by the sheer variety of magic they contained. &quot;So, these tiers,&quot; Thomas began, scratching his chin, &quot;How do they actually work? What&#39;s the real difference between them?&quot; Robert paused, considering the question carefully. He had a brief, silent conversation with Hal, clarifying some of</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">the finer points, before responding. He needed to make sure to use an easy- to-understand analogy when taking about how the system worked. &quot;Okay, so the system has a total of ten tiers and they&#39;re, let&#39;s say, a measurement of power,&quot; he explained carefully</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><ol id="l4"><li data-list-text="1)"><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 16pt;text-indent: -16pt;text-align: left;">Minor Effect: A subtle influence on a single individual or object.</p></li><li data-list-text="2)"><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Localized Effect: A significant impact on a small area or group of people or objects.</p></li><li data-list-text="3)"><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Limited Widespread Effect: A substantial influence on a larger group within a confined area, typically up to 30 meters in radius.</p></li><li data-list-text="4)"><p style="padding-left: 16pt;text-indent: -15pt;text-align: left;">Widespread Effect: A significant impact on a village-sized area.</p></li><li data-list-text="5)"><p style="padding-left: 16pt;text-indent: -16pt;text-align: left;">Large-Scale Effect: A dramatic influence on a city-sized area.</p></li></ol><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><ol id="l5"><li data-list-text="6)"><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Extensive large-scale effect: A powerful impact on a region spanning 25 to 30 square miles, encompassing a city and its surrounding area.</p></li><li data-list-text="7)"><p style="padding-left: 16pt;text-indent: -16pt;text-align: left;">Regional Effect: A major influence on a small country-sized region.</p></li><li data-list-text="8)"><p style="padding-left: 16pt;text-indent: -16pt;text-align: left;">Continental Effect: A massive impact on a continent-sized area.</p></li><li data-list-text="9)"><p style="padding-left: 16pt;text-indent: -16pt;text-align: left;">Hemispheric Effect: A profound influence on a hemisphere of a planet.</p></li><li data-list-text="10)"><p style="padding-left: 23pt;text-indent: -23pt;text-align: left;">Planetary Effect: A global impact on the entire planet.</p></li></ol><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 13pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;So, yeah, that&#39;s the basic idea of how powerful each tier is. But what you can <i>actually do </i>at each tier? That&#39;s... a bit trickier to explain,&quot; Robert said, running a hand through his hair. &quot;Like, Tier 1 spells are usually pretty small stuff  healing a little cut, lifting something light with your mind, that sort of thing. By the time you get to Tier 5, though, you&#39;re summoning some seriously strong creatures or even messing with the weather. And then, way up at Tier 9? We&#39;re talking about spells that could literally reshape mountains, change the weather for a whole continent, or even, Hal told me, crack open a planet&#39;s core. Tier 10 is just... insane. Think creating <i>new </i>planets, creating life from scratch, or even changing a planet&#39;s orbit. Hal keeps saying Tier 10 is basically god-level power.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;So, you&#39;re saying you can now cast Tier 4 spells, right?&quot; Thomas asked, his brow furrowed. Robert nodded. &quot;Yeah, that&#39;s right. I learned one called &#39;Fiery Tempest&#39;  it&#39;s a battlefield spell, and honestly, it&#39;s kind of terrifying to think that it&#39;s considered <i>weak </i>compared to what some things out there can do. Magic is... well, it&#39;s a double-edged sword,&quot; Robert continued, choosing his words carefully. &quot;I mean, I have this Tier 3 fire spell,</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&#39;Incinerate,&#39; that could turn a person to ash in, like, <i>seconds</i>. But then I also have a Tier 3 water spell, &#39;Water Purification,&#39; that can clean up an entire swimming pool&#39;s worth of water. Or &#39;Wind Shear,&#39; a Tier 3 air spell, that could literally rip a plane out of the sky. And then there&#39;s &#39;Stone Shape,&#39; which is also Tier 3, but it just lets me mold rock and build little things.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Thomas&#39;s expression was grave. &quot;That sounds like an incredible amount of power to have, son. Are you absolutely <i>sure </i>you&#39;re ready for that kind of responsibility?&quot; Robert took a deep breath, considering the question. &quot;Dad, I think I am. I&#39;m not looking to be some kind of ruler or conqueror. I just want to get stronger, learn more, and when I come back, I want to help protect the planet during the, uh, &#39;transition,&#39; as Hal calls it. I don&#39;t want to</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">be in charge. Magic is, to me, I don&#39;t know. An amazing form of art! And I can&#39;t wait to see what else I can do with it.&quot; Thomas looked at him intently. &quot;Son, you might not have a choice. When you get back, you&#39;ll probably be the strongest person on Earth. I think things are going to get bad, and you&#39;ll have to protect people, even from their own bad choices. I know you&#39;ll do</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">the right thing. I raised you. Just... be strong.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Well, I&#39;ve got a few hundred years before I have to worry about any of <i>that</i>,&quot; Robert said with a slightly forced chuckle, trying to lighten the mood. &quot;Right now, my plan is to learn those three spells from the scrolls and</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">memorize as many spells as I can from the new books. I&#39;ll probably never learn <i>all </i>the Tier 1 spells in that giant master book, but I can definitely learn all the spells in the smaller ones. And I need to finish those fifteen healing rods. With my higher level, I can make four a day now, so I should have at least ten done before my next run. Plus, vacation&#39;s almost over, and I need to get the kids back home soon before school starts up again.&quot; He needed to focus.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Over the next two days, Robert dedicated himself to the task. He meticulously worked through the new spells, committing them to his System Spellbook, vastly expanding his magical arsenal. He also returned to crafting the enhanced healing rods, his increased efficiency allowing him to complete eleven of them by the time his next scheduled run arrived, a testament to his growing power and dedication. He felt he was making good progress.</p><h3 style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Welcome, adventurer. You have entered Dungeon <i>7883667HG8776DE985762763FF7-1</i>, currently known as The Training Dungeon. You are now on the Thirteenth Floor.</h3><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">There was nothing new in the shop so he sold his 11 rods for 88 gold and moved on. This floor was another cave system with Giant spiders, which was not Robert&#39;s favorite. The only good thing is that the spiders really did not like fire and Robert found this run to be fairly easy. He did get a new level out of the run and a lot of spider silk. The final battle turned out to be easy when a misplaced fire spell ignited the entire cave of webs and burned most of the spiders alive. The Queen spider took nearly half her health in</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">damage from that and Robert was able to quickly finish her off.</p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;left:0.4pt;min-height:234.8pt;top:0.4pt;width:287.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Dungeon run complete: Rare chest awarded.</p><p class="s6" style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Chest contains:</p><p class="s9" style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Tier 4 Waterstone Five gold coins</p><p class="s9" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">One unlocked skill tokens Two Rare Shop Tokens</p><p class="s6" style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Items added to user inventory.</p><p class="s6" style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Thank you for visiting The Training Dungeon!</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Looking at the Waterstone, he compared it to the firestone he had already received.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;min-height:243.0pt;width:287.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 17pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="s8">: Firestone</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Tier<span class="s8">: 4</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Rank<span class="s8">: Rare</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="s8">: The Firestone was a rough, jagged crystal, its surface a fiery crimson, almost glowing with inner heat. It was shaped like a teardrop, but its edges were sharp and dangerous. When held, it radiated warmth, almost as if it were a miniature sun. The stone pulsed with a fiery energy, its light flickering and dancing. It felt heavy in the hand, a</span></p><p class="s8" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">tangible weight of raw power. These stones are used to enchant and create permanent fire- based effects.</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="p">: Waterstone </span>Tier<span class="p">: 4</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Rank<span class="p">: Rare</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="p">: The Waterstone was a smooth,</span></h3><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 17pt;text-align: left;">oval-shaped gem, its surface shimmering like</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">the ocean&#39;s depths. It was a deep, oceanic blue, with swirls of darker indigo and lighter</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">turquoise dancing within its depths. When held to the light, it seemed to pulse with an inner light, casting a soft, calming glow. The stone felt cool to the touch, almost icy, and had a soothing weight to it. It hummed with a quiet</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">energy, a constant whisper of the sea. These stones are used to enchant and create permanent water-based effects.</p><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 13pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Okay, then. Something for enchanting,&quot; Robert mused. Gathering his belongings, he stepped through the portal. Back at his parents&#39; home, he recounted his adventure, eliciting laughter with the tale of the fiery mishap. The rest of the day was spent simply enjoying their company. The following day, they packed up and returned home. With Elara&#39;s 15th birthday just two days away, preparations were underway. Robert was curious to witness</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">someone fully unlocking the System.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a href="https://oceanofpdf.com/">OceanofPDF.com</a></p><h1 style="padding-top: 2pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a name="bookmark69">&zwnj;</a>Chapter 34<a name="bookmark70">&zwnj;</a></h1><p style="padding-top: 21pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Life after Robert&#39;s return settled into a comfortable, predictable rhythm, a welcome respite from the dangers of the dungeon; his days were structured around a balanced routine of continued magical studies, focusing intently on honing his spellcasting techniques and refining his crafting abilities, aiming to produce a manageable five enchanted items per dungeon run, a more modest and sustainable goal that allowed for precious moments of</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">leisure and family time, something he deeply cherished.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">This peaceful interlude, however, was delightfully disrupted by Elara&#39;s birthday, a day of joyous celebration that culminated in an unexpected and extraordinary revelation: &quot;Robert, you won&#39;t believe this! Something absolutely incredible has happened!&quot; Elara exclaimed, rushing to him, her voice brimming with excitement, her eyes sparkling with a mixture of</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">disbelief and elation, &quot;The System just notified me  I&#39;ve earned <i>two </i>feats and a title! That&#39;s... that&#39;s not normal, is it?&quot; She thrust her System-granted device towards him, her finger pointing emphatically at the newly acquired accolades displayed on the screen, a clear testament to a truly unusual and momentous occasion.</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="s8">: Granted to a user who, before fully unlocking the system, travels to another universe and becomes the first child to unlock it there.</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Reward<span class="s8">: +5% XP, +1 Tier to class and profession options.</span></p></div><p style="padding-left:
