pioneer shaping the future. </span>Reward<span class="s8">: +5% XP, +5 free stat points, +2 unlocked skill points.</span></p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;That&#39;s truly extraordinary, Elara,&quot; Robert replied, his voice a blend of</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">genuine awe and quiet pride, a warm smile spreading across his face as he examined the unexpected achievements status page; &quot;so, let&#39;s discuss your next steps, a strategic plan, so to speak. If you were still living with your family, following their guidance, what would their advice be, what would the traditional &#39;game plan&#39; be in this situation?&quot; He posed the question gently, knowing it might touch upon a sensitive area.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Elara&#39;s bright expression dimmed, a shadow of sadness crossing her features, and she lamented, her voice thick with regret and a hint of longing, &quot;Momma always used to say, &#39;Skills are the foundation upon which everything is built; levels are merely the fruit that blossoms from that strong foundation.&#39; I was supposed to be focusing on diligently building up my</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">core skills, not just chasing after levels and immediate power.&quot; Robert listened intently, his heart aching for her loss and the evident conflict within her, before softly urging, &quot;Show me your current skill page, Elara. Let&#39;s see what we&#39;re working with, what foundation you&#39;ve already built.&quot; With a heavy sigh, a mixture of resignation and a glimmer of hope, Elara opened</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">her System interface, displaying her current skill progression for Robert&#39;s assessment.</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: class="s8" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Magical ability to</p><p class="s8" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">manipulate and control light.</p></td></tr></table><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Alright, Elara, let&#39;s tackle this systematically,&quot; Robert said, gently tapping the device displaying her skill list. &quot;First up: these foundational skills. We need to get them leveled up. Your magical abilities will naturally improve with practice and as you gain more experience, but these others... well, a good fishing trip might be just what we need for some practical training.&quot; He winked, trying to lighten the mood. &quot;Now, about your System-specific skills. What&#39;s the current level of your inventory skill?&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Elara shifted uncomfortably, a blush creeping up her cheeks. &quot;It&#39;s... it&#39;s still at level one, I&#39;m afraid,&quot; she admitted quietly. &quot;The System says I can&#39;t</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">upgrade it until I&#39;ve fully unlocked all the basic System functions.&quot; Robert chuckled softly, offering her a reassuring smile. &quot;Don&#39;t worry about it, Elara. That&#39;s one of the easiest skills to improve. It&#39;s all about repetition.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Just keep actively using it  storing items, retrieving them, organizing your inventory. You&#39;ll level it up in no time. Actually,&quot; he added, a thoughtful expression on his face, &quot;I&#39;m pretty close to leveling up my own inventory skill as well. Probably just a few more days of consistent use.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He paused, studying her skill list again. &quot;So, the big question is: do you want to concentrate on leveling up these existing skills, or should we</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">explore the possibility of acquiring new ones? I should warn you, though,&quot; he said, a wry grin spreading across his face, &quot;the System seems to have... overlooked a few skills that I feel <i>should </i>be included. Like Running, for instance. I mean, I was on the track team in high school and college! It&#39;s a pretty fundamental skill, wouldn&#39;t you say?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">It requires a certain expenditure of System energy to grant skills. The System prioritizes efficiency and may have deemed certain skills redundant based on your existing</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">physical capabilities. However, we could submit a request for a skill reassessment.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Robert rubbed his chin thoughtfully. &quot;Hmm, that&#39;s a double-edged sword, isn&#39;t it? Would I end up with a deluge of utterly useless skills, just for the sake of completeness?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The outcome is uncertain, it depends on your definition of</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&#39;useless.&#39; Consider the Running skill, for example. At higher levels, it could grant superhuman speed and endurance, allowing you to outpace virtually any creature and traverse vast distances without tiring. However, it is true that the majority of newly acquired skills would likely be Tier 1, Level 1  basic proficiencies. Some might prove beneficial, others might be of negligible value.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Oh, what the heck,&quot; Robert said with a shrug and a playful grin. &quot;Let&#39;s roll the dice. Go ahead and request the reassessment, Hal. Worst-case scenario? I end up with a ridiculously long skill list and spend a few extra minutes scrolling. I can live with that.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:33.0pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Request Skill List Review!</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 1pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:222.8pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 125pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><u>Review Underway!</u> Setting Baseline! Setting Baseline!</p><p class="s12" style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 17pt;text-align: center;">Scanning User History!</p><p class="s12" style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Extracting System-Defined Skills from User History!</p><p class="s12" style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 17pt;text-align: center;">Identifying Skills That Are Not Yet Defined!</p><p class="s12" style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Building Additional Skill List!</p><p class="s12" style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">List Built!</p><p class="s12" style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Identifying New Skills To Create Database Entries for!</p><p class="s12" style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 17pt;text-align: center;">Task complete!</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">A wave of new information, a torrent of skills and abilities, flooded Robert&#39;s mind, causing his head to throb momentarily. He blinked, trying to clear the mental fog, the sheer volume of data overwhelming. After a few minutes,</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">the mental pressure subsided, and he could focus again. He accessed his updated status sheet, his eyes scanning the lengthy list of newly acquired skills. &quot;Okay, Hal,&quot; he said, a mixture of amusement and bewilderment in his voice, &quot;I get the point. Some of these are definitely going to be useful, like Running  that&#39;s a no-brainer. But <i>Technical Writing</i>? Seriously? I&#39;m</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">not sure how documenting the intricacies of goblin sewage systems is going to help me survive in the multiverse.&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">No skill is entirely devoid of utility, Robert, while the immediate application of, say, Computer Engineering might be limited in a low-technology environment, your military training and survival skills will undoubtedly prove invaluable</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">regardless of the setting. The skill review, on balance, was a net positive.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;I can see your point,&quot; Robert conceded, scrolling through the list. &quot;Well, this is good news for you, Elara,&quot; he said, turning to his student with a smile. &quot;It looks like I&#39;ve unlocked a whole bunch of skills that I can now teach you. Things like Archery and Survival, for instance. I can show you my skill sheet, and you can pick and choose what you&#39;d like to learn.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 10pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Elara, who had been watching the exchange with a mixture of curiosity and concern, leaned forward, her eyes widening with anticipation as Robert displayed his skill sheet.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The sheer number of skills listed, each with its own level and description, was initially daunting, but her excitement quickly overcame her apprehension. She traced her finger along the glowing list, her brow furrowed in concentration as she considered her options. &quot;Archery sounds like fun,&quot; she mused, &quot;but... I think Survival skills might be more practical, given our... circumstances. We don&#39;t really know what kind of dangers we might encounter out there, do we?&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert nodded in agreement, impressed by her pragmatic approach. &quot;That&#39;s a wise choice, Elara. Survival skills are always a solid foundation. I can teach you the basics of first aid, tracking, finding and identifying edible plants, building a shelter  a whole range of things. It&#39;s a lot to cover, but it&#39;ll be incredibly valuable.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 11pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He paused, then added with a grin, &quot;However, we won&#39;t have much time for lessons <i>today</i>. It <i>is </i>your birthday, after all.&quot; Elara&#39;s eyebrows shot up in surprise, a flicker of confusion crossing her face. &quot;My... birthday?&quot; she asked, as if the concept were foreign to her. &quot;Birthdays are a pretty big deal here on Earth,&quot; Robert explained gently. &quot;And the family will definitely want to celebrate. Did you not celebrate birthdays in Aeria?&quot; &quot;Just...</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">specific ones, I guess,&quot; Elara replied, a touch of sadness, a hint of homesickness, creeping into her voice. &quot;My System day would have been one of those important celebrations.&quot; &quot;Well, worry not,&quot; Robert reassured her, his voice warm and comforting. &quot;We&#39;ll make this a birthday to</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">remember. In fact, I have a feeling Sara is planning something special. I</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">wouldn&#39;t be surprised if she shows up any minute now to whisk you away for a day of shopping and pampering.&quot; As if on cue, Sara burst into the room, her energy filling the space.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Robert! No lessons on her birthday! I know you two were discussing important System stuff, but that&#39;s enough for today. Come on, Elara,&quot; she declared, her eyes sparkling with mischievous glee, &quot;it&#39;s time to introduce you to the wonders of Earth culture: malls, food courts, and beauty salons! Prepare to be amazed!&quot; Elara tilted her head, a perplexed expression on her face. &quot;Food court? Are we paying a visit to the local governing body? I thought Stacey mentioned you didn&#39;t have a nobility system here.&quot; Robert chuckled, shaking his head at Elara&#39;s literal interpretation. &quot;No, no, a food court is just an area inside a mall  a large shopping center  with lots of</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">different restaurants and food stalls. It&#39;s kind of like a market, but exclusively for prepared food.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Elara pondered this for a moment, her brow furrowed in concentration. &quot;So, it&#39;s a market... <i>within </i>a market?&quot; she asked, still trying to wrap her head around the concept. Sara laughed, a bright, infectious sound, and gently took Elara&#39;s hand. &quot;Come on, sweetie, it&#39;s much easier to show you than to explain. Besides, Stacey&#39;s waiting impatiently in the car!&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">With that, she ushered Elara out of the room, leaving Robert alone with his thoughts. obert chuckled softly at the bewildered expression Elara had worn as Sara dragged her away, and at the pure, unadulterated joy on his wife&#39;s</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">face at having a new person to introduce to Earth culture. He shook his head, a smile playing on his lips, and turned his attention back to his newly expanded skill list. &quot;Well,&quot; he murmured to himself, &quot;looks like I have some skills to work on as well, some new avenues to explore.&quot; He also noticed his new title displayed prominently on his status sheet:</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Title<span class="p">: </span><i>Skilled Trailblazer</i></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="p">: Awarded to those who pioneer new paths in the realm of skills. This title recognizes individuals who have successfully introduced novel abilities to the System, expanding the boundaries of what is possible.</span></h3><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Their innovative spirit and mastery of their craft have earned them this prestigious honor. <b>Reward</b>: +5% Experience gain towards skills,</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">+2 Unallocated Skill Points.</p><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 13pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert chuckled again, a hint of self-deprecating humor in his voice. It was rather ironic, he thought, that he had earned a &quot;Trailblazer&quot; title for introducing <i>Ruby programming</i>, of all things, to the System. It seemed that no one in the vast, interconnected multiverse had ever bothered with it before. &quot;Hey, Hal,&quot; he asked, &quot;should I spend these two extra skill points</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">now, or should I save them for the Constitution boost we discussed?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">While saving points for your long-term plan regarding Constitution is advisable, I would recommend allocating one point to Charisma and the remaining points to Strength.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Your frequent use of the sword makes Strength a valuable asset, and a slight increase in Charisma could prove</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">beneficial in future interactions.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">&quot;Makes sense,&quot; Robert agreed. &quot;Alright, let&#39;s do it. One point to Charisma, bringing it to 15, and five points to Strength. I&#39;ll keep the rest in reserve for now.&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Sounds reasonable.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert spent the next few hours engrossed in his spellbooks, diligently committing several new spells to his System Spellbook, expanding his magical repertoire. When the girls finally returned, their arms laden with shopping bags, Robert couldn&#39;t help but smile. Elara&#39;s hair had been expertly styled, her nails were freshly manicured, and a radiant, almost overwhelming, smile illuminated her face. It was evident that she had thoroughly enjoyed her introduction to Earth&#39;s consumer culture.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Later that evening, they celebrated with a birthday cake, the flickering candles casting a warm glow on their faces, and sang the traditional &quot;Happy Birthday&quot; song, a custom that Elara found both strange and endearing. She received gifts from Robert and Sara, carefully chosen items meant to ease</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">her transition into this new world, as well as presents from the rest of the</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">family that Robert had brought back from his dungeon runs, small tokens of affection and acceptance.</p><p style="padding-top: 10pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">She might not have fully understood the nuances of the Earth tradition, but her gratitude was palpable, her eyes shining with genuine emotion. As they spent the remainder of the evening together, sharing stories and laughter, it became clear that the birthday celebration had served as another thread, weaving them closer together, strengthening the bonds of their newly formed, unconventional family.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">As the day came to a close, Robert took the time to look over his current status page.</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><table style="border-collapse:collapse;margin-left:6.625pt" cellspacing="0"><tr center;"><a href="https://oceanofpdf.com/">OceanofPDF.com</a></p><h1 style="padding-top: 2pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a name="bookmark71">&zwnj;</a>Chapter 35<a name="bookmark72">&zwnj;</a></h1><p style="padding-top: 21pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The following morning, Robert settled into his office chair. Turning to Hal, he inquired, &#39;You mentioned that I might benefit from a skill to conceal my status. Could you elaborate on how to acquire such a skill and what specific skills would be necessary?&#39;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">You&#39;ll need the System Skill Status Protection, It&#39;s a popular choice among the nobility, and while it may raise a few eyebrows, it won&#39;t cause a major scandal. Once you&#39;ve obtained that, you can unlock subskills that allow you to hide your skills, feats, traits, abilities, base status screen, inventory, and more. There&#39;s even a subskill to falsify the information displayed.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;So, with my four points, I could take the base skill and the hide base stats, skills, and abilities for now?&quot; Robert asked, confirming his understanding.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Precisely, that will effectively conceal your class, profession, skills, and abilities. Remember, though, due to your perks,</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">you&#39;ll start with a high level in these skills. In most worlds, outside of major cities, you won&#39;t encounter anyone capable of penetrating your defenses. However, larger cities often have a few individuals with a Tier 5 Identify skill, and occasionally, you might find someone working for a high- ranking royal family with a Tier 6 Identify skill. But let&#39;s not worry about royal court intrigue just yet.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;So, should I focus on leveling up those skills?&quot; Robert asked.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Unfortunately, that&#39;s not feasible here, to level them up, you&#39;d need to defend against high-level attempts to penetrate your skills, and you currently lack the necessary training partners. Your best option is to invest points to directly level them. While I generally advise against wasting points on skill levels, in this case, it&#39;s necessary to conceal</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">your class and profession. Aim for a mid-6 or, ideally, a Tier</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">7. When you Tier up the base skill, the subskills will also advance a level. So, you&#39;ll need 10 unlocked points to reach a safe level, though 7 points should be sufficient unless you&#39;re exceptionally unlucky.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">&quot;Assuming I need all 10 points, I think I have enough remaining runs to acquire them,&quot; Robert pondered. &quot;However, if unexpected circumstances</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">arise, I could be in trouble. I also think I need the rest of those skills as well, the good news is those just need normal points, so not a waste, seeing how I should earn enough normal points just from leveling up.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert spent the rest of the day crafting more Rods for his upcoming run, just two days away. Later that afternoon, John approached him with an ambitious idea. &quot;Dad, I&#39;ve been thinking. We need to keep your spellbooks safe but also make them accessible to the family. We can&#39;t possibly copy</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">your master bookit&#39;s over 123,000 pages! But I think we can create something just as effective. If we invest in some high-quality printers and binding equipment, we can set up a small operation out back for about</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">$75,000. That includes a small building, or we could rent one for a few months.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;What exactly do you propose printing, John?&quot; Robert inquired.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;A series of books, Dad,&quot; John explained. &quot;First, we should make copies of the System Guide, a mere 50 pages, so we can distribute them to family members and the Men in Black. Next, we&#39;ll create training spellbooks, focusing on fundamental spells. These would be categorized by Magic Sphere, each containing a few essential spells: two combat, two defensive, two utility, and two healing, if applicable. These would be simple, introductory guides. Once they master those, we&#39;ll provide a second volume with eight more advanced spells in each category.</p><p style="padding-top: 10pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">These tiers would be a solid foundation for them to build upon and pursue their class. We could also provide my training guides to senior family members, who could then create master books containing a hundred or so spells in each Sphere, starting with Tier 1 and progressing to Tier 3.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert nodded in agreement. &quot;That&#39;s a sound plan. We could limit the</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">higher-tier books, perhaps offering a few copies of larger spellbooks with Tier 4 and above spells for family use. This would undoubtedly give our family a significant advantage in the future. Once I return, I can take over training and share additional knowledge. I&#39;m so impressed with your idea,</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">John. You&#39;re in charge of this project. Find the necessary equipment, I&#39;ll secure a rental property, and you can get started on the printing process. And don&#39;t forget about long-term storage. We need to preserve master copies for centuries to come.&quot; John thanked his father for his support and approval, eager to embark on this new endeavor.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Two days later, Robert was ready for his next run. The System Shop offered nothing new, so he sold six Rods for a tidy sum of gold and ventured back into the dungeon.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">This time, he faced a more challenging undead dungeon. His Light spells proved effective, but the tougher foes demanded a more strategic approach. His Fiery Tempest spell, cast before engaging the final boss, a powerful Mummy, dealt significant damage, setting the stage for a decisive victory. The best part was the chest after he looted the mummy, which earned him gold and undead dust.</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;left:0.4pt;min-height:217.5pt;top:0.4pt;width:287.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 187%;text-align: left;">Dungeon run complete: Epic chest awarded. Chest contains:</p><p class="s9" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Tier 5 Mace &#39;The Necromancer&#39;s Bane&#39; Ten gold coins</p><p class="s9" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Two unlocked skill tokens One Epic Shop Token</p><p class="s6" style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Items added to user inventory.</p><p class="s6" style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Thank you for visiting The Training Dungeon!</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 1pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:33.0pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Level Up!</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert pulled the mace out and looked over the description:</p><p style="padding-top: 14pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><h3 style="padding-left: 7pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="p">: </span><i>The Necromancer&#39;s Bane</i></h3><h3 style="padding-left: 7pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Tier<span class="p">: 5</span></h3><h3 style="padding-left: 7pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Rank<span class="p">: Epic</span></h3><h3 style="padding-left: 7pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="p">: A sleek, Mithril mace head, infused with the essence of holy light and dark shadow. The haft is wrapped in glowing, ethereal vines that hum with holy energy, radiating a faint, divine glow. Enchanted with the following:</span></h3><p class="s5" style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 37pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Undead Bane: <span class="p">Deals massive bonus damage to undead creatures.</span></p><p class="s5" style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 37pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Holy Smite: <span class="p">A powerful holy strike that can dispel undead magic and weaken their defenses.</span></p><p class="s5" style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 37pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The Reaper&#39;s Kiss<span class="p">: Upon a critical hit against an undead creature, the mace channels the power of divine light, dealing devastating damage and purifying the target&#39;s corrupted soul. This ability can also dispel powerful undead enchantments and curses.</span></p><p class="s5" style="padding-left: 37pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Self Repair: <span class="p">The mace slowly repairs itself over time, drawing energy from ambient mana. This process is accelerated after defeating powerful undead foes.</span></p><p style="padding-top: 14pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert examined the mace, its divine glow captivating his attention. He couldn&#39;t help but wonder, &quot;Hal, is this the kind of weapon that would spark wars between kingdoms?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">While it&#39;s a powerful weapon, its effectiveness is limited to undead foes. It&#39;s more likely to interest a holy order or a group of adventurers seeking a powerful artifact. You could probably sell it for a few hundred gold, but it won&#39;t ignite a global conflict.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert chuckled. &quot;Even so, it&#39;s tempting to keep it, despite my lack of skill with maces.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert returned home and continued his daily routine for the next few days. John quickly found a suitable building downtown, and Robert negotiated a 90-day lease with the landlord, offering a premium rate for the short-term rental. The equipment arrived sooner than expected, allowing them to begin the printing process within two weeks. To fund the printing operation, Robert sold another 60 gold coins. While he was concerned about drawing attention to his frequent sales, so far, he had managed to avoid suspicion.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">With the remaining coins, he purchased new gemstones and continued preparing rods for sale.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">In a parallel effort, John and Robert jointly undertook the selection of spells for the inaugural training volume. Robert, having nearly attained level 30</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">after the successful completion of four additional dungeon expeditions, had secured the Tier 2 Master Spellbook. His most recent trial, Floor 15, had presented a formidable challenge in the form of numerous aerial adversaries.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Nevertheless, through the skillful application of his bow and spells, Robert had navigated this level successfully, procuring a valuable reward: a skill book on the discipline of Jewelcrafting. During this two-week period, Robert had accumulated five Unlocked Skill Tokens and two Normal Skill Tokens. These were utilized to unlock the remaining Status Protection skills, including the strategically significant Falsify Status skill. The three remaining Unlocked Skill Tokens were reserved for future use. With the installation of the printing equipment complete, they were now prepared to initiate the large-scale production of training materials.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">After careful deliberation, John and Robert finalized the spell selections for both the training volumes and the master books. While John&#39;s preference leaned towards combat spells, Robert advocated for a balanced approach, prioritizing defense, healing, and utility spells. The final master books, encompassing all spheres, included 40 combat spells, 70 defensive spells, 100 utility spells, and 55 healing spells. These 265 spells, spanning Tiers 1 to 4, would become the family&#39;s secret weapon, filling 540 pages. They planned to print these last, allowing for potential additions of Tier 5 spells and further expansion of Tier 4 options.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The duo spent the next two days meticulously designing and preparing the first series of training books. Just as they were about to begin printing, an anticipated visitor arrived at their door.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a href="https://oceanofpdf.com/">OceanofPDF.com</a></p><h1 style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a name="bookmark73">&zwnj;</a>Chapter 36<a name="bookmark74">&zwnj;</a></h1><p style="padding-top: 21pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Afternoon, gentlemen,&quot; Robert greeted the two men at his door. &quot;Can I help you?&quot; The older man, Detective Noah Ramirez, consulted a folder.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;We&#39;re looking for Robert Williams. I assume that&#39;s you?&quot; Robert chuckled. &quot;That&#39;s me. Never judge a book by its driver&#39;s license photo.&quot; &quot;Right,&quot;</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Ramirez replied, a slight smile playing on his lips. &quot;We&#39;re Detectives</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Ramirez and Foxworth with the Sheriff&#39;s Office. We&#39;d like to ask you a few questions.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert paused, a flicker of concern crossing his face. &quot;Sure, but I&#39;m going to need to see some ID first.&quot; Ramirez and Foxworth complied, displaying their badges. &quot;No problem. This isn&#39;t a criminal investigation, just a routine inquiry. We&#39;re looking into some recent gold sales at local pawn shops.&quot; Robert leaned against the doorframe, a relaxed expression returning. &quot;So, I can&#39;t sell my own stuff anymore?&quot; &quot;It&#39;s not about that,&quot; Ramirez assured him. &quot;Pawn shops report all significant transactions to the state. We&#39;re just following up on a large number of sales involving high-purity gold.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Well, I can understand why that might raise some eyebrows,&quot; Robert said. &quot;But these coins have been in my family for generations. I&#39;m selling them to pay for my kids&#39; college funds.&quot; &quot;We understand,&quot; Ramirez said. &quot;But we need to verify the legal provenance of these items. They&#39;re unusually pure, and we&#39;re trying to determine their origin.&quot; Robert sighed. &quot;I wish I could tell you more. Family history isn&#39;t always crystal clear. These coins have been passed down for eight generations. We don&#39;t have any documentation that old.&quot; Ramirez nodded, understanding the limitations of such ancient history. &quot;We appreciate your cooperation, Mr. Williams. We&#39;ll be in touch if we need any further information.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">As the detectives turned to leave, Robert&#39;s expression hardened. &quot;One more thing,&quot; he called out. &quot;If you plan on seizing my property without due process, you better be prepared for the consequences.&quot; With a firm shut of the door, Robert was alone again, a sense of unease settling over him.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Walking back into the house, Robert encountered Sara. &quot;Who was that?&quot; she inquired, her brow furrowed. &quot;The police,&quot; Robert replied, his voice heavy. &quot;Seems there are some questions about the recent gold sales.&quot; Sara nodded, understanding the gravity of the situation. &quot;Well, we anticipated</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">that,&quot; she said calmly. &quot;We still have some money left, so we could hold off on selling more.&quot; Robert considered her suggestion. &quot;No,&quot; he decided firmly. &quot;I&#39;m going to travel upstate and make one large sale to secure our financial future until we relocate with the healing items. The police can</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">speculate all they want, but they can&#39;t prove the origin of the coins, and we don&#39;t have time to waste. Once the financial records are complete and secure, we&#39;ll inform the federal authorities, who will protect us from local interference.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">With a clear plan in mind, Robert spent the next few hours researching potential buyers for a large quantity of gold. His research led him to a reputable bulk bullion buyer in South Florida, known for handling</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">significant gold transactions. Planning to sell 200 gold coins, he contacted the shop and discussed the details. They were eager to purchase the gold in bulk at a fair price, and he scheduled an appointment for two days later.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">With the sale arranged, Robert turned his attention to the next challenge: contacting the government. He struggled to find a straightforward way to reach out to the appropriate authorities.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Knowing his best course of action involved a healing demonstration, Robert turned to his sister for guidance. &quot;Where could I discreetly test one of my healing items?&quot; he asked. Emily paused for a moment before responding,</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;How public do you want to be? I&#39;d suggest an active military hospital. They can enforce confidentiality, but do you want to make a big show of it or keep a low profile? Also, where would you do the most good?&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Robert answered honestly, &quot;If we&#39;re going to expose ourselves, it should be to maximize the impact. A military hospital is a good idea, but access might be limited. Walter Reed would be ideal, but it seems heavily restricted.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Brooke Army Medical Center could be an option, but the patients there are mostly stable. Reed is still the best choice, but I&#39;m not sure how to gain access to the right areas.&quot; Emily chuckled. &quot;Sounds like you have a plan,&quot; she teased. &quot;Sorry, I can&#39;t help you get in, but it&#39;ll be fun to watch you try.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert spent a few more minutes discussing the situation with his sister</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">before hanging up. He returned to his new Tier 2 master spellbook, hoping to discover more potent healing spells. Unfortunately, most of the spells seemed to be targeted or offered little improvement over his current Tier 3 spell.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The following two days were a whirlwind of activity. Robert crafted rods, worked with John to finalize the first series of books, and prepared for his trip to South Florida. His plan was to sell 200 gold coins, which should net the family nearly $400,000. This substantial sum would provide ample financial security until they could establish a reliable income stream.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Early the next morning, Robert set off for the gold shop. He spent most of</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">the day waiting for the coins to be appraised. The shop manager questioned him twice about selling such unique coins, but Robert assured him that he had considered the implications. He jokingly wondered how long it would take before the IRS or the police inquired about the coins&#39; origin. The</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">manager laughed, assuring him that as a legitimate business, he only reported to the IRS and wasn&#39;t concerned with the provenance of the gold. This eased Robert&#39;s mind, as he knew he had some time before the detectives returned for further questioning.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Near the end of the day, Robert completed the sale and walked out with a check for $386,750. He took the check and the bill of sale to his bank to deposit the funds. The teller asked a few routine questions, but upon seeing the bill of sale, she recognized the gold shop as a frequent customer and acknowledged the large checks they often deposited. After verifying the check with the company, she accepted the deposit and thanked Robert for his long-standing relationship with the bank.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Returning home, Robert let Sara know how things went and spent the rest of the evening just hanging with his family, knowing the next day would be a dungeon run.</p><h3 style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Welcome, adventurer. You have entered Dungeon <i>7883667HG8776DE985762763FF7-1</i>, currently known as The Training Dungeon. You are now on the Nineteenth Floor.</h3><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">As usual, he checked the shop for something new:</p><p style="padding-top: left;">His disdain for the System grew with each passing day. After selling ten rods for a modest eighty-six gold, he reviewed his finances. With eight hundred thirty-eight gold coins remaining, he splurged on all the gold- priced books and an epic scroll pack, using four of his rare shop tokens. Still, he had three hundred thirteen gold coins left. He asked Hal to remind him to consult Elara about the cost of various items upon his return home.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Looking over the 5 new scrolls he was excited and scared at the same time:</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;min-height:174.8pt;width:287.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="s8">: Scroll of Illusionary Realm</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Tier<span class="s8">: 5 Epic</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Sphere(s)<span class="s8">: Illusion, Mind</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="s8">: The caster creates a completely convincing illusionary realm, capable of trapping and deceiving even the most powerful beings. This spell requires a deep understanding of the mind and the nature of reality.</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Charges<span class="s8">: 1</span></p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;min-height:174.0pt;width:287.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 17pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="s8">: Scroll of Soul Mend</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Tier<span class="s8">: 5, Epic</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Sphere(s)<span class="s8">: Healing, Soul</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="s8">: A potent healing spell that can</span></p><p class="s8" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">repair severe physical and spiritual wounds. It can restore lost limbs, heal mortal wounds, and even mend damaged souls. However, it drains the target&#39;s life force, making it a dangerous spell to overuse.</p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Charges<span class="s8">: 1</span></p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="p">: Scroll of Elemental Storm</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Tier<span class="p">: 5, Legendary</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Sphere(s)<span class="p">: Fire, Water, Earth, Air </span>Description<span class="p">: The caster summons a devastating storm of the four classical elements. This spell can create towering waves</span></h3><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">of fire, earthquakes, hurricanes, and torrential downpours, capable of leveling entire towns. It requires immense control over elemental</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">energies.</p><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Charges<span class="p">: 1</span></h3><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;min-height:174.0pt;width:287.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="s8">: Scroll of Accelerated Healing</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Tier<span class="s8">: 5, Rare</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Sphere(s)<span class="s8">: Healing, Time</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="s8">: This spell significantly speeds up the natural healing process. It can heal severe wounds in a matter of minutes, and even</span></p><p class="s8" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">reverse aging effects. However, it requires a significant amount of energy and can leave the caster and target feeling drained.</p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Charges<span class="s8">: 1</span></p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;min-height:192.0pt;width:287.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="s8">: Scroll of Death&#39;s Embrace</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Tier<span class="s8">: 5 Legendary</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Sphere(s)<span class="s8">: Death, Soul</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="s8">: This spell allows the caster to siphon life force from a target, draining their vitality and transferring it to themselves or</span></p><p class="s8" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">another creature. It can be used to heal allies, weaken enemies, or even kill outright.</p><p class="s8" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">However, it requires a deep understanding of life and death, and overuse can lead to dire consequences. <b>Charges</b>: 1</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He knew right away he would be taking mind and soul as skills. Death he wasn&#39;t sure about, &quot;Hal is Death magic evil?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">There is no evil magic, there are only evil casters. The Sphere of Death contains spells to kill, but also spells to heal, everything depends on the caster. Now I will warn you about that spell, it drains the soul, which if you are wondering is a real thing, and uses that soul fragment to</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">heal, sometimes the spell doesn&#39;t fully clean the fragment and it&#39;s possible that part of the target&#39;s soul might bond with whoever you are healing.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;So that is a no then, I&#39;ve got enough healing spells that I don&#39;t need one that might change people&#39;s souls. That&#39;s getting sold.&quot; With his decision made, he returned to the shop and sold the Death Scroll for 400 gold, it seems Legendary spells were expensive.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Moving into the dungeon itself this was another forest level and included a lot of large cats, Robert summoned his Celestial being which as luck had it was a large cat:</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;min-height:226.5pt;width:287.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="s8">: Starlit Panther</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Class<span class="s8">: N/A</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Race<span class="s8">: Cosmic Guardian</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="s8">: A majestic, ethereal panther, its fur shimmering with starlight. It roams the cosmos, a guardian of balance and harmony. </span>Gender<span class="s8">: Male</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Stats<span class="s8">: Str 28, Dex 39, Con 29, Int 13, Wis 14,</span></p><p class="s8" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Cha 25</p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Level<span class="s8">: 27</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Resistances<span class="s8">: Death(50%)</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Health<span class="s8">: 2590</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Mana<span class="s8">: 3700</span></p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">This silent Guardian owned the forest and nothing was able to stand in his way, even the final fight was easy. Robert was kind of disappointed and didn&#39;t feel like he earned his level up from this run.</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Dungeon run complete: Rare chest awarded.</h3><h3 style="padding-top: 14pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Chest contains:</h3><p class="s5" style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">One skill book (Painting) Five gold coins</p><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p class="s5" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">One unlocked skill tokens Two Rare Shop Tokens</p><h3 style="padding-top: 14pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Items added to user inventory.</h3><h3 style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Thank you for visiting The Training Dungeon!</h3><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 13pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Even the chest at the end seemed to make fun of how easy it was. After looting everything Robert returned home.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a href="https://oceanofpdf.com/">OceanofPDF.com</a></p><h1 style="padding-top: 2pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a name="bookmark75">&zwnj;</a>Chapter 37<a name="bookmark76">&zwnj;</a></h1><p style="padding-top: 21pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">The next morning, Hal was reviewing the first draft of Johns Starter Book when Robert interrupted. Hal, remind me again: when do I get my second class?</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Level 100, and before you ask, the chances of reaching that before you leave are slim.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">What about my second profession? Robert asked.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Level 150, and thats definitely out of reach, which is a good thing.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Robert raised an eyebrow. Whys that?</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">You already have a powerful mage class and a solid support class. You need a strong fighting class to balance them out. Right now, you havent earned one. <b>Wandering Ranger of the Silent Way </b>would have been perfect, but you passed on it, so its gone forever.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Thats a bummer, Robert admitted.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The problem is, youd only be offered a mediocre class now. You need more skills, feats, traitseverything. Youve focused on being a mage, so the System has tailored your dungeon runs to that. You need a good trainer and skill books to boost your fighting abilities, but you wont find those here.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">So, I want to be as powerful as possible before I leave, but I need room for a higher-tier second class, Robert mused.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">That is correct.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Speaking of builds, what should I do with these skill books? I still think Painting was a joke reward, but should I take Jewelcrafting? It might help with a second profession. And I think Cartography is a must, regardless, Robert asked.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Learn them all. Painting might seem like a joke, but the System doesnt joke. It could unlock unexpected options later.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">If you say so. Robert pulled out the books and started using them.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid unlocked!</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 1pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Hal, did you know that would happen? Robert asked, surprised.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Yes. Thats why I suggested using the book. A higher Survival skill will help you earn a better second class.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Thanks for looking out for me, Hal, Robert said with a smile.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">I&#39;m here to support you. I can&#39;t share everything, I&#39;m not allowed, but I&#39;ll do my best to guide and advise you.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">I appreciate it, Robert replied.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Robert spent the next two days doing the same, though he did approve John&#39;s first book so he spent a few hours helping him start the printing process.
