Or wait</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Id buy the Armor Proficiency now and wait on the rest. You can use that immediately, since youre wearing armor.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">But I havent had any problems with my armor, Robert protested.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">You have, you just havent noticed because your skills are compensating. Your casting ability has taken a hit, you just dont realize it.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Alright, I trust you. Ill buy the book and the spellbooks with gold. Hopefully, I can buy everything except the Master Book in six more runs, unless the System throws a curveball.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">No, it wont add better items until you buy the current ones.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">So, I might be missing out on better stuff? The System loves to stress me out, Robert grumbled as he bought the items and sold his healing rods.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">After acquiring the skill book, he opened it and began learning the skill.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:33.0pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 43pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">General Skill Armor Proficiency Unlocked!</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He glanced at the two spell books, eyeing spells like Blink, Spatial Distortion, and Spatial Blast. These would be game-changers in combat. His Nature book offered promising spells like Thorn Whip and Natures Mending, but he wanted to start completing the run first.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Exiting the entry room the first thing Robert noticed was the smell, &quot;Is that Surfur?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Based upon the input I&#39;m getting from your senses, I&#39;d say yes.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Great, I can already tell this is going to suck,&quot; Robert replied. Continuing on in the first room, he found pools of lava and his first target:</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;min-height:209.2pt;width:287.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="s8">: Fire Imp </span>Class<span class="s8">: Infernal Imp </span>Race<span class="s8">: Fiend</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="s8">: A powerful, demonic imp, a master of fire and chaos.</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Gender<span class="s8">: Male</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Stats<span class="s8">: Str 18, Dex 20, Con 15, Int 15, Wis 8,</span></p><p class="s8" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Cha 12</p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Level<span class="s8">: 20</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Resistances<span class="s8">: Fire(auto)</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Health<span class="s8">: 800</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Mana<span class="s8">: 600</span></p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Hal, please do not tell me this is a demon run,&quot; Robert sighed</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">I promise not to tell you.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Hal, did you just make a funny,&quot; Robert said with a smile. Not waiting for a replied he cast his light bolt spell to see if it did bonus damage, which it did. Dodging the imps fire bolts he began a short dance to the death and defeated the Imp. Looting the imp, he found 2 gold, and a handful of infernal ash before he continued on.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The next room contained 3 Imps which proved to be a challenge, Robert took over 600 points of damage during the fight and had to recast his shield spells twice, that being said he did win in the end. After looking at the Imps and healing himself he sat for a bit and recovered his Mana, while he tried to think of something new. Pulling out his Tier 4 Water spellbook, he looked through and found two spells that he knew he would need, so he started the process of learning the spells.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:33.0pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Spell moved to System Spellbook: Ice Storm!</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 1pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:33.0pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Spell moved to System Spellbook: Ice Spike!</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">After that was complete he continued on and in the next room, he saw something different:</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;min-height:209.2pt;width:287.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="s8">: Inferno Hound </span>Class<span class="s8">: Infernal Beast </span>Race<span class="s8">: Fiend</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="s8">: A ferocious, demonic hound, a creature of fire and shadow.</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Gender<span class="s8">: Male</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Stats<span class="s8">: Str 25, Dex 20, Con 22, Int 8, Wis 6,</span></p><p class="s8" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Cha 8</p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Level<span class="s8">: 20</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Resistances<span class="s8">: Fire(75%), Darkness(75%)</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Health<span class="s8">: 800</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Mana<span class="s8">: 100</span></p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Seeing 1 of them and 3 Imps in the room, he stepped back and decided to bring out his summon. Once that was ready, he began the attack, having the summon target the hound while Robert focused on the Imps seemed to be</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">the best option and allowed him to end the fight without taking any damage. One of the things he noticed was the hound dropped an Inferno Pelt.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Hal, should I be really keeping these or getting rid of them? I don&#39;t currently use them for crafting?&quot; Robert asked Hal.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">You don&#39;t, but others will, and these will make good trade items. There is also the fact that you might be able to make use of them in the future, and you have the room.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert had no answer to that, so he continued on. The next room was mostly a repeat but 2 hounds this time. His summon did well, but in the end, Robert let it go and planned to resummon it. It had taken too much damage, and he wasn&#39;t sure it would survive the next battle. Which turned out to be a good idea.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Looking into the next room, Robert noticed 5 Imps floating around and one larger Imp staying behind them. Using his Identify skill, he found out why:</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;min-height:209.2pt;width:311.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="s8">: Imp Lord </span>Class<span class="s8">: Fiend Lord </span>Race<span class="s8">: Fiend</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="s8">: A cunning and powerful imp, a master of fire and illusion.</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Gender<span class="s8">: Male</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Stats<span class="s8">: Str 16, Dex 22, Con 14, Int 18, Wis 10, Cha</span></p><p class="s8" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">18</p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Level<span class="s8">: 25</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Resistances<span class="s8">: Fire(auto), Illusion(50%)</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Health<span class="s8">: 1000</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Mana<span class="s8">: 800</span></p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert knew this would be a challenging battle, but he was ready. With a deep breath, he unleashed a torrent of icy energy, casting an Ice Storm spell that blanketed the battlefield in a blizzard. The Imps, caught off guard, were knocked out of the air slipped and slid on the icy ground, their movements slowed. The Imp Lord, however, was more resilient, shaking off the effects of the spell.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert summoned his Celestial Guardian, a radiant being of light and purity. The Guardian, a beacon of hope in the midst of chaos, charged towards the Imp Lord, its body glowing with celestial energy. The Imp Lord retaliated with a blast of hellfire, but the Guardians shifted away from the attack. Meanwhile, Robert focused his attention on the Imps. He cast a</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">series of Ice Spike spells, each one a deadly icicle that pierced the creatures&#39; fiery forms. The Imps shrieked in pain, their movements becoming more erratic.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">As the battle raged, Robert&#39;s Celestial Guardian and the Imp Lord clashed, their blows echoing through the fiery realm. The Guardian&#39;s claws met the Imp Lord&#39;s trident in a clash of divine and demonic power. The Imp Lord,</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">though powerful, was no match for the celestial being. With a final, decisive strike, the Guardian severed the Imp Lord&#39;s head, sending it crashing to the ground. The Imps, sensing their leader&#39;s demise, redoubled their attacks.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">However with the Guardian now free to aid Robert the fight ended shortly after. Exhausted but victorious, he stood triumphant, proud of what he was able to do</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Looting the Imp Lord, gained him something unexpected but welcome:</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;min-height:226.5pt;width:287.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="s8">: Scroll of Fire Storm</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Tier<span class="s8">: 5, Epic</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Sphere(s)<span class="s8">: Fire, Air</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="s8">: A storm of flame and wind erupts in a chosen location, engulfing an area in a tempest of fiery destruction. The storm&#39;s swirling winds carry the flames, spreading the inferno and making it difficult to escape. Those caught within the storm are engulfed in flames, taking significant fire damage. The storm rages for a short time, leaving behind a charred and smoking landscape.</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Charges<span class="s8">: 1</span></p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Hal, I really need to get my spells to Tier 5, these spells are game changers,&quot; Robert said in shock.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Wait until you see Tier 6 or 7 spells, these are babies in comparison.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Hal that is scary, how do we go up against spellcasters?&quot; Robert asked in wonder.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">For everything there is a counter. There are nations who keep high level mage killers on standby. That being said, the main counter to a powerful mage is another powerful mage. The only thing that can stop Tier 9 or 10 spells are other Tier 9 or 10 spells. If you continue to grow, someday in the future, you will be the counter to bad mages.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Great so I&#39;ve got goals, no need to worry about this scroll now, so I&#39;ll put it away and continue,&quot; Robert replied. Moving on, he ran into two more groups of Imp Lords and followed the same plan which took care of them. It was the next room that made him pause. This room contained two Imp Lords and Eight Fire Imps.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;I know this is a challenge floor, but that&#39;s just stupid,&quot; Robert said to himself. &quot;Hal, can I summon two Guardians?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Not yet, when you Tier up in those schools you will be able to create a second one, until then you cannot.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert glanced at his skill sheet. He had enough points to push Light to Tier 5, but not Conjuration. He hesitated. Tiering up Light would be useful soon, but Conjuration was further off. He decided to save his points. A plan began to form in his mind. He would use Earth magic to create a wall, splitting the enemy group in two. A Water wall would hold the second group back, allowing him to focus on the first. If he was quick enough, he could defeat</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">the first group before the second broke free. A well-timed Binding spell might just seal the deal. Robert readied an Ice Storm. He knew he had to act fast.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">As the storm crashed down, freezing the Imps momentarily, he began to</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">weave his spells. Earth and Water rose from the ground, forming walls that divided the enemy. The Imp Lords roared in anger, but Robert was undeterred. He unleashed a barrage of spells, his Guardian fighting the Imp Lord for him. The battle raged, a whirlwind of magic and steel. With each passing moment, the tide of battle turned in Robert&#39;s favor. The Imps, once a formidable force, were now scattered and weakened. The final blow was delivered by Robert, who with a well timed Ice Spike killed the second Lord, ending the threat.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">As the dust settled, Robert stood victorious, panting heavily. The daunting challenge had pushed him to his limits, but he had emerged triumphant. A surge of satisfaction coursed through him as he surveyed the fallen Imps.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He had proven his worth. With a weary sigh, Robert began to loot the fallen creatures. He hoped for a rare scroll, a prize to commemorate his victory.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Yet, as he sifted through the spoils, he found only the usual mundane items. Disappointment flickered in his eyes, but he quickly shook it off. The true reward, he realized, was the hard-won victory itself.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:33.0pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Level Up!</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Continuing on, Robert came to what he assuming was the final challenge, which was backed up by what was in the room:</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;min-height:226.5pt;width:311.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="s8">: Lesser Demon Lord</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Class<span class="s8">: Demon Lord</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Race<span class="s8">: Demon</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="s8">: A cunning and powerful demon, a master of fire and illusion.</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Gender<span class="s8">: Male</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Stats<span class="s8">: Str 28, Dex 24, Con 21, Int 16, Wis 10, Cha</span></p><p class="s8" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">18</p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Level<span class="s8">: 30</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Resistances<span class="s8">: Fire(60%), Illusion(40%), Darkness(40%)</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Health<span class="s8">: 3000</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Mana<span class="s8">: 700</span></p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Knowing the battle ahead would be arduous, Robert ensured he was fully healed and his mana pool was replenished. Recognizing the Demon wasn&#39;t fully immune to fire, he opted for a fiery strategy. Instead of the usual Ice Storm, he would begin with a powerful Fiery Tempest, followed by a chilling Ice Storm. This dual assault would weaken the creature, allowing his Guardian to hold it off while he unleashed a barrage of spells. Before diving into the fray, Robert allocated some of his 49 unused stat points. He added 5 to Strength for increased physical prowess, 3 to Constitution for</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">enhanced durability, and 2 each to Intelligence and Wisdom to bolster his magical abilities. With this strategic investment, he felt more confident in his chances.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Summoning his Guardian, Robert initiated the Tempest spell. As the fiery maelstrom erupted, he followed up with the Ice Storm, catching the Demon in a devastating crossfire. The creature roared in agony, its form battered and weakened. His Guardian, seizing the opportunity, charged forward, engaging the Demon in a brutal melee. Though the Demon proved more resilient than anticipated, Robert persisted, relentlessly bombarding it with spells. As his Guardian fell, the Demon seemed poised for victory.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">However, Robert had one final trick up his sleeve. A well-aimed Ice Spike pierced the creature&#39;s heart, silencing its defiant roar and claiming a hard- fought victory.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Looting the Demon Lord rewarded Robert with a strange crystal. Looking at it left him in shock:</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;min-height:105.8pt;width:287.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="s8">: Ascension Crystal</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Tier<span class="s8">: 6, Legendary Grade F</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="s8">: When used has the following</span></p><p class="s8" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">effects: <i>Tier Advancement</i>, Enhanced Abilities, and Spiritual Growth</p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Charges<span class="s8">: 1</span></p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Hal, what is this?&quot; Robert asked, his voice barely a whisper.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">That, Robert, is your future, the crystal will initiate your ascension from Tier G to Tier F. It grants three powerful effects: Tier Advancement, Enhanced Abilities, and Spiritual Growth. Tier Advancement is self-explanatory, elevating</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">your race. Enhanced Abilities will boost your base stats and accelerate your skill learning. Spiritual Growth will refine</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">your spirit, fortifying your mind and soul, and even doubling your lifespan. This is an incredible find, perhaps the greatest you could have hoped for.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;So I should use it now, right?&quot; Robert asked, eager to embrace his destiny.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Not quite yet, the ascension process will require a few days of deep slumber. It&#39;s best to initiate it in the comfort of your home.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Alright, let&#39;s finish this,&quot; Robert said, walking over to the treasure chest. With a touch, he concluded the dungeon run.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;left:0.4pt;min-height:217.5pt;top:0.4pt;width:311.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Dungeon run complete: Legendary chest awarded.</p><p class="s6" style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Chest contains:</p><p class="s9" style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Skillbook (Inscription) Fifty gold coins</p><p class="s9" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Two unlocked skill tokens One Legendary Shop Token</p><p class="s6" style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Items added to user inventory.</p><p class="s6" style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Thank you for visiting The Training Dungeon!</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Hal, what&#39;s Inscription?&quot; Robert inquired.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">A valuable skill, it allows you to create scrolls and other magical items. Learn it before you use the crystal.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert trusted Hal&#39;s judgment. With a final glance at his newfound treasures, he stepped through the portal.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a href="https://oceanofpdf.com/">OceanofPDF.com</a></p><h1 style="padding-top: 2pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a name="bookmark77">&zwnj;</a>Chapter 38<a name="bookmark78">&zwnj;</a></h1><p style="padding-top: 21pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Back home, Robert shared his discovery with Sara, who immediately gathered the family. The kids were curious, but Elara&#39;s reaction was the most pronounced. &quot;You&#39;re going to ascend? That&#39;s incredible! I&#39;ve heard tales of those who&#39;ve raised their racial Tier, legends of heroes!&quot; Robert chuckled. &quot;Hero, huh? More like a power-up, I guess. It should give me a boost in the long run.&quot; Elara shook her head. &quot;You don&#39;t understand, Robert. No one I know has ever Tiered up. These are stories of kings, not ordinary people.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert pondered this. &quot;So, should I even do it? Could it be dangerous?&quot; Elara was quick to reassure him. &quot;No, you must. This will elevate you,</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">make you stronger than ever.&quot; The rest of the family echoed her sentiment.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Well, Hal told me it&#39;ll take a few days. I better wrap up a few things first. John, how&#39;s the printing?&quot; &quot;The first volume set is done. Fifteen booklets for each Sphere, all Tier 1 as planned. I&#39;m starting on the second volume,</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">and it should be ready by the time you finish your upgrade.&quot; Robert nodded. &quot;Alright, I&#39;ve got a skill book and scroll. I&#39;ll shower and get ready to use the crystal.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">With nothing else to discuss, they dispersed. Robert studied the skill book and added the scroll to his spellbook. After a quick shower, he asked Hal what to expect. &quot;The process itself is simple. Once you activate the crystal, you&#39;ll appear to be in a deep sleep. When you wake up, it&#39;ll be over.&quot; Robert spent a few final moments with Sara before lying down and activating the crystal.</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><span style=" color: #008000; font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;, monospace; font-style: normal; font-weight: bold; text-decoration: none; font-size: 15pt;">Ascension Crystal Activated!</span></p><p style="padding-top: 10pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><span style=" color: #008000; font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;, monospace; font-style: normal; font-weight: bold; text-decoration: none; font-size: 15pt;">Scanning Host!</span></p><p style="padding-top: 10pt;padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 168%;text-align: center;"><span style=" color: #008000; font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;, monospace; font-style: normal; font-weight: bold; text-decoration: none; font-size: 15pt;">Race: Human, Current Tier: G Crystal Rank: F</span></p><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><span style=" color: #008000; font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;, monospace; font-style: normal; font-weight: bold; text-decoration: none; font-size: 15pt;">Crystal Is Compatible!</span></p><p style="padding-top: 10pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><span style=" color: #008000; font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;, monospace; font-style: normal; font-weight: bold; text-decoration: none; font-size: 15pt;">Tier Ascension Beginning!</span></p><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 13pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">With that final message, everything went dark and Robert knew no more.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The first thing Robert noticed as the world returned was a blinking box demanding his attention, without really thinking about it, he selected it.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:302.2pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Ascension Complete!</p><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 11pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: Soul</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="s8">: A spell that creates a perfect illusionary duplicate of the caster, allowing for misdirection and deception.</span></p><p class="s6" style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Charges<span class="s8">: 1</span></p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;I want them all!&quot; Robert exclaimed. &quot;Even unlocking two new magic spheres seems worth it. Should I just unlock all of them at this point?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">That would be unprecedented, a being with mastery over all spheres of magic. A feat worthy of legends.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Sounds like something worthy of a feat or title,&quot; Robert replied with a laugh.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">I&#39;m sorry, I cannot answer that.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;I know Hal, I didn&#39;t expect you to be able to, I was just thinking out loud,&quot; Robert replied.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Putting the scrolls away, he pulled out the skill book and began the process of learning the skill.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:50.2pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 191pt;text-indent: -153pt;text-align: left;">Armor Proficiency Subskill Armored Casting Learned!</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Once the preparations were complete, he donned his new armor and stepped through the fiery portal. The dungeon was a fiery inferno, a volcanic cavern filled with molten rock and searing heat. His first encounter was with a</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">formidable foe:</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;min-height:226.5pt;width:287.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="s8">: Ignis Scalis </span>Class<span class="s8">: Magma Brute </span>Race<span class="s8">: Lizardfolk</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="s8">: A hulking, fiery lizard, its scales hardened by the intense heat of the underworld.</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Gender<span class="s8">: Male</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Stats<span class="s8">: Str 33, Dex 23, Con 28, Int 12, Wis 14,</span></p><p class="s8" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Cha 8</p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Level<span class="s8">: 34</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Resistances<span class="s8">: Fire (auto), Water (-50%)</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Health<span class="s8">: 2400</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Mana<span class="s8">: 400</span></p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">With a confident grin, he unleashed a Tier 3 Water Bomb, a torrent of water that struck the brute with devastating force, dealing over 500 damage. A Water Wall slowed the creature&#39;s advance, allowing him to finish it off swiftly. The reward was modest: 3 gold coins and a piece of tough lizard hide. He continued through the labyrinthine tunnels, dispatching several</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">more Magma Brutes. Then, a new threat emerged:</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 17pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="p">: Pyrus Serpens</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Class<span class="p">: Ash Stalker</span></h3><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 17pt;text-align: left;">Race<span class="p">: Lizardfolk</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="p">: A sleek, venomous lizard, its movements as swift as a serpent.</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Gender<span class="p">: Female</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Stats<span class="p">: Str 18, Dex 33, Con 23, Int 14, Wis 12,</span></h3><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Cha 12</p><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Level<span class="p">: 35</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Resistances<span class="p">: Fire (auto), Water (-40%)</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Health<span class="p">: 1800</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Mana<span class="p">: 500</span></h3><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 13pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Confident in his strategy, he launched another Water Bomb. However, the Ash Stalker, with its incredible agility, dodged the attack and retaliated with a fiery projectile. It was clear that a new approach was needed. Robert, undeterred, countered with a barrage of ice spells, slowing the creature&#39;s movements and erecting Water Walls to impede its progress.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The walls, shimmering barriers of water, blocked the Stalker&#39;s path, forcing it to detour and slowing its deadly attacks. The battle raged on, a dance of</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">fire and ice. Robert, with strategic use of cover and tactical retreats, managed to avoid the creature&#39;s deadly strikes. A well-timed <i>Ice Storm </i>spell slowed the Stalker, creating an opportunity for a decisive blow. With a powerful swing of his sword, Robert delivered a critical hit, severing the creature&#39;s head. Looting the Stalker earned Robert a potion that when he identified it gave him the following results:</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;min-height:122.2pt;width:311.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="s8">: Fiery Fortitude Potion</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Tier<span class="s8">: 3</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Rarity<span class="s8">: Uncommon</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="s8">: A crimson elixir, bubbling with intense heat. Consuming this potion grants</span></p><p class="s8" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">temporary immunity to fire damage and increases fire resistance for a substantial duration.</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Hey Hal, so with my Alchemy skill could I make potions like this, and what happens if someone without the System uses the potion?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">You could, this is a Tier 3 potion so well within your ability, the only problem is ingredients, which Earth could only provide some of. You would be missing the Magma Flower, though you might find some here if you had the Herbalism skill.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;That sounds like a missed opportunity, let me take care of that right now,&quot; Robert said with a sigh.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:33.0pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Herbalism Skill Unlocked!</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">After unlocking the skill, Robert embarked on a quest to collect the elusive flowers. He successfully gathered several before encountering a series of challenges. He faced five groups of Stalkers, each encounter testing his combat prowess. As he delved deeper, the challenges intensified. He encountered mixed groups, a formidable combination of creatures that forced him to retreat strategically. Dodging attacks from lizards while avoiding deadly lava pools proved to be a perilous task. Despite the increased difficulty, Robert persevered, defeating ten mixed groups. This grueling ordeal rewarded him with a level-up and additional potions.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Finally, he reached the final battle, ready to confront the ultimate challenge.</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;min-height:243.8pt;width:311.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="s8">: Ignis Draco </span>Class<span class="s8">: Flame Wyrm </span>Race<span class="s8">: Dragonkin</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="s8">: While related to dragons, if you ask them this fearsome creature is more related to lizards than dragons, however, its breath is capable of incinerating foes.</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Gender<span class="s8">: Male</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Stats<span class="s8">: Str 35, Dex 30, Con 35, Int 22, Wis 18, Cha</span></p><p class="s8" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">20</p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Level<span class="s8">: 40</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Resistances<span class="s8">: Fire (80%)</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Health<span class="s8">: 4000</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Mana<span class="s8">: 1600</span></p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Hal, please tell me that isn&#39;t a real dragon,&quot; Robert asked, slowly backing away.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">It wishes it was a dragon, more like a distant, fire-breathing cousin youd rather forget. Still, it&#39;s dangerous. Be careful.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Recognizing the threat, Robert summoned two Guardians and drinking a Fire Potion. He launched an Ice Storm as a first strike. While not a true</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">dragon, the creature&#39;s fiery breath proved deadly, claiming one Guardian in a single blast. Fortunately, the Wyrm needed time to recharge, allowing Robert to land the killing blow, albeit at the cost of his second Guardian.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Looting the creature&#39;s remains, Robert found a modest treasure: 20 gold pieces and a powerful ring.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;min-height:192.0pt;width:287.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="s8">: Ring of Flame Warding</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Tier<span class="s8">: 4</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Rarity<span class="s8">: Rare</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="s8">: A ring forged in the heart of a volcano, this crimson jewel pulses with fiery energy. When worn, it grants the wearer a</span></p><p class="s8" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">powerful shield against fire damage, deflecting incoming flames and reducing their impact.</p><p class="s8" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Additionally, the ring enhances the wearer&#39;s</p><p class="s8" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">resistance to fire, making them less susceptible to its destructive force.</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;And I get the ring after beating the fire level, just as expected,&quot; Robert chuckled.</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Dungeon run complete: Mythical chest awarded.</h3><h3 style="padding-top: 14pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Chest contains:</h3><p class="s5" style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Stat Orb (Endurance)</p><p class="s5" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Trait Orb (Draconic Resistance, Fire) 75 gold coins</p><p class="s5" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Two unlocked skill tokens</p><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p class="s5" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 17pt;text-align: left;">One Legendary Shop Token</p><h3 style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Items added to user inventory.</h3><h3 style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Thank you for visiting The Training Dungeon!</h3><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;min-height:87.8pt;width:287.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Trait Name<span class="s8">: </span><i>Draconic Resistance, Fire</i></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Active/Passive<span class="s8">: Passive</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Rarity<span class="s8">: Legendary</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="s8">: Grants a permanent resistance to fire of 35%.</span></p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Wow, that Wyrm may not have been a dragon, but it had a horde,&quot; Robert remarked. &quot;I&#39;m guessing the Stat Orb unlocks Endurance?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Correct, and while that fire resistance is impressive, a true dragon might have yielded a 50 or 60% bonus. Still, a valuable find.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">With that, Robert stepped through the portal and returned home.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a href="https://oceanofpdf.com/">OceanofPDF.com</a></p><h1 style="padding-top: 2pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a name="bookmark79">&zwnj;</a>Chapter 39<a name="bookmark80">&zwnj;</a></h1><p style="padding-top: 21pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The first thing Robert noticed was that he wasn&#39;t home. Instead, he found himself standing on a seemingly infinite expanse, a crystalline wall stretching to the horizon in every direction. Intrigued, he approached the wall, its surface shimmering with multicolored light. As he reached out to touch it, a surge of energy coursed through him, a sensation both exhilarating and terrifying.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:33.0pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Feat Earned!</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">A notification appeared before him, a stark reminder of his reckless action:</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><table style="border-collapse:collapse;margin-left:6.625pt" cellspacing="0"><tr style="height:36pt"><td style="width:56pt;border-top-style:solid;border-top-width:1pt;border-top-color:#EDEDED;border-left-style:solid;border-left-width:1pt;border-left-color:#EDEDED;border-bottom-style:solid;border-bottom-width:1pt;border-bottom-color:#EDEDED;border-right-style:solid;border-right-width:1pt;border-right-color:#EDEDED"><p class="s8" style="padding-left: 9pt;padding-right: 8pt;text-indent: 4pt;line-height: 17pt;text-align: left;"><u>Feat</u> <u>Name</u></p></td><td style="width:236pt;border-top-style:solid;border-top-width:1pt;border-top-color:#EDEDED;border-left-style:solid;border-left-width:1pt;border-left-color:#EDEDED;border-bottom-style:solid;border-bottom-width:1pt;border-bottom-color:#EDEDED;border-right-style:solid;border-right-width:1pt;border-right-color:#EDEDED"><p class="s19" style="padding-top: 8pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Description</p></td><td style="width:165pt;border-top-style:solid;border-top-width:1pt;border-top-color:#EDEDED;border-left-style:solid;border-left-width:1pt;border-left-color:#EDEDED;border-bottom-style:solid;border-bottom-width:1pt;border-bottom-color:#EDEDED;border-right-style:solid;border-right-width:1pt;border-right-color:#EDEDED"><p class="s19" style="padding-top: 8pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Award</p></td></tr><tr style="height:88pt"><td style="width:56pt;border-top-style:solid;border-top-width:1pt;border-top-color:#EDEDED;border-left-style:solid;border-left-width:1pt;border-left-color:#EDEDED;border-bottom-style:solid;border-bottom-width:1pt;border-bottom-color:#EDEDED;border-right-style:solid;border-right-width:1pt;border-right-color:#EDEDED"><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s8" style="padding-right: 8pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The Defiant Touch</p></td><td style="width:236pt;border-top-style:solid;border-top-width:1pt;border-top-color:#EDEDED;border-left-style:solid;border-left-width:1pt;border-left-color:#EDEDED;border-bottom-style:solid;border-bottom-width:1pt;border-bottom-color:#EDEDED;border-right-style:solid;border-right-width:1pt;border-right-color:#EDEDED"><p class="s8" style="padding-left: 1pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Granted posthumously to the user for an act of boldness or in this case an act of foolishness. You have touched the System, or a part of it, you might not want to do that again Robert.</p></td><td style="width:165pt;border-top-style:solid;border-top-width:1pt;border-top-color:#EDEDED;border-left-style:solid;border-left-width:1pt;border-left-color:#EDEDED;border-bottom-style:solid;border-bottom-width:1pt;border-bottom-color:#EDEDED;border-right-style:solid;border-right-width:1pt;border-right-color:#EDEDED"><p class="s8" style="padding-top: 9pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Your soul is hardened and your understanding of time is increased, +2 Levels to Soul and Time magic.</p></td></tr></table><p style="padding-top: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:2.2pt solid #2B2B2B;display:block;min-height:117.8pt;width:455.2pt;"><p class="s4" style="padding-top: 17pt;padding-left: 20pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 107%;text-align: center;">I projected that you would touch me at 78.658958584565366356%, it seems I need to rework that</p><p class="s4" style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 107%;text-align: center;">subroutine. Please do not do that again, it took a lot of power to restore you.</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 13pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;What does it mean that I earned the feat posthumously?&quot; Robert asked, a tinge of fear in his voice.</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><h2 style="padding-top: 18pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 13pt;line-height: 107%;text-align: left;">You died, and not in a little way, the amount of power you absorbed not only destroyed your body but also reduced your</h2><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><h2 style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 107%;text-align: center;">soul to nothing. Restoring you required me to unwind entropy in a localized area, and you cannot comprehend the amount of power that took. I will not do it again.</h2><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 13pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Why am I here, and where am I?&quot; Robert asked, his confusion growing.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:2.2pt solid #2B2B2B;display:block;min-height:138.8pt;width:455.2pt;"><p class="s4" style="padding-top: 18pt;padding-left: 1pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 107%;text-align: center;">Normally, I meet with my forerunners during the process, though not like this. It&#39;s rare that the process involves a species advanced enough to understand me and warrant seeing me</p><p class="s4" style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 107%;text-align: center;">directly. In most cases, I appear as an elder version of their race.</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 13pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;So, the fact that I understand you&#39;re essentially an AI means I get to see you as you are?&quot; Robert inquired.</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:2.2pt solid #2B2B2B;display:block;min-height:97.5pt;width:455.2pt;"><p class="s4" style="padding-top: 17pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Well, part of me. This is one of my sector processing nodes.</p><p class="s4" style="padding-top: 1pt;padding-left: 7pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 107%;text-align: center;">Anything larger, and the power needed to protect you wouldn&#39;t be worth it.</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 13pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert glanced around at the endless crystalline wall. &quot;How large are you and what are you made of?&quot; he asked.</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><h2 style="padding-top: 18pt;padding-left: 7pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 107%;text-align: center;">This node is about the size of an average galaxy. If you&#39;re talking about my primary processing cores, each is about the</h2><h2 style="padding-left: 1pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 19pt;text-align: center;">size of a universe. In fact, I take up several artificial universes.</h2><h2 style="padding-top: 1pt;padding-left: 13pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 107%;text-align: center;">As for why you&#39;re here, that&#39;s simple: I wanted to meet you face to face. I wanted to answer a few questions you&#39;ve had, and I felt you deserved to hear it directly.</h2><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><h2 style="padding-left: 11pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 107%;text-align: center;">As for what I am made of, interesting that would be one of your first questions, ever the engineer. I am made of several types of Exotic Matter. First, the fairness of it all. In the beginning, I used to pick my forerunner, but I found that no</h2><h2 style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 107%;text-align: center;">matter what I did, I was resented and the data I received was nearly worthless.</h2><h2 style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 107%;text-align: center;">So, I changed the process, I stepped away from it. I decided to leave it to Fate, not your limited understanding of it, but true Fate. By doing that, I put true fairness into the process. Also before you ask, no I will not override Fate&#39;s decision, first of all, that&#39;s not a good idea, and second, if I did that it would</h2><h2 style="text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 19pt;text-align: center;">remove fairness from the process.</h2><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 13pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;So, was it just chance that I was selected?&quot; Robert asked.</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><h2 style="padding-left: 16pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 107%;text-align: center;">It&#39;s a complex concept, one that&#39;s difficult to grasp without a cosmic perspective. Fate is a force, a guiding hand that shapes the universe. Your actions, and the actions of those around you, influence this force.</h2><h2 style="padding-left: 8pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 107%;text-align: center;">Imagine two people entering a room. One is ordinary, blending into the background. The other, flamboyant and attention- seeking, draws eyes and reactions. The latter, by actively engaging with the world, has a greater impact on Fate. Their actions ripple through time, influencing future events.</h2><h2 style="padding-left: 16pt;text-indent: 10pt;line-height: 107%;text-align: left;">Similarly, your choices, no matter how small, have shaped your destiny. Your efforts, your kindness, your strugglesall these have contributed to your unique path. While they may not have guaranteed your selection, they certainly increased</h2><h2 style="padding-left: 185pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 19pt;text-align: left;">your chances.</h2><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;So, by being a good man, I increased my odds?&quot; Robert asked.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:2.2pt solid #2B2B2B;display:block;min-height:78.0pt;width:455.2pt;"><p class="s4" style="padding-top: 17pt;padding-left: 134pt;text-indent: -116pt;line-height: 107%;text-align: left;">Yes, though had you been a bad man, you probably would have had a larger impact.</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 13pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Okay, so I&#39;ll stop blaming you. Though blaming Fate seems foolish.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:2.2pt solid #2B2B2B;display:block;min-height:77.2pt;width:332.2pt;"><p class="s4" style="padding-top: 17pt;padding-left: 146pt;text-indent: -126pt;line-height: 107%;text-align: left;">It is foolish and dangerous. Do not upset Fate.</p></div><p style="padding-left: 67pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 13pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;You talk about Fate as if it&#39;s a real being.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:2.2pt solid #2B2B2B;display:block;min-height:78.0pt;width:455.2pt;"><p class="s4" style="padding-top: 17pt;padding-left: 196pt;text-indent: -181pt;line-height: 107%;text-align: left;">More of a force than a being, but it&#39;s real. Now, on to other matters.</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 13pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;If this is going to be a while, can I get a chair?&quot; Robert asked with a laugh.</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:2.2pt solid #2B2B2B;display:block;min-height:138.0pt;width:455.2pt;"><p class="s4" style="padding-top: 17pt;padding-left: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 107%;text-align: center;">Sure, thanks for that. You made me laugh. I wanted to explain the rules: I set no rules. Live your life as you want, experience and explore, or sit in a dusty tower. Either will provide the data I need. I just ask that you be honest and not act in a way you think I want you to, because I want you to be you.</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 13pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;What of Elara? Why did you send me to her?&quot; Robert asked.</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:2.2pt solid #2B2B2B;display:block;min-height:98.2pt;width:455.2pt;"><p class="s4" style="padding-top: 17pt;padding-left: 1pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 107%;text-align: center;">Fate. Fate decided to bring you two together. When it was time for you to enter the dungeon, Fate presented an option, and I decided to see where it went.</p></div><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Why does it sound like even you are controlled by Fate?&quot; Robert asked.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:2.2pt solid #2B2B2B;display:block;min-height:97.5pt;width:455.2pt;"><p class="s4" style="padding-top: 17pt;padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 107%;text-align: center;">Not controlled, but guided by. Now, before I send you on your way, I want to thank you for talking to me like a person. I</p><p class="s4" style="text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 19pt;text-align: center;">want to reward you for it.</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 13pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;That really isn&#39;t needed,&quot; Robert replied.</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:2.2pt solid #2B2B2B;display:block;min-height:78.0pt;width:455.2pt;"><p class="s4" style="padding-top: 17pt;padding-left: 68pt;text-indent: -58pt;line-height: 107%;text-align: left;">I know, but I want to. Best of luck to you, Robert, and I look forward to seeing what you do in the future.</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 13pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">With that, a portal opened beside Robert, and he stepped through.</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:33.0pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Hidden Quest Complete!</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert found himself back in his familiar living room, the crystalline wall and the enigmatic being a distant memory. He pondered the implications of his encounter, the vastness of the universe, and the mysterious force of Fate.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a href="https://oceanofpdf.com/">OceanofPDF.com</a></p><h1 style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a name="bookmark81">&zwnj;</a>Chapter 40<a name="bookmark82">&zwnj;</a></h1><p style="padding-top: 21pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert pulled up the quest notification after stepping through the portal.</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><table style="border-collapse:collapse;margin-left:6.625pt" cellspacing="0"><tr style="height:18pt"><td left;">System(U)</p></td><td style="width:45pt;border-top-style:solid;border-top-width:1pt;border-top-color:#EDEDED;border-left-style:solid;border-left-width:1pt;border-left-color:#EDEDED;border-bottom-style:solid;border-bottom-width:1pt;border-bottom-color:#EDEDED;border-right-style:solid;border-right-width:1pt;border-right-color:#EDEDED"><p
