class="s8" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">You&#39;ve met the System, or at least a part of it. You even managed to make it happy by treating it like a real person.</p></td><td style="width:110pt;border-top-style:solid;border-top-width:1pt;border-top-color:#EDEDED;border-left-style:solid;border-left-width:1pt;border-left-color:#EDEDED;border-bottom-style:solid;border-bottom-width:1pt;border-bottom-color:#EDEDED;border-right-style:solid;border-right-width:1pt;border-right-color:#EDEDED"><p class="s8" style="padding-top: 8pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Knowledge Tome(The</p><p class="s8" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Systems Guide to Enchanting)</p></td><td style="width:65pt;border-top-style:solid;border-top-width:1pt;border-top-color:#EDEDED;border-left-style:solid;border-left-width:1pt;border-left-color:#EDEDED;border-bottom-style:solid;border-bottom-width:1pt;border-bottom-color:#EDEDED;border-right-style:solid;border-right-width:1pt;border-right-color:#EDEDED"><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s8" style="padding-left: 1pt;padding-right: 1pt;text-indent: 3pt;text-align: justify;">A unique version of this quest.</p></td></tr></table><p style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Hal, what just happened?&quot; Robert asked, still processing the bizarre encounter.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Exactly what you think, the System wanted to meet you before your time on Earth was up. You did well, except for the whole dying part, but you got over that.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;What&#39;s a Knowledge Tome?&quot; Robert inquired, picking up the mysterious book.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Unlike a skill guide, which teaches you how to do something, a Knowledge Tome grants you the knowledge itself. This is a rare find. When you use it, you&#39;ll gain all the System&#39;s knowledge on enchanting up to your current Tier.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: -28pt;text-align: left;">&quot;So it&#39;ll make me a better enchanter?&quot; Robert asked, hopeful.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">You don&#39;t quite understand, this will give you all the knowledge related to Enchanting up to and including Tier 5. Every plan, blueprint, and understanding. It&#39;s like spending years training under every master in the multiverse. You&#39;ll become one of the greatest Enchanters, at least up to Tier</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">5. There&#39;ll always be grandmasters and beyond, but this will be a game-changer.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;I&#39;m going to use this then,&quot; Robert said, awestruck.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Use it before you go to sleep tonight. That book will knock you out for sure.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Just then, Sara entered the room and greeted Robert. He spent a few minutes filling her in on everything that had happened. When he got to the part about the book, she laughed. &quot;Only you could make a computer happy,&quot; she teased. The rest of the day was spent between bringing</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">everyone else up to speed and Robert committing the Scrolls to his spellbook. That evening when he lay down he used the Knowledge Tome and everything went dark.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:84.8pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Knowledge Tome Consumed!</p><p class="s12" style="padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Enchanting Skill enhanced +1 Tier System Level Knowledge Granted</p><p class="s12" style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 17pt;text-align: center;">Enchanting Skill Granted at Tier 5</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">After carefully considering the information, Robert realized he possessed a wealth of knowledge. He knew how to craft a variety of items, from</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">protective rings to storage containers, and even more esoteric objects like an enchanted toe ring for a Varirian Fire Scout, designed to grant limited color vision. While he couldn&#39;t fathom the reason for such a specific enchantment, he did discover something that could aid John&#39;s project.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert summoned John to his office and outlined his plan. &quot;A Tier 6</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Enchanter can accomplish many things, including creating a vault. Rather than burden our future family with safeguarding these materials, we&#39;ll construct a vault to store them securely. It will be a protected space</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">accessible only to direct family members.&quot; John contemplated this and asked, &quot;How do we protect the vault itself?&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert explained, &quot;That&#39;s the easy part. We&#39;ll bury it deep beneath the surface, far beyond the reach of any earthly threat. I possess the spells to tunnel miles underground, create a fortified chamber, and seal it off completely.&quot; John inquired, &quot;How will we access it then?&quot; Robert grinned, &quot;That&#39;s the best part. We&#39;ll create rings for you, Richard, Stacey, my</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">siblings, and future generations. These rings will bond with a single direct</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">bloodline descendant and grant various abilities, including teleportation to a landing pad within the vault chamber.&#39; John raised another concern, &#39;What happens when the rings lose power in a Mana-deprived future?&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert assured him, &quot;I&#39;ll make them rechargeable and place a charging station within the vault, powered by Manastones. This should be sufficient for infrequent use, primarily to demonstrate the truth to future generations.&quot; John, intrigued by the idea, asked, &quot;How do we protect against forced access to the vault?&quot; Robert replied, &quot;That would be unwise. I&#39;ll enchant the Teleportation room with powerful guardians and additional protections.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">However, the best safeguard remains secrecy. Ensure that whoever inherits the ring understands its significance.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">John expressed his approval and asked about the location. Robert suggested his grandfather&#39;s camp in the Rockies, which he believed was now owned by his father. He planned to confirm ownership and determine its suitability for the vault. That night Robert called his father and talked about the plan, he was told that the land was indeed owned by his father and he was on board with using it to hide the family vault. He said he would visit a lawyer to find out how to ensure that the land could never be sold outside of the family and would include a trust to make sure all of the property taxes were paid.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">With that taken care of Robert spent the next few days designing the plans for the vault, he sketched out the overall designs for the enchantments and made plans to travel out to the camp to see where to start working on the tunnel. His plan was to quickly tunnel down and create a rough chamber then add a teleport room before pulling out and sealing the tunnel behind him. Once he returned home he would be able to use that teleport beacon to return to the chamber to complete the build-out process in secret.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The following day he made the 22nd run through the dungeon which was an interesting one. After leaving the entry chamber he arrived at the shore of a lake. Not seeing anything else to do, he used his underwater breathing spell and entered the lake, there he battled against sharks and other underwater life.</p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;left:0.4pt;min-height:217.5pt;top:0.4pt;width:287.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 187%;text-align: left;">Dungeon run complete: Epic chest awarded. Chest contains:</p><p class="s9" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Quarterstaff(Tier 4 Epic)</p><p class="s9" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">25 gold coins</p><p class="s9" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">One unlocked skill token One Epic Shop Token</p><p class="s6" style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Items added to user inventory.</p><p class="s6" style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Thank you for visiting The Training Dungeon!</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">The staff wasn&#39;t anything special and with that final shop token, he now had enough tokens to purchase the Tier 3 master spellbook, which he planned to do during the next run. Returning home he found out John had completed</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">the printout of the stage two training booklets and started a first pass at the final training booklet, which would contain a few Tier 2 spells. Robert spent the rest of the day working with him to design the new booklets before he retired to his office to finish the designs for the vault.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert talked with his family and they decided that he would travel to the camp after the next run, he would fly out there on Monday, spend Tuesday getting the chamber dug out, and fly home on Wednesday. Then he would spend the next two weeks completing the build and show everyone how the rings worked. Once that was all taken care of they would transfer all the current books as well as his old gear into the vault. Shortly after that he would approach the military about his healing abilities and begin the process of letting the government know what was going on.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">A few days later Robert completed his 23rd dungeon dive. The first thing he did was buy the Tier 3 master Spellbook. He noticed nothing else new in the shop and asked Hal about it.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">You&#39;ve reached the point where the System will no longer provide you with more powerful items, now I expect to see new spellbooks for some of your newer spheres and some</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">scroll packs, but I doubt you will be given any more master spellbooks. Your armor and weapons should last you until you hit level 75 or so, which will probably be after you leave Earth.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Venturing into the dungeon, Robert encountered a mine teeming with Kobolds. Ambushed by the mining creatures, he defended himself and, fortuitously, looted a Mining Skillbook from a fallen Kobold Foreman. Immediately activating the book, he unlocked the Mining skill.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:33.0pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">General Skill Mining Unlocked!</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Seeing that there was nothing around, he decided to see what kind of ore he could get from the mine and took one of the Iron picks he had collected from the miners and went to work. After an hour, he had collected 25 pieces of Iron Ore and 7 pieces of copper ore before his iron pick broke and he continued out. Taking out another 30 miners and 4 foremen, he did level up and he continued to spend some time mining, bringing his total up to 47 iron, 18 copper, and 2 silver pieces of ore. Near what he assumed was the end of the mine he did run into a group of 5 foremen which proved be a challenge, they were tough fighters and Robert spent half his time dodging the swings of their mine picks but in the end, stats won and he was the</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">victor.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Reaching the end of the mine, Robert discovered a smelter and blacksmith shop, guarded by 5 Kobold Foremen and a powerful Dragonkin blacksmith named Sparky.</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="p">: Sparky </span>Class<span class="p">: Blacksmith </span>Race<span class="p">: Dragonkin</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="p">: A diminutive dragonkin with a fiery temper. Despite his small stature, Sparky wields a hammer forged in the heart of a volcano, capable of shaping metal with incredible precision. His mastery of fire magic allows him to infuse his creations with elemental power, making them both</span></h3><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 17pt;text-align: left;">deadly and beautiful.</p><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Gender<span class="p">: Male</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Stats<span class="p">: Str 45, Dex 25, Con 40, Int 25, Wis 20, Cha</span></h3><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">15</p><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Level<span class="p">: 50</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Resistances<span class="p">: Fire (90%), Heat(75%), Poison(50%)</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Health<span class="p">: 5000</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Mana<span class="p">: 2000</span></h3><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 13pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Recognizing the threat, Robert initiated the battle with an Ice Storm, which not only damaged the enemies but also caused the smelter to explode, dealing significant damage to Sparky. In a swift and decisive battle, Robert emerged victorious, claiming the blacksmith&#39;s Steel hammer and a substantial amount of gold. As the battle concluded, the bodies vanished, and a treasure chest appeared.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;left:0.4pt;min-height:216.8pt;top:0.4pt;width:287.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Dungeon run complete: Rare chest awarded.</p><p class="s6" style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Chest contains:</p><p class="s8" style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Skill Book (Blacksmithing)</p><p class="s9" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">35 gold coins</p><p class="s9" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">One unlocked skill token</p><p class="s6" style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Items added to user inventory.</p><p class="s6" style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Thank you for visiting The Training Dungeon!</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Returning home through the portal, Robert concluded his day. The following day, he activated the Blacksmithing skill book, though he lacked the immediate means to practice the craft. He hoped that acquiring the skill would broaden his options for a second profession. Continuing his educational endeavors, Robert imparted the final math lessons to his children. From that point forward, their training would be tailored to their individual futures. John, excited about his upcoming training, eagerly anticipated his first skill in spacecraft design.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">A few days later, Robert traveled to his father&#39;s camp in Wyoming. Upon arrival, he identified a suitable location to begin his project. Over the course of seven hours and consuming 70,000 Mana, he dug a tunnel three miles deep into the mountain. At the end of the tunnel, he carved out a 2,500</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">square foot chamber and illuminated it with enchanted stones. Next, he focused on enchanting a small side room to serve as the teleport waypoint</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">for the vault chamber. After two hours of intricate work, he created a simple teleport stone, allowing for three round-trip teleports to the entry chamber. With the enchantment complete, Robert sealed the tunnel system and returned to the surface. He then departed the camp and flew back home.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Upon returning home, Robert established a temporary return waypoint on a copper sheet, intending to replace it with a more permanent solution once</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">the rings were complete. The following day, he teleported into the</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">underground chamber, where he found the air stale. To rectify this, he quickly implemented a rune-based air circulation system. Next, he refined the chamber&#39;s shape, smoothing the walls and carving out a space for the vault. The vault itself, a compact System Storage Device, was enchanted to absorb Mana from the surrounding environment, initially relying on 15 Manastones for power.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">To illuminate the chamber, Robert created glowing stone orbs powered by individual Manastones. He also installed a rune-based air recycling system, powered by four Manastones. To ensure the vault&#39;s security, Robert enchanted two plates on opposite walls, each capable of summoning two level 50 Guardian Constructs. Looking over the details of the enchantment, he knew these would stand up to anything that could possibly attack the vault:</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="p">: Vault Guardian</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Class<span class="p">: Guardian</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Race<span class="p">: Construct</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="p">: A potent enchantment that summons two formidable guardian constructs to protect the enchanted location. These guardians will tirelessly defend the area from intruders, using force and cunning to eliminate threats.</span></h3><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 17pt;text-align: left;">Gender<span class="p">: N/A</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Stats<span class="p">: Str 50, Dex 40, Con 60, Int 25, Wis 30, Cha 10</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Level<span class="p">: 50</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Resistances<span class="p">: Fire(50%)</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Health<span class="p">: 6000</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Mana<span class="p">: 2500</span></h3><p style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The enchantment added the following abilities to the guardians</p><h3 style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Unrelenting Defense<span class="p">: The guardian possesses an unwavering defense, mitigating damage and enduring relentless attacks.</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Guardian Strike<span class="p">: A powerful melee attack that can stun enemies.</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Regeneration<span class="p">: The guardian slowly regenerates health over time.</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Detect Intrusion<span class="p">: The guardian can sense intruders within a certain radius, alerting the owner of the vault.</span></h3><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 13pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Knowing that would protect the vault, he added Two Manastones to each of the plates, which would provide the power needed to summon the guardians 4 times each. In the entry chamber, Robert expanded the space to</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">accommodate the summoning of additional guardians. Four plates were installed, each capable of summoning a level 30 guardian ten times. Finally, Robert constructed a charging station within the main chamber, powered by ten Manastones. This station would be used to recharge the rings he planned to create. With the vault secure and the necessary infrastructure in place, Robert left the chamber, satisfied with his work. He considered future expansions, such as additional rooms, but decided to focus on other priorities for the time being.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">With his work here complete, Robert returned home.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a href="https://oceanofpdf.com/">OceanofPDF.com</a></p><h1 style="padding-top: 2pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a name="bookmark83">&zwnj;</a>Chapter 41<a name="bookmark84">&zwnj;</a></h1><p style="padding-top: 21pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">After returning home, Robert spent the next two days immersed in the intricate task of designing and crafting a formidable master ring. He</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">couldn&#39;t shake the fleeting thought of its Lord of the Rings-esque nature, but the ring&#39;s purpose was far from sinister. The primary challenge was its small size. Despite his Enchanting skill and the aid of the Sphere, inscribing the complex runes onto the ring was a painstaking process.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The master ring was a crucial component of Robert&#39;s long-term plan to</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">secure control of the vault. While he trusted his current family members, he recognized the uncertainties of the future. The ring itself was a luxurious piece, featuring a dazzling 2-carat diamond surrounded by eight smaller stones. Its appearance might have been somewhat gaudy, but its potential was extraordinary. The master ring boasted an impressive array of abilities:</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;left:0.4pt;min-height:290.2pt;top:0.4pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s6" style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Teleport and Return<span class="s8">: Instantly teleport to a designated location and return to the original spot (one charge per use).</span></p><p class="s6" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Air Barrier<span class="s8">: Create a powerful, Tier 5 air barrier for protection (one charge per use).</span></p><p class="s6" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Ring Locator<span class="s8">: Locate paired rings within a 3,000-mile radius (one charge per use).</span></p><p class="s6" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Ring Disabler<span class="s8">: Disable the functions of paired rings (one charge per use).</span></p><p class="s6" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Ring Enabler<span class="s8">: Re-enable the functions of paired rings (one charge per use).</span></p><p class="s6" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Passive Recall<span class="s8">: Automatically returns to the bonded user if separated by more than 100 feet.</span></p><p class="s6" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Adaptive Size<span class="s8">: Resizes to fit the wearer comfortably.</span></p><p class="s6" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Rechargeable<span class="s8">: The ring&#39;s forty charges can be replenished.</span></p><p class="s6" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Charges: <span class="s8">40/40</span></p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The ring turned out well. For the normal rings, he purchased simple silver and gold rings, with a single small 1/2-carat diamond in the middle. To</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">these, he added only a few abilities:</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;left:0.4pt;min-height:153.0pt;top:0.4pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s6" style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Teleport and Return<span class="s8">: Instant teleportation and return (one charge per use).</span></p><p class="s6" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Air Barrier: <span class="s8">Create a protective Tier 2 air barrier (one charge per use).</span></p><p class="s6" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Bonding<span class="s8">: Bonds to the first user and can be transferred to another.</span></p><p class="s6" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Rechargeable<span class="s8">: The ring&#39;s fifteen charges can be replenished.</span></p><p class="s6" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Charges: <span class="s8">15/15</span></p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 1pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid 0pt;text-align: left;">For the rest of the day, Robert spent it looking over the Tier 3 Master book, adding several new spells to his spellbook, the following day, he entered the dungeon again.</p><h3 style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Welcome, adventurer. You have entered Dungeon <i>7883667HG8776DE985762763FF7-1</i>, currently known as The Training Dungeon. You are now on the Twenty-Fourth Floor.</h3><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">There in the System store, he found a Tier 1 book for each of his new magic Spheres, while only having the standard 25 random spells, it ensured he would have some way to use his new powers. Setting him back 1200 gold was harsh but worth it. This dungeon run had something new, Orcs, these warriors were powerful and he had to make sure of his Guardians to make it through unharmed. But he was able to complete it in several hours.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;left:0.4pt;min-height:217.5pt;top:0.4pt;width:287.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 187%;text-align: left;">Dungeon run complete: Epic chest awarded. Chest contains:</p><p class="s8" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Skillbook(Skinning)</p><p class="s9" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">50 gold coins</p><p class="s9" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Two unlocked skill token One Epic Shop Token</p><p class="s6" style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Items added to user inventory.</p><p class="s6" style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Thank you for visiting The Training Dungeon!</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The thought of practicing <i>Skinning</i>, a newly acquired subskill of his Hunting proficiency, would have to be postponed; his recent, intensely successful dungeon run had propelled him to a remarkable level 40. A staggering 87 unallocated stat points weighed heavily on his mind, a virtual treasure trove demanding careful investment. &quot;Hal,&quot; Robert said, turning his thoughts outward to his AI companion, &quot;what&#39;s your strategic assessment?</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Where should I allocate these points for maximum benefit?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Perception is paramount, Robert, even the initial unlocking of that stat provided a significant enhancement to your</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">observational capabilities, and further investment will yield exponential returns. I recommend a minimum allocation of 20 points. Additionally, allocate 10 points to Charisma, and increase Constitution to an even 70.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert considered Hal&#39;s advice, recognizing the inherent logic. He trusted the AI&#39;s calculations implicitly. He swiftly implemented the suggested</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">changes, watching as the numbers on his status screen shifted, reflecting his growing power. Even after these substantial allocations, a hefty 61 points remained. &quot;What about Perk points, Hal?&quot; he inquired. &quot;Any recommendations on that front?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The available Perk selection is vast, numbering in the tens of thousands, to narrow your search, identify areas where you perceive a deficiency or a need for enhanced capability. Begin your exploration there.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert, following Hal&#39;s guidance, delved into the seemingly endless list of Perks. His attention was immediately captured by <i>Regeneration</i>. &quot;Hal, clarify the distinction between the Rare and Legendary versions of the Regeneration Perk,&quot; he requested.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The Rare variant of Regeneration facilitates the accelerated healing of most wounds, achieving full recovery within approximately five hours, the Legendary version, however, possesses the additional capability of regenerating lost limbs and organs. It is, quite literally, a life-saving attribute.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Without a moment&#39;s hesitation, Robert selected the Legendary version. The prospect of such complete recovery was too valuable to pass up.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">He continued his exploration, discovering two Rare Perks that piqued his interest: Arcane Sight and Soul Sight. The former promised the ability to perceive magical auras, revealing hidden items and traps, while the latter</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">offered the power to see through illusions and discern the true intentions of others, a potent social and defensive tool. Finally, he chose Cosmic</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Awareness from the Legendary list, a Perk that hinted at precognitive abilities and heightened intuition, a subtle but powerful edge in a dangerous world.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">With his Perk selections finalized, Robert decided to dedicate the remaining time before his next major dungeon run  his 25th, a milestone run  to simply enjoying the company of his family, savoring the precious moments of peace and By her skillset, she&#39;s leaning towards a powerful mage build. So, why bring her here?&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert shrugged, &quot;I didn&#39;t plan it. I was supposed to be soloing a dungeon, but the System issued her a quest to join me, and well, she decided to come.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Kaelan raised an eyebrow. &quot;She decided? Most teachers don&#39;t let their students make such decisions.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Then they&#39;re bad teachers,&quot; Robert retorted.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Kaelan chuckled. &quot;Fair enough. But that still doesn&#39;t explain why you&#39;re here. The nearest dungeons are level 70 and above, far too dangerous for her.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert nodded. &quot;I agree. We were in a dungeon when the System changed the exit portal, forcing us here.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Kaelan considered this. &quot;The System&#39;s quests are undeniable. But this chain quest is unusual. They often bring trouble to the location.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert hesitated. &quot;This is my first chain quest. I&#39;m not sure what to expect.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Normally, I&#39;d turn you away,&quot; Kaelan admitted. &quot;But you intrigue me. I&#39;ll allow you to stay, but expect to be watched.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;I&#39;d expect you to keep an eye on strangers,&quot; Robert replied. &quot;Perhaps one of your guards could act as a guide?&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Kaelan chuckled. &quot;Don&#39;t push your luck. You&#39;ll find a guide soon enough. Good luck, Robert. I&#39;ll see you around.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">As Kaelan left, she approached a cloaked figure. &quot;What did you see?&quot; The figure replied, &quot;Much like you. His protection is at least Tier 7. I couldn&#39;t</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">penetrate it.&quot; Kaelan narrowed her eyes. &quot;No one has that level of protection unless they&#39;re trouble or powerful. Which is he?&quot; The figure pondered. &quot;Both, I think.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Shortly after, Robert and Elara were released from the guardhouse. As they stepped into the bustling city, the towering walls and bustling streets were a stark contrast to the quiet countryside. The air was filled with the clamor of merchants, the clinking of coins, and the general hubbub of city life.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Following the flow of the crowd, they headed towards the shopping district. Suddenly, Robert halted, his grip tightening on a young boy&#39;s wrist. The boy, no older than twelve, had been attempting to pickpocket Elara. Caught red-handed, the boy&#39;s eyes widened in fear.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">A nearby guard noticed the commotion. &quot;Good eye, milord,&quot; the guard remarked. &quot;I didn&#39;t even spot him. You must have a keen perception. Want me to take care of him?&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Please, sir, I&#39;m sorry!&quot; the boy pleaded. &quot;I didn&#39;t mean to steal anything. I was just going to look.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert chuckled. &quot;We both know that&#39;s not true. However, rather than handing you over to the guard, perhaps you could be of service to us.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">The boy&#39;s eyes lit up with hope. &quot;What service, sir?&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">&quot;We&#39;re new to the city,&quot; Robert explained. &quot;A local guide could help us find the best magic and inscription shops.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;I know those places, milord,&quot; the boy offered eagerly. &quot;But I can&#39;t go inside. They don&#39;t let street urchins like me in.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">&quot;Fair enough,&quot; Robert replied. &quot;Just lead us there.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Ash waited for a moment before asking, &quot;No disrespect milord, but what do I get out of this?&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Robert laughed, &quot;Boy I think keeping you away from the guard would be reward enough, but I understand your need to earn something, so how about</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">a silver upfront and a silver when we are done, and I&#39;ll buy lunch and dinner?&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">At the mention of silver Ash&#39;s eyes got large and he was quick to reply, &quot;Yes milord that would be more than fair.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">After thanking the guard for his time Robert handed Ash a silver coin and asked him to take them to the best inscription shop in town. Taking off Ash guided them through the crowd into a more well-to-do section of the city where they approached a small well-kept building with a sign on the front designed to look like a scroll with a pen over it. below the sign was the</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">name *The Scrivener&#39;s Sanctum* as Robert went to enter the shop he noticed Ash standing off to the side and asked the boy to join him.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Sir shops like this do not like people like me,&quot; Ash said with a conflicted sound to his voice.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;They don&#39;t like street rats?&quot; asked Robert.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;No sir, they do not like poor people,&quot; Ash answered.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Ah, well the good news is that you are currently in my employ, so if they want my coin they will ignore your presence,&quot; Robert replied.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Entering the shop Robert took note of Its dimly lit interior, filled with the soft glow of enchanted lamps, exuded an air of ancient wisdom. Shelves lined the walls, groaning under the weight of ancient scrolls, quills, and mysterious inks. A large, ornate desk sat at the back of the shop, where a wizened old man hunched over a book, his quill scratching across the parchment. As Robert and Ash entered, a small bell above the door tinkled, alerting the old man to their presence. He looked up, his eyes twinkling with curiosity.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Welcome to the Scrivener&#39;s Sanctum,&quot; he greeted them with a warm smile. &quot;What brings you to my humble shop?&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert explained his need for inscription supplies. The old man nodded, his eyes lighting up with interest. He led them through the shop, pointing out</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">various items: shimmering inks, enchanted quills, and a variety of strange and wondrous tools.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;While I will not ask for exact details, can you give me a Tier range, I have supplies for up to Tier 6,&quot; The old shopkeeper asked.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert was careful to reply but answered with, &quot;Let&#39;s say Tier 4 to 5.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">With a nod, the shopkeeper started to point things out. &quot;This quill, for instance,&quot; the old man said, picking up a feather quill with intricate silver inlays, &quot;is enchanted to ensure perfect handwriting and clarity of thought.&quot; He then showed them a small, unassuming vial. &quot;This ink, a concoction of ancient herbs and starlight, can imbue your words with a subtle magic, enhancing their impact.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;What kind of documents are you looking to create?&quot; the shopkeeper inquired, his eyes twinkling with curiosity.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert pondered for a moment, then replied, &quot;Spell scrolls, for now.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Ah, spell scrolls,&quot; the old man mused. &quot;A lofty goal indeed. But you&#39;ve come to the right place.&quot; He paused, a knowing smile playing on his lips.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Such magic requires rare and potent ingredients. Let&#39;s see what we have...&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The old man turned and began rummaging through a drawer filled with strange, glowing objects. &quot;This parchment,&quot; he said, holding up a sheet of paper, &quot;is treated with a special enchantment to prevent your scrolls from</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">disintegrating. And this quill, made from a Phoenix feather, is the finest tool for inscribing spells.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert listened intently, his interest piqued. &quot;What about the ink?&quot; he asked.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Ah, the ink,&quot; the old man replied, a mischievous glint in his eye. &quot;The soul of the scroll. This special blend, a secret recipe passed down through generations, is infused with the essence of ancient magic.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;How much would all that cost?&quot; Robert asked, curious about the price.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The old man paused, considering his answer. &quot;A hefty price, I&#39;m afraid. But the power of your scrolls will be worth it.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;So, what&#39;s a &#39;hefty price&#39;?&quot; Robert pressed.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Well,&quot; the old man began, &quot;the parchment is one gold per scroll, the ink is fifteen gold per bottle, and the quill is ten gold. For thirty scrolls, three bottles of ink, and two quills, that would be ninety-five gold. But as a first- time customer, I&#39;ll give you a small discount so we will say ninety gold.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert smiled, satisfied with the price. After paying and storing his purchases, he thanked the old man and left the shop, eager to begin his magical endeavors.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a href="https://oceanofpdf.com/">OceanofPDF.com</a></p><h1 style="padding-top: 2pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a name="bookmark89">&zwnj;</a>Chapter 44<a name="bookmark90">&zwnj;</a></h1><p style="padding-top: 21pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The trio emerged from the weathered Inscription shop, bathed in the midday sun&#39;s golden glow. A gentle hunger gnawed at their bellies as the tantalizing aroma of sizzling meats and freshly baked bread wafted through the bustling street. A jovial street vendor, his apron a riot of colors, had set up shop nearby, his cart overflowing with mouthwatering delicacies. The</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">vendor greeted them with a warm smile, his voice as inviting as the food he sold. He extolled the virtues of his day&#39;s specials, a symphony of flavors that danced on the tip of their tongues. Robert, ever the hearty eater, opted for a meat pie, its golden crust promising a savory surprise within. Elara, with a more delicate palate, chose a pastry filled with sweet berries, a</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">perfect balance of tart and sweet. Ash, after making sure Robert was paying, selected a savory kebab, its marinated meat sizzling to perfection.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">As they savored their meal, the trio engaged in lively conversation. Ash,</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">unable to resist his curiosity, leaned in and asked, &quot;Milord, you spent ninety gold like it was nothing. You must be a noble, aren&#39;t you?&quot; Robert shrugged. &quot;Nah, I&#39;m just a guy. An adventurer, I guess you could say. Just trying to</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">make my way in the world.&quot; Ash&#39;s brow furrowed, &quot;But where do you get all that gold?&quot; Robert chuckled. &quot;Well, adventurers do more than just slay monsters and delve into dungeons. We also trade, craft, and sometimes, we get lucky. Besides, a good craftsman can make a decent living, especially if they know where to sell their wares.&quot; He paused, a thoughtful expression crossing his face. &quot;Of course, dungeon delving is always a reliable source of income, but it&#39;s a dangerous game. You&#39;ve got to be prepared, both physically and mentally.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">As soon as they finished their lunch, Robert turned to Ash. &quot;I need to find a shop that sells magic scrolls and books,&quot; he said. Ash considered this.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">&quot;Well, there&#39;s The Bound Book, but they only deal with licensed mages. I doubt they&#39;ll do business with you. It&#39;s in the noble&#39;s district, so we might have some trouble getting in.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Without further hesitation, Ash began to walk, and Robert and Elara followed. Twenty minutes later, they reached a grand gate blocking the</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">road. Two guards emerged, their expressions stern. &quot;State your business, or begone,&quot; one of them demanded.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert stepped forward. &quot;We&#39;re headed to The Bound Book. We&#39;re looking to make a purchase.&quot; The guard eyed them with disdain. &quot;Your master</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">should&#39;ve sent better-looking people,&quot; he sneered. A small crowd had gathered, their curious eyes fixed on the scene. Two particularly well- dressed individuals snickered and pointed at the trio. The other guard, growing impatient, slammed his spear into the ground. &quot;This area is for your betters. Move on, or we&#39;ll move you.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert, unfazed, simply smiled. &quot;I think I&#39;ll have a seat at that caf while my assistant, Ash, runs over to the guard headquarters. Perhaps he can ask Captain Stormheart for a moment of her time.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Ash, ever the showman, saluted with a grin. &quot;As you command, milord.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The first guard, his confidence wavering, interjected. &quot;How do you know Captain Stormheart?&quot; Robert chuckled. &quot;You mean Kaelan? We&#39;re quite</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">familiar.&quot; Before Ash could leave, a man emerged from around the corner. He approached the guards, his demeanor authoritative. &quot;I believe there&#39;s been a misunderstanding. These men will be retrained on proper conduct.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The guards stiffened, their arrogance melting away. &quot;Lieutenant Walsh, sir. What are you doing here?&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Helping you keep your jobs, though that&#39;s still up for debate,&quot; the Lieutenant replied. He pointed at Robert. &quot;Look at that man. That scale</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">armor, likely Tier 5, and he wears it like a second skin. That&#39;s the mark of a skilled warrior. And he&#39;s asking to visit a shop catering to high-level mages, suggesting he&#39;s a mage himself, capable of wearing heavy, high-tier armor. What does all that tell you?&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The first guard&#39;s face paled. &quot;Sir, it means he&#39;s someone we probably don&#39;t want to cross.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Lieutenant Walsh nodded. &quot;Wise choice. Return to your post.&quot; Turning back to Robert, he offered a wry smile. &quot;Please, excuse the interruption. Enjoy</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">your shopping trip.&quot; With that, the guards stepped aside, allowing the trio to pass.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">As they continued, Ash leaned in. &quot;Did you know that Lieutenant was there?&quot; Robert smiled. &quot;Oh, he&#39;s been following us since the guardhouse.&quot; Ash&#39;s eyes widened. &quot;How? I didn&#39;t see anything.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert paused, a thoughtful look on his face. &quot;Perception. It&#39;s a stat that helps you see things others might miss. Mine&#39;s pretty high.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Ash&#39;s eyes sparkled with curiosity. &quot;I thought only nobles and high-level adventurers unlocked stats!&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert chuckled. &quot;Being a noble or an adventurer isn&#39;t a requirement. Hard work is. If you put in the effort, anyone can unlock stats.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Ash&#39;s jaw dropped. &quot;You mean, you&#39;ve unlocked more than one?&quot; Robert simply smiled and continued walking.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">As they approached The Bound Book, a guard stepped forward. &quot;Mage license, please,&quot; he demanded. Robert sighed. &quot;I&#39;m not from this kingdom, and I don&#39;t have a license. But I&#39;m sure the owners wouldn&#39;t mind a little</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">extra business.&quot; The guard remained firm. &quot;No license, no entry. Please</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">move along.&quot; Robert shook his head, a playful glint in his eye. &quot;Well, in that case, I guess the owners here already know every spell in every sphere. I&#39;ll just take my business elsewhere, to a shop that&#39;s actually interested in expanding its knowledge.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Turning to Ash, he asked, &quot;Can you think of another shop in town that wouldn&#39;t mind working with a Tier 6 Inscriptionist?&quot; Before Ash could answer, an older man, draped in ornate robes, materialized before them. &quot;Wait, young man. My guard can be a bit... rigid. The Bound Book is</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">always open to those of your skill level. Please, come in.&quot; Turning toward</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">the door the man nodded to the guard who opened the door, turning back he waved them in.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Entering the shop Robert looked around. The interior of The Bound Book was a sight to behold. The air was thick with the scent of ancient parchment</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">and potent magic, a heady elixir for any spellcaster. Towering bookshelves lined the walls, their shelves groaning under the weight of countless tomes. Each book was a treasure trove of arcane knowledge, its cover adorned with intricate symbols and sigils. The shop was bathed in a soft, ethereal glow, cast by floating orbs of luminescent energy. The light danced across the polished wooden floor, illuminating the countless arcane artifacts scattered about. There were crystal spheres, each humming with a different type of magical energy, strange devices with glowing dials and levers, and even a</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">few ancient scrolls, their fragile parchment whispering secrets of forgotten ages.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Behind a long, ornate counter sat a wizened old man, his eyes twinkling with arcane wisdom. His fingers, gnarled and stained with ink, delicately turned the pages of a thick, leather-bound book. The man was a master of his craft, a guardian of ancient knowledge. He had spent countless hours poring over these books, deciphering their secrets, and unlocking their</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">power. The shop was a place of quiet contemplation, a sanctuary for those seeking knowledge and power. The only sounds were the soft rustle of turning pages and the occasional whisper of wind through a nearby window.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">It was a place where time seemed to slow down, where the worries of the</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">outside world faded away, and where the mind could wander freely through the vast expanse of magical possibilities.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert quickly noticed that the man behind the counter was in fact the man who he had just met outside, with a smile Robert decided magic was wonderful. Looking around at the volume of books Robert began, &quot;So it&#39;s possible you do have every spell known to the System.&quot; The old man laughed and said, &quot;Not even close.&quot; Looking around, &quot;This looks like a lot of knowledge but it&#39;s not. A lot of these are nearly worthless pieces, take</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">this one for example,&quot; He held out his hand and a large book flew from one of the shelves and into his hands, &quot;This book is from the Sphere of Fire, and you would think it&#39;s full of knowledge, but it&#39;s not. This entire book only includes one spell in it. The Tier one spell for ignite&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert approached a bookshelf, his eyes scanning the titles. A particularly intriguing tome caught his attention, its cover adorned with intricate symbols. He pulled it from the shelf and began to flip through the pages.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">&quot;Who wrote this?&quot; Robert asked the old man, his voice laced with disappointment. &quot;Most of this seems to be a glorified essay on the superiority of fire magic. It&#39;s practically worthless.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The old man, Eldrin, chuckled. &quot;There are 968 books in this shop, and only 2,491 spells. Quite a limited selection, isn&#39;t it?&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert was taken aback. &quot;That&#39;s it? I have more spells than that, and I&#39;m just one person.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Eldrin nodded, a hint of sadness in his eyes. &quot;Magic is a tightly controlled resource, guarded by noble houses and arcane schools. It&#39;s taken me nearly three centuries to amass this collection, and even then, it&#39;s far from complete.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert smiled. &quot;Well, while I can&#39;t give you every spell in the system, I can provide copies of numerous spellbooks. Where do you see the biggest gap in your collection?&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Eldrin pondered. &quot;Lesser spells, primarily. New mages and those seeking to become mages often rely on noble houses or magic schools, both of which come with significant costs.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert nodded. &quot;I can inscribe a hundred or so Tier 1 spells from all spheres, and perhaps some Tier 2 spells, depending on the time.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Eldrin&#39;s eyes widened. &quot;You have copies of that many spells? I only know about thirty Tier 1 and twenty-five Tier 2. If you can provide those, I&#39;ll let you copy any spell from my collection that you don&#39;t have.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert was puzzled. &quot;Why such a generous offer? A few Tier 1 and 2 spells hardly match your entire library.&quot; Eldrin sighed. &quot;It&#39;s not about the spells themselves. It&#39;s about spreading knowledge. If you were to share these spells with others, those outside the control of noble houses and schools, that would be a great service. A service I can&#39;t do openly.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Robert understood the implication. Eldrin wanted to democratize magic, to make it accessible to all, not just the privileged few. &quot;Do you happen to</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">have any spare blank books lying around?&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Eldrin chuckled. &quot;As a matter of fact, I do. My workshop is a bit cluttered. And speaking of clutter, the Leaky Cup Tavern has a convenient trash bin. If you have a moment, could you dispose of these?&quot; He handed Robert a box containing six blank books. &quot;Thank you for helping me clear the</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">clutter.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a href="https://oceanofpdf.com/">OceanofPDF.com</a></p><h1 style="padding-top: 2pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a name="bookmark91">&zwnj;</a>Chapter 45<a name="bookmark92">&zwnj;</a></h1><p style="padding-top: 21pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert and the others bid farewell to Eldrin at <i>The Bound Book</i>, and then asked Ash to guide them to a suitable inn. Ash, knowing the perfect place, led them back to the merchant&#39;s district and the inviting inn, The Flowered Pot. Pleased by the inn&#39;s cleanliness and maintenance, Robert approached</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">the counter to inquire about rooms. The innkeeper informed him that rooms cost 10 silver per night, including dinner, a drink, and breakfast. When asked about his own accommodations, Ash assured Robert, &quot;Do not worry, milord. I&#39;ll find a place. Will you need me tomorrow?&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert, without responding, turned back to the innkeeper and booked three rooms for the night, handing over 30 silver. &quot;All three rooms are on the second floor, left side, and are adjacent. Dinner starts in an hour and lasts</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">for three,&quot; the innkeeper explained. Thanking the innkeeper, Robert led the group upstairs, distributing room keys. &quot;Relax in your rooms. I&#39;m going to start working on the spellbook,&quot; he instructed the two children.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Entering his room, Robert retrieved the blank books and his tier 1 master spellbook. Deciding on a 20/60/20 split for combat, utility, and healing spells, he began transferring combat spells to one of the blank books. After an hour, with 30 combat spells completed, a knock interrupted his work. It was Elara and Ash, ready for dinner.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Following dinner, Robert returned to his room and spent the night completing the books. By morning, he had filled all four books with nearly 300 spells, mostly tier 1 and 2, with 25 tier 3 spells for future growth. He noticed that the &quot;Explore the City&quot; quest had been completed, but the third part remained inactive, likely awaiting a trigger. Early that morning, while the children were still asleep, Robert went downstairs to inquire about the tavern&#39;s location. The innkeeper provided directions, and Robert quickly headed there to dispose of the books.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Well, well, well, if it isn&#39;t the esteemed Captain Stormheart,&quot; Robert greeted the woman, taking a seat across from her. &quot;Quite the surprise to see you here.&quot; The Captain chuckled, a playful glint in her eye. &quot;Please, tell me</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">that wasn&#39;t a pickup line. Because it was a terrible one.&quot; Robert smirked. &quot;My wife would certainly agree. But seriously, what brings you to this</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">humble inn? Not for the world-class cuisine, I presume.&quot; He gestured towards the waitress and ordered the same meal as the Captain. &quot;So, what&#39;s the real reason behind your visit, Kaelan?&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;How long do you plan to stay in the city?&quot; she asked Robert. Robert paused, considering his answer. &quot;I don&#39;t know for sure,&quot; he replied, a hint of unease in his voice. &quot;Perhaps another day or so. Is there a problem?&quot; A</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">silence fell over the table as the server arrived with Robert&#39;s breakfast.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Once she left, Kaelan spoke up. &quot;There wasn&#39;t a problem until someone mentioned my name at the gate to the noble district. It seems to be a question now regarding our relationship, and now I&#39;m fielding questions about you and your business here.&quot; Robert shifted uncomfortably. &quot;I</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">apologize for the misunderstanding. I wanted to avoid unnecessary questioning from your guards, so I...implied a closer relationship than we actually have. Perhaps I was a bit hasty.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;I&#39;m not worried about the guards, they&#39;ve been reassigned and will not</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">have a happy few months, the issue is that there were two men there who heard. One of them was the son of an Earl and he told his father about what happened, his father went to Duke Marcisiant who happens to be my uncle, he of course sent for me to find out who this strange man was who seemed to be on a first name basis with me,&quot; Kaelan told Robert. &quot;Ouch, ya I figured you were high up, seeing how your status page showed some relation to the Royal Family, but related to a Duke, congrats.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">That being said, I am sorry for causing you issues,&quot; Robert replied sadly, &quot;That being said, the System normally sends me back home as soon as I</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">complete whatever task I was given, which shouldn&#39;t take much longer, just need it to tell me what that is.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Kaelan paused, then asked, &quot;So, where are you on your quest?&quot; Robert pulled out his quest sheet. &quot;I finished the second step, but the third hasn&#39;t appeared yet.&quot; Just as he finished, a distant bell began to toll. Captain Stormheart abruptly stood up. &quot;I must go. Enjoy your breakfast,&quot; she said,</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">rushing out the door. Robert noticed the concerned looks of the other patrons.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He called over the innkeeper and asked what the bell signified. The</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">innkeeper replied, &quot;That&#39;s the alarm for an impending attack.&quot; Before he could fully process the news, Elara and Ash burst into the inn. Spotting Robert, they hurried over to his table. Ash&#39;s face was etched with worry. &quot;I&#39;ve never heard that bell before,&quot; he said. Robert, still a bit bewildered, prompted, &quot;Explain.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Ash explained quickly, &quot;Everyone in the city knows about the bells. That one&#39;s near the north gate. Three long, two short rings mean an attack&#39;s imminent.&quot; Before Robert could delve deeper, he received the expected notification:</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:33.0pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 11pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The next Part of the Quest Chain has been Added!</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 1pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><table style="border-collapse:collapse;margin-left:6.625pt" cellspacing="0"><tr style="height:19pt"><td
