Head to the north gate and provide aid.</p></td><td style="width:127pt;border-top-style:solid;border-top-width:1pt;border-top-color:#EDEDED;border-left-style:solid;border-left-width:1pt;border-left-color:#EDEDED;border-bottom-style:solid;border-bottom-width:1pt;border-bottom-color:#EDEDED;border-right-style:solid;border-right-width:1pt;border-right-color:#EDEDED"><p class="s8" style="padding-top: 8pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">2500 exp, increased reputation with the City of Lunaris</p></td><td style="width:82pt;border-top-style:solid;border-top-width:1pt;border-top-color:#EDEDED;border-left-style:solid;border-left-width:1pt;border-left-color:#EDEDED;border-bottom-style:solid;border-bottom-width:1pt;border-bottom-color:#EDEDED;border-right-style:solid;border-right-width:1pt;border-right-color:#EDEDED"><p class="s8" style="padding-right: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">This is the third part of a quest chain.</p></td></tr></table><p style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Elara confirmed she&#39;d received her quest as well, but hers was different: she was to stay with Robert and learn. Turning to Ash, Robert said, &quot;We need to head to the gate. I&#39;m releasing you from your service. Find a safe place to stay.&quot; Robert handed him three silver coins and urged them to finish their breakfast quickly. With a luck wish, Ash took off. Robert and Elara quickly donned their armor and bid the innkeeper farewell before heading towards</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">the north gate.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">As they approached the North Gate, they noticed heightened activity. Guards were bustling about, and Robert spotted what looked like soldiers mixed in with them. They made their way towards Lieutenant Walsh, who was directing a group of guards. &quot;Good morning, Lieutenant,&quot; Robert greeted him. &quot;Seems like a busy morning for you all.&quot; Walsh glanced over. &quot;Ah, Milord Williams, good morning. Yes, it&#39;s quite hectic. Is there</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">something specific you need assistance with?&quot; Robert smiled. &quot;Actually, I&#39;m here to offer my assistance. The System has tasked me with helping defend the North Wall. Where might I be most useful?&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Walsh paused, then asked, &quot;You&#39;re saying your quest requires you to help defend the city?&quot; Robert, a bit puzzled, replied, &quot;Yes. I got the quest update after the alarm sounded.&quot; Walsh considered this. &quot;Normally, we don&#39;t need help from adventurers. But the System granting you this quest is...beyond my authority. Let&#39;s go find someone who can handle this.&quot; With that, Walsh turned and headed towards the nearby guardhouse. Robert and Elara followed closely behind. They ascended a set of stairs leading to the upper wall. At the top, Walsh spotted Captain Stormheart and a group of others.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He approached the Captain and whispered something in her ear, then quickly turned and headed back downstairs.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Captain Stormheart sighed and gestured for Robert to approach. &quot;Mr. Williams,&quot; she began, &quot;please explain why you&#39;re here.&quot; Robert, a bit unsure, replied, &quot;Well, I received a quest. The System gives you quests it expects you to complete.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The others in the group seemed to perk up at the mention of a quest. &quot;Mr. Williams,&quot; Stormheart asked, &quot;can you provide the details of this quest?&quot; Robert opened his quest window and shared the details with her. She shook her head. &quot;Well, that&#39;s not much to go on. It simply tasks you with aiding</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">the city in defending the North Gate.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">One of the men, the oldest of them stepped near and asked, &quot;Captain, who is this man and why is he here, this is not the place nor the time for civilians to be on the wall.&quot; Stoneheart standing at attention replied, &quot;Duke Nariantian may I introduce Robert Williams, it seems he was sent to our fair city on order from the Great System and has been issued a quest to help defend the gate.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The Duke, eyeing Robert with disinterest, asked, &quot;Why would we want help from this man and the child he brought?&quot; Robert, a bit irritated, replied, &quot;She&#39;s my student. And while I usually complete quests, I have no problem failing this one if I&#39;m not wanted. Besides, I need to see Eldrin at the Bound Book. Good luck with the defense.&quot; He nodded to the Duke and turned to</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">leave. &quot;Wait,&quot; Stormheart called out. &quot;I know you&#39;re new to the Kingdom. You wouldn&#39;t have a license, would you? What business do you have at that shop?&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert turned back, smirking. &quot;Oh, we&#39;re just discussing magic. Seems he hasn&#39;t had many opportunities to talk to someone with several Tier 6 Spheres. Elara, let&#39;s leave the professionals to their work.&quot; Robert and Elara hadn&#39;t taken three steps before a voice boomed, &quot;Halt! I did not give you</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">leave to leave my presence,&quot; the Duke declared. &quot;What is a Grand Master Mage doing passing through our Kingdom?&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert paused, considering his response. &quot;I was taking my student through her first dungeon run when the System decided to interrupt and provide a more suitable learning opportunity.&quot; The Duke raised an eyebrow. &quot;Why would the System take such an interest in you? I&#39;ve never heard of it paying that much attention to anyone.&quot; &quot;That&#39;s a question I can&#39;t answer,&quot; Robert replied. &quot;Can&#39;t or won&#39;t?&quot; the Duke pressed. &quot;Sir,&quot; Robert said carefully,</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;please forgive my ignorance. On my world, while some countries have nobility, it&#39;s mostly in title. I&#39;m not quite sure how to address you without causing offense. Some things, the System keeps to itself.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Are you willing to aid in the defense of our city?&quot; the Duke asked. &quot;That depends on what&#39;s attacking,&quot; Robert replied honestly. &quot;I know little of your political landscape. I won&#39;t start killing people without knowing it&#39;s the right thing to do.&quot; The Duke smiled. &quot;That makes you a better man than most I deal with. This is a dungeon overflow. We&#39;ll be facing monsters.&quot; Robert, confused, asked, &quot;How did this happen, and what kind of monsters are we dealing with?&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Captain Stormheart stepped in to explain. &quot;We believe someone tried to destroy the dungeon&#39;s core but stopped before finishing. It&#39;s a common</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">tactic to weaken a place before a larger attack. As for the monsters, it&#39;s bad. The dungeon was level 75 to 100, and thousands of creatures are on the loose. They&#39;ve already destroyed several villages on their way here.&quot; &quot;How long until they arrive?&quot; Robert asked. &quot;Within minutes,&quot; The Captain answered. Robert nodded and asked, &quot;So where do you want me?&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a href="https://oceanofpdf.com/">OceanofPDF.com</a></p><h1 style="padding-top: 2pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a name="bookmark93">&zwnj;</a>Chapter 46<a name="bookmark94">&zwnj;</a></h1><p style="padding-top: 21pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert quickly looked over at a group of guards who called out and pointed toward the woods, looking in the direction he saw the first group of monsters exiting the tree. They were Goblins, and the numbers kept increasing, within seconds there were hundreds of the little green killing machines grouping together and preparing to charge the wall. Turning to Stoneheart she saw his look and replied, &quot;Save your Mana, these are not worth it.&quot; Robert had a confused look on his face which caused Captain Stoneheart to continue, &quot;Goblins are easy and these are only in the 50s. It&#39;s good experience for the guard, and we would rather save your Mana to break up the more power charges.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert looked at the group of Goblins which looked to now be nearly 500 to 600 strong and shrugged, &quot;Up to you, but I could wipe them all out in moments and wouldn&#39;t even notice the Mana expenditure.&quot; The Duke hearing this asked, &quot;How much Mana does a mid-tier spell cost?&quot; Robert looking over his spellbook replied, &quot;Depends on the spell, but I was thinking about a Firestorm, it&#39;s a Fire and Air spell, Tier 5, can cover up to a 3 square-mile area, and requires 1188 Mana.&quot; The Duke with a slightly shocked look asked, &quot;How much damage would that do?&quot; Robert looking</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">over the numbers replied, &quot;About 127 health,&quot; With that the Duke seemed relieved until Robert added, &quot;Per second, the storm will last for about 48 seconds. So assuming those Goblins do not have any resistance, about 6000 points of health damage.&quot; With those final words Robert noticed the area around him had gotten quiet, &quot;I know it&#39;s not a lot when going against high- level targets, but I&#39;m thinking it&#39;d be perfect against goblins.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Robert, that would kill nearly everyone on the wall, how many times could you cast that if you need to?&quot; Captain Stormheart said quietly. Robert thought it over and answered, &quot;Maybe 40 or so times.&quot; Duke Nariantian upon hearing that looked closer at Robert, &quot;Well I cannot identify you so I&#39;m guessing your level is in the hundreds, I will not ask what your second class is but if you want to take care of our problem here, I&#39;ll not stop you.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert looking a little guilty that they viewed him as being way more powerful than he was kept quiet and just watched the goblins awaiting their charge. At some unseen signal, the goblins with a massive roar launched</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">their charge, In response, Robert, a renowned wizard, stood tall. His eyes, filled with a calm determination, focused on the advancing horde. With a swift gesture of his hand, he began to weave a complex spell, his voice echoing with ancient incantations. The air crackled with magic as the power surged through him.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The moment the goblins launched their charge, Robert unleashed the Firestorm spell. A colossal, swirling vortex of flame erupted from the ground, directly in the path of the advancing horde. The goblins, caught off guard by the sudden and intense heat, were engulfed by the inferno.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The ensuing chaos was terrifying. The air crackled with searing heat, and the screams of the goblins were drowned out by the roaring flames. The</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">once fearsome horde was quickly reduced to ash, their bodies consumed by the relentless fire.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Some goblins, caught on the fringes of the inferno, writhed in agony, their flesh melting and bones cracking under the intense heat. The defenders watched in awe as the Firestorm raged, a testament to Robert&#39;s incredible</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">power. Within a mere 15 seconds, the Firestorm had claimed the lives of all 800 goblins.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The spell continued to burn for another 23 seconds, leaving behind a blackened and desolate landscape. The charred remains of the goblins, scattered across the ground, were a stark reminder of the devastating power of the Firestorm. As the flames finally died down, a silence fell over the battlefield. The defenders, stunned by the sheer power and swiftness of the attack, stared in disbelief at the aftermath. The once-threatening horde was now nothing more than a grim memory, a testament to the destructive force of magic.</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:33.0pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 1pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 1pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:33.0pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Level Up!</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert was surprised by the level-ups, but then as he thought about it he did just kill nearly 800 level-50 goblins. The aftermath of the Firestorm was a stark contrast to the chaos that had preceded it. A heavy silence hung over</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">the wall as the defenders processed what they had just witnessed. The once- threatening goblin horde had been utterly obliterated, their charred remains a testament to the sheer power of Robert&#39;s spell. The Duke, still recovering from the shock of witnessing such raw power, approached Robert.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;You have proven yourself to be a formidable asset,&quot; he said, his voice filled with respect. &quot;I am curious, what is your true level?&quot; Robert, hesitant to reveal his full capabilities, replied, &quot;It&#39;s...complicated. Let&#39;s just say I&#39;ve had some unique experiences.&quot; The Duke nodded, understanding the implication. &quot;Regardless, your contribution has been invaluable.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Moving closer to Captain Stormheart, Robert began, &quot;Kaelan, any word on the next wave?&quot; Kaelan, still gazing at the ravaged landscape, replied slowly, &quot;Orcs. A large group, maybe 300 to 400 strong. Our scouts estimate they&#39;re about half an hour out.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert nodded, considering the situation. &quot;What do you think they&#39;ll make of this?&quot; he asked, gesturing towards the decimated field. &quot;Nothing,&quot; Kaelan replied, a touch of weariness in her voice. &quot;They&#39;re mindless creatures, driven by the dungeon&#39;s will.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert turned to Elara, a young sorceress with a spark of raw power in her eyes. &quot;When the next wave arrives, use this scroll,&quot; he said, handing her a</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">powerful artifact. &quot;It should grant you significant experience, perhaps even a more powerful class. If nothing else you should earn a Feat&quot; Elara&#39;s eyes widened in surprise. &quot;Are you sure? It&#39;s incredibly powerful.&quot; Robert smiled. &quot;I made it last night. I can always make another.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Kaelan, ever the cautious one, interjected, &quot;What kind of spell is it?&quot; &quot;A Tier 5 Lightning Storm,&quot; Robert replied. Kaelan&#39;s eyes widened. &quot;A Tier 5 spell? To a level 5 novice?&quot; Robert chuckled. &quot;She&#39;ll be more than level 5 soon enough. This should accelerate her growth.&quot; Kaelan just shook her</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">head and replied, &quot;Just be careful, growing too fast can be hard on a person, she needs time to learn her strength.&quot; &quot;Oh I agree, that scroll is a weaker version of the spell, she&#39;ll get 6 or 7 levels out of it, but that&#39;s all, the feat is more important.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert sat down to rest, while they waited for the Orcs to arrive. After about 20 minutes the first of them exited the woods and started to gather</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">together. It took about another 40 minutes for the entire horde to arrive but when it did, Robert guessed there were nearly 400 of them gathered. Robert called Elara over and pointed, &quot;Once they charge let them get going and then use the scroll, remember focus on where you want the spell to land, Try to aim right at the front of the line.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Elara nodded and watched the Orcs, only about another minute went by</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">before they started their charge. With a deep breath, she unfurled the Scroll of Lightning Storm. The air crackled with energy as the spell took effect. A furious storm erupted overhead, the sky darkening as thunderclouds rolled in. Lightning bolts, thick and jagged, arced down from the heavens, striking the orc horde. For thirty seconds, the storm raged. The orcs, caught in the lightning&#39;s wrath, were struck down in droves. Their screams mingled with the thunder, a cacophony of fear and pain.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">When the storm finally subsided, the once-mighty orc horde was significantly diminished, with over forty of their number reduced to charred husks and the rest hurt. While the spell had harmed the horde and slowed it down it did not stop them, Robert placed his hand on Elara&#39;s shoulder,</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Well done, now let me finish up,&quot; With that Robert cast his own version of the Lightning Storm spell, to anyone watching they could tell the</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">difference. The spell Robert cast lasted longer and the bolts were more numerous and powerful.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">When the air cleared the horde was no more. Robert looking over at Elara asked, &quot;So how did you do?&quot; With a smile, she answered, &quot;I&#39;m at level 10 and I earned two feats,&quot; Elara pulled up her stat page and showed 14pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Well, that was unexpected,&quot; Robert mused, gazing at the newly activated quest. Kaelan&#39;s brow furrowed in confusion. &quot;So, what was the real purpose of our mission here?&quot; Duke Nariantian, deep in thought, offered an explanation. &quot;I believe it was to grant Elara a unique opportunity to</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">participate in this battle. I can&#39;t predict her exact class, but I&#39;m certain it will</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">be either Epic or, perhaps, even Legendary.&quot; Robert paused, considering the implications. &quot;You&#39;re probably right. But why would the System go to such lengths to set her up like this?&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The Duke chuckled. &quot;I&#39;ve learned not to question the System&#39;s motives. It&#39;s a futile endeavor. Thank you for your assistance. You&#39;ve eliminated the majority of the attacking monsters, leaving the rest to us. Safe travels, Mr. Williams.&quot; As the portal materialized, Robert pulled out another scroll and handed it to Captain Stormheart. &quot;If things worsen, use this. It&#39;s the same Firestorm I employed against the goblins. Come, Elara, let&#39;s return home.&quot; With that, Robert and Elara stepped through the portal.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:33.0pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Quest Complete!</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a href="https://oceanofpdf.com/">OceanofPDF.com</a></p><h1 style="padding-top: 2pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a name="bookmark95">&zwnj;</a>Chapter 47<a name="bookmark96">&zwnj;</a></h1><p style="padding-top: 21pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;It&#39;s the middle of the night,&quot; Robert muttered, startled. &quot;Hal, what happened to time? How long were we gone?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">ime flowed differently there, you were gone for fourteen hours here, thirty-one in Lunaris.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert blinked at the alarm clock, the red numbers mocking him: 3:42 AM. &quot;Seriously?&quot; he groaned, raking a hand through his already-disheveled hair. Time dilation was a cruel mistress. He felt like he&#39;d barely closed his eyes. He glanced over at Elara, who looked about as lively as a wilted flower. &quot;Hey, you look exhausted. Go get some rest. Unpack, or just crash,</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">whatever. We&#39;ll deal with all this class selection stuff in the morning. After a</p><p class="s5" style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">lot <span class="p">of caffeine. Sound good?&quot;</span></p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Elara gave him a small, grateful smile. &quot;Sounds good. More than good, actually. I&#39;ll see you later.&quot; Robert, ever cautious  old habits were hard to break  secured the door locks before heading for his own room. He dumped his gear unceremoniously; organization could wait. A shower was all he wanted right now, just to rinse off the feeling of being somewhere...else. But, as the water began to run, the bathroom door opened, and Sara stepped in, a knowing smile playing on her lips.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Welcome back,&quot; she murmured, her voice a soft invitation. &quot;Need any help...getting comfortable?&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">...Hours later, with the sun well risen and warming the world, Robert found Elara on the back porch, gazing out at the landscape. He settled into a chair beside her, keeping a comfortable distance. &quot;So,&quot; he began casually, &quot;what&#39;s got you so deep in thought? Planning your next adventure already?&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">She chuckled softly. &quot;Not quite. Just thinking. It&#39;s strange, isn&#39;t it? A whole different world, but some things are the same. My mother always used to say, &#39;a copper for your thoughts,&#39; not a penny.&quot; Robert&#39;s smile softened, understanding flooding him. &quot;You miss them. I&#39;m so sorry, Elara. I wish I could have been there faster.&quot; Elara turned to him, her eyes suddenly bright</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">and firm. &quot;Don&#39;t you dare, Robert. It was the gremlins. Vile little things. You saved who you could, and you gave me a home, a future I never thought possible. You don&#39;t give yourself nearly enough credit.&quot; He smiled, a little embarrassed now. &quot;Okay, okay, I hear you. And you&#39;re pretty amazing yourself. Just, maybe, try not to curse quite so much around me, alright?&quot; He paused, then shifted gears. &quot;Anyway! Big day. Level 10. Ready to choose your destiny?&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">She shifted a little, her earlier confidence wavering. &quot;I&#39;m excited, I am, but also...nervous. What if I haven&#39;t done well enough? What if I&#39;m only</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">offered, like... apprentice stablehand?&quot; Robert barked out a laugh. &quot;Not a chance. Never going to happen. Come on, let&#39;s do this. Get it started.&quot; Elara took a deep breath and activated the Class Selection. You wouldn&#39;t be on the front lines swinging a sword, but you&#39;d be shaping the flow of battle, influencing events from the shadows. A different kind of power, but power nonetheless.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Elara frowned slightly, a thoughtful crease appearing between her brows. &quot;I... style="width:272pt;border-top-style:solid;border-top-width:1pt;border-top-color:#EDEDED;border-left-style:solid;border-left-width:1pt;border-left-color:#EDEDED;border-bottom-style:solid;border-bottom-width:1pt;border-bottom-color:#EDEDED;border-right-style:solid;border-right-width:1pt;border-right-color:#EDEDED"><p class="s8" style="padding-left: 1pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">effect. By channeling their energy and focus, they can unleash a powerful blast of energy, a blinding flash of light, a whirlwind of air, a haunting illusion, or a wave of healing</p><p class="s8" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">energy. The specific effect depends on the Arcanist&#39;s intent and the current situation.</p><p class="s8" style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 11pt;padding-right: 10pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">This ability requires careful planning and precise execution, as it can be draining to use. However, when used correctly, it can</p><p class="s8" style="padding-left: 62pt;text-indent: -61pt;text-align: justify;">turn the tide of battle and bring victory to the Arcanist and their allies.</p></td></tr></table><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert&#39;s gaze lingered on the description of Celestial Symphony, a slow nod of his head the only outward sign of his assessment. &quot;That, Elara,&quot; he said, his voice low and serious, &quot;is an ability of extraordinary power. Master it, and you could change the course of any battle.&quot; Elara practically vibrated with excitement, a wide grin splitting her face. &quot;I know! And, guess what?</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Four more levels, just like that!&quot; Robert&#39;s eyebrows shot up in surprise.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Fourteen? Remarkable progress. Which means,&quot; he added, his tone shifting to one of gentle guidance, &quot;you have another Sphere choice to make. Don&#39;t rush that, Elara. It&#39;s a decision that will profoundly shape your magical destiny.&quot; Elara nodded, her initial exuberance calming into a focused determination, a silent acknowledgment passing between them before she turned and headed off to find the others, leaving Robert to contemplate the</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">immense potential now unfolding before him.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a href="https://oceanofpdf.com/">OceanofPDF.com</a></p><h1 style="padding-top: 2pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a name="bookmark97">&zwnj;</a>Chapter 48<a name="bookmark98">&zwnj;</a></h1><p style="padding-top: 21pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Entering the home, they found Sara preparing a late breakfast. Upon seeing them, she inquired, &quot;So, is it settled?&quot; Elara, beaming with excitement, confirmed, &quot;Yes! I found the perfect class.&quot; Sara smiled warmly and replied, &quot;I&#39;m so happy for you, dear. Are you hungry?&quot; Elara nodded, taking a seat at the table. &quot;I am, thank you.&quot; As they ate, the other children joined them, and Elara eagerly shared her news. Robert, content in the company of his family, including Elara whom he considered one of their own, simply enjoyed the moment.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">After a leisurely breakfast, Robert retreated to his office to plan the coming days. He was eager to delve deeper into the art of scroll-making, but his limited supplies necessitated a strategic approach. He envisioned crafting scrolls that would be both practical for his family and worthy of presentation to the government. As his thoughts turned to the government, he pondered the most effective way to engage with them. Visiting a military hospital still seemed like the best course of action, but the specifics of how to best execute this plan remained unclear.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert lost in thought, picked up a quill and began to sketch intricate patterns on a blank spell scroll. His hand moved with practiced ease, the delicate lines and precise angles a testament to his mastery of the arcane. Each stroke was deliberate, each curve intentional, as he channeled his magical energy into the parchment. Hours slipped by as he crafted ten identical scrolls, each imbued with a Tier 4 protection spell designed to shield the bearer from almost any threat. The air crackled with magical</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">energy as he completed each scroll, a tangible manifestation of his skill. Satisfied with his work, Robert stored the scrolls in his family&#39;s vault.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Turning his attention to his family, he gathered his children and asked, &quot;What would you like to learn today?&quot; John, ever the curious one, requested the General Power Production Design skill. Richard, the budding warrior, opted for martial arts, while Stacey, surprisingly, expressed interest in cooking. Robert, a skilled teacher, imparted the knowledge, tailoring his instruction to each child&#39;s unique learning style.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">After the lesson, John, his mind buzzing with newfound knowledge, exclaimed, &quot;Dad, I think I could build a basic nuclear reactor right now if I had the parts!&quot; Robert chuckled, &quot;Maybe, but let&#39;s hold off on that for now. In two weeks, I&#39;ll teach you about anti-matter. That&#39;s where things get really interesting.&quot; The father and son chatted for a few more minutes, sharing ideas and discussing the limitless possibilities of knowledge. Then, John took his leave to share his excitement with friends.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">A short time later Robert call his Sister Emily, &quot;So, about Walter Reed,&quot; Robert begins, a thoughtful tone in his voice. &quot;I&#39;ve been pondering a more direct approach. I could use my abilities to slip into the hospital undetected, heal the wounded soldiers, and then reveal myself. It would be a bold move, but it could also be quite impactful.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Emily considered the proposal. &quot;It&#39;s a risky plan, Robert. A heavily guarded military hospital won&#39;t be easy to infiltrate. You&#39;ll need to be incredibly cautious and precise. Perhaps using a combination of illusion and stealth spells could help you bypass security. You could create a minor distraction, like a small illusion, to divert attention from yourself or employ an invisibility spell to move unseen.&quot; &quot;Exactly,&quot; Robert agreed. &quot;Once inside, I can use my healing magic to treat the wounded soldiers. The potential rewards of such an action are significant, but the risks must be carefully weighed.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Pulling up an online map of the hospital, Robert noticed a lack of detailed information regarding patient locations. &quot;It might take some time to pinpoint the most critical areas once I&#39;m inside,&quot; he mused. &quot;But I believe my invisibility spell, lasting approximately 45 minutes, can provide the necessary cover. I&#39;ll find a secluded spot to use tracking spells to locate the most severely injured patients. Then, employing stealth and additional spells, I&#39;ll navigate to their locations and begin the healing process.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert and Emily spent the next twenty minutes refining their plan. Robert would enter the hospital under the cloak of invisibility, seeking a concealed location near the hospital&#39;s center. Once there, he would utilize tracking spells to identify a large group of injured patients and make his way towards them. To draw attention to his presence, he would target a sleeping patient, causing their monitor to alarm. As medical staff rushed to</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">investigate, he would reveal himself, casting a highly visible healing spell on the nearest patients. Then, slipping back into invisibility, he would move on to the next group, repeating the process.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Once he was certain the hospital staff was aware of the mysterious healer, Robert would head to the intensive care unit to perform more complex healing. This would likely spark intense curiosity and speculation among the medical professionals. After completing approximately ten healing cycles, he would announce a public speech in one of the hospital&#39;s auditoriums. Gathering a crowd, he would reveal his ability to heal and</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">offer proof of his extraordinary power. If everything went according to plan, the hospital&#39;s leadership would be eager to engage with him. From there, Robert envisioned a rapid progression of events. While the plan was far from perfect, it offered a glimmer of hope and a chance to make a real</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">difference. If successful, it could potentially attract the attention of government agencies and military organizations.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;So, the next question is, When?&quot; Emily asked. Robert pondered the timing. &quot;In about three weeks. I&#39;ll head to D.C. in a couple of weeks to verify the details and ensure there aren&#39;t any high-profile individuals present. While attracting attention could be beneficial, it might also complicate matters.&quot; Emily remained silent for a moment, considering the implications. &quot;That sounds like a solid plan. Well, then, good luck.&quot; They chatted for a few</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">more minutes, exchanging pleasantries before ending the call. Robert then sought out Sara to share the latest planning.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Things continued for the next three days until Robert made his next dungeon run, the only real thing of note was the store having several Tier 4 books, including Healing, space, and Nature, which he purchased for 800 gold. This was another desert run that contained level 55 to 60 monsters and a level 65 boss. The level wasn&#39;t that hard, except the boss tended to keep digging through the sand. It was a pain and took nearly an hour, but the reward was well worth it.</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 187%;text-align: left;">Dungeon run complete: Epic chest awarded. Chest contains:</h3><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p class="s5" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">One Spell Scroll (Lesser Raise Dead) 25 gold coins</p><p class="s5" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Two basic skill points</p><p class="s5" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">One unlocked skill point</p><h3 style="padding-top: 14pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Items added to user inventory.</h3><h3 style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Thank you for visiting The Training Dungeon!</h3><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 13pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Looking at the scroll he was excited, this was one spell he was really looking forward to, until he read the description:</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;min-height:346.5pt;width:311.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="s8">: Scroll of </span><i>Lesser Raise Dead</i></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Tier<span class="s8">: 4</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Rank<span class="s8">: Rare</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="s8">: To cast Lesser Raise Dead, the caster must be within sight of the recently deceased and</span></p><p class="s8" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">initiate the spell within thirty minutes of death. A pulse of radiant energy, tinged with an ethereal blue, emanates from the caster&#39;s hands and flows into the lifeless body. The body begins to stir, muscles twitching as life is breathed back into them. However, this is a fragile state. The newly</p><p class="s8" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">revived being is vulnerable, their life force tethered to the spell&#39;s duration. Should the cause of death persist, such as mortal wounds or fatal illnesses,</p><p class="s8" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">the revived being will simply perish once more. Therefore, it is imperative to address the underlying cause of death, whether it be physical injury or magical affliction. Only then can the revived being truly live.</p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Charges<span class="s8">: 1</span></p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The thirty-minute time constraint was the first limitation Robert noticed.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The second, and perhaps more significant, was the requirement to address the underlying cause of death. With modern medical knowledge, it seemed</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">that many deaths could be reversed simply through timely medical intervention. Nevertheless, Robert learned the spell, recognizing its potential utility in situations beyond the confines of a hospital. He contacted his sister, Emily, to share his findings. She agreed that the spell, while limited, could still prove valuable in certain circumstances. At the end he thought the level he earned was probably better.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert continued the same routine for 4 days before it was time for the next run. This was another mine, with Level 60 Greater Kobolds, which his guardian spell seemed to make short work out of. This run did net him</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">another level, but the interesting thing was from the mines, he mined a lot of iron and a little silver but the best find was the single vein of mithril. He was able to extract enough to form perhaps 4 ingots.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;left:0.4pt;min-height:217.5pt;top:0.4pt;width:287.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 187%;text-align: left;">Dungeon run complete: Epic chest awarded. Chest contains:</p><p class="s9" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">One Spell Scroll (Temporal Ward) 25 gold coins</p><p class="s9" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Two basic skill points</p><p class="s9" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">One unlocked skill point</p><p class="s6" style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Items added to user inventory.</p><p class="s6" style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Thank you for visiting The Training Dungeon!</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">This spell was interesting:</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 17pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="p">: Scroll of Temporal Ward</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Tier<span class="p">: 5</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Rank<span class="p">: Epic</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="p">: Creates a protective barrier around a target area or individual, slowing down time within the barrier. This significantly reduces the speed of attacks, spells, and other</span></h3><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">effects within the ward, making it an</p><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">invaluable defensive tool. Additionally, the ward can distort space within its boundaries, making it difficult for enemies to enter or</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">target those inside.</p><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Charges<span class="p">: 1</span></h3><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 13pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The potential applications of the Temporal Ward spell were immediately apparent to Robert. As the date of his public reveal drew near, a sense of anticipation and tension filled the household. To prepare for the upcoming challenges, Robert crafted several powerful artifacts, including a staff adorned with diamonds that held the Lesser Raise Dead spell. He planned to use these items as bargaining chips in his negotiations with the government figures.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a href="https://oceanofpdf.com/">OceanofPDF.com</a></p><h1 style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a name="bookmark99">&zwnj;</a>Chapter 49<a name="bookmark100">&zwnj;</a></h1><p style="padding-top: 21pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The following week was much of the same. Robert diligently expanded his spellbook and conquered two more dungeons. The first, an island teeming with colossal apes, and the second, a shadowy cavern filled with the undead. While the shops offered nothing extraordinary, the final boss of the second dungeon rewarded him with a truly magnificent staff, one that immediately captured his heart. And as if that wasn&#39;t enough, he leveled up three times over the course of the week.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;min-height:363.8pt;width:335.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 17pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="s8">: The Architect&#39;s Staff</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Tier<span class="s8">: 6</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Rank<span class="s8">: Epic</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="s8">: Soul Bound to Robert Williams, A colossal staff, 80 inches tall with mithril-inlaid runes covering the staff, forged from the essence of the cosmos itself. Its form is ever-changing, adapting to</span></p><p class="s8" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">the wielder&#39;s needs. It hums with the power of creation, allowing its wielder to shape the world according to</p><p class="s8" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">their will. The staff is adorned with countless symbols of creation and destruction, each imbued with immense power. Has three powers: Cosmic Forge, Passively restores creative energy over time, and increases the potency of creation and restoration magic. Reality Warp, Allows the wielder to manipulate the fabric of reality, creating objects, altering terrain, and healing wounds on a grand scale(Charges expended based upon use). Divine Construction, Summons a celestial construct to aid the wielder in battle or construction projects(30 Charges per use).</p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Charges<span class="s8">: 120(Recharageable)</span></p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Dungeon run complete: Rare chest awarded.</h3><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 17pt;text-align: left;">Chest contains:</h3><p class="s5" style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Ten Gold coins</p><p class="s5" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Two Standard Skill Points One Epic Shop Token</p><h3 style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Items added to user inventory.</h3><h3 style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Thank you for visiting The Training Dungeon!</h3><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 13pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">As it was nearing time for Robert to head to DC, he took the time to talk to Hal, regarding his Free points, &quot;Hal I think I&#39;ve banked too many points,</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">where should I put them?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">As I&#39;ve mentioned, I cannot dictate your actions. However, if you seek advice, I&#39;d recommend focusing on bolstering your weaker attributes and potentially rounding out your Constitution.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Looking over his status page, he agreed, so he spent 75 points and moved his attributes to as follows:</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><table style="border-collapse:collapse;margin-left:170.875pt" cellspacing="0"><tr style="height:18pt"><td unused points, Robert decided he was as prepared as he could be. The following day, he relished a much-needed break, spending quality</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">time with his family. Unfortunately, the respite ended too soon. The next</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">morning, he boarded a flight to DC and checked into a hotel near Walter Reed National Military Medical Center.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The following day, he began his reconnaissance mission at the hospital&#39;s</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">visitor center. Approaching the information desk, he asked a volunteer, &quot;My brother is expected to transfer here in a few days. Could you please explain the visiting process once he arrives?&quot; The volunteer smiled and replied, &quot;To visit a patient at Walter Reed, you&#39;ll need to contact your brother&#39;s unit to confirm visiting hours, present a valid government-issued ID at the Visitor Control Center, and complete a visitor pass form based on your relationship. Since you&#39;re his brother, you won&#39;t need the form if he can</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">authorize your visit. Always check the hospital&#39;s website for the latest</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">visitor guidelines and potential restrictions. It&#39;s worth noting that VIP visits might temporarily limit access.&quot; Robert smiled back and replied, &quot;Thank you, I&#39;m sure he knows the process, but he&#39;s my older brother and you know how they can be. I&#39;ll call him later today and remind him. Thank you for</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">your time.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">After that, Robert left the hospital after taking note of where security seemed to be. Returning to his hotel he called Sara to let her know he had finished his inspection of the target. He spent about 45 minutes on the</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">phone just talking to her and enjoying the break. The following morning Robert got up and ate breakfast and then returned to his room. Robert put on his armor, picked up his staff, and checked his inventory to make sure he had everything. Casting an invisibility spell he headed up to the rooftop pool of the hotel. Once there he walked to the end of the roof toward the hospital and used a blink spell to teleport down to the road. Several blinks</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">later he arrived at the first vehicle checkpoint leading into the hospital area. It was here that Robert knew something was going on. The checkpoint had twice the guards and two extra vehicles.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert slipped past the checkpoint, his eyes scanning for an opening. Spotting a staff entrance, he ducked inside, noticing the heightened security. It was clear that someone important was in the hospital. He waited for an opportunity, then slipped through the door and into the bustling hospital.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Dodging the crowd, he finally learned the cause of the commotion: Secretary of State Frank Davenport was in critical condition. A group of</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">men stood guard near the emergency room. Any word on the Secretary? one asked. Not yet, but the Presidents on her way, another replied. Its not good.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Heading in that direction he was able to locate where they were working on Secretary Davenport. Outside the room where a large group of people but</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">before Robert could decide what to do, the President arrived. &quot;Victoria, how is he?&quot; asked President Harrington. &quot;Oh Elizabeth, he&#39;s not doing good. The doctors are sure it&#39;s a Cerebral Aneurysm, they are getting ready to do</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">surgery, but even if he wakes up, he&#39;ll probably never be the same,&quot; answered Victoria Davenport, wife of Secretary Frank Davenport. President Harrington went to her and hugged her, &quot;He&#39;s a tough man, you might be surprised.&quot; Robert knew that with an Aneurysm, everything depended on</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">where the bleed was and how big it was. Without hesitation, he slipped past the crowd and opened the door to the surgery room. A Secret Service Agent, alerted by the sudden movement, turned to investigate, but it was too late.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Robert was already inside.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert moved swiftly, his form materializing as he approached Frank&#39;s bedside. With a gentle touch, he nudged a nurse aside, revealing himself to the startled medical team. As he did so, a protective barrier shimmered into existence, encasing him and Frank. Several Secret Service agents burst into</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">the room, their weapons drawn. They demanded that Robert step away from the Secretary, but he remained focused on his task. In the chaos, Victoria Davenport, Frank&#39;s wife, rushed into the room.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;What&#39;s going on?&quot; she demanded, her eyes wide with fear. A Secret</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Service agent tried to restrain her, but she struggled against his grasp. &quot;Who are you?&quot; Victoria asked, her gaze fixed on Robert. &quot;You look familiar.&quot; Robert smiled. &quot;It&#39;s been over thirty years, Victoria. East High, class of &#39;91?&quot; Recognition dawned in her eyes. &quot;Robert Williams? I haven&#39;t seen you since graduation. What are you doing here? And what are you wearing?&quot;</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">she asked, her confusion evident.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert chuckled, &quot;I&#39;m here to help, as for what I&#39;m wearing, it&#39;s armor, well, let&#39;s just say it comes with the job. And about helping people, I didn&#39;t expect it to be an old classmate.&quot; Victoria&#39;s confusion deepened. &quot;Help how? Are you a doctor?&quot; Robert shook his head. &quot;Not exactly. Right now, I&#39;m</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">something more. Give me forty seconds.&quot; With that, he began to cast the Tier 4 Healing Spell, Mending Tide.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;min-height:312.8pt;width:287.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="s8">: Mending Tide</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Tier<span class="s8">: 4</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Rank<span class="s8">: Epic</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="s8">: This spell channels the healing power of the spheres of healing, light, and water to mend grievous wounds. The caster</span></p><p class="s8" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">traces a sigil of restoration in the air, infusing it with their intent. As the sigil glows, a gentle, luminescent wave emanates from the caster&#39;s hand, washing over the target. The wave carries the life-giving energy of water, cleansing and purifying the wounds. The light of healing illuminates the damaged tissues, accelerating the body&#39;s natural repair processes. The combined power of these spheres revitalizes the target, mending broken bones, staunching bleeding, and soothing pain. <b>Mana Required</b>: 1952</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert closed his eyes, his mind a canvas of healing, light, and water. He raised his hand, tracing a luminous sigil in the air. A gentle wave of energy, imbued with the life-giving power of water, emanated from his palm, washing over Frank&#39;s unconscious form. The light of healing illuminated his body, stimulating its natural repair mechanisms. As the spell took effect, a</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">subtle change washed over Frank&#39;s face. The pallor of illness began to fade, replaced by a healthy hue. The sigil dissolved, leaving behind an aura of tranquility and renewal. A hush fell over the room as everyone watched, breathless. Then, to their astonishment, Frank&#39;s eyes fluttered open. &quot;What happened?&quot; he asked, his voice weak but clear.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert looked over at the group and said, &quot;I think we should have a private conversation, Madam President?&quot; he suggested, his tone serious.</p><table
