href="https://oceanofpdf.com/">OceanofPDF.com</a></p><h1 style="padding-top: 2pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a name="bookmark101">&zwnj;</a>Chapter 50<a name="bookmark102">&zwnj;</a></h1><p style="padding-top: 21pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert calmly deactivated the shielding spell, allowing the relieved Victoria to rush to her husband&#39;s side. He turned his attention to the Secret Service agents, who still had their weapons trained on him, faces a mixture of confusion and barely-controlled aggression. &quot;Gentlemen,&quot; he said, his voice calm and measured, &quot;I understand your concern, but firing those weapons in here is a profoundly bad idea. You might hit someone innocent. And, as a</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">side note, those weapons won&#39;t harm me.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">President Harrington, ever the composed leader even in the face of the utterly bizarre, glanced at her Senior Agent, Pete. &quot;Pete, stand down. I don&#39;t know what in God&#39;s name is happening here, but clearly, we need some answers. And right now, this gentleman seems to be the only one offering any.&quot; Pete, his jaw tight, clearly disagreed but reluctantly lowered his weapon slightly. &quot;Madam President, with all due respect, we have no idea who this man is. He somehow bypassed every security measure in a supposedly secure wing of this hospital.&quot; Robert chuckled, a dry, almost amused sound. &quot;Bypassed? I simply walked in. Your security isn&#39;t quite as</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">impenetrable as you believe.&quot; Pete, ignoring the interruption, his face reddening, continued, &quot;And he&#39;s clearly using some kind of incredibly advanced stealth technology, possibly military-grade, possibly foreign. We have no idea who he&#39;s working for, or what his motives are.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert offered a disarming smile, the picture of calm amidst the storm. &quot;The answers are surprisingly simple, gentlemen. It&#39;s not technology,</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">military or otherwise. And I work for myself, and for the well-being of my family.&quot; Turning to his friend, he said, &quot;Hello Frank!&quot; &quot;Robert Williams.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Haven&#39;t heard that name in a while. How&#39;ve you been, man? Long time no see.&quot; Frank croaked, his voice weak but strengthening, &quot;Couldn&#39;t be better, and judging by those monitors, same goes for you now. If I&#39;m reading those right, you&#39;re now immune to aneurysms.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Robert grinned. &quot;Must be nice. How&#39;d you swing <i>that</i>?&quot; With a smirk, Frank replied, &quot;Magic, I think.&quot; He paused, collecting himself. &quot;And let me guess, is that how you&#39;re looking half <i>my </i>age, too?&quot; &quot;Nah,&quot; Robert replied quickly.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Clean living, a good diet, and staying as far away from politics as humanly possible. That stuff will age you <i>fast</i>,&quot; Robert quipped, trying to lighten the mood. Frank laughed, a genuine, hearty laugh that eased the tension slightly. &quot;I&#39;ve heard that before. And honestly, I can&#39;t disagree. My wife tells me you just... waved your hand and <i>healed </i>me? Like, straight out of a fantasy movie? I owe you dinner, Robert. A very, <i>very </i>nice dinner.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert&#39;s smile widened. &quot;Dinner sounds fantastic, Frank. Although, if my memory serves me correctly  and it usually does  dinner with you back in high school often culminated in a rather enthusiastic make-out session.&quot; Victoria, surprisingly unfazed by the entire situation, laughed, a clear,</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">melodic sound. &quot;Oh, he&#39;s still very much a fan of the post-dinner make-out, don&#39;t you worry about that. But I think, under the circumstances, you&#39;re probably safe.&quot; Pete, however, was clearly reaching his breaking point. His patience, already stretched thin, snapped. &quot;Mr. Williams,&quot; he said, his voice dangerously low and tight with controlled fury, &quot;I need you to put your hands in the air, right now, and step away from the Secretary. This is <i>not </i>a joke, and this is <i>not </i>a negotiation.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Frank, his voice gaining strength with each passing moment, intervened. &quot;Pete, for God&#39;s sake, stand down! If Robert wanted to harm me, he would have let me die. He <i>saved </i>my life. Use your head.&quot; Pete, still radiating suspicion and barely-contained anger, refused to completely lower his weapon. &quot;With all due respect, sir, it&#39;s my <i>job </i>to protect everyone in this room. And right now, Mr. Williams is an unknown, potentially hostile entity. Mr. Williams, I&#39;m asking you, please cooperate.&quot; Robert sighed, a hint of weariness in his voice, and shook his head slightly. He turned to Frank. &quot;Look, I&#39;m going to be in town for a few more days. Here&#39;s my</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">number.&quot; He pulled a small, plain piece of paper from seemingly nowhere and handed it to Frank, who, with a questioning look, passed it to Victoria. &quot;I&#39;m afraid I&#39;m a bit underdressed for a proper thank you at the moment,&quot; Frank said, gesturing to his hospital gown.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert chuckled softly. &quot;I&#39;m fairly certain this isn&#39;t the first time you&#39;ve woken up in an unexpected location without your pants, Frank. Anyway,&quot; he continued, his tone shifting to a more serious note, &quot;I&#39;m going to head out. I&#39;ll be back later this evening, as promised, to help out with the other</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">wounded soldiers. It was good seeing you both again, truly. And, Madam President,&quot; he added, with a respectful nod in her direction, &quot;it was a</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">pleasure meeting you, under unusual circumstances.&quot; And with that, he simply vanished. No flash of light, no puff of smoke, just gone.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The room erupted into controlled chaos. Pete immediately barked orders, his voice sharp and commanding. &quot;Lock down the entire hospital! I want a room-to-room search, every inch of this place! Now!&quot; The President, looking shaken but resolute, was quickly and efficiently escorted out of the room, presumably back to the relative safety of the White House. Frank, meanwhile, was surrounded by a flurry of medical personnel, eager to</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">examine their miraculously healed patient, their minds struggling to</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">reconcile what they had just witnessed with everything they thought they knew about medicine and reality.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The Secret Service, their composure visibly rattled, immediately contacted the FBI, who, in turn, launched a full-scale investigation into the enigmatic Robert Williams. His background was quickly unearthed: a high school graduation in Florida, 1991, a stint in the military, a somewhat</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">unremarkable work history... and, crucially, his current cell phone number, which was swiftly traced to a high-end hotel in downtown D.C.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert, meanwhile, was calmly enjoying a late lunch by the hotel pool, the warm D.C. sun beating down on him. He heard the distinctive screech of tires pulling up below  a <i>lot </i>of tires. Glancing casually over the edge of the rooftop terrace, he saw a veritable convoy of black SUVs and a swarm of</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">FBI agents, including a fully equipped SWAT team, pouring out of the vehicles. He sighed, a mixture of amusement and resignation on his face.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He sent a quick text message to Sara  &quot;Things have escalated somewhat. Might be a bit delayed getting back. Don&#39;t worry. Love you.&quot;  and then returned to his half-eaten sandwich. He had plenty of time. They&#39;d search his room first, of course, and find absolutely nothing of interest; all his belongings, including anything remotely incriminating or revealing, were safely tucked away in his inventory. Then, they&#39;d question the hotel staff, who would undoubtedly confirm that, yes, Mr. Robert Williams had ordered lunch and was currently on the rooftop, enjoying the sunshine.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He&#39;d just finished the last bite of his sandwich when the FBI team, weapons drawn and faces grim, stormed onto the rooftop terrace. &quot;Robert Williams, you&#39;re under arrest! Get on the ground, hands behind your head, now!&quot; one of the agents yelled, his voice amplified by the tense silence. Robert waited patiently for the few other guests on the roof to scurry away, their leisurely afternoon abruptly interrupted. Then, with a barely perceptible movement, he blinked  and reappeared on the opposite side of the pool, leaving the agents momentarily staring at empty air.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Gentlemen,&quot; he said calmly, his voice carrying easily across the water, &quot;if you&#39;d like to have a civilized conversation, I&#39;m more than happy to oblige. But the whole &#39;guns blazing, shouting orders&#39; routine really isn&#39;t necessary. And, frankly, it&#39;s rather ineffective.&quot; The SWAT team, clearly disconcerted by his sudden teleportation, spread out, attempting to surround him, still shouting demands and threats. Robert, growing increasingly bored with the whole charade, decided to expedite matters. He cast a simple, non-lethal</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">barrier spell, effectively trapping the agents in place, not harming them, simply... containing them.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Then, he calmly pulled out his phone and dialed the White House switchboard. &quot;Good afternoon,&quot; he said pleasantly, as if ordering takeout. &quot;My name is Robert Williams, and I believe I caused a bit of a stir at Walter Reed earlier today. I&#39;m currently enjoying a lovely afternoon by the pool, albeit in the company of a somewhat agitated FBI SWAT team. I&#39;m perfectly willing to cooperate and answer any questions, but I&#39;m <i>not </i>going to be dragged off to some undisclosed black site. If someone in authority wishes to meet with me at FBI headquarters, or a similar location, I&#39;m happy to comply. They have my number. Have a nice day.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He hung up and addressed the trapped agents, who were now looking a</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">mixture of furious and bewildered. &quot;The barrier is purely for containment, gentlemen. No one&#39;s getting hurt. We&#39;re just going to wait here patiently until someone with a little more sense and a little less testosterone arrives. So, relax, maybe work on your tans. It&#39;s a beautiful day, after all.&quot; He noticed several agents speaking urgently into their radios, no doubt reporting this latest, highly unusual development. After approximately</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">twelve minutes  Robert made a point of checking his watch  his phone rang.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Robert Williams,&quot; he answered. A brief pause. Then, &quot;Mr. Williams, this is FBI Director Paul Newman. I believe there&#39;s been a rather significant misunderstanding. I&#39;m asking you, please, release my agents.&quot; Robert chuckled softly. &quot;No problem at all, Director. Consider it done.&quot; With a</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">subtle flick of his wrist, the invisible barrier dissolved. &quot;There. They&#39;re free to go. See? Simple as that.&quot; Another pause, longer this time. Most of the agents, looking distinctly embarrassed and muttering under their breath, began to file off the rooftop. Two, however, remained  plainclothes, clearly higher-ranking, their expressions carefully neutral.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Thank you, Mr. Williams. We appreciate your cooperation. These agents will escort you to the J. Edgar Hoover Building, where we can discuss this matter further, in a more appropriate setting.&quot; Robert shrugged, a gesture of nonchalant agreement. &quot;Sounds like a plan. I do know the way. But, I</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">suppose an escort might prevent any further... unfortunate misunderstandings. Lead the way.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert, flanked by the two grim-faced agents, who looked like they&#39;d rather be undergoing root canal surgery than escorting him, left the hotel and entered a waiting, unmarked black SUV. They arrived at the imposing, brutalist architecture of the FBI headquarters  the J. Edgar Hoover Building  and he was ushered to a large, sterile, and undoubtedly bugged</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">conference room. The agents offered him coffee, water, anything he might need. He politely declined. After a few minutes of tense silence, the door opened, and three men entered, their faces serious, their demeanor all business.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Mr. Williams,&quot; the first man said, extending a hand in greeting, &quot;I&#39;m FBI Director Paul Newman. This is Secret Service Director Jason Tully,&quot; he gestured to the second man, a stern-looking individual with a military bearing, &quot;and this is General Mark Jacobson, the commanding officer of Walter Reed.&quot; The two escorting agents discreetly exited, closing the heavy door behind them, leaving Robert alone with the three most powerful men in the room. &quot;Mr. Williams,&quot; Director Newman began, his voice carefully</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">controlled, &quot;you&#39;ve certainly created quite a stir today. Perhaps you&#39;d like to provide us with an explanation for your actions?&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert leaned back in his chair, considering his words. &quot;It&#39;s a rather long and complicated story, gentlemen,&quot; he admitted. &quot;In essence, I was at Walter Reed to introduce myself and offer my unique services to the United States government. The Secretary&#39;s unexpected presence simply</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">altered my initial plans somewhat.&quot; Director Tully interjected skeptically, &quot;And what, exactly, were your original plans, Mr. Williams?&quot; Robert replied matter-of-factly, &quot;Quite simply, I intended to heal a number of patients, demonstrating my capabilities, attract the attention of the hospital&#39;s medical staff, and then propose a mutually beneficial collaboration with the military. However, before we delve into the specifics, there are a few fundamental truths, a new reality, if you will, that you need to be aware of.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">He reached into well, nowhere visible, and produced three neatly bound, professionally printed documents. &quot;These are for you. Please, take your</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">time and read them carefully.&quot; General Jacobson remarked, &quot;Son, I don&#39;t</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">know how you did that, but I can assure you, you were throughly searched.&quot; Robert gave a slight smile, &quot;Read first, I will happily answer your questions later.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The three men, looking increasingly perplexed and uneasy, each took a copy of the document and began to read. The report, a concise, meticulously crafted 18-page summary of Robert&#39;s incredibly extensive and detailed guide to the System, held their complete and undivided attention.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The room was filled with a heavy silence, broken only by the occasional rustle of paper as they turned the pages, their expressions shifting from disbelief to confusion to a dawning, unsettling comprehension.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">When they finally finished, a thick, almost palpable silence descended upon the room. It was Director Tully who finally broke the stillness, his voice carefully measured, betraying none of the turmoil he undoubtedly felt. &quot;Mr.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Williams are you seriously suggesting that this this document is genuine? That this isn&#39;t some kind of elaborate hoax?&quot; Robert shook his</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">head, his expression unwavering, deadly serious. &quot;Not at all, Director. And I can provide irrefutable proof, if you require it. I could, with minimal effort,</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">destroy this entire city. But I believe a less catastrophic demonstration would be more appropriate, and less disruptive to everyone&#39;s afternoon.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He then proceeded to offer them a glimpse of the impossible. He displayed the initial System messages, the undeniable proof of his connection to something beyond their comprehension. He then cast a series of minor, but undeniably <i>magical</i>, spells  a ball of light that danced in the air, a sudden, localized gust of wind that ruffled their papers, a small, intricately carved wooden bird appearing seemingly out of thin air. The final, clinching piece of evidence was the summoning of his staff, a clearly magical artifact of significant power, from his inventory  a feat that was simply impossible to fake, especially within the confines of a heavily secured government building.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He offered, almost casually, to demonstrate a high-level combat spell, a display of raw power that could have devastating consequences, but they quickly, and understandably, declined. &quot;Assuming, for the sake of argument, and purely hypothetically, of course,&quot; Director Newman began, his voice still struggling to reconcile what he had just witnessed with his understanding of reality, &quot;that all of this is true why are you revealing this information to us <i>now</i>? If your claims are accurate, this System is centuries away from becoming a relevant issue.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">General Jacobson, however, seemed to have grasped the strategic implications far more quickly than his colleagues. &quot;I disagree, Director,&quot; he said, his voice firm, his gaze fixed on Robert. &quot;If Mr. Williams is telling the truth  and I&#39;m increasingly inclined to believe that he is  this changes <i>everything</i>. The future of warfare, the balance of global power it will all be determined by this magic. We need to be prepared.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Centuries is a long time, yes, but preparing for something of this magnitude, something that could fundamentally alter the course of human history we need to start <i>now</i>. Today.&quot; Robert nodded in agreement. &quot;Precisely, General. I can provide the knowledge, the blueprints, the theoretical framework for understanding this new reality. But actual, usable magic, as we currently understand it, is impossible. Without Mana, spells are simply inert words and gestures. However,&quot; he continued, a subtle shift in his tone, &quot;I <i>can </i>offer spellbooks, meticulously crafted and preserved, for future generations to</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">utilize. And, more importantly, I can create <i>items </i>that function <i>now</i>, items that could provide a decisive strategic advantage in the present.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He then proceeded to demonstrate several of these items, explaining their functions and capabilities with a calm, almost clinical detachment  healing devices that could mend grievous wounds in seconds, protective shields that could withstand incredible forces, communication tools that defied distance and conventional technology. The meeting stretched on for another two hours, a dizzying, mind-bending marathon of explanations, demonstrations, and increasingly incredulous questions.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Finally, Robert dropped his most significant revelation, the piece of information that truly shattered their preconceived notions. &quot;And this,&quot; he said, gesturing to a specific section of the document, &quot;is the method I&#39;ve been using to educate my children. Imparting skills and knowledge directly, bypassing years of traditional learning.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">General Jacobson stared at him, his mouth agape, speechless for a moment. &quot;You&#39;re you&#39;re saying you just <i>touched </i>your son, and he suddenly <i>knew </i>how to build nuclear reactors? Is that is that even remotely <i>legal</i>?&quot; Robert chuckled, a low rumble in his chest. &quot;As long as he doesn&#39;t actually <i>construct </i>one without the appropriate licenses and permits, I believe we&#39;re in the clear. And don&#39;t worry, General, in a week or so, I&#39;m planning to</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">move on to anti-matter. He&#39;s going to have a very interesting career path.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Director Newman, looking slightly shell-shocked and overwhelmed by the sheer volume of paradigm-shifting information he&#39;d just been bombarded with, spoke up, his voice strained. &quot;Mr. Williams, I think it&#39;s abundantly</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">clear that we don&#39;t want you sharing this kind of knowledge with</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">anyone outside of very, <i>very </i>strict government control.&quot; Robert raised an eyebrow, a hint of amusement in his eyes. &quot;With all due respect, Director, you can&#39;t <i>stop </i>me. My son has expressed a keen interest in aerospace engineering. Before I depart, he&#39;ll be, without exaggeration, the world&#39;s leading expert in space travel technology. He&#39;ll possess the knowledge and understanding to design and construct a spacecraft capable of reaching</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Mars in a little over three days, at its furthest orbital point. The question you need to ask yourselves, gentlemen, is this: who do you want him working</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">for</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a href="https://oceanofpdf.com/">OceanofPDF.com</a></p><h1 style="padding-top: 2pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a name="bookmark103">&zwnj;</a>Chapter 51<a name="bookmark104">&zwnj;</a></h1><p style="padding-top: 21pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert spent the rest of the day reconnecting with family, filling them in on the day&#39;s unusual events, and reassuring them that he was merely waiting</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">for his next appointment. This waiting period was brief. The following day, the tranquility of his hotel room was shattered by a knock. Standing before him were two FBI agents and two military personnel. &quot;Mr. Williams, we&#39;ve been assigned to escort you to the White House for a scheduled meeting with several officials.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Robert quickly scanned the room, ensuring he hadn&#39;t left anything behind, before following them out. The drive to the White House was eerily quiet. Robert was surprised to see the normally bustling streets devoid of traffic.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Then it dawned on him  they had closed off the roads. &quot;While it&#39;s flattering to be treated like a VIP, couldn&#39;t we have avoided inconveniencing people who simply need to get around town?&quot; he asked. One of the agents replied, &quot;I apologize, sir. We rank-and-file agents aren&#39;t privy to the specifics.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">All we know is that you&#39;re a high-priority individual and you&#39;re getting the full treatment.&quot; Robert smiled and replied, &quot;Worry not, I can promise you I&#39;m far from special. I just know something certain other people want to</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">know, and they&#39;re trying to play nice.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Shortly after reaching the main gate of the White House, they paused for an ID check before being swiftly ushered through. Robert anticipated further security screenings, but it dawned on him that his inventory made thorough inspection impossible. He was then handed off to White House staff and escorted to a secure briefing room. Instructed to wait, Robert found himself growing impatient after an hour. The door swung open, and a large group entered, the President bringing up the rear.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Taking his seat, the President began, &quot;Robert, thank you for joining us. This room holds some of the most powerful people in the government, as well as leading scientists. We have the Vice President, Chief of Staff, Secretaries of State and Defense, Directors of National Intelligence, NASA, and DARPA,</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">and the Chairman of the Joint Chiefs. Gentlemen, this is Robert Williams.&quot; Robert replied, &quot;Good afternoon. Thank you for meeting with me.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Frank interjected, &quot;Robert, good to see you again. We still need to have dinner.&quot; Robert smiled, &quot;I might be free tonight.&quot; The President quickly</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">interceded, &quot;You can catch up later. Robert, we&#39;ve reviewed your materials, but the details are sparse.&quot; Robert nodded, pulling out the massive System Guide Book. &quot;The issue is the sheer volume of information. This is a basic guide, covering the System&#39;s history and fundamental operations.&quot; He gestured to the book. &quot;And I emphasize basic.&quot; Director Manshon, head of National Intelligence, inquired, &quot;Can we access that book?&quot; Robert smiled, producing a flash drive. &quot;The physical book, no. But my wife scanned it, so you can have a digital copy.&quot; Dr. Ashworth, the Science Advisor, asked,</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;How does it work? It&#39;s like a video game inventory system, but... how?&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert paused and wondered how to answer and then realized with his high-tier knowledge of the Sphere of Space and Time, he did in fact understand how the Inventory system worked and provided the answer.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;The inventory system is intrinsically linked to each user&#39;s System Core, this core serves as the interface between the user and the System. This System Core is, in turn, connected to a subcore dedicated to managing the inventory space. This subcore, a specialized computational entity, resides within the subspace layer and controls the dematerialization and rematerialization processes. When an item is placed into the inventory, the subcore analyzes its quantum state and creates a digital blueprint. This blueprint is then stored within the subspace layer, while the physical item is dematerialized and its energy signature is transferred to the blueprint. To</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">retrieve an item, the subcore reverses the process, rematerializing the item from the blueprint and restoring its energy signature. The System Core provides the necessary energy and computational power to facilitate this</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">intricate process, ensuring seamless interaction with the inventory space.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Dr. Ashworth listened intently, then asked, &quot;So this System Core is essentially a personal computer for each user?&quot; Robert nodded. &quot;Correct. It&#39;s not explicitly detailed in the book, but I&#39;ve learned a bit about the underlying infrastructure. At the apex is the System&#39;s Central Processing Core Cluster, a colossal network of cores spanning universes. Below that</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">are Universal Control Nodes, massive subcores managing each universe. Each galaxy has a Galaxy Control Core, overseeing galactic-scale System functions. Sector Control Nodes manage specific regions within galaxies. And finally, at the bottom, are the Personal Access Nodes, our individual System Cores.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Dr. Ashworth&#39;s eyes lit up. &quot;So the System is a massive AI network. How do you prevent hacks?&quot; Robert smiled. &quot;Even as a Tier 6 computer expert, probably the highest rank in this universe, I can&#39;t fathom accessing my own core. These cores exist outside our reality. The only way to interact with them is through the System itself, which has stringent security measures.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Additionally, they&#39;re protected by Divine-tier constructs. It would take a coordinated effort by multiple gods, and even then, it&#39;s just a matter of time before the System counterattacks, and at that point, the gods would lose.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Vice President Brakenson interjected, &quot;You speak of gods as if they&#39;re real. What are these so-called gods?&quot; Robert paused, collecting his thoughts.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;They&#39;re Tier 10 Divine beings. Or, to put it simply, they&#39;re incredibly powerful, immortal beings who have mastered a specific skill to such a</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">degree that they&#39;ve become it. Imagine someone reaching the pinnacle of a skill like the Magic Sphere of Fire. If they continue to delve deeper, they could potentially become one with fire itself, ascending to godhood. It&#39;s a risky endeavor, with failure resulting in death. But success grants divine status.&quot; He continued, &quot;Our universe will eventually produce its own gods, but there can only be one god per skill, limiting their number.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The Vice President then asked, &quot;What about the God that many believe in?&quot;</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert looked at her, &quot;I asked the System the same question, and the response was... it doesn&#39;t know. The System, while incredibly</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">knowledgeable, doesn&#39;t possess omniscience. It can&#39;t explain the origins of the multiverse. Its answer was that God&#39;s existence is possible, but until a revelation occurs, the question remains unanswered.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">General Tailly, The Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, asked the next question, &quot;What is magic and what can you do with it?&quot; Robert had an</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">answer for that, &quot;magic isn&#39;t a mystical force, but a complex interplay of energy, information, and consciousness. At its core, magic is the</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">manipulation of the fundamental building blocks of reality, often referred to</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">as &#39;mana.&#39; This mana, a pervasive energy field, permeates all things, from</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">the smallest particle to the grandest celestial body. To access and wield this power, individuals must first unlock specific skills related to the spheres of magic. These spheres, such as the Sphere of Elemental Fire, the Sphere of Time, or the Sphere of Illusion, represent fundamental aspects of reality. By mastering spells within a sphere, a practitioner gains the ability to channel and manipulate mana in accordance with that sphere&#39;s principles. For instance, a mage who has learned the &quot;Fireball&quot; spell within the Sphere of Elemental Fire can harness the energy of fire to create and project a fiery projectile. Similarly, a master of the Sphere of Time could gain access to a spell to slow down time or even reverse it within a limited area.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Dr. Ashworth mused, &quot;Mana seems to be the key, isn&#39;t it? Without it, magic remains inaccessible.&quot; Robert nodded, &quot;Exactly. Magic items function</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">because they contain stored mana.&quot; NASA Administrator William Felson inquired, &quot;You&#39;ve shared knowledge with your family. Would you be willing to extend that to others?&quot; Robert confirmed, &quot;Yes, but there&#39;s a cost.&quot; Director Manshon guessed, &quot;A financial one?&quot; Robert smiled, &quot;While I do want to provide for my family, the cost isn&#39;t monetary. Let me explain how the System works. Currently, I&#39;m limited to Tier 1, Level 3 knowledge.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">This is due to the System Core&#39;s role in guiding knowledge transfer. At higher levels, without proper guidance, there&#39;s a risk of brain damage.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Tier 1, Level 3 knowledge, using Anti-Matter as an example, provides a foundational understanding of its creation, storage, and use. It&#39;s akin to the initial discovery of fire. At Level 1, you could create and store Anti-Matter, but it would be inefficient and risky. Level 2 refines the process, making it safer and more energy-efficient. Level 3 represents a significant advancement, allowing for efficient production and practical applications,</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">such as Anti-Matter power generation. My son, aspiring to a career in space, will receive the knowledge to build advanced spacecraft capable of reaching Mars in days, not months. However, I won&#39;t share weapon-related knowledge. I&#39;m committed to America&#39;s leadership, but not at the expense</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">of global dominance.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">I can impart one skill every two weeks to each person, limiting the depth of knowledge transfer. I can provide the foundation for expertise in a specific</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">field, but further advancement will require dedicated study and research.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">For instance, I can provide the mathematical framework for advanced Anti-</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Matter production, but you&#39;ll need to apply it independently. Regarding</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">defensive technology, I&#39;ll consider two additional skills: Advanced Primary Subsystem Design for Spacecraft and Advanced Sensor and Scanning Systems. These skills will enable the development of artificial gravity and advanced sensor capabilities, respectively.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The meeting continued for another two hours. Ultimately, they agreed that Robert would impart power and ship design skills to 20 individuals. He would also provide written guidance on advancing to Level 4, though the specific implementation would be left to the scientists. In exchange, he would receive a tax-free payment of $250 million, ensuring his family&#39;s future. Additionally, they agreed to provide John with a $300 million grant</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">to establish a company upon completing college, positioning him as a future leader in the space industry. Shortly after, the meeting concluded, and Robert was escorted back to his hotel. Later that evening, he finally had</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">dinner with Frank and his wife.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a href="https://oceanofpdf.com/">OceanofPDF.com</a></p><h1 style="padding-top: 2pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a name="bookmark105">&zwnj;</a>Chapter 52<a name="bookmark106">&zwnj;</a></h1><p style="padding-top: 21pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Dinner was delightful. Frank and Victoria were wonderful company, and the conversation flowed effortlessly. They shared updates on their lives post- graduation, and Victoria inquired about Sara&#39;s reaction to Robert&#39;s impending departure. With a heavy heart, Robert confessed, &quot;There have been many tearful nights. We&#39;re putting on a brave front for the children, but the uncertainty of the future weighs heavily on me.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Victoria, her face etched with sympathy, replied, &quot;I can&#39;t imagine the pain</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Sara must be enduring. It&#39;s clear you&#39;re struggling as well.&quot; Frank nodded in agreement, then posed a curious question, &quot;You mentioned a System arriving in over 400 years, and that you&#39;d return with it. How is that possible?&quot; A knowing smile spread across Robert&#39;s face. &quot;Well, I suppose I haven&#39;t delved into the specifics. As you progress and enhance your attributes, you unlock certain perks. For instance, my Constitution stat is at 100, which alone grants me a lifespan exceeding 500 years.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Additionally, I&#39;ve ascended to a higher racial tier, further extending my potential lifespan to over a thousand years, assuming I don&#39;t meet an untimely demise.&quot; Frank&#39;s jaw dropped. &quot;Wait, you&#39;re telling me you could live for over a thousand years? And what do you mean by &#39;increased your racial tier&#39;?&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert chuckled, &quot;Yep, and even by the System&#39;s standards, that&#39;s not an extraordinary lifespan. The multiverse is teeming with ancient, powerful beings who&#39;ve existed for tens, if not hundreds of thousands of years. Scary, right? While it&#39;s possible to achieve such longevity, it&#39;s not exactly common. The key lies in your stats, or attributes. When you&#39;re granted a class and profession, you&#39;re given a specific number of stat points to</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">allocate at each level-up.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Most people receive common or uncommon classes and professions, which yield around 5 or 6 stat points per level. Some of these points are automatically assigned to specific stats based on your class and skills, leaving only one or two as free points. Unless you&#39;ve chosen a combat class,</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">you&#39;ll primarily use your free points to boost your Constitution. This is a common strategy, as everyone desires a longer life. However, most people opt for non-combat classes and professions, prioritizing stats relevant to</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">their occupation.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;A weaver, for instance, would focus on Dexterity. While working can earn you experience and level-ups, it&#39;s a much slower process&quot; Robert took a sip of his drink and continued, &quot;Most people, with an uncommon non-combat class and profession, will reach the end of their lives around level 60. With about 50 free stat points to allocate, they can&#39;t afford to invest them all in Constitution. So, they typically allocate around 15 points, ensuring a full lifespan of roughly 200 years.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Adventurers and soldiers, on the other hand, level up more rapidly. Many combat classes automatically allocate points to Constitution. Even an uncommon combat class can allow someone to reach a Constitution of 40 or 50, extending their lifespan to around 400 years. However, as you might imagine, there&#39;s a significant drawback to this lifestyle.&quot; Frank nodded,</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;The risk, of course, is the constant danger. Sooner or later, every adventurer&#39;s luck runs out.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert agreed. &quot;Precisely. Adventurers possess immense power, but they often don&#39;t live long enough to succumb to natural causes.&quot; Frank was curious. &quot;So, what level did you reach to attain a Constitution of 100?&quot; A knowing smile spread across Robert&#39;s face. &quot;I reached level 54. I possess both a Mythical class and profession. Not only do I gain a point in Constitution at each levela total of 44 pointsbut I also receive 5 free points per level.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;As far as I understand, my situation is quite rare. As the Forerunner of this universe, I&#39;ve been granted unique feats and traits that no one else can obtain, allowing me to attain such high-level classes and professions. It&#39;s estimated that there are only tens of thousands of dual Mythical holders across billions of trillions of beings in each universe, making me part of a very exclusive group.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;As for my racial tier,&quot; Robert explained, &quot;every human in this universe is Tier G, the baseline. I was fortunate enough to upgrade to Tier F, essentially</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">doubling my potential. No offense, Frank, but that makes me twice as</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">capable as you.&quot; Robert playfully poked Frank, who retorted, &quot;That&#39;s not funny, and no, you&#39;re not twice the man I am. You&#39;re... well, I&#39;m not sure what you are.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Victoria, intrigued, asked, &quot;But what does being Tier F actually mean?&quot; Robert did his best to explain. &quot;While it might sound impressive, the benefits aren&#39;t as significant as you&#39;d think. Yes, it doubles my natural lifespan, allowing me to live a very long life. It also grants me certain perks and abilities, and will open up more powerful classes and professions in the future.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;However, the real advantage lies in the next generation. If I were to marry another Tier F human, our children would start at Tier F. Currently, there&#39;s only a 20% chance of that happening if I were to have children with a Tier G human. Being born Tier F means they&#39;d start with increased stats. For the first ten levels, a Tier G human earns one free stat point per level, while a Tier F human earns two.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Additionally, their initial class and profession would be of a higher tier. A level 10 Tier F human has a better chance of acquiring higher-tier classes and professions, as well as feats and traits.&quot; Victoria chuckled, &quot;Should I call Sara and let her know you&#39;re already discussing your next wife?&quot; Robert smiled. &quot;No, she and I have already discussed the whole Tier system. In fact, she was the one who figured it all out.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;As for my next wife, I have no plans, and honestly, I&#39;m not sure if I ever will.&quot; Victoria spoke softly, &quot;Robert, you can&#39;t spend a thousand years alone. You&#39;ll need someone to share your experiences with.&quot; He replied with a somber look, &quot;We&#39;ll see what happens. But I&#39;ve already found the love of my life. How can I top that?&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Besides, I&#39;ve got a feeling this journey will be filled with unexpected twists and turns, and who knows what kind of people I&#39;ll meet along the way.&quot; The conversation grew quiet, and soon after, dinner ended. Victoria promised to reach out to Sara, offering her support and understanding. Robert thanked</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">her and wished them both a good night, returning to his hotel room.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Later that night, Robert recounted the details of the dinner to Sara, who was pleased to hear about Victoria&#39;s call and agreed that having someone to</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">confide in would make things easier. They continued their conversation for another hour or so before Robert retired for the night.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The following morning, Robert initiated his next dungeon run, but he simply wasn&#39;t feeling it. Without even a glance at the System Shop, he plunged directly into the dungeon, only to confront another fiery level teeming with giant lizards. He mechanically went through the motions, listlessly completing the run, his mind far removed from reality.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;left:0.4pt;min-height:170.2pt;top:0.4pt;width:287.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Dungeon run complete: Rare chest awarded. Chest contains:</p><p class="s9" style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Ten Gold coins</p><p class="s9" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Two Standard Skill Points One Epic Shop Token</p><p class="s6" style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Items added to user inventory. Thank you for visiting The Training Dungeon!</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Later that day, Robert phoned Frank to inform him of his departure plans the following day. He suggested that when the time came to send trainees,</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">they should simply reach out, and he would meet them either at his home or a nearby location. After a few more minutes of conversation, Robert ended the call. The next morning, Robert was taken aback to find an escort waiting for him. He was informed that his plans had been altered.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Instead of returning home independently, he would be escorted to Andrews Air Force Base and flown back to MacDill Air Force Base. From there, two FBI agents would drive him home. Unhappy with the sudden change of plans, Robert called Frank to inquire about the situation. Frank explained, &quot;Robert, you need to understand that you&#39;re now considered a National Resource. It&#39;s to be expected that the government would want to protect you.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert chuckled and replied, &quot;Frank, as it stands, you could probably drop a bomb on me and all you&#39;d do is annoy me. You can&#39;t harm or kill me, you can&#39;t kidnap me, and if I wanted to vanish, you&#39;d never find me. This level</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">of security is unnecessary.&quot; Frank simply responded, &quot;It&#39;s not my decision, and let&#39;s be honest, would you rather stand in line at one of the busiest airports in the country or bypass the lines and take a quick flight home?&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert conceded, &quot;Fine, but someone will need to go to Tampa International Airport and drive my car home.&quot; Frank assured him that he would arrange for someone to take care of it, so the car would be waiting for him upon his arrival. Frank wished him well and invited him to visit again before his final departure. With that, Robert&#39;s trip to DC concluded, and he returned home.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">After returning home, Robert spent some time sharing the details of his trip and the decisions made with his family. John was filled with excitement about the future, while Stacey found the world of politics intriguing and began to consider it as a potential career path. Richard, ever the curious one, inquired about the possibility of his father securing him a position with the FBI. Spending quality time with his family was exactly what Robert needed, and by the end of the day, he felt relaxed and rejuvenated.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">As the sun set, Robert spent the evening enjoying his wife&#39;s company not knowing that the next day would end his happy mood.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a href="https://oceanofpdf.com/">OceanofPDF.com</a></p><h1 style="padding-top: 2pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a name="bookmark107">&zwnj;</a>Chapter 53<a name="bookmark108">&zwnj;</a></h1><p style="padding-top: 21pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The next morning, as Robert was enjoying a tranquil moment with his morning coffee the quietude of his home was abruptly shattered by a firm knock at the door. With a curious mix of anticipation and apprehension, Robert opened the door to find two familiar faces. &quot;Good morning,</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Detective Ramirez,&quot; Robert greeted the officers, his voice laced with a hint of surprise. &quot;What brings you out this fine day?&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Detective Ramirez returned the greeting. &quot;Mr. Williams, it&#39;s good to see you again. I hope you don&#39;t mind, but I have a few more questions about the gold you recently sold. I believe it would be best to discuss this matter</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">further at the station.&quot; Robert&#39;s brow furrowed as he contemplated the detective&#39;s request. &quot;I&#39;m not quite sure I understand,&quot; Robert stated, &quot;What exactly do you want to know?&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Detective Ramirez, sensing Robert&#39;s unease, maintained a professional demeanor. &quot;I assure you, Mr. Williams, this is merely a routine inquiry.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">However, given the nature of the gold in question, it&#39;s imperative that we have a more detailed conversation. Your cooperation would be greatly</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">appreciated.&quot; The detective&#39;s insistence was clear, leaving Robert with little choice but to comply, &quot;If you insist, give me a moment to let my wife</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">know.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Sara, could you come here for a moment, please?&quot; Robert called out, his voice tinged with a hint of urgency. A moment later, Sara appeared in the doorway, her expression curious. &quot;Yes, Robert?&quot; she inquired, her gaze shifting to the two men standing behind her husband. &quot;It seems these fine officers,&quot; Robert began, his tone laced with sarcasm, &quot;can&#39;t quite grasp the concept of leaving law-abiding citizens alone. They&#39;re determined to waste their time with pointless questioning.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He pulled out a business card and handed it to Sara. &quot;Give Frank a call and let him know I&#39;ve been &#39;invited&#39; to the station. He&#39;ll handle this.&quot; Sara&#39;s concern was evident as she took the card. &quot;Are you sure everything will be alright?&quot; she asked, her voice filled with worry. Robert offered a reassuring</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">smile. &quot;Don&#39;t worry, honey. Frank will take care of it. I just hope these detectives have a solid backup plan for their post-law enforcement careers.&quot; With a quick kiss, he turned to the officers. &quot;Alright, gentlemen, let&#39;s get this show on the road. It&#39;s time to start the countdown to your retirement.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">After nearly an hour, Robert sat impatiently in the sterile interview room, his patience waning. He was on the verge of leaving when the door swung open, revealing two familiar faces and a young woman. &quot;Mr. Williams, this is Assistant District Attorney Catherine Van Derlyn. Thank you for agreeing to answer our questions,&quot; the detective announced. Robert let out a dry laugh. &quot;Agreed, is that what you told the ADA, miss? I didnt agree; I was told to be here.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The ADA exchanged a glance with the detectives. &quot;Sir, firstly, you are not obligated to be here. Secondly, you are not under arrest. However, I understand you called your attorney. Would you like to wait for him to arrive?&quot; A moment of confusion flashed across Robert&#39;s face, followed by a knowing smile. &quot;Oh, I apologize. Frank isn&#39;t my attorney. The number I</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">gave my wife was for the White House switchboard. Frank is Frank Davenport, a wonderful man. I had dinner with him and Victoria a few nights ago when I was in D.C.&quot; A heavy silence fell over the room.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Detective Ramirez, visibly shaken, finally broke the silence. &quot;Wait, are you telling us you know the Secretary of State?&quot; Robert simply smiled. &quot;I know several people in the White House.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">After a brief pause, ADA Derlyn began, &quot;Mr. Williams, we understand your concern. However, in recent months, you&#39;ve sold approximately half a million dollars worth of gold with unknown markings and an unidentified source. This has raised some red flags.&quot; Robert, unfazed, replied, &quot;So, is it now illegal to sell one&#39;s own property?&quot; The ADA quickly responded, &quot;Of</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">course not. But we need to verify the legitimacy of the gold&#39;s origin.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Detective Ramirez, eager to contribute, interjected, &quot;Is it drugs or terrorism? How else could you have acquired that much gold?&quot; Robert, visibly confused, asked, &quot;Excuse me?&quot; Detective Ramirez persisted, &quot;The only explanation is either a drug deal or a terrorist plot. Which is it?&quot; Robert stood up abruptly. &quot;I believe we&#39;re done here.&quot; ADA Derlyn attempted to</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">salvage the situation. &quot;Sir, we&#39;re going to need you to stay. We&#39;re in the</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">process of obtaining a warrant to search your home and review your financial records.&quot; Robert, visibly angry, retorted, &quot;So, I&#39;m under arrest? You lied about that.&quot; ADA Derlyn quickly clarified, &quot;No, sir. You&#39;re not under arrest, but you are detained.&quot; Before she could continue, the door burst open, revealing a furious Chief of Police.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Mr. Williams,&quot; Chief Lawson began, his voice a mixture of frustration and apology, &quot;on behalf of the department, I want to apologize for the egregious misunderstanding caused by two of my officers. Please believe me when I say a thorough investigation into their actions is underway.&quot; ADA Derlyn, visibly perplexed, interjected, &quot;Sir, I don&#39;t understand.&quot; Chief Lawson&#39;s</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">voice grew sharper. &quot;Well, let me enlighten you. I just spent the last five minutes being chewed out by your boss, who was, in turn, chewed out by</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">the Attorney General of the United States. Do you three have any idea what kind of mess you&#39;ve created?&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Detective Ramirez, still bewildered, blurted out, &quot;Sir, why is the AG involved?&quot; &quot;I don&#39;t know, and frankly, I don&#39;t care,&quot; Chief Lawson retorted. &quot;All I know is there&#39;s a squad of FBI agents waiting outside to escort Mr.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Williams home. You three are to stay as far away from this as possible. Is that understood? Now, all of you, get out. And you two, detectives, I&#39;ll see you in my office when I&#39;m done.&quot; Turning to Robert, the Chief offered a</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">sincere apology. &quot;Please accept my apologies, Mr. Williams. You&#39;re free to go. The agents outside will take you home.&quot; As Robert left the station, he couldn&#39;t help but feel a sense of relief. A simple misunderstanding had escalated into a major incident involving high-ranking officials and federal agents.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">When Robert arrived home, Sara was waiting for him, worry etched on her face. &quot;Are you okay?&quot; she asked, rushing to embrace him. &quot;I&#39;m fine,&quot; Robert reassured her. &quot;So, did Frank help out?&quot; Sara chuckled. &quot;It took a bit to get through to someone who could confirm, but once they did and Frank took my call, things moved quickly. He mentioned walking into the President&#39;s office and I could hear her swearing like a sailor. Apparently, she took the matter very seriously. They assured me it would be handled.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert recounted the events at the police station, leaving Sara amused by</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">the chaos and confusion. &quot;Well, I hope that puts an end to that nonsense. We</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">have more important things to worry about,&quot; she said, trying to lighten the mood. Later that afternoon, Robert received a call from the President herself. She assured him that the issue with the local police had been resolved and that he had nothing more to worry about. She also informed him that they had selected the group of people who would be receiving his training. Someone would contact him the following day to finalize the schedule. Robert thanked her for her help and expressed his eagerness to contribute.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The following morning, Robert received a call informing him that two uniformed military personnel would be arriving to pick him up for his training session at MacDill Air Force Base. He confirmed his readiness and was told to expect them within the hour. After notifying Sara, Robert prepared for the day. As scheduled, two Airmen arrived and escorted him to MacDill. Upon arrival, he was introduced to the team he would be training: a diverse group of civilian engineers and military personnel, all with strong mathematical backgrounds. Robert decided to begin with the fundamental power system skills.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He spent the rest of the day imparting his knowledge to the group. At the conclusion of the session, he agreed to return in two weeks to teach the next skill. After the training, he was driven back home. The next day, he received a call confirming the success of the training session and assuring him that</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">the funds would be transferred to his account after the next round. Sharing the good news with Sara, Robert relaxed for the rest of the day before embarking on his next dungeon run the following morning.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The following morning Robert began his 30th dungeon run, this time he did visit the store where he found a few interesting items:</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: While he planned to keep the mind spell, the very notion of its existence filled him with a sense of awe and trepidation.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert left the entry chamber and entered the dungeon which appeared again to be a mine, Fighting Dark Dwarves he found several sections that</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">contained mithril and spent some time mining the valuable ore. Completing the run earned him two new levels . The boss at the end was a Dwarf King.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;left:0.4pt;min-height:217.5pt;top:0.4pt;width:287.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 187%;text-align: left;">Dungeon run complete: Epic chest awarded. Chest contains:</p><p class="s8" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Skillbook(Weapon Crafting)</p><p class="s9" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">50 gold coins</p><p class="s9" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Two unlocked skill token One Epic Shop Token</p><p class="s6" style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Items added to user inventory.</p><p class="s6" style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Thank you for visiting The Training Dungeon!</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a href="https://oceanofpdf.com/">OceanofPDF.com</a></p><h1 style="padding-top: 2pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a name="bookmark109">&zwnj;</a>Chapter 54<a name="bookmark110">&zwnj;</a></h1><p style="padding-top: 21pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Over the next two weeks, Robert stayed busy, continuing his training sessions with the kids. While John secured the Anti-Matter. Richard delved into Spanish studies, and Stacey focused on Biology. Robert completed</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">another five dungeon levels, bringing his total to thirty-five floors. He leveled up six times, amassed a significant amount of gold and iron ore, and learned new spells and weapon crafting skills. With all his blank scrolls utilized and stored in the family vault, and the crafted rings distributed</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">three to his kids and one each to his siblingshe felt confident about the future.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He collaborated with John to finalize the remaining booklets, including detailed spellbooks for his family. Copies of the simpler booklets were presented to the government for safekeeping. He also traveled to MacDill</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">for the second training session. A few days after the second training session, the promised funds were deposited into his account. He consulted with a</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">law firm to ensure his affairs were in order, though under the pretense of potential death. In coordination with Frank, he devised a plan with the government to stage his death, protecting his family from legal complications, even after his wifes passing.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert, as promised, acquired the two additional spaceship design skills. He intended to share these with John to ensure his continued progress. As time marched on, a sense of routine settled in. However, beneath the surface, a growing awareness of his impending departure loomed large. Four months had slipped away, leaving less than two before his family was taken from him and his familiar world dissolved. Sara, though outwardly courageous,</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">bore the weight of their shared sorrow. Their children, while visibly stressed, seemed oblivious to the gravity of their situation. Sheltered from loss, they clung to hope. A silver lining emerged as his wife and Victoria</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">forged an unexpected friendship, a comforting thought as he contemplated the future.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert and Sara consulted with a financial team to secure their government windfall. They established a fund for their children&#39;s future and generously</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">shared their wealth with extended family. In the following two weeks, Robert dedicated himself to documenting the next phase of his technological advancements. This comprehensive guide would empower those he left behind to continue his work, albeit with significant effort.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">During this period, he completed floors 36 to 39, gaining three levels.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He also invested a Legendary Token in a Tier 6 scroll pack, acquiring</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">valuable utility spells such as Mind Fortress, Greater Ward of Protection, Earth&#39;s Perfect Bounty, Dimensional Shield, and Spatial Ward. As the days dwindled, a sense of urgency grew within Robert. He knew that time was slipping away, and he had much to accomplish before his departure. With each passing day, he felt a growing sense of responsibility to ensure the</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">future of his family. He was determined to leave behind a legacy that would benefit generations to come.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">With the recent level-ups, Robert found himself with a surplus of 111 attribute points. He strategically invested these points to enhance his</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">abilities: 20 in Strength, 33 in Dexterity, 29 in Constitution, 10 in Charisma, and 5 each in Perception, Endurance, and Willpower. This significant boost not only amplified his physical prowess but also rejuvenated his appearance, making him look closer to 27 or 28 years old. As the countdown to his departure neared six weeks, Robert took stock of his remaining tasks. His family&#39;s future was secured, and the training regimen was on track.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The time had come to cherish the present and prioritize family. With his parents set to visit in a few days and his siblings planning their arrival, Robert looked forward to spending quality time with loved ones. The impending farewell added a poignant sweetness to these precious moments, making every interaction a cherished memory. Robert reflected on the extraordinary journey he had embarked upon. From humble beginnings to a life of extraordinary power and responsibility, he had faced countless challenges and emerged victorious. As he prepared to bid farewell to this world, he felt a sense of peace and fulfillment. He knew that his legacy would endure, and that his family would carry on his work, ensuring a</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">brighter future for humanity.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Three days later he headed in for the 40th floor of the dungeon,</p><h3 style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><span class="p">&quot;</span>Welcome, adventurer. You have entered Dungeon <i>7883667HG8776DE985762763FF7-1</i>, currently known as The Training Dungeon. You are now on the Fortieth Floor.<span class="p">&quot;</span></h3><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Looking in the shop he was surprised to see the style="width:266pt;border-top-style:solid;border-top-width:1pt;border-top-color:#EDEDED;border-left-style:solid;border-left-width:1pt;border-left-color:#EDEDED;border-bottom-style:solid;border-bottom-width:1pt;border-bottom-color:#EDEDED;border-right-style:solid;border-right-width:1pt;border-right-color:#EDEDED"><p
