14pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert readily purchased the items, using his surplus of Rare Tokens to acquire the entire set. While he noted the absence of food, water, and potions, these were items he hadn&#39;t purchased in a while, so the loss was</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">minimal. As he ventured into the dungeon, he was met with an unexpected surprise. Instead of the familiar dungeon corridors, he found himself standing in a grand arena, surrounded by thousands of spectators roaring his name. Before he could fully comprehend the situation, an announcer&#39;s voice boomed, &quot;And now, the main event! Before you stands the champion of the arena, your hero &#39;Actavaious&#39;! He will face the Rolling Wave in a five-round battle. Will he emerge victorious, or will we witness the rise of a new</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">champion? Let the contest begin!&quot; With those words, the gate on the other side of the arena opened and out poured dozens of the following:</p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;min-height:174.8pt;width:335.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="s8">: High Goblin Warriors</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Class<span class="s8">: Warrior </span>Race<span class="s8">: Goblin</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="s8">: A powerful, Goblin, trained in battle</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Gender<span class="s8">: Male</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Stats<span class="s8">: Str 75, Dex 40, Con 65, Int 15, Wis 12, Cha 12</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Level<span class="s8">: 75 </span>Resistances<span class="s8">: </span>Health<span class="s8">: 2900</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Mana<span class="s8">: 200</span></p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Without a moment to spare, Robert cast <i>Greater Earthbind </i>to slow the advancing goblins, buying precious time to unleash a more potent spell. The spell took effect, slowing their advance for forty crucial seconds. Seizing</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">the opportunity, he unleashed <i>Nature&#39;s Wraith</i>, followed by <i>Fiery Tempest</i>. The combined force of these spells halted the goblin onslaught completely, This gave him just enough time to cast and <i>Elemental Storm </i>spell, leading to the annihilation of the Goblins.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">&quot;And there you have it, as expected our hero made short work on that first group, can he continue, let us waste no time, send in the next group.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;min-height:191.2pt;width:335.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 17pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="s8">: Orc Warrior</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Class<span class="s8">: Warrior </span>Race<span class="s8">: Orc</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="s8">: A common Orc warrior, strong and brutal.</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Gender<span class="s8">: Male</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Stats<span class="s8">: Str 85, Dex 40, Con 75, Int 10, Wis 10, Cha 8</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Level<span class="s8">: 80</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Resistances<span class="s8">: Fire(15%),Cold(10%)</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Health<span class="s8">: 3100</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Mana<span class="s8">: 200</span></p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Seeking out the announcer to voice his displeasure, Robert initiated the</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">battle with familiar spells. While the initial impact was similar, several Orcs managed to survive the onslaught and counterattacked. Switching to melee</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">combat, Robert&#39;s superior swordsmanship proved decisive, ultimately securing his victory in the round.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:33.0pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Level Up!</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">As soon as the last Orc fell, Robert began to prepare for the next wave. He initiated the casting of Summon Celestial Host, a spell requiring a full 112 seconds to complete. The crowd, still ecstatic from the previous battle, erupted in cheers. After a brief moment, the announcer regained control of the crowd, declaring, &quot;And there you have it! The second wave is</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">conquered! Did you witness that incredible display of swordsmanship? This is why he is our champion. But can he maintain this momentum? Wave</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">three is ready. Open the gate!&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;min-height:209.2pt;width:335.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="s8">: Desert Stalker</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Class<span class="s8">: Rogue</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Race<span class="s8">: Sand Lizard</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="s8">: A stealthy and agile creature of the desert.</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Gender<span class="s8">: Male</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Stats<span class="s8">: Str 50, Dex 90, Con 70, Int 15, Wis 20, Cha 8</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Level<span class="s8">: 85</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Resistances<span class="s8">: Fire(20%),Poison(10%), Bludgeoning(10%)</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Health<span class="s8">: 3000</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Mana<span class="s8">: 150</span></p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">35 of the Lizards made it through the gate before Robert completed the spell. The celestial host descends, a blinding light filling the arena. Angelic figures, radiant and powerful, emerge from the light. They move with grace and precision, their weapons gleaming with divine energy.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The desert stalkers, known for their stealth and agility, are no match for the celestial host. The angelic beings, with their superior speed and power, easily outmaneuver the sand lizards. Arrows of light pierce the air, striking down the desert stalkers with deadly accuracy.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Blazing swords cleave through their scales, and powerful divine magic obliterates entire groups of enemies. The celestial host, guided by the caster&#39;s will, fights with unwavering determination, protecting the caster and driving back the desert stalkers. The once-fearsome creatures of the desert are no match for the divine power unleashed upon them.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">As the last desert stalker falls, the celestial beings return to the heavens, leaving behind a silent, awe-inspiring arena.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:33.0pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Level Up!</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert, weary from the constant battles, sought a respite. He cast the Summon Guardian spell, summoning powerful guardians to protect him</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">while he prepared his next move. &quot;And there you have it, folks! That&#39;s why he&#39;s our champion. Let&#39;s not waste any time, open the gate!&quot; the announcer declared, as the next wave of enemies prepared to attack. Robert, ready to face the challenge, began casting a devastating <i>Firestorm </i>spell.</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;min-height:192.0pt;width:335.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="s8">: Frost Lord</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Class<span class="s8">: Warrior </span>Race<span class="s8">: Ice Ape</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="s8">: A powerful Ice Ape, master of the frozen wastes.</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Gender<span class="s8">: Male</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Stats<span class="s8">: Str 95, Dex 60, Con 90, Int 10, Wis 15, Cha 8</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Level<span class="s8">: 85</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Resistances<span class="s8">: Cold(30%),Ice(25%), Bludgeoning(15%)</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Health<span class="s8">: 4500</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Mana<span class="s8">: 200</span></p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">A mere twenty Ice Apes charged directly at Robert&#39;s Guardians, a hopeless endeavor. Just as the Guardians engaged the creatures, Robert&#39;s <i>Firestorm </i>spell detonated at the heart of the pack. The apes, weakened by the blast, were then ensnared by a Greater Earth Binding spell, leaving them vulnerable. Seizing the opportunity, Robert unleashed a second <i>Firestorm</i>, decimating the remaining Ice Apes.</p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:33.0pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Level Up!</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The crowd erupted in cheers. &quot;And there you have it, folks! Our hero has conquered yet another challenge. But will this be the end of his journey? Let&#39;s find out! Open the gate!&quot; the announcer declared, building anticipation for the next, even more perilous trial. Stepping through the gate was a</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">single man, using his identify Robert was worried.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;min-height:209.2pt;width:335.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="s8">: Malachi the Wise </span>Class<span class="s8">: High Archmage </span>Race<span class="s8">: Human</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="s8">: A grizzled old wizard, known for his arcane knowledge and powerful spells.</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Gender<span class="s8">: Male</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Stats<span class="s8">: Str 15, Dex 44, Con 80, Int 200, Wis 154, Cha</span></p><p class="s8" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">37</p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Level<span class="s8">: 90</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Resistances<span class="s8">: Fire(15%),Cold(15%), Lightning(15%)</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Health<span class="s8">: 2000</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Mana<span class="s8">: 75000</span></p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The air crackled as Malachi materialized through the portal, his arrival heralded by a blinding sphere of light that pulsed around him, a silent declaration of his formidable power. Robert, recognizing the futility of a direct magical assault against such an imposing presence, drew not a wand, but a curious rod. Its intricate carvings hummed with a contained, potent magic. &quot;So, young mage,&quot; Malachi&#39;s voice echoed, laced with amusement, &quot;you choose the crutch of physical artifacts over the purity of arcane might?&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Robert met his gaze, a spark of defiance igniting in his eyes. &quot;My strength lies in more than mere incantations, sir,&quot; he retorted, his voice firm. &quot;I am an enchanter, and these tools are an extension of my will.&quot; A flicker of</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">genuine curiosity crossed Malachi&#39;s face. &quot;Intriguing. Very well, then. Let us see if your trinkets can withstand the true power of magic.&quot; He raised his</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">hands, his fingers weaving complex patterns, and a guttural chant resonated in the air, thick with power.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Responding in kind, Robert activated the first rod. A shimmering, golden shield blossomed before him, its surface rippling with energy. In swift succession, he activated a second. This time, a wall of cerulean energy</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">surged forth, solidifying into a barrier that seemed to defy the very laws of nature. With a final, precise movement, he triggered a third rod, layering</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">another golden shield over the first, reinforcing his defenses.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Malachi&#39;s spell broke free  a roaring torrent of fire, a searing wave of pure destruction that consumed the space before it. Robert&#39;s first shield held, a beacon of gold against the raging inferno, but only for a heartbeat. The flames licked at its edges, consuming it with terrifying speed. The water wall, now the sole defense, hissed and spat as the fire onslaught slammed against it, a valiant but ultimately futile resistance.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">But Robert had anticipated this. Even as the water wall evaporated, his eyes were narrowed in focus. He was not merely defending; he was preparing. In one fluid movement, he slammed the butt of his primary rod to the ground. &quot;Inferno&#39;s Embrace!&quot; he cried, his voice ringing with power.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">A maelstrom of fire erupted, not from Malachi, but from Robert himself. This was no mere wall of flame, but a cataclysmic inferno that expanded with terrifying speed, consuming the entire arena in a vortex of fire and fury. Malachi&#39;s own protective sphere, formidable as it was, shimmered and buckled under the sheer, unbridled power of the unleashed inferno.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The heat was unbearable. The light, blinding. The roar of the firestorm, deafening. It seemed to last an eternity, a world consumed by fire.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Then, just as suddenly as it began, the inferno subsided, leaving behind an echoing silence. The air was thick with smoke, the ground reduced to scorched earth and ashes. Through the haze, a single figure emerged.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Robert. His robes were singed, his face streaked with soot, but his eyes blazed with the light of victory. He stood alone, the sole survivor of the inferno he had unleashed, a testament to the power of a mage who was more than just a spellcaster - a master of enchanted weaponry.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The battle was over. &quot;What a breathtaking display of power and skill! Our hero has emerged victorious once more, standing alone as the ultimate champion. Let us celebrate this incredible feat!&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;left:0.4pt;min-height:200.2pt;top:0.4pt;width:287.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 187%;text-align: left;">Dungeon run complete: Epic chest awarded. Chest contains:</p><p class="s9" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Tier 6 Spell Scroll (Greater Farsight) 75 gold coins</p><p class="s9" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Two Epic Shop Token</p><p class="s6" style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Items added to user inventory.</p><p class="s6" style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Thank you for visiting The Training Dungeon!</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert unfurled the scroll, a satisfied smile spreading across his face as he read its contents.</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="border:0.7pt solid #EDEDED;display:block;min-height:191.2pt;width:287.2pt;"><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 17pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="s8">: Scroll of Greater Farsight</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Tier<span class="s8">: 6, Epic</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Sphere(s)<span class="s8">: Divination, Mind</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="s8">: Farsight is a potent divination spell that allows the caster to peer through vast distances, observing events and individuals as if they were present. By focusing their mind and channeling their magical energy, the caster can see up to 1000 miles away, bypassing most protective enchantments Tier 5 and below.</span></p><p class="s6" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Charges<span class="s8">: 1</span></p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">With a wave to the cheering crowd, Robert stepped through the portal, returning home to his family.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a href="https://oceanofpdf.com/">OceanofPDF.com</a></p><h1 style="padding-top: 2pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a name="bookmark111">&zwnj;</a>Chapter 55<a name="bookmark112">&zwnj;</a></h1><p style="padding-top: 21pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Later that night, Robert recounted the details of the dinner to Sara, who was pleased to hear about Victoria&#39;s call and agreed that having someone to</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">confide in would make things easier. They continued their conversation for another hour or so before Robert retired for the night.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The following morning, Robert initiated his next dungeon run, but he simply wasn&#39;t feeling it. Without even a glance at the System Shop, he plunged directly into the dungeon, only to confront another fiery level teeming with giant lizards. He mechanically went through the motions, listlessly completing the run, his mind far removed from reality.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert watched his wife disappear into the kitchen, a pang of sadness settling in his heart. Twenty-eight years of shared life, more than half his life of companionship, were drawing to a close. Yet, a sense of peace washed over him as he realized his family was secure, financially stable, and equipped with the skills to thrive. He sought out Elara, finding her</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">engrossed in a book in the guest room. &quot;I feel like I haven&#39;t been much of a teacher lately. Is there anything specific you need?&quot; he asked.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Elara paused, her gaze thoughtful. &quot;Not while we&#39;re here. I need practical experience, something I can&#39;t gain in this environment. Once we reach our destination, I&#39;ll require your guidance. Until then, please cherish the time you have with your family.&quot; Robert smiled, grateful for her honesty. &quot;Thank you. Enjoy your book.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Returning to his office, he diligently worked on crafting a replacement amulet, a precautionary measure. Dinner was a lively affair, filled with the excited chatter of hyperactive children. The next day promised a quiet</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">respite until his parents arrived that evening. After helping his father unload the truck, they settled into John&#39;s room, their temporary abode. Thomas and Robert retreated to the backyard, finding solace in the quietude of the evening.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Son, how are you holding up?&quot; Thomas asked, his voice filled with concern. &quot;Not well,&quot; Robert admitted, his tone heavy. &quot;I&#39;ve accepted my fate, but that doesn&#39;t make it any easier.&quot; Thomas nodded understandingly.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">&quot;I know. I can&#39;t offer words that will magically alleviate your pain, but I can offer this advice: Don&#39;t let this adversity consume you. Cherish the time you have left with your family.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;When the time comes to mourn, do so, but then seek out new sources of happiness. Remember, you&#39;ve been granted over a thousand years of life. You can&#39;t let sadness dominate such a vast expanse of time.&quot; A comfortable silence settled between them as they absorbed each other&#39;s words.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;I&#39;ll try, Dad,&quot; Robert replied, &quot;but it won&#39;t be easy. I anticipate a busy period ahead. Elara&#39;s training, exploring our new surroundings, and adapting to our new reality will undoubtedly be challenging. Perhaps that challenge will help me cope.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Having his parents, Thomas and Elizabeth, around proved to be a source of comfort. Thomas, in particular, had a unique ability to guide Robert through his emotional turmoil. It was a poignant realization for Robert that his</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">father was a man of profound wisdom. Sadly, it took the prospect of leaving to truly appreciate this.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He managed to persuade his father to stay for a while after his departure, ensuring that his children would have a strong, steady presence in their lives. The next two weeks followed a familiar pattern. Robert diligently worked his way through floors 41 to 45, earning him four levels and bringing his total to 71. Level 70 held an unexpected surprise, one that piqued his curiosity.</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:33.0pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Class Ability Upgraded!</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 1pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Class Ability<span class="p">: </span><i>Fabric of Reality</i></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="p">: The user can sense and manipulate the underlying structure of reality, allowing them to:</span></h3><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">1) Analyze Objects: Gain detailed information about an object, including its composition, history, and potential uses.</p><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><ol id="l6"><li data-list-text="2)"><p style="padding-left: 16pt;text-indent: -16pt;line-height: 17pt;text-align: left;">Repair Objects: Mend damaged objects at a molecular level.</p></li><li data-list-text="3)"><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Create Constructs: Form Small and medium objects from raw energy or existing matter.</p></li></ol><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Limitations<span class="p">: 1) The complexity of the creations is limited by the user&#39;s skill and energy reserves.</span></h3><ol id="l7"><li data-list-text="2)"><p style="padding-left: 16pt;text-indent: -15pt;text-align: left;">The user must be in direct contact with the object to manipulate it.</p></li><li data-list-text="3)"><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Overuse can lead to mental fatigue and a drain on the user&#39;s energy. This ability provides a versatile tool for problem-solving and exploration. It allows the user to understand the world on a fundamental level and interact with it in unique ways. Use requires Mana and the amount varies.</p></li></ol><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 13pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Experimenting with his newfound ability, Robert discovered he could now create either larger objects or more intricate designs. Previously limited to objects the size of a remote control, he could now conjure items as large as a television. Moreover, the complexity of these objects had increased significantly. While still not capable of creating advanced computer systems, he could now fabricate items with simple mechanical components. Using his upgraded ability, he fashioned a watch, a practical demonstration of his newfound power. Though not immediately essential, this upgrade hinted at a promising future. If his ability continued to evolve, perhaps he could one day create objects with intricate circuitry, opening up the possibility of constructing vehicles like planes or cars. The mere thought of such potential was exhilarating.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a href="https://oceanofpdf.com/">OceanofPDF.com</a></p><h1 style="padding-top: 2pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a name="bookmark113">&zwnj;</a>Chapter 56<a name="bookmark114">&zwnj;</a></h1><p style="padding-top: 21pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Two weeks after Robert&#39;s parents had settled in, bringing a sense of comforting normalcy, his two brothers, along with their wives and kids, descended upon the house. This arrival coincided, conveniently, with Robert finishing up dungeon runs on Floors 46 and 47, adding another layer of accomplishment to the celebratory atmosphere. The house instantly transformed into a vibrant, chaotic, joyful party zone  the kind that only happens when a large, close-knit family gets together under one roof.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The younger kids, blissfully unaware of the underlying reasons for this extended family reunion, were in their element, running around wild, playing games, and generally enjoying the company of their cousins. The older children, however, were a bit more perceptive. They noticed <i>something </i>was different about Uncle Robert. He looked... younger.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Healthier. More <i>vibrant </i>than he had the previous summer. When they cautiously inquired, poking and prodding with the relentless curiosity of teenagers, they were met with Robert&#39;s usual playful deflection: &quot;Don&#39;t you worry about it, kiddos. Just go have fun. Plenty of time for boring adult</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">stuff later.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">But the older kids weren&#39;t easily fooled. They whispered among themselves, comparing notes, piecing together the fragments of overheard conversations and unusual events. Soon enough, the &quot;secret&quot;  Robert&#39;s dramatically altered appearance and his impending, vaguely defined &quot;departure&quot;  was out in the open, at least among the older cousins. The news, while exciting in a strange, almost unbelievable way, was also tinged with a somber understanding. They grasped, at least on some level, the seriousness of the situation, the weight of what Robert was facing. And, with the unspoken loyalty of family, they vowed to keep the information contained, protecting Robert and his immediate family from unwanted outside scrutiny.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The adults, meanwhile, were focused on the more immediate, practical aspects of Robert&#39;s upcoming journey. There were serious discussions, held in hushed tones after the kids were in bed, about essential supplies, contingency plans, and the very real possibility of Robert and Elara finding</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">themselves stranded in some unknown, potentially hostile environment. This led to a series of increasingly large shopping trips to Sam&#39;s Club,</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">where Robert, with a slightly grim determination, stocked up on everything from durable cooking pots and pans to heavy-duty plates, bowls, and silverware.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He even bought new, high-quality tents and sleeping bags, enough for a small expedition. These preparations, while necessary, were also a constant, stark reminder of the looming separation, the uncertainty that hung in the</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">air like a persistent, low-humming note. But amidst the anxiety and the planning, Robert made a conscious effort to savor every moment with his parents and brothers. He cherished the shared meals, the late-night conversations, the simple act of being together, knowing that these precious moments were finite.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Another week seemed to evaporate, filled with the usual whirlwind of family life, two more successful (and thankfully uneventful) dungeon runs, and the highly anticipated arrival of Robert&#39;s sister, Emily. She burst through the front door with the unshakeable confidence of someone who</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">knew she belonged, immediately enveloping Robert in a fierce hug. &quot;I told you,&quot; she declared, her voice ringing with a mixture of affection and playful accusation, &quot;I wasn&#39;t going to let you disappear off the face of the earth without saying goodbye!&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert, grinning, hugged her back just as tightly. Moments later, Emily&#39;s husband, Ethan, walked in, carrying their two youngest children. He extended a hand towards Robert, a polite, almost formal gesture. But Robert, feeling a surge of emotion, brushed it aside and pulled Ethan into a warm embrace. &quot;No formalities, man. We&#39;re family.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The rest of that day unfolded in a blissful haze of laughter, shared stories, and the comforting rhythm of family connection. For the first time since this whole crazy ordeal had begun, Robert felt a genuine sense of peace, a deep, abiding tranquility that settled over him like a warm blanket.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Surrounded by the people he loved most in the world, he found a renewed sense of hope, a strength he hadn&#39;t realized he&#39;d been missing.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">As he looked around the room that evening, taking in the familiar faces, the sounds of conversation and laughter, a profound realization washed over him. He saw the future, not in some grand, abstract vision, but in the everyday moments, in the simple joys of family. He saw it in the carefree</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">exuberance of the children playing outside, their shrieks of delight echoing through the open windows. He saw it in the enduring bond between his parents, his brothers, his sister, a testament to the strength of their family ties. &quot;You know what?&quot; he said, his voice a little thick with emotion, settling into a comfortable armchair in the family room. &quot;Everything&#39;s going to be okay. Look at them,&quot; he gestured towards the children, now visible through the sliding glass doors, their silhouettes dancing in the fading light. &quot;Our family, our future... it&#39;s in good hands.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">His father, Thomas, approached and placed a comforting hand on Robert&#39;s shoulder, his touch conveying a depth of understanding that words couldn&#39;t</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">express. &quot;Son,&quot; he said, his voice low and steady, &quot;you&#39;re not leaving us in a lurch. You&#39;ve done more for this family than you&#39;ll ever know. You&#39;ve set us up for a future we never could have imagined. And while none of us, except maybe those kids, will live to see the full extent of your legacy, we <i>know </i>this family will carry on. You made that possible.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">A profound silence settled over the room, a quiet acknowledgment of the truth in his father&#39;s words. Everyone, in their own way, was reflecting on Robert&#39;s extraordinary journey, on the sacrifices he was making, and on the enduring power of family. They watched the children play, their hearts filled with a bittersweet mixture of gratitude, hope, and a quiet, underlying sadness.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The following day, Robert, still feeling the lingering effects of his recent dungeon excursions, decided to take it easy. He spent the morning with his parents, simply talking, reminiscing about childhood memories, sharing stories, and enjoying the quiet comfort of their company. It was a simple, ordinary day, but it felt incredibly precious, a reminder of the things that truly mattered. As the afternoon unfolded, the extended family gathered for a large, boisterous barbecue.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The air filled with the tantalizing aroma of grilling meat, the sounds of</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">laughter and conversation, and the general happy chaos that comes with a</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">large family gathering. But even amidst the festivities, Robert couldn&#39;t shake the feeling of time slipping away, like grains of sand through his</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">fingers. He knew that his departure was imminent, that soon he would have to say goodbye to this life, to this family, to everything he held dear. As the sun began its slow descent, casting long shadows across the yard, a wave of melancholy washed over him. This was it. His last real chance to soak it all in, to imprint these moments, these faces, these feelings, onto his memory.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He sat by the crackling fire pit, watching the flames dance and flicker, a bittersweet mixture of emotions swirling within him. There was sadness, yes, a profound sense of loss, but there was also a surprising surge of hope, a quiet confidence in the future. He knew his family would be okay. They were strong, resilient, and they had each other. He had done everything he could to prepare them, to equip them for whatever challenges lay ahead.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">And with that realization, a sense of acceptance, of peace, settled over him. He was ready. Or, as ready as he could ever be.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Two days later, the quiet routine was interrupted. Robert had just finished an intense training session, pushing his physical and magical limits, when his phone rang. It was the Secret Service. The Secretary of State, Frank Davenport, and his wife, Victoria, were planning a visit  the following day. While Robert had heard whispers, rumors of a potential visit from his old friend, the suddenness of it still caught him off guard. The news spread through the house like wildfire, a flurry of excited whispers and frantic preparations.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The next morning, the advance team from the Secret Service arrived, their presence turning the quiet suburban street into something resembling a</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">scene from a political thriller. The kids, of course, were thrilled, peering out the windows with wide-eyed fascination. The neighbors, however, were a</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">different story. Eddie, Robert&#39;s next-door neighbor, a man with an insatiable curiosity and a complete lack of filter, couldn&#39;t resist the opportunity to investigate.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">&quot;Hey, Robert!&quot; he called out, leaning over the fence, his voice a stage whisper. &quot;What&#39;s going on over here? You guys hosting a presidential summit or something? And, by the way,&quot; he added, lowering his voice</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">conspiratorially, &quot;when are you going to spill the beans about that whole</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&#39;eternal youth&#39; thing? My wife&#39;s turning 35 next month, and she&#39;s convinced you&#39;ve found the fountain of youth. She&#39;s threatening to move in here until you tell her your secret!&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert chuckled, shaking his head. &quot;No fountain of youth, Eddie, I promise. I&#39;m just as baffled by this whole &#39;looking younger&#39; thing as everyone else.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">They&#39;ve run tests, poked and prodded me, and still... nothing. As for the Secret Service,&quot; he gestured towards the four imposing black SUVs parked along the curb, &quot;well, the Secretary of State is an old friend. He&#39;s from around here, you know. His position, unfortunately, comes with a certain level of... security detail.&quot; He winked. &quot;Well, when you and your doctors</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">figure it out. I expect a call. My wife is driving me nuts.&quot; Eddie responded. Robert laughed, then added &quot;No problem, I&#39;ll put you on the short list.&quot; Eddie, turning back to his own home, replied &quot;Thanks, I knew I could count on you.&quot; After a few more minutes of joking with each other, Robert went back inside to finish preparing for his guests.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">A few hours later, another, even more impressive convoy of black SUVs arrived, this time carrying the Secretary of State himself, Frank Davenport, and his wife, Victoria. Robert and Sara stepped outside to greet them, a</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">picture of calm hospitality amidst the controlled chaos.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Frank, Victoria, welcome to our humble abode,&quot; Robert said, extending a warm handshake to his old friend. Victoria, radiant and elegant as always, bypassed the handshake and enveloped Sara in a warm hug. &quot;Sara, darling, it&#39;s so wonderful to finally meet you in person! I feel like we&#39;re already old friends. I just <i>know </i>we&#39;re going to have so much fun together.&quot; Robert, ever observant, noticed a group of paparazzi lurking near the edge of the property, their long lenses pointed directly at them. &quot;Frank,&quot; he whispered, leaning in close, &quot;I think we have a welcoming committee of the</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">photographic variety next door.&quot; Frank sighed, glancing in the direction Robert indicated. &quot;Yeah, I saw them. It&#39;s a pain, but if the homeowner gave them permission, there&#39;s not much we can do. It comes with the territory, unfortunately. Let&#39;s just ignore them and head inside.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">As Sara and Victoria, already deep in conversation, walked towards the house, Robert and Frank followed behind. &quot;So,&quot; Robert began, keeping his voice low, &quot;while I&#39;m genuinely thrilled to see you both, and I appreciate</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">the visit, I have a feeling this isn&#39;t <i>entirely </i>a social call. You&#39;re a busy man, Frank. What&#39;s the real reason you&#39;re here?&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Well, first, it was Victoria&#39;s idea, she really did want to meet Sara. And it seems the two get along very well, over the phone and in person. Expect more visits from her. My wife has very few close female friends, so she values this relationship already.&quot; Robert smiled, &quot;Sara is the same, she&#39;s been talking for hours after every phone call. I&#39;m beginning to think she loves your wife more than me.&quot; Frank laughed and replied, &quot;Between you and me, I tend to disappear, when I notice the two in a deep conversation.&quot; Robert smiled, &quot;Good to know. But you had another reason for the visit, what was it?&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Frank nodded, his expression turning serious. &quot;Right. The President has a proposition for you, something we think you might be uniquely qualified to assist with.&quot; Robert&#39;s eyebrows rose slightly. &quot;Oh? And what&#39;s that?&quot; Frank smiled, a knowing glint in his eyes. &quot;Nothing too strenuous, I assure you.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">We&#39;d like you to lend your expertise to the field of metallurgy.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert blinked, surprised. &quot;Metallurgy? Seriously? What, are we running out of good steel or something?&quot; Frank explained, &quot;Our engineers have been running simulations, using the data and designs from your teachings and they&#39;ve come to the conclusion that our current metal alloys aren&#39;t strong enough to withstand the stresses of the advanced spacecraft they&#39;re envisioning. We could figure it out eventually, of course, but your input, your insights could potentially save us years, maybe even decades, of research and development.&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert considered this for a moment, stroking his chin thoughtfully. &quot;Alright,&quot; he finally said, &quot;that doesn&#39;t sound too terribly arduous. I&#39;m in. Tell them to gather a group of, say, ten of their top people, and I&#39;ll bring them up to speed. Give them a solid foundation to work from.&quot; Frank nodded, clearly relieved. &quot;Excellent, Robert. I appreciate it. I knew we could count on you.&quot; The rest of the day was spent in pleasant, relaxed conversation, catching up, sharing stories, and generally enjoying each other&#39;s company. The Davenports finally departed around ten that evening, leaving behind a sense of warmth and genuine connection. It had been a successful visit, both personally and, potentially, professionally.</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a href="https://oceanofpdf.com/">OceanofPDF.com</a></p><h1 style="padding-top: 2pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a name="bookmark115">&zwnj;</a>Chapter 57<a name="bookmark116">&zwnj;</a></h1><p style="padding-top: 21pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">With the Davenports gone, Robert turned to the skills page, selecting the one he needed. The knowledge sparked an immediate idea: a way to drastically improve steel&#39;s strength and heat resistance. The next day, he</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">spent hours at his laptop, meticulously documenting the process for creating his new alloy. He dubbed it &quot;Robtonium,&quot; much to the amusement of his kidsand the eye-rolling exasperation of Sara, who muttered something about &#39;stupid boys&#39; as she walked away.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Later, Robert discussed future plans with his siblings. Johns response was unchanged from their previous conversation: Just one less birthday to</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">remember, a comment that earned him a playful punch from Emily. David chuckled at their banter, confirming his own plans remained the same. He did, however, admit that the recent influx of money meant he could afford to retire a bit earlier and cherish the remaining time with his children before they left home. Emily simply reiterated her desire to further her career in</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">the medical field.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The following days settled into a comfortable routine. Robert spent quality time with his family and sent Frank his book. After a brief chat, they both felt a sense of closure, and Frank wished him well. A few days later, Robert tackled the 48th floor. Compared to the grueling challenges of the previous levels, this one was surprisingly easy, completed in under two hours. The shop, however, was a letdown, offering nothing of interest.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The only real reward was the level gained from the run. Back home, Robert spent the rest of the day relaxing. With less than a month remaining, Robert decided to pace himself, deliberately delaying the final two runs. He put off run 49 until the very last possible day. It turned out to be another mine level, allowing him to push his mining skill to level 5 and gather a dozen</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">more pieces of Mithril. Knowing the next run would be his last, Robert took four days to unwind and mentally prepare before finally facing the 50th</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">floor.</p><h3 style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Welcome, adventurer. You have entered Dungeon <i>7883667HG8776DE985762763FF7-1</i>, currently known as The Training Dungeon. You are now on the Fiftieth Floor.</h3><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Checking the shop, he hoped that was something he could use his tokens on and he was surprised there was.</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><table style="border-collapse:collapse;margin-left:6.625pt" cellspacing="0"><tr style="width:224pt;border-top-style:solid;border-top-width:1pt;border-top-color:#EDEDED;border-left-style:solid;border-left-width:1pt;border-left-color:#EDEDED;border-bottom-style:solid;border-bottom-width:1pt;border-bottom-color:#EDEDED;border-right-style:solid;border-right-width:1pt;border-right-color:#EDEDED"><p class="s8" style="padding-top: 9pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">200 Gold Coins</p></td></tr></table><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Guess the System knew exactly how many tokens I had left,&quot; Robert muttered, having just cleared out the entire store with his last remaining tokens. Turning to Hal, he added, &quot;These items seem a little overpowered, don&#39;t you think?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Yes and no, You essentially soloed fifty dungeon floors, all of which were higher level than you. If anything, the System&#39;s still in your debt. Just so you know, Floor 50 is a level 100 dungeon. Expect a serious challenge.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Got it, so find a spell to add to the amulet and make sure my gear is ready.&quot; Swapping out his sword and putting the amulet on Robert decided to wait</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">on the spell until he understood what he would face. Taking a deep breath he crossed the door and left the safe room.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a href="https://oceanofpdf.com/">OceanofPDF.com</a></p><h1 style="padding-top: 2pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a name="bookmark117">&zwnj;</a>Chapter 58<a name="bookmark118">&zwnj;</a></h1><p style="padding-top: 21pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">As he stepped into the first chamber, a surge of power coursed through him. The air shimmered, and a spectral hand materialized, reaching out to grasp him. Robert, however, was prepared. A swift incantation, a flick of his wrist, and a bolt of lightning arced from his fingertips, shattering the spectral hand. The chamber was filled with the sounds of battle, the clash of steel and the roar of magical fire. Greater kobolds, their bodies imbued with dark magic, charged at him, their claws outstretched. Robert, however, remained calm.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">A wave of his hand, and a wall of force sprang forth, deflecting the</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">creatures&#39; attacks. A fire lizard, its scales shimmering with arcane energy, launched itself at him, its fiery breath scorching the air. Robert, with a swift incantation, summoned a shield of ice, deflecting the fiery breath. The lizard, stunned, was an easy target for a well-placed fireball.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">As he delved deeper into the dungeon, the challenges grew more complex. After dozens of battles with the Kobolds, Robert started to encounter Orcs. These brutes soon earned a place on Robarts hate list, even surpassing Goblins. This continued for about 6 battles before Robert approached a</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">simple campfire and a single Orc standing by it.</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="p">: Grokk </span>Class<span class="p">: Orc General </span>Race<span class="p">: Orc</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="p">: A legendary warrior, Grokk is a whirlwind of rage and muscle on the battlefield. Covered in scars from countless battles, he possesses a terrifying aura that intimidates even the bravest of foes. Grokk thrives in the chaos of combat, his fury fueling his strength and making him an unstoppable force. He is a living legend amongst the Orcs, his name whispered with a mixture of fear and respect.</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Gender<span class="p">: Male</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Stats<span class="p">: Str 120, Dex 60, Con 150, Int 20, Wis 30, Cha</span></h3><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 17pt;text-align: left;">15</p><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Level<span class="p">: 90</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Resistances<span class="p">: Fire (10%)</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Health<span class="p">: 17000</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Mana<span class="p">: 1000</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Stamina<span class="p">: 7000</span></h3><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 13pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The air crackled with anticipation as Robert and the Orc General faced off. The General, a hulking beast of a Orc, towered over Robert, his face a mask of grim determination. In his massive hands, he gripped a mithril greatsword, its edge gleaming menacingly in the afternoon sun. Robert stood poised, his own blade, the Silent Judgment, held low, its Adamantine surface reflecting the orc&#39;s menacing glare. The General roared, a thunderous sound that shook the very ground. He charged, a whirlwind of muscle and fury. Robert met the onslaught with a graceful sidestep, the Silent Judgment a blur as it parried the descending blow. The orc&#39;s</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">greatsword, despite its weight, was surprisingly agile in the General&#39;s hands. The battle raged. Robert, nimble and precise, danced around the orc, his strikes swift and deadly.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The Silent Judgment, whisper-silent, found gaps in the orc&#39;s defenses, each touch leaving a searing wound. The General, enraged, retaliated with a flurry of blows, his strength a terrifying force. Robert, relying on his speed and the uncanny precision of his sword, managed to deflect each attack, the obsidian blade absorbing the impact with an eerie calm.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The fight reached a crescendo. The General, desperate, unleashed a mighty swing, the mithril sword arcing through the air in a deadly arc. Robert, anticipating the move, leaped back, the Silent Judgment a venomous snake striking out. It found its mark, sinking deep into the orc&#39;s chest, piercing through bone and muscle with chilling ease. The General staggered, a guttural roar escaping his lips. He looked down at the Adamantine blade protruding from his chest, his eyes widening in disbelief. With a final, shuddering breath, he collapsed to the ground, his lifeblood staining the earth crimson. Robert stood over the fallen orc, his breath coming in ragged gasps. The Silent Judgment, still sheathed within the orc&#39;s chest, hummed</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">softly, as if satisfied with its work. The battle was over. Robert, the victor, stood alone, the weight of his victory settling upon him like a shroud.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Looting the Orc, he collected Grokk&#39;s greatsword and continued. As he navigated the labyrinthine corridors of the dungeon, he encountered a series of intricate puzzles. These puzzles tested not only his intelligence but also his knowledge of arcane theory. He had to decipher cryptic riddles,</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">manipulate arcane symbols, and even solve complex mathematical equations. One such puzzle involved a series of enchanted glyphs. To</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">activate the mechanism, he had to align the glyphs in a specific sequence, drawing power from a hidden energy source.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">After hours of careful study and experimentation, he finally solved the puzzle, the glyphs glowing with power. As he delved deeper into the dungeon, the air grew heavy with anticipation. He knew he was nearing the final chamber, the heart of the dungeon. The air crackled with raw magic, and the shadows danced with unseen forces. Finally, he reached the</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">chamber. It was a vast cavern, its walls adorned with ancient murals depicting the birth of the dungeon. In the center of the chamber, a dragon, its scales shimmering with arcane energy, slumbered. Robert knew this would be the ultimate test. The dragon was a creature of immense power, its breath a weapon of destruction. But Robert was prepared. He raised his</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">staff, and a surge of power coursed through him. He began to chant, his voice echoing through the cavern.</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Name<span class="p">: Ignis</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Class<span class="p">: Dragon Lord</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Race<span class="p">: Red Dragon</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="p">: Ignis, a colossal red dragon, is a force of</span></h3><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">nature incarnate. With scales that shimmer like molten gold and eyes that burn with infernal fire, he commands awe and terror wherever he goes. Ignis is a master of aerial combat, capable of unleashing devastating firestorms and scorching the earth with his breath. He is a cunning strategist, utilizing his intellect to outmaneuver his enemies and claim victory.</p><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Gender<span class="p">: Male</span></h3><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 17pt;text-align: left;">Stats<span class="p">: Str 200, Dex 150, Con 300, Int 120, Wis 100, Cha</span></h3><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">80</p><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Level<span class="p">: 110</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Resistances<span class="p">: Fire (40%), Heat(50%)</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Health<span class="p">: 35000</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Mana<span class="p">: 25000</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Stamina<span class="p">: 17000</span></h3><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 13pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The air crackled with anticipation as Robert, his eyes glowing with arcane power, began to chant. Ancient words, lost to time, tumbled from his lips, each syllable imbued with the essence of raw magic. The dragon, a magnificent beast of obsidian and fire, stirred, its eyes slowly opening.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Gold flecks danced within the depths of its pupils, reflecting the flickering torches that illuminated the cavern. It regarded Robert with a mixture of curiosity and disdain, its massive head tilting slightly to one side.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The battle erupted with the ferocity of a raging inferno. The dragon unleashed a torrent of fire, a searing wave of heat that engulfed the cavern. Robert, his mind a whirlwind of arcane calculations, swiftly countered.</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">With a muttered incantation, he conjured a shimmering barrier of force, deflecting the attack. The dragon roared, a sound that shook the very foundations of the dungeon, its voice a thunderclap that echoed through the cavern. It charged, its massive body a blur of motion, a terrifying engine of destruction.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert, unfazed, unleashed a barrage of spells, each more powerful than the last. Fireballs, the color of molten gold, erupted from his fingertips, crashing against the dragon&#39;s scales. Lightning bolts, crackling with raw</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">energy, struck the beast, sending jolts of pain through its immense frame. Arcane missiles, guided by his will, rained down upon the dragon, each impact leaving behind a trail of smoke and sizzling flesh. The dragon,</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">enraged, retaliated. Its claws, sharper than any steel, slashed through the air, leaving deep gouges in the cavern walls. Robert, agile despite his robes, dodged with practiced ease, his movements a blur of motion. But the dragon was relentless, its attacks growing more ferocious with each passing moment. In a desperate attempt to gain an advantage, Robert teleported</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">behind the creature, his sword, a gleaming blade of moonlight, glowing with arcane energy.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">With a single, powerful thrust, he plunged the sword into the dragon&#39;s hide. The blade met with unexpected resistance, the scales proving tougher than anticipated. The dragon, enraged, whipped its tail around, striking Robert with devastating force. The blow sent him crashing against the cavern wall, the impact shattering his left arm. Pain, searing and intense, shot through his body. He gritted his teeth, ignoring the agony, and focused his remaining strength. He channeled his magic, summoning a wave of pure energy that</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">surged through his sword.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">With a renewed ferocity, he plunged the blade deeper, aiming for the dragon&#39;s heart. The dragon let out a deafening roar, a sound of pure rage and agony. Its movements faltered, its strength waning. The lifeblood of the creature, a thick, viscous fluid, erupted from the wound, staining the cavern floor. With a final, shuddering gasp, the dragon collapsed to the ground, its massive body trembling violently before finally succumbing to its wounds.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert, exhausted and bleeding, lay on the cold stone floor, his left arm missing while he tried to calm down and catch his breath. He had defeated</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">the dragon, but at a terrible cost. The victory was bittersweet, a testament to his skill and courage, but marred by the loss of his limb. He had conquered the dungeon, but at a devastating price.</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Robert you need to calm down, remember you will regenerate, your arm will grow back in a few days, you just need to wait a few minutes for the pain to reduce.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;I know the arm will grow back, but when I get home Sara is going to flip,&quot; Robert answered Hal.</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 187%;text-align: left;">Dungeon run complete: Legendary chest awarded. Chest contains:</h3><p style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Skillbook(Taming)</p><p class="s5" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">1 Platinum coin</p><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p class="s5" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 17pt;text-align: left;">One unlocked skill token</p><p class="s5" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Title Earned(Dragon Slayer)</p><h3 style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Items added to user inventory.</h3><h3 style="padding-top: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Thank you for visiting The Training Dungeon!</h3><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 2pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:33.0pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Level Up!</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 1pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:33.0pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Level Up!</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 1pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid #CCCCCC;display:block;min-height:33.0pt;width:456.8pt;"><p class="s12" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Level Up!</p></div><p style="padding-left: 6pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a href="https://oceanofpdf.com/">OceanofPDF.com</a></p><h1 style="padding-top: 2pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;"><a name="bookmark119">&zwnj;</a>Chapter 59<a name="bookmark120">&zwnj;</a></h1><p style="padding-top: 21pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The instant Robert stumbled back through the shimmering portal and into his living room, a wave of dread washed over him. He knew this wasn&#39;t going to be a pleasant homecoming. His daughter, Stacey, was curled up on the sofa, engrossed in a book. Her head snapped up at the sound of his arrival, and her eyes widened in horror at the sight of him. A blood-curdling scream tore from her throat, echoing through the house like a siren. Within seconds, the room was swarming with concerned family members, their faces etched with alarm.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Sara, his wife, pushed her way to the front, her gaze locking onto Robert&#39;s mangled arm. &quot;Robert! What in the world happened to you?&quot; she demanded, her voice laced with panic. Their eyes were drawn to his injured arm, where the severed limb was already beginning to knit itself back</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">together, a grotesque yet fascinating spectacle. While they knew Robert possessed this extraordinary healing ability, witnessing it firsthand was a different story altogether.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">This was the first time he had sustained such a grievous injury, and the shock was palpable. They understood he would eventually make a full recovery, but the sight of his mangled flesh and the knowledge of the pain he must be enduring filled them with a deep sense of unease. Until he was whole again, the cloud of worry would linger over their household.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">True to Hal&#39;s prediction, Robert&#39;s arm regenerated within a day. It was a mesmerizing, albeit unsettling process to observe. At times, he could actually perceive the bones lengthening, the muscles knitting together, and the skin slowly creeping back to cover the raw flesh. A phantom tingling sensation accompanied the regrowth, an incessant itch he couldn&#39;t scratch. While intellectually fascinated, Robert found the experience viscerally disturbing.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">He decided it was definitely not a process he cared to repeat, or witness again, if he could help it. However, the discomfort was a small price to pay for a fully functional arm. He had to admit that six months ago, before</p><p style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">gaining this extraordinary ability, such a recovery would have been unimaginable. He would have been left permanently maimed, his life irrevocably altered. Once the regeneration was complete and Robert was able to demonstrate to his family that his arm was whole and perfectly functional, the tension in the house eased somewhat. But the incident had left an indelible mark. They had always believed, or perhaps simply assumed, that Robert was somehow immune to the dangers of his interdimensional travels. Yesterday, that illusion of safety shattered. The reality of the perils he faced in those other worlds had crashed into their lives, leaving them shaken and vulnerable.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;So, Hal,&quot; Robert began, leaning back in his chair, &quot;I&#39;ve conquered all 50 floors with time to spare. Just a little over two weeks left. What am I supposed to do now? Twiddle my thumbs and wait?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Not necessarily, you could choose to leave early, though I suspect that wouldn&#39;t appeal to you. I&#39;m authorized to offer you another dungeon run in a few days. Something easier, just to bring your solo run count up to 50. Normally, the</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">System limits participants to 50 runs, but since it commandeered one of yours for Elara&#39;s trial, it will offer a compensatory run to maintain fairness. It&#39;s entirely your choice, of course. No pressure either way.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;A compensatory run, huh?&quot; Robert mused, stroking his chin thoughtfully. &quot;So, a level 40 floor then? Nothing too challenging, and probably not much in the way of rewards. Still,&quot; he decided, &quot;it&#39;s better than sitting around doing nothing. I&#39;ll take it.&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Excellent choice, now, regarding your departure. It won&#39;t be a sudden, unceremonious expulsion. Three hours before</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">your time is up, a portal will appear. You and Elara can pass through at your leisure.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: -28pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Good to know,&quot; Robert said, relieved. &quot;Any hints about our destination?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">I can provide some general information, you&#39;ll be pleased to know it&#39;s a rather pleasant world, quite similar to Earth. Your</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">destination is a small, peaceful town within a human-run kingdom. A few hundred inhabitants, at most. Unless you actively seek it out, danger should be minimal.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Sounds like I landed on my feet, then,&quot; Robert said with a sigh of relief. &quot;I&#39;ll let Elara know the good news.&quot; A wave of melancholy washed over him as the reality of his impending departure sank in. &quot;It&#39;s almost over, Hal,&quot; he murmured, a touch of wistfulness in his voice. &quot;I&#39;ll be leaving soon. What are my options? Do I wait 400 years and return, pretending nothing happened? Is there any way to get back here sooner? I&#39;m a time mage, after all. Can&#39;t I just rewind?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">I&#39;m afraid not, and before you ask why, allow me to explain. Time travel is indeed possible. You already possess spells that allow glimpses into the future. At higher Tiers, there are spells that enable movement both forward and backward in time. To traverse 400 years, you would need one of the highest-tiered spells. But that&#39;s only part of the problem, time travel through the System requires its presence in the desired destination time. In your case, the System would need to be fully active here and now, which it isn&#39;t. Time</p><p class="s7" style="padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">travel functions because the System continuously records the quantum state of everything. It&#39;s a complex process, but the crux of the matter is that the System cannot send you back to a time where it doesn&#39;t exist.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;So, I&#39;m stuck,&quot; Robert concluded, a hint of resignation in his voice. &quot;Fate doesn&#39;t want me here, it seems.&quot; He shifted in his seat, a new thought arising. &quot;What happens to you when I leave, Hal? My understanding was that you were here specifically to guide me. Will you still be with me when I leave?&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">That&#39;s entirely your choice, you&#39;ll be given the option.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Do you want to stay with me?&quot; Robert asked sincerely. &quot;I wouldn&#39;t want to force you.&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 3pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">I would like to remain, but ultimately, the decision lies with you.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">A warm smile spread across Robert&#39;s face. &quot;Well then, I&#39;m afraid you&#39;re stuck with me.&quot; He chuckled. &quot;Though I suspect there are worse fates.&quot;</p><p class="s7" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 34pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Indeed there are.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Later that day, Robert gathered his family and relayed the information Hal had provided. Elara was particularly enthused about their impending move. &quot;A town with a few hundred people?&quot; she exclaimed, her eyes sparkling with excitement. &quot;My village had less than a hundred! This is going to be amazing!&quot; Robert chuckled, her infectious enthusiasm easing some of his lingering apprehension. Sara, however, expressed concern about the upcoming final dungeon run. &quot;Are you sure about this, Robert?&quot; she asked, her brow furrowed with worry. &quot;Even if it&#39;s just a level 40 floor...&quot;</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">&quot;Relax, Sara,&quot; Robert reassured her, flashing a confident grin. &quot;A level 40 dungeon is child&#39;s play at this point. I could probably run it with my eyes closed.&quot; &quot;I know, I know,&quot; Sara replied with a sigh, her anxiety still lingering. &quot;But I can&#39;t help but worry. Seeing you like that... without an arm... it was horrifying. It&#39;s not something I&#39;ll ever forget.&quot; She reached out and gently touched his now perfectly whole arm, a lingering trace of fear in her eyes. &quot;Just promise me you&#39;ll be careful.&quot; Robert took her hand, his</p><p style="padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">gaze softening. &quot;I promise,&quot; he said sincerely. &quot;Nothing is going to happen. This is just a formality, a final victory lap before we head home.&quot; He gave her hand a reassuring squeeze, hoping to quell the fear that still flickered within her.</p><p style="padding-top: 15pt;padding-left: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">A few days later Robert ran his 51st dungeon run, as Hal said it was easy, Robert did not get hit a single time and finished in less than an hour. He did end up getting rewarded for it.</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><div class="textbox" style="background:#F7F7F7;border:0.7pt solid style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Sphere(s)<span class="p">: Earth, Water</span></h3><h3 style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Description<span class="p">: The caster summons a
